YyO4Y6voJpmxGaytxdlz6Q.text: I ordered the sage chicken Benedict. The portion was crazy large. The fried chicken was good. The sauce was a bit spicy and the fried cheese layer was no longer melted when it came out. I don't think I will need to return to one.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge portions...

qkOeX7qsR_UttnBsGEP_8Q.text: Stopped by for lunch after a long Vegas night.  Had a short wait to be seated; but that's expected in Vegas.  Once seated we were attended to quickly. Our server was polite, helpful and professional. He made some recommendations on drinks and food. He warned us the portions are large, and he was right. When the food arrived it was hot and looked great. It tasted good, but it's nothing extremely special. It's essentially huge portions of diner food with a slight twist. Nothing to make a huge deal out of.  It is a place worth returning to though.  Give it a shot for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch time. Steak and eggs on top, chorizo skillet on bottom. DO IT!!

wAic96nUhah8h5IBgGGIvw.text: This place is actually good. Went here for the second time (but first time at this location) this time I decided on a burger and it was quit delicious. The Patty was stuffed with cheese, avocado, and bacon I believe. Big portion, at a good price. The only downfall was the service at the time. Our waiter seemed rude to me. I think at any job you should try to be happy and do your job, without any complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge portions, at a good price.

UwRQAIOtIC2WGgTAFqag0Q.text: Huge portions and some interesting menu items. Referred to as "twisted farm food", I would say it's worth a try, but I wouldn't make the effort to return. Maybe it's because I was more than slightly hungover from the night before, but when the famous fried chicken benedict arrived at the table, my stomach almost felt worse. It's so huge and hard to figure out where to start. I basically ate the mashed potatoes and a bit of the chicken, and left the rest to the bf and to save for later (we slowly finished it throughout the rest of the day as we waited for our flight home). On top of the benedict, bf also got a salmon scramble and we were surprised it was thoroughly cooked though it was supposed to be smoked. I've had smoked salmon scrambles elsewhere where the salmon was still light and refreshing.  As others have said, you can probably order 1 dish for every 2 people, but if you really want to try a lot of things, just be okay with having a lot of leftovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rdNoSosp4yV6RWSMfiPyAA.text: Was told the wait would be 45 minutes. Wound up being 65 minutes. I'll hold back a star for that. There were 6 of us and we just ordered a bunch of things to get a good sampling of the menu.  The Red Velvet Waffle was the stand out for me. Pancakes and the chicken hash also solid.  A bit pricey, but now with no Dupar's, this is a solid breakfast choice Downtown.  Just be prepared to wait a bit.

KDFXU6muNGuhbDL9CVY3sQ.text: Finally got a chance to try this place. They weren't kidding when they said its huge portions. I went to the one inside The Plaza Hotel in downtown Vegas. It was a Tuesday morning about 10am - no wait.   Our server was nice and gave us a run down of the menu and gave us a few recommendations. I went with the chicken and waffles (of course). After placing our order, it was about 10 mins before our food came out.   OMG! There's no way I'm going to finish this, and I was already planning how I was going to drop off my leftovers back at my hotel. 4 waffles on the plate, and 2 chicken breast in the middle and a knife stuck in the chicken. Lots of garnishes which I just knocked off the plate to get to the good stuff. The waffle has bacon right in it - no not bits. Actual bacon strips. The chicken was good, not overcooked. I was only able to finish 1 waffle and 1 chicken. The rest was taken back to the hotel.  Definitely gonna come back and try some other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

YJiQ9pjN5Y3k8hbNCRkCMw.text: If you are thrown off by the prices, just know that the portion size is huge. I got the warm spinach side salad and could only eat half.  The warm maple vinaigrette was the perfect compliment to this salad.  I tried the waffles, which were stuffed with bacon, and they were delicious.  The maple syrup was good quality.  The service was prompt, this location was not crowded.

G9XRJlwGARdX55sFp4_xAw.text: Hash House a Go Go is an experience similar to a Las Vegas Show. Tourists have to go inside, but locals love their meals 24 hours a day at Hash House as well. Down the street from City Hall, many of the celebrities that live in Las Vegas can be found eating breakfast with press agents and talent managers inside the Plaza Casino's Hash House. Mayor Oscar Goodman's restaurant serving steak is directly above Hash House a Go Go. Today dozens followed us inside from the MLK Day Parade. Hundreds of hungry breakfast folks gathered at the Martin Luther King Jr. Day Parade the ended at Fremont Street near the Plaza Casino on Main Street. The plates are giant. The dishes are creative with the perfect taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X1CyvVLsdQ65OIcpEpfwfw.text: SO FUCKING GOOD!   They have huge proportions, and delicious food!   Had it for the first time while staying at the Plaza and was pleasantly surprised!  We had the salmon Benedict, bacon and mashed potato stuffed burger, chicken and waffles, and the bacon avocado burger, and they all were HUGE and SOOO tasty!   Definitely a good drunk or hungover meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT Bloody Mary
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar, bacon, avocado burger

FtDNpMXQKUu-lEJQXIwSug.text: No lie at all, this is for sure one of my favorite places that I've ever eaten. We went twice on our trip and was so happy. The first time my husband ordered the meatloaf breakfast and I ordered Andy's sage chicken Benedict. The Benedict was the coolest dish. You'll see the picture in a second. It was enough to feed four. The meatloaf tasted yummy. . The second time we were smarter and shared a breakfast quesadilla with chorizo. There were leftovers. Hahaha. It was huge! I wish I could give this place more stars. I seriously have no complaints about  the service or food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast quesadilla with chorizo. Two of us shared this and there was still leftovers.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s sage fried chicken Benedict. 10 out 5 stars. Price in menu pic. Order this!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hh menu

CXS3-C5CeXSdWcnp6c2fIw.text: Not very busy(Sunday around 5 PM)and overlooks Freemont Street casinos. Service was friendly and very fast. Glad we went to this location instead of Linq location on the strip. We were seated and greeted right away and given our drinks within five minutes. The tea/fresh lemonade is very good!  As for meals, we were naive about the sizes. We can usually eat Cheesecake Factory meals in 1-2 sittings, but these bad boys could feed a family of four(seriously, the bowl of my chicken pot pie was a family-sized serving bowl). Hubby and I both ordered a side salad, which were both the size of 3-4 side salads elsewhere. Could easily be split by 2-4 people, as an FYI. Hubby loved his mixed greens salad with macadamia nuts and said it was unique and the sweet vinaigrette complimentary. My Caesar salad was pretty basic with only four croutons and an over-abundance of manufactured parm cheese. Would have liked more crunch or additions of tomatoes/cucumbers. The four small corn croutons had a stale taste and odd texture. Get a different salad.   Our son liked his cheese quesadilla(which was very big) and the "fruit garnish" is a slice of orange and cantaloupe. Hubby loved his sage chicken and waffles. The chicken was moist, crispy, and well-flavored white meat. The waffles were fluffy yet crisp. He had a second meal from his leftovers.   My chicken pot pie tastes similar to chicken and biscuits. They first put down what looks like a huge cracker hat and then fill it with a creamy chicken stew. Lots of veggies, which were fresh and great. Some were undercooked and hard (potatoes and carrots) but it was otherwise tasty. Nothing super unique about the taste of the dish aside from the hat...err...crust. It was delicious, crisp and flaky but a nice chew inside. I would imagine that I will get four meals out of this dish.   I would go back but go at breakfast and order sage chicken benedict. Breakfast seems to be the star.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage chicken and waffles, kids quesadilla and chicken pot pie. Enormous.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage chicken and waffles

WKs_JSz56YnssC1QI09rSQ.text: Definitely a delicious treat for your taste buds and a lot of fun!  The portion sizes are huge and the staff was friendly. We are visiting from out of town and were told this was a must visit. And it was definitely worth it.

Y1nOxHull9FQjGnj9jWnzg.text: Stayed at the hotel during a music festival so the rooms were sold out. Wait was about an hour and half for sit down so my party of five opted for take out. That was about 20-25 min wait. The portions are GIANT!!!! Got the country fried steak, was 7/10.  It was definitely double deep fried. The gravy had good tasty bits inside and the mashed potatoes were yummy. The green beans were sad and overcooked. My boyfriend got the eggs benedict but it came with scramble eggs rather than poached. Also giant portion! All in all, it wasnt exciting. Just food to fill the stomach.

mRmbUeIdDJOEIQwvZi_vJQ.text: Stopped in Saturday morning said the wait would be 25 minutes but it was only about 10 for four people. Our waitress was friendly and quick to get our first drink order. Refills however were a little slow and had to be requested. Also our food order did not come out together. Portions were huge and the presentation was cool. A little pricey but nice to try once.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s sage fried chicken Benedict
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage Chicken and waffles

psGDwACpn7tFmWm36865fA.text: There isn't much here for vegetarians, but I had their portabello mushroom sandwich and sweet potato fries - both of which I enjoyed.  The waitress was attentive and courteous, and my friend and I were well taken care of.  A lot of reviews talk about breakfast/brunch...  We went for dinner, but I might return at some point to try other meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo burger that my friend ordered...
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great portabello mushroom burger!

qhy64zd1s2MEhsC8Jk3Mpg.text: The food was so fresh and delicious! Our server was nice and our food came out fast. I ordered the waffle combo and my fiance ordered the pancake with a side sausage. The portions were huge! Easily shareable with another person. I will definitely come back.

u6V5NUOy_9J6PLs6JubiEw.text: Hash House A Go Go was a convenient spot for my family and I to have lunch at due to the fact that it is located right in the entrance of the Plaza Hotel and Casino. We hopped off our long flight and decided to grab a quick bite to eat after checking in at the hotel. My brother had been to this establishment before and actually recommended it to me, so I was actually really excited to have lunch here.  The restaurant definitely gets a star for their friendly staff. Our waitress there patiently took our orders and brought us everything we asked for in a timely manner. She had a cheery attitude and overall, made me feel much less stressed after my long travels. Later that night, I also came back to drop in to the bar to order that Watermelon Cocktail that the hotel had advertised on every wall. The bartender was also friendly and helped me out with my drinks quickly. They do some pretty cool drinks and that warrants another star. During that lunch break I ordered a banana latte, which was fantastic. The warmth and general sweetness gave me a sense of nostalgia and made me feel like I was home. The Watermelon Cocktail that I got later on was also very good. Not too sweet and not too sour. Overall I was very happy with those.  Unfortunately, I was not that impressed with my meal. I ordered a mushroom burger and fries. I love mushrooms--usually I'll eat anything that it's smothered in--however, my burger tasted like it was lacking some flavor. I can't put my finger on what it was missing, but it just seemed sort of soggy and bland. The fries were great though and that really lightening the whole plate. The atmosphere was as you could expect from a hotel lobby restaurant. The entire place was flooded with that strange smell that floats throughout the Plaza Hotel, almost like old cologne mixed in with the trademark Las Vegas cigarette smoke.  All in all, I'll probably dip back in for a drink or two if I'm ever in the Fremont Street area again, but I'll hit up a different place for lunch.

XfniA7sumzATkWbDOi_RdA.text: Was pretty damn good, got the fried chicken and waffles. Only reason it got a 4 star is because I didn't receive a refill on my water.  Definitely recommend checking this place out, it's in the Plaza hotel.

uLFfIBPQEmMHp1nMFLPtlg.text: This restaurant is located in the Plaza Hotel in Downtown Las Vegas. The food here is amazing! The portions are gigantic! My favorite dish was the chicken and waffles. If you wake up with a hangover, this place will definitely cure you! I can't imagine how unhealthy the food may be, but it is freakin' delicious!  The service however, could've been better. Our server looked like he wasn't enjoying his job very much. But whatever, the food was great.  WARNING: Do not order your own dish and expect to eat the whole thing. The portion are extremely large. One dish could fill 1-3 people up, depending on how much they can eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

Vs_ZAc9pfWYpWqMxrgJLCQ.text: Food and service was great I order the basic and a cocktail at 11am yes it's vegas so why not. Food was tasty I got two scramble eggs biscuit bacon and potatoes and fruit. I love that they have more than one location .

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spike Watermelon lemonade
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The basic

_xDb8nmp6Lsjh1b5vLan3g.text: The food is great, waitresses are super super sweet. But let me tell you something about the jerk of a manager they have working here. Ed, a bigger & much older gentleman, supposedly the manager, is so unbelievably rude. He came over to us, and immediately said "Move your luggage, this is a walkway". (He literally commanded me). Not only is the walkway about 4 people wide and my tiny suitcase is the size of a small dog, but as I dropped my phone and clearly struggled to put my very heavy suitcase under my feet, he watched me struggle and didn't once offer to help. Note, he stood there staring for the full duration of me putting it away. As a woman, I've never struggled in front of a man who didn't offer to assist me. It wasn't even busy, at all. I mean, I was STRUGGLING, and he just scoffed & walked off. Nothing like having to enjoy a meal with your feet uncomfortably sitting on your luggage. We watched him ask, "how's it going?" to various other tables right next to us, but never came back to us. The food really is fantastic, but as a place that serves primarily breakfast foods, how do run out of orange juice? Next time that happens, just send Ed to get more oranges. He wouldn't be missed. I'd opt for another location if you can.

N0SEN6ayhne3MRkjXALIOg.text: Brunch day with my cousin!  I woke up wanting to grub on some food and have a few cocktails.  When I thought about brunch, I thought about this place!  I've been fortunate enough to the check out the M Resort location, I suggested we go and try the Plaza hotel location.  The look is very consistent to the south location.  You have table tops, you have booths.  Lots of wood and metal lining the tables and walls.  Tables have grains in vases.  It's exactly what they advertise:  Twisted Farm Food (and Decor).  I decided to sit at the bar and was helped by Mandy (blonde bartender).  She was nice and super timely.  For brunch, we started with mimosas for $6.95 each.  Served with an orange slice, this drink contains orange juice with lots of pulp, so be advised.  Not a problem for me, but I know some folks don't like pulp.  It still did the trick!  For my meal, I had the popular Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles for $16.95.  This dish was lined with bacon waffles with two huge breast pieces of Sage Fried chicken, accompanied with fried leaks, hot maple caramel reduction and a sprig of rosemary.  The chicken was amazing!  Super juicy for a breast, the batter was crunchy and seasoned very well!  Home run for me :)  another home run was the bacon waffles.  There's not just bits of bacon, but entire strips of bacon!  The syrup was on point, thick and sweet and really enhanced the overall flavor!!  What I didn't like was the fried leaks.  They were everywhere and made the plate look super sloppy.  Thank goodness they were edible because they kept getting in all bite.  Little irritating but not a huge deal.  What was a huge deal for me was the fact that my cousin's dish came out and I waiting more than 5 minutes until my dish came out.  I understand her dish was just a scramble, however, they should be aware of ticket times so the entire party gets their meals at once.    Other than that, I would still return to this place.  What I've learned about Hash House is that it's affordable and really packed with flavor.  The crowds of people that wait for a table, no matter the location, is proof that this place rocks!  If you're downtown, come on by and check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage Fried chicken and waffles for $16.95

XCftAsag7npAluYN3cmR5g.text: Food was amazing!  Huge portions! The server we had was really nice and kept my drink filled the whole time!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Benedict!!!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles!! Yummy!

0dMtDnDDib8kda4PPvuL9A.text: if you are a breakfast enthusiast and/or a lumberjack, this place will amaze you. but if you're like me and don't like to go overboard on your breakfast portions, Hash House scores a "mehh.."  i've eaten at a different Hash House several times before, and i usually opt to share one of their dishes with another person because the serving sizes are ginormous.  the service was great, but the breakfast and lunch dishes are literally stacked with ingredients, and some of the dishes my family ordered looked more like 3 meals combined into one. for example: my brother's "bacon + eggs + potatoes + hash browns + biscuit + gravy + omelette + chicken benedict" aka "the WTF" (served with a knife through the top and some sort of sage plant pierced through the biscuit).  all i needed for a satisfying breakfast was a hot cup of coffee and their french toast, which was actually delicious and not too huge of a portion. thankfully, they did not overkill the french toast as they did with the others' meals.  -civilities.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dad and his Andy&#39;s Sage Fried Chicken Benedict aka &#39;The WTF&#39;
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast dipped in banana cinnamon cream sans banana.

LDrGlBcLVGEFE6FPy2rR3A.text: Super friendly, super delicious. Portions are HUGE  (as advertised) but I felt bed wasting so much! Friendly staff and and great location in The Plaza.

x7VKfcWAv7wZyNlQDke2yA.text: We had a great breakfast here and food was very good. Waite staff, was very polite and friendly.   The young man "Alfy" our server   Had a great cheerful attitude,  explained the menu and was very attentive. .....I was nice to see this young man take his job seriously and having fun.  More servers could learn from him...  Great place to eat....

QyuzqQbW0bbHaxMfseISbw.text: Had this on my list of places to visit if we had the chance and BOOM we had the chance.  WOW this place was GREAT.  We split a Sage Chicken Fried Steak salad.  BIG tasty piece of Chicken a meal in itself.  Good Salad under it too.  I had the BBLT good good good.  Tasty bacon, Great bread.  Good Good Good.  A good good family place to go.   TRY IT if your on FREEMONT street in DownTown VEGAS love this place.

80x0P5AAohfGLVMVsU1LTw.text: I had such high hopes for my dining experience.....unfortunately it was tainted by an allergic reaction to what I will never know was in my bacon, eggs, potatoes and biscuit breakfast.  I would however like to return and try the chicken and waffles...this time I'll take some anti-histamines beforehand.

XMl1Xi99jQGd-_YmBCttZw.text: I came here for only one thing, to try out their Bloody Mary. There's so much talk on the internet about their Bloody Mary. So what's cool? They make their own mix. That's respectable. But it's ok, not great. They serve it with low quality vodka which you can ask for a higher quality but I decided to stick with their formula. I really did think it would have tasted better with a higher quality vodka like Grey Goose. Regardless, this is not a Bloody Mary I would go out of my way to come and drink.

Zrxi7qKNk3IW98-nALEb2Q.text: We ate breakfast here all three mornings that we were in Vegas. The portions are ridiculous. If you can agree on an item, share a plate. For example, pancakes are about 14" in diameter. A waffle is about 7x12. Both were delicious. The French toast was good, but not as good. The grilled mashed potatoes beat out the cubed fried potatoes hands down. The bacon was meh. Morning cocktails are expensive so we passed. Coffee is actually really good and we are pretty picky when in comes to coffee. Recommend.

1g8lnsrvcuMPJQaYDV97ag.text: First the reason for the loss of the star . . . we asked for a table . . . they hostess tried to fit me (a still large man) into a both . . . and we were told there were no tables available . . . even though three were in plain sight . . . with that we opted for the bar.  Food was great . . . had the mushroom swiss burger . . . missed the part about it being a poung of ground beef . . . put like a trooper . . . I ate the whole thing . . . but not the side.  This burger was great in a taste way . . . not the oowee gooyee way . . . but pure tast way.  Service was great . . . cocktails were very tasty . . . we will devfinitelly be back . . .

D6ooujbH8pV-bnUggGXLGw.text: Pros:  It's across the plaza and a good location and portions are huge!  Cons:  The price, and depends on what you get.  Food Experience: I was expecting something better when I ordered the HH special Benedict. It was not that great when I realized its sauce, mash potatoes on top that with large biscuits two thick slices of tomato, a sunny side up egg and more sauce. It was alright honestly.  Conclusion: Overall don't go here if you're not gonna get the chicken and waffles. It's a brunch/breakfast joint as well. It's worth it at least once to see such large portions.

DlMeLs3SulEw8IOMtAyEwg.text: Seriously one of the best chicken and waffles I've had, the plates are huge the food is great and reasonably priced given the fact of what it is. Both locations are solid too. Recommend for sure!

5GzqxxmM2OrRqireMgukvw.text: They have amazing food here. The portions are massive. The prices are reasonable for what you get and the service is excellent. We love stopping by when we are in town.

eWsiLCmTGQcJhc0ZkJVfQg.text: I saw this place on the Travel Channel and said "If I ever get to Las Vegas, I'm eating there."    Last week my friends and I finally went to Las Vegas for a week vacation and made it a point to eat here... and it was the BEST meal we had the whole trip!  The size of the plates alone took up 1/4 of the table.  The amount of food you get is absolutely ridiculous.  Plus the honey biscuits they give you... OMG they have to be a pound apiece.    I had the famous chicken and waffles and almost had an orgasm at the table.  The waffles had bacon cooked into them and the fried chicken was perfection.  It had real maple syrup on it too, not that fake crap.    My friends got meatloaf and stuffed hamburgers.  All you heard during dinner was "Ohhh my god this is soooo goooood!".    Our waiter was awesome and gave us the souvenir drink glasses for free.  I wanted to try the bacon bloody mary but my tummy was telling me NO!!!!  The prices were more reasonable then I thought they would be.   For 2 people to eat like pigs and bring more than half the food home, along with drinks, was only $37.    After dinner we waddled back to our hotel and laid in the hot tub for a few hours to digest.  Then after a few hours of drinking and gambling, we ate our leftovers and they were even better!  LOL  I've heard they just opened a new location in Chicago and I'm definitely going to find it!  Hmmm, maybe I shouldn't or I'll be broke and weigh 400 pounds!

ST4uJMJqkHm1ojrfVUBTIw.text: 2nd time here and it never disapoints! Tried the corned beef hash a go go and it was delicious! Huge portions. Service is great. Always a stop for us while we're in Vegas!

dBGq9jQpMqnOx1iQ-GlWGQ.text: My BFF had nothing but great things to say about the food here, so the next afternoon after a crazy night out in Vegas, we decided to give this location a try!  They have a great selection of food here and everything just sounds so mouth watering (especially if you are hanging like we were!).  I decided to go for the chicken salad sandwich with salad and my friend got the chicken and waffles, which she said she always gets cause it's that darn good!  Her food came out first and I waited about another 10 min before I got my food.  When I did, I was not disappointed!  My sandwich was HUGE! I had to take a minute to wrap my head and mouth around it.  But, it was DELICIOUS!  I also tried some of my friend's chicken and that was delicious as well.    The amount of food we got for the price was well worth it.  We both had leftovers, which we munched on later.  Everyone thanked us as we left, which was really nice and pretty rare to see that everyone stops to thank you for your business as you leave.

WM5g1CKJ6DbO1Q66WZ-PbQ.text: This location is much better than other locations. The waffle with bacon is excellent. The service is a lot faster here. I give this place ten stars. I've been here almost five or six times. Each and every time it was worth it.

4RuIMxKfohvxWDKBKEVVYQ.text: Great tasting food! Bloody marys are hot and spicy! They have fresh house made strawberry jam ...and it went a home made biscuit. You get a lot of food for a good price.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

__uifcalPw9hVkgsNDERog.text: visited 06.26.15  Excellent breakfast spot for a hearty way to start your day, or end your night of drinking.  Portions were massive, so bring your appetite but the large sizes don't take away from the wonderful flavors you encounter when you taste the food.  I had the truck drivers special with french toast and it was awesome.  The toast was soft and fluffy and crunchy and it was served with a very generous side of maple syrup, eggs and bacon!  A friend had the chorizo, eggs and toast and she did her best but she couldn't quite devour the mountain of food served to her in the cast iron skillet that just adds to the presentation.  Coffee and OJ were on point so all in all a great spot.

6Ni4wcWlDiJn_lssiF6oeg.text: SOOO MUUUCCCHHH FOOODDDDDD!!! Come hungry or prepare to split cause these portions are HUGE!  I ordered the Hardwood smoked bacon, avocado, onion & swiss scramble which came out with fluffy eggs and stuffed with bacon and avocado. Got a brown sugar and banana pancake as a side... but it was 14" wide! Super tasty, and fluffy, that is a winning pancake.   The boys ordered the Sage Fried chicken, chicken and waffles, and chicken fried steak. The chicken is cranky on the outside, moist on the inside and fills you to the brim. We left with full tummy, smiles on our faces, and lots of doggy bags.  Servies was friendly and this place was defo worth the wait.

ev9dWMRHkufLm4CalRhBgw.text: Yummy Yummy for your tummy!  HUGE!  Did I mention HUGE portions?????  Feel free to share, as you cant possibly eat it all!  Hint:  Try the Cucumber Ranch Dressing !!!!  An absolute must for a lunch or dinner!!!

TTnu2TzmRE4jtEN1Yt5MVw.text: Recommended by a friend and didn't disappoint! H-U-G-E Portions reasonably priced and the food is tasty and delicious. The service was excellent and the wait staff more than accommodating. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because we didn't actually get to taste the dinners but the food we saw go by looked delicious and everyone took home extras. And what presentation on the food! We had a coupon for a free dinner but went too early to use it. Our waiter was able to get it applied to our appetizers and and gave us a complimentary drink. So during happy hour we had 3 appetizers and 2 drinks for $5. And we were stuffed! And it was delicious, we couldn't have eaten a meal after that. The wings we're spicy, large and had great flavor. Not Buffalo wings but just as tasty. The bacon was delectable and the fried pickles yummy. Definitely recommend!

uySYudvdh5_eZOLCaq4Xig.text: Amazing hammered pork! Great chicken n waffles. So fresh and homemade everything! It's the way to go! Really good food!  Huge portions! Make sure you share!  Great service too! Thank you Monique, you're the best!

DyROEgPj4jksIjmSj9NEdA.text: Awesome food!  Big portions of food.  Plan on sharing a plate or taking a doggy bag home!  The Hot Chocolate is Huge!

icXSiXb2VxCRdJmQK-lvrg.text: Party of 14 brings you a variety of orders to view! What stands out about this place is their commitment to freshness and making things from scratch. No processed junk here! Their dishes are very tasty and come in large (I mean LARGE) portions!! They have a creative farmhouse-style food blend on traditional dishes. Comfortable ambience, great for small or large groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gr-uFH7y8aINdSeVzUvqBA.text: Hubby had the pumpkin pancake. Delicious and huge!  I had the biscuit and gravy and a side a home fries. Biscuit is very dense and they were skimpy on the gravy.  It was very good though. Loved the home-fries!  Prices are Vegas style. Expensive. But portion sizes are very good.

YHkffFc3Uo3KGHYJu9K6PQ.text: Subpar brunch food... not sure what the hype is about. We waited close to 1.5 hours during Life is Beautiful so not sure if the wait is normally this long but it was ridiculous. Oh yeah and their lame wifi does not work for guests. So yea, you'll get pretty bored waiting here.   Service was horrible here too. Server totally neglected us, forgot utensils, forgot our requests, etc. I got the Marshmallow Mocha drink which was way too sweet...   They have GINORMOUS portions so you should just share. My fiance and I just ended up sharing the chicken and waffles plate which was just okay. The breading of the chicken was a little mushy and not crispy. Even though we shared, we only finished probably 2/3 of the food.  Ugh. would not come back. Waste of money, time, and calories!

HyghMma2ZihEtDHzlMOVHQ.text: Can't wait to go back to my favorite diner in Vegas. Great food, amazing service and clean and fast with the orders. This is our happy place.

GfLoBos1CpvyRfJ_Big2cA.text: This is my favorite breakfast place. Today was a bad experience. We arrived at about 8:30 am, the restaurant was almost empty, we were told by the hostess it would be a 15 minute wait. She refused to smile or be pleasant. We will go elsewhere in the future.

2lxOp0v2kOCJTR7s3KyjHw.text: Tips:  1. There will be a wait especially on the weekends. It's ok and worth it. 2. Order anything with fried chicken. Even for breakfast. Personal fav is the fried chicken Benedict. 3. SHARE BETWEEN TWO PEOPLE. The plates are enormous. If you don't share you'll have leftovers, and who wants to eat soggy microwaved leftovers in Vegas? No one. Just share and save some money.

UnpwONZlw4Akk2Dnfavu_Q.text: Three of us went for dinner.  Got seated quickly and our server came to us right away.  We ordered drinks and got them quickly.  When ordering,  we discovered they were out of root beer and bacon due to a large party that was in earlier.  This did change an order at our table.  We had a snickers pancake which was very good.  The country fried steak with mashed potatoes and a biscuit. The steak was fine very well and the potatoes were as well.  The last thing we had was the crab cake Benedict. It had a bit of heat to it but was really good.  There was large chunks of crab in the cake and it was seasoned well.  While eating the power went out for a brief moment.  Our server was super excited about the food we ordered and very friendly. I would have given 5 stars,  however the seating area was very warm.

mJSKl-YrQ3NQwH6DM2IWBw.text: To sum it up. I think people love this place for the huge portions, not so much the quality of the food.  The best item our group had was the chicken hash.  The chicken & waffles is huge, but bland.  I asked to purchase the sauce that goes on the Man v Food chicken dish (it is cheesy and spicy).  It was awesome and that helped make the chicken and waffles a dish I wanted to continue to eat.  The red velvet pancake is huge but they put hardly any cream cheese frosting on it. So it was dry. We had to ask for more frosting. The pancake itself was hard to eat as it just fell apart.  Not so great.   The worst part honestly was the service.  I think our waitress did not want to be at work today.  She was nice but brief.  Our food took FOREVER (& we were lucky to get there before the rush - we arrived around 9:30a and were seated immediately). Our waitress never acknowledged our food issue.  She did a good job of filling our coffee, but I'm not exaggerating when I say it took a solid 45 min to get our food (& there were only 4 us).  I don't blame her for the food timing but please at least acknowledge there's an issue.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is under specialities but don&#39;t remember name. It&#39;s a shredded meat with eggs and veggies served with tortilla.  It was good.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles.  Bland.  I would get the Man v Food chicken dish that has a spicy cheese sauce in lieu of this option.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes.  Hardly any cream cheese frosting - very dry &amp; crumbly.

vqULocAYQBRNSEfbVF4CqA.text: Great food and huge portions, definitely share with someone! Only giving three stars because the service was pretty bad. When we asked the bartender if we could pay for our drinks separately she started telling the guy next to us about how rude it is for people to get separate checks and that she makes her son split checks evenly. My friend's drink was 2x as much as mine, so it's not like we got the same thing. Anyway, then we went to sit down and our waitress took our order, our food came out at different times to the point that I felt bad my friend was waiting for me and then the waitress didn't check in on us till we pulled her aside to ask for the check. But hey, it's good food so if you're willing to put up with some potential annoyances then it's worth it

aTtQwU4svVX6YLoaHkvmrQ.text: Let me warn you, if you chose to eat here and do not tend to eat a lot I would recommend to split a meal with a friend. Hash House A Go Go does not play with portion size. Their entrees are the size of your head!   I ordered the chicken pot pie and it was enormous. It was really good but impossible to finish. My friends ordered the eggs benedit, chicken and waffles, and basic breakfast- all which were too big to consume for one person.   Overall, great decor and service. Would recommend to all!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FcFmRf6DdlV1Efct5D47lw.text: Their chicken strips with chipotle sauce is amazing. Have had it twice and look forward to it every time. Lemon chicken platter was also enjoyed by my husband. Service and price is great

uHA-XZbLJLjXlpSOEQbkdw.text: Great service but giving them 4 stars because their "HH Famous Mac and cheese" was definitely nothing to write home about. It looked more like a light alfredo dish and I had to add salt and pepper to get any flavor.

cMXJHjROKu2568CdyndYxw.text: The name is as cool as the food they serve!!!! If your looking for a good "hangover helper" breakfast in Vegas, THIS is the place to go!!!! By the time we left here, I felt right as rain.....

cys2YJGvRROA7omsNb36YA.text: It's like eating from a pig through. Hash House policy forbids sharing their unreasonable oversized portions among the table. By the end of the day Hash House is throwing tons of food away. Or hopefully... they feed it to the pigs.

dqDaEAVr7JMATXCzxeIlZg.text: I had Hash House A Go Go bookmarked for a while. This wasn't the location I bookmarked but it was near my current location. We went for brunch on a Saturday morning. It was a 30 minute wait (first come, first serve at bar). Luckily, we were able to get bar seats. I usually wait to be seated at a table but I was hungry so we took the open bar seats. I ordered banana French toast. The portion was huge (enough for 2 people IMO). Customer service at the bar left a lot to be desired. I understand why this location was rated a lot lower than other locations. Service at the bar definitely needed tuning up. My experience was "meh" in Yelp terms for brunch. I'm hoping this was just an off day but reading reviews it's unlikely.

uMPx1KbV1G3Tbu8UaNVB8A.text: I was not trilled to have to stay at the Plaza but one good thing was Hash House A Go Go is in the lobby. The breakfasts are fantastic. We had a family of 6 and we all enjoyed our selections. Large portions! But food and service was excellent. So if you're staying (or wake up) in downtown Vegas, this is a good place for breakfast.

TStQzPDmaQa_J8zVn81Etw.text: We went for breakfast on a Wednesday morning. Seemingly not busy, but waited 10 minutes to be greeted by our server. Then proceeded to wait without a check in for 25 mins for breakfast. The food was not great, and was cold. She never checked on us and never asked if everything was to our satisfaction. We had to ask a busser to ask if he could track her down for the bill. Suffice to say we will not return.

LZna4xpklsie5G8wKl_BcA.text: As we planned our Vegas trip I had multiple friends swear by how incredible this place is. The wife and I checked it out last night. The food portions are enormous. She had the pot pie and I had the chicken and waffles. The place was clean and the food was reasonably priced. For all the hype I was a little disappointed. While the food was good, it was not even close to being the best breakfast I have had. There's more flash and presentation to the plates than there is deliciousness.

a8CCsFVsk5nmq80QxPfhGw.text: 5 stars for the AMAZING food! This place is off the hook! Service was decent, wish our server had more personality but maybe she was having a bad day. It was our first time here so I'll be patient and see what the service is like when we come back. We showed up around noon and no waiting! Everything on the menu looks incredible. Between  4 of us we had the man vs food plate, banana french toast, fried green tomatoes, a stuffed burger and the mac n cheese. I recommend everything!!! Can't wait until our next visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast.... OMG!! SOOOO good!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Off the hook! Man vs food favorite!

oec_6wHts1BJjpfjrQtvUg.text: This location is inside of the Plaza hotel.  We had been walking around Fremont and needed to feed the beast.  It was our first visit to Hash house and had noticed many yelpers pictures of the huge portions.  Needless to say I was going to try it out!   We were greeted by a very upbeat and spunky hostess.  Upon being immediately seated, our waiter was there to get our drink orders.   I will say their service was top notch and perfect!  Our drinks never went empty and the waiter was the definition of great customer service.   After ordering our food, it was out in the blink of an eye!    I had ordered the Cobb Salad.  Yes, this huge portion was more than I could handle.  It was definitely something I could have shared.  But the salads flavor and ingredients were just ok.  It was filled with plenty of lettuce but kinda skimped on the toppings.  The ratio was way off.  The chicken that was on the salad seemed to be out of a can.  Bummer.   I would have though they would have seasoned it before putting it on the salad but I was wrong.    Yes, their servings are enormous but then lack in quality.  Service deserves all of the praise!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger with bacon, cheese and avacado
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb Salad

uEHLHXmBXs6UxZ89Pgck4w.text: Food is yummy, they give you a GREAT BIG portion of food and the price is well worth it, service is great, our waiter was prompt and friendly I'd come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

imf5LnNyltQe4_0jjb2BXg.text: Service was good. Wait was sorta long but that's because the place is very popular with people who are staying in the  hotel and others who are not. Overall the food was very good. Would definitely recommend trying this place.

kwQT-VGKvi06kX9WeJIGow.text: First off, this place is FUN!!  You're greeted by smiling faces when you make your way into this cool, hip restaurant that's right inside the lobby.  This place was packed during both times that I have been there for breakfast.  Even though they were packed; the bartenders (I sat at the bar since it was so packed) and waitresses were extremely friendly!  Even if you come in STARVING; I don't see how you can finish one of their "Benedicts".  They've become some of the best meals that I've ever had for breakfast.  This time, I tried their Blue Crab Benedict.  Let me tell you something...These guys DO NOT CHINCH on the crab!!! I got 2 really large crab cakes that were smothered in some of the most complex and delicious sauces and ingredients you could find while eating out.    While waiting for breakfast (this food is freshly cooked, so you'll wait a bit), I knocked back a perfectly made Bloody Mary at their bar.  This didn't have any store bought cheapo mix..It's their own mix and it's one of the best I've had.    Since the bar had great TV's, I ended up spending the ENTIRE DAY there!! I'm not kidding!  I watched 2 NFL playoff games, and was surrounded by nothing but friendly people as I bought bucket after bucket of beer (5 for $14)!  This place is one of two GREAT restaurants; not only in Downtown; but in Vegas PERIOD!  The food, and the Plaza Hotel are both huge reasons why Downtown Vegas is getting better each year.

Y--WAjPbpXreW1ZpdEUKhg.text: Brown sugar banana pancake was AMAZING!!!!! I also tried the Snickers pancake which was just okay....

_CI-T1xrzSjNGJYiF9HHCQ.text: Huge portions!! On top of that, everything tasted great! A must go while in downtown Vegas and an empty stomach. Family loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WHVMapxgCdtdp2ciHq1OZw.text: If your looking for a place where you won't leave hungry look no further.  This is perfect hangover comfort food.  Every was really happy with their meal and I would definitely come back here.  We tried the chicken and waffles, some type of quesadilla and the chicken benedict.  Everything was delicious.  We went during the week for brunch and the place was pretty empty so we received excellent service and the chef even came out to chat with us.  We definitely go back here on our trips to vegas.

M00K40nRL34wRKu52TzrNg.text: Ate here on st pattys day and was not disappointed Irish coffees were awesome the Guinness beef stew was phenomenal and the corned beef and cabbage was seriously the best I have ever had. The corned beef was so tender it pulled apart perfectly with a fork I will be back every year for this day. Service was great too he was an older gentlemen with white hair was our server. Very friendly and attentive.

upG4pIDZeHDVJ7Iyi5ox6Q.text: Enjoyed the food. I ordered the tractor driver combo with a pancake. The food came out fast and was warm.  It was actually good. But nothing over the top. It was pretty average. I ordered a mimosa. But the orange juice I. It tasted cheap and made the mimosa pretty weird tasting. The price was good. I would go again. The waitress seemed tired and Uninterested. Not rude but just tired. It wasn't too busy. We went on a Sunday around 8am.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tractor driver combo.

KI4f3vqYXcKn8KVvfadm-g.text: This place is amazing! We were staying at The Plaza over Memorial Day weekend and decided to come here for breakfast. When we arrived we were told there was an hour wait but that they could text us when our table was ready so we went back to our room and waited. We received a text in about 40mins so not too bad of a wait. But trust me, it's definitely worth the wait! I ordered the waffles, one friend ordered the French toast, and my other friend ordered the fried chicken eggs Benedict. Our plates were GINORMOUS! We couldn't even finish. Definitely stop here if you're gonna be in old town Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken eggs Benedict.

UiOJ4uCQQnIbQqt5KkUFSA.text: This place is amazing! Grab a buddy to share with because portions are huge! We ate here three times on our last trip, it was convenient as we stayed at the Golden Nugget and delicious! One of the best things about this place is they serve my favorite huckleberry vodka all the way from Idaho and it comes in an adorable mason jar you get to take with you.  We tried both fried chicken and chicken fried steak, both were great but the chicken was just slightly better. Try the gravy on both, it's wonderful! Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

l0bVnKqF5UDXwJ2xEy6Hig.text: Items Selected: Coffee Four Jumbo Biscuits with Butter and Housemade Jam Andy's sage fried chicken Benedict w/ fresh spinach, hardwood smoked bacon, market tomato, griddled mozzarella, chipotle cream and scrambled eggs Andy's famous Bread pudding topped w/ ice cream and served w/ a cup of coffee French Toast - Griddled french toast dipped in banana cinnamon cream w/ pecan maple syrup  Snicker's Flapjack  Already having visited the location on Sahara along with those within the (then) Imperial Palace as well as the Rio, it was with a full compliment of family that breakfast was ordered amidst the spacious confines of Hash House a Go-Go at the Plaza, but with substantial delays and subpar service marring this rendition of the San Diwego import the overall experience was less memorable than all had hoped for, though the "Twisted Farm Food" was largely just as good.  Known for its enormous portions and perhaps even more famous in Las Vegas than at home in the Golden State, it was first to a substantial wait for a table despite the restaurant being almost 2/3 empty that we stood at the podium after arriving at 8:30, another protracted delay to follow as servers seemed completely lost as to who was responsible for which table, then further complicated  by a similar wait for both food as well as drinks.  Not one to suffer such annoyances well, particularly after an early rise and nearly twelve-mile early morning run, it was finally after wondering aloud why such a delay was taking place that coffee was refilled and plates began to trickle forth, the benedict still fifteen minutes away with a steaming block of bread pudding oddly arriving first.  Previously impressed by the molten brownie topped in chocolate, caramel, and nuts with ice cream slowly forming a pool of creamy vanilla sauce, it was after a few bites that attention was turned to the hubcap sized pancake studded in the similar flavors of Snickers that attention was turned, the buttermilk largely overwhelming the candybar when topped in butter and pure maple syrup brought from home while the French Toast was rich with the flavors of cinnamon and vanilla custard plus skin-on bananas, the presentation a bit slipshod though perhaps also the most "down home."  Always attuned to the presence of biscuits, those at Hash House a Go-Go of the larger, fluffier variety popular throughout the Midwest, it was alongside the signature chicken that a quartet of golden rounds was brought forth, each amongst the best in Sin City while the mountainous Benedict buried the one included beneath crispy well-seasoned bird and fresh vegetables, the addition of bacon, cheese, at least three eggs, and smoky cream sauce no doubt making the Man vs. Food Classic a dish best shared.  Offering more support than most for the sort of early morning gluttony through which  Hash House a Go-Go has made its name it may warrant further visits to determine precisely why the service was so awful during this visit to the one at the Plaza, but unless one is restricted by transportation the better bet would seem to be a trip to the locations with better service (and free parking) on Sahara, 24/7 in the Rio, or Stripside at The Linq.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ucPHPjG-Z2ybH0xZ71VDRA.text: The fried chicken eggs benedict is a life changing experience. The fried chicken was perfect, the mashed potatoes were perfect, the biscuit was perfect, the vegetables were a nice touch. The drinks were really good. The red velvet waffle was really good. But you need the fried chicken eggs benedict in your life. By the way, the portions are gigantic, and we split this with three people.

p7uqmJ2AvmuJuzAk6IdBHQ.text: The meatloaf was the best I've ever had.  And the BBQ is amazing with it.  Must order the meatloaf.

SLcHb4yTptBpQnUbqQkhQA.text: The waitress was very loud an agresive. I'm a little hung over so that sucks. The table was VERY wobbly. Was the food good I mean it was pretty good but between the wobbly table and the aggressive waitress I just feel uncomfortable. My wife and I almost started arguing because we didn't feel very good at where we were at. Was there plenty of food on a plate yes there was we shared a plate. Was it good yes it was. Did I feel a little bit uncomfortable like cattle yes. I felt like we were just being pushed through a stall and being told to get done and get out so they can put somebody else in the table. That made me feel very uncomfortable. When I asked about the menu items I got given a light response. The lady didn't even want to tell me. I felt like I was putting her out. The table was so wobbly are water spilled like five times. Again was it good food yes it was good food. Was there enough for us to both share and yes it was. Did I feel uncomfortable there yes absolutely I did feel uncomfortable. I felt like they were like hurry up and Order and get out. We were looking at the menu and should come by 4X loud asking do you know what you want. And I said can we please have a little bit of time. I'm a little hungover. Can you please not be so loud. She laughed at me.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was a big plate of food.

ueWSfcJEj88vhvzRav6Uig.text: The portions are on the large side. My husband and I were able to share our breakfast. Fresh fruit and crispy house potatoes were a plus.  Enjoyed our meal so much, we ate here again on our 2nd day.

26azNxcbvCCkABcS6ufGbQ.text: Solid spot to eat on Fremont. Waffle was delicious and my wife loved her burger. Great spot for morning/brunch. Would have given it a 5 star but the wait was a little over 39 minutes to get in and then another 20 minutes to get our food. Long wait but will definitely come back next time I am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Junior burger and fries
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle and eggs

36O14fVJb9rxMeVRpwH1jA.text: Great food!   I had the chicken hash. Not was so well seasoned.  The portions were so big that I split it with a friend and we still didn't finish.  I will be back!

cUgYo30O3FMDGcDSexCMwg.text: Ok, maybe 3 1/2 stars.  Breakfast is good but way overpriced.  Breakfast for two... Corned beef hash and eggs, a pancake, and two coffees... $33.  We have had dinner here, and it's a much better value.

UB4-5rY127m8o9yvC6fKTg.text: Decided to come here for breakfast since it was within walking distance from our hotel.  The "Brown Sugar Banana Flapjack" lives up to the hype, as well as the "Fried Chicken & Waffles."  Like many others have said, huge portions, & as much as we tried, we couldn't finish it all.  Our servers were very nice & checked on us often to make sure we were okay. We left there stuffed & weren't hungry until dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brown Sugar &amp; Banana Flapjack

Z78BzwUudTdFc8ep728b7Q.text: Horrible. .served eggs with the whites uncooked. Sausage was nasty...for the price it should at least try to compete and serve decent food that is not raw!  Told the girl at the front desk and she said "good" apparently she was not hearing what we said or just didn't  care...that explains it!   Thumbs down a BIG one......horrible!

DTbJipoOauKqHlck9frPTw.text: I was in downtown Vegas for a conference and was stoked to be able to try the Hash House from this location. I have gone to the one in SD many times and wanted to see if they could keep the consistency.  The food was okay. I was a little disappointed. The mashed potatoes and the gravy did not taste fresh, kind of tasted like something that came out of a box. The chicken breast was soggy from the frying. It was meh.  HOWEVER, their Bloody Mary's are off the hook wonderful! If nothing else go for a bloody and same eggs. Seriously, I would go back just for them. (Notice how I am saying THEY) The mix is just the right amount of spice and they don't go easy on the good stuff. The coffee is good ole diner coffee too. So A PLUS on the liquids.  The restaurant is located inside the Plaza Hotel; right in front of the main entrance. This makes it extremely easy to get to, especially if you are wandering up and down Fremont.

qD9XDfyO1GbmMO_yAYVDcQ.text: The food here was delicious (breakfast). However the service was so so. Our waitress had an attitude whenever we would ask for something. I asked for my eggs over-medium and not runny but they were runny. The homemade jam was delicious!

Cg494lC2hYaWVnZOh-wciw.text: I must admit that I came here with high expectations as I've seen a few specials praising Hash House A Go Go however when I finally was able to try this Las Vegas legend I was not very impressed. Unable to order the praised pancakes, since there were no gluten free options, I opted for a scramble filled with sun-dried tomato, basil and goat cheese: three ingredients destined for perfection. It was to come with potatoes and fruit and a side of bacon (which was an extra $3.95) when my food arrived it looked delicious and promising, but my side of bacon was rather sad and turned out to be cold. When I asked for a new side of bacon some was brought to me immediately and I'm convinced it was simply because it was microwaved. I'm guessing so because I've microwaved plenty of bacon myself. As for the scramble, it was good, but not the best I've had and the potatoes although tasty were not evenly cooked.   The service was good, but the overall experience was not worth the price/the hype.

y-fFI3ov8Eyz-HW1JywuaA.text: Food is great, the people suck. Only one waffle maker working, ridiculous, never going there again only to the Sahara one. But the manager was nice enough to make us feel better. By the way the hostess JOEY sucks, he rolled his eyes at us and looked blank at everything we said.

-2FqPgxKfv91r6sViBqLsg.text: Wow. The manager (tall balding man) there has no experience with customer care and how to get his point across without insulting repeat customers...definitely in need of training/retraining. Needless to say that we and all of our friends will not be returning.

q0vwsEtrmaxrmjyxWpkQ9w.text: First let me say, I love HHAGG.  But the service here was poor.  Perhaps it is the downtown location that attracts a certain clientele. But don't assume I am a low class citizen until I do something that warrants such treatment.    My son's pancakes were supposed to have chocolate chips. They arrived plain. Our six orders didn't arrive together. The last order arrived a full 1/2 hour after the first order.   We asked for a bottle of ketchup. They said weren't allowed to give a whole bottle. .. Really?!? Is there a ketchup shortage in Vegas I'm not aware of?   I will probably not come back here by choice.   The saving grace is the food which is consistently good.

2TlHfsxcdqtcCeJg3eYRVg.text: We had breakfast here this morning.  Portions are large so if you go with someone who wants the same item as you, share if you can.  We had tangerine mimosas and absolutely delicious.   Give them a try the next time you're in Vegas.

8wLluNbu3plcIprbNTAuUw.text: Great breakfast here in the newly renovated Plaza Hotel.  Ate their sage fried chicken & waffles.  Two pieces of perfectly  battered fried chicken with waffles, bacon and tomatoes garnished with fried green onions and a rosemary stem made for a totally satisfying meal.  This dish was huge!  The chicken was not greasy at all and had a lightly seasoned with sage batter that came out crispy.    The guy next to me ordered their pork eggs benedict.  The waitress said that there are 18 ounces of chicken fried pork alone in that dish.  She said Adam from Man vs Food ate this dish.  Very good value for the money.  I'd eat here again in a heartbeat, but my arteries would probably kill me if I made this a habit.

V2xOAnVeDpc34ZUP4zcomQ.text: The novelty has worn off....too many locations....too meh of flavors.... Portions still huge, but paying $14 for a giant pancake, eggs and some bacon is pretty deceiving.... Service ok for a weekday.....  Im still trying to figure out WHY go in the Plaza.... I mean friggin urine stained plaza...... wow....somebody got paid big bucks....  anyhow....its always worth trying once.....Definitely need a menu upgrade....

I2hoMOPXtO47r6e_9NlSEA.text: Based on reviews we were not expecting much but was very pleased with the service and food. We love the Hash House in San Diego and was pleased to find this one in downtown Vegas. The food was great and service fantastic. There was enough to feed a small army so come with stretch pants. This place would make a killing in Scottsdale. Love it!

tpgiSijn2azq1sIipQsy5g.text: I came here a couple weeks ago following a wedding.  This was my second Hash House experience and was just as awesome as the first!  I will say the same thing I said on my review of the Hash House at the Linq-the portion sizes are huge and can be a little intimidating, but that is their thing.  You have been warned.  The food also comes out fresh as it is made so you might not get it all at once, but at least it isn't just sitting back there.  Depending on what time of day you come, you might be waiting for a little while, but I think that it's worth it.  I know some will disagree, but you can't please everyone, right?!  I had breakfast for dinner (brinner) that consisted of pecan french toast with maple syrup and golden bananas with a side of bacon and scrambled eggs.  It was wonderful.  My husband had a chicken dish served with the pumpkin mashed potatoes and a tomato compote on top.  It was incredible!  I kept sneaking bites. Everyone needs to experience this place at least once!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pecan french toast with bananas and a side of bacon and eggs! Amazing!

5qfNQgtA4VvOJF0nARTHKw.text: This was my 4th time here.............the service is good, the portions are RIDICULOUSLY huge.....and the food is unique. Great place if you are starving for breakfast after a long night and needing to offset a hangover! I have trouble finding many items that I like on the menu, though.....and the novelty of the huge amount of food has worn off.

_Df6N6wQmBRiEW62DGSUMA.text: Throwback restaurant with HUGE portions of food. Fast service and good prices for what's on the plate. Over at the Plaza Hotel right inside the front doors off Fremont Street.

EAMuqmqACIpYWv9xp5dsGw.text: The portions are just stupid, nobody needs to eat that much.  The food is just average.  I would have thought with a slogan like "twisted farm food"  they would have had organic options.

UqOO2pnDEzMvrbaIYQCtXQ.text: I love hash house!  But, this was by far my worst experience!  Took forever for our waitress to get to our table. Ordered coffee and wasn't brought anything to stir it, my fork was dirty, our food was luke warm.  There wasn't any butter or jam, asked an employee for some (since our waitress didn't check on us) and he kept wiping down a table and then went and got it. Overall really bad service. Not the amazing experience I have had in the past.

AZgkCiQ-N8_bYODSSUjeYA.text: Their spinach mushroom hash was amazing especially for a diabetic. I wish I could've had there fried chicken benedicts like my boyfriend, at least he let me try a bite. And the nitro coffee was just what I needed after a night in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach mushroom hash and a nitro coffee
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken benedicts

QFgYVvqcG7sBt_a8gUNodA.text: Whenever I visit Vegas, I normally always go to hash house a go go. Huge portions, heavy types of dishes. Even when I asked the waitress if one dish was more than the other, she responded with all the dishes are ridiculously large and will make you stuffed!   I ordered the sage chicken Benedict. WAYYY TOO MUCH FOOD for one person. I highly suggest splitting the meal with another person because they give you a lot!   The corned beef hash is bomb and the chicken and waffles are always a great meal to try. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage fried chicken Benedict (with bacon, scrambled eggs, biscuit, spinach and bacon mashed potatoes)
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quesadilla

ZqAmfngHYFn1mbQUO30r0Q.text: I saw Hash House on Travel Channel's Man Vs. Food. So going to Vegas I had to check it out and I was not disappointed. I went with my family and we all had a great time. The service was amazing. Our server helped us choose the best menu items and the best drinks. And his recommendations didn't disappoint. I ordered the chicken and waffles, it was so delicious. The chicken pieces were huge and crunchy and perfectly seasoned. The waffle were fluffy. Together the chicken and waffles are a perfect pair, then adding the syrup...is like taste buds heaven. The meal was so big, I tried to eat all of it but couldn't. But it was a great meal.   This Hash House location gives an older vibe and it was hard to walk through especially with a stroller. But the restaurant is clean and the staff is super friendly. I would definitely eat here again.

3XPJPnjPE20X3QPo4QBehA.text: I've eaten at the downtown location many times over the last couple of years.  This last trip I ate there twice.  The first day I had the corn beef hash.  The corn beef was dry and it was shredded instead of chopped.  It was just stringy and chewy.  I didn't really care for it.  The next day I ordered the sausage gravy and biscuits.  It was really just country gravy ( very little sausage if any).  Once again it wasn't great.  I probably won't go back.  There are better options downtown.

w3LAaRZuzbFnrRW7CTjMQw.text: I hate leaving reviews like this but the staff or owner should know. The hostess at the front named Diana was rude and just not someone who should be at the front. We walked up she ignored us. We asked how long for the wait she said 45 minutes. We asked if we could be added to the list please. We had to ask. She didnt say anything just kept organizing the menus as if her job wasnt to host but to organize menus. I had to say what do you need? She said name. Phone number. I gave her the information and then she continued to do what she was doing. It's sad to find young people who dont want to work and have no manners. Blah. Didnt stay to eat. She ruined our excitement to eat here. We have ate at Hash a go go in Sahara  and it was amazing and the service was superb!

d-AvAyNkI08LgvsHjAS3LQ.text: On a slow Monday afternoon 7/8/19 we were seated at a sticky table & the divider between us & the next booth had finger prints all over it. Obviously hadn't been cleaned in a long time. We asked for a beer & an ice water while we looked at the menu. 5mins later 2 ice waters arrived & was told the beer was coming. Waited 5 more mins. for the waitress to arrive & take our order & she said the beer was coming. Then she walked over to 2 more tables to take orders before putting our order in. We walked out..she said "your leaving" I said "yeah, you guys take too long" And right in front of the table of 6 she was taking an order from She said "oh it's like that?" We just kept walking. Dirty, slow & rude restaurant. We won't go back. 1 star because the ice water was refreshing.

pVTPau9_lESVXGvmLbRUGQ.text: Omg, food is awesome, huge portions, must get  a side of bacon and biscuits, i had the benedict and couldn't finish it

J8XCQyK7Yp2qUZngPAOdMA.text: What a great place for breakfast in Vegas!  Of course we'll have to visit for lunch or dinner next time! Everyone enjoyed morning cocktails of mimosas and bloody marys...I enjoyed the coffee and fresh cream myself.  I believe everyone was satisfied with their meal choices - I really enjoyed my ham, spinach & cheddar scramble after much debating about my meal choice.  Two of my companions shared one of the hashes and couldn't even finish their huge dish! Our waitress was friendly and efficient once she got to our table...that would be my only issue, costing them a star - it was busy and took extra time to get to us to take drink orders.  She redeemed herself by quickly getting our orders and then the kitchen got them out quickly and beautifully presented!   I would say Hash House would be a great place to eat in Vegas...at the Plaza Hotel it was walking distance to our Fremont Street hotel!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham, spinach &amp; cheddar scramble with biscuit and fresh fruit

c9HozRwwfLwyGz8x9wa0Tw.text: The downtown location has consistently delivered enjoyable breakfasts and latenight meals more so than the other locations.  A routine go to that always delivers is the chicken and waffles.  This trip we also had the Nashville hot chicken which was a new dish on the menu.  It was a hot/spicy spin on their regular fried chicken and it was well executed.   We also had French toast covered in a roasted banana and pecan concoction similar to Bananas Foster.  Good stuff, we'll be back.

The chicken had great flavor and the waffles had bacon in them. There were 6 of us and 4 of us ordered the chicken and waffles and we all loved it.

F5LcY-VhMYTxcjgrSSzZPw.text: The portions are huge everything is a work of art couldn't make up my mind when I got there because I kept looking at everyone else's plates the sandwiches are amazing pancakes and waffles are two this is an experience you don't want to miss!

gok-AdpaqrIpvbCyEB4Yyg.text: Had really high expectations but the food wasn't all that great. Eggs came raw, the service was slacking, and for the price I've had much better. I can say The food was ready really fast once we gave our order and wait time was only 15 minutes.

UkMsSVAFCBpDCqXPdBVyIg.text: It was my my dates birthday so I decided to take her here (May 2nd, yes I'm kinda late) but I thought it would be a great surprise. I ordered the chicken and waffles and she ordered the sage fried chicken.   It was all not fulfilling. It did not have any seasoning and salt and pepper did not help. There are so many good reviews about this place and the items we ordered I just knew it would be a great experience but it was not.   2 orders of food And 2 beers ended up being 60 something. I won't be going to this hash house again. I do however want to give them another try since Las Vegas raves about it.. I'm just gonna day this wasn't the one for me and try a different location.   It was my dates b day as I previously stated and the waitress said we both can get a free shot and she brought us a b day cake shot I believe she called it but we ended up paying for it anyway. The service was slow and we just didn't have a good time. I hope other do.. looks good but looks are deceiving..

CAPDwJF_imvlSNJ8FK2skQ.text: This place is not that good. Average at most. Tried there signature fried chicken and waffles. I was some what disappointed for lack of a better word. Chicken didn't have any flavor and waffles were soggy. Large portion made it impossible to finish. What a waste of food.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The signature Fried chicken and waffles. Over rated.

Aj0pasLhjFCEZnTPBRyW6Q.text: I've been to two other Hash House A Go Go locations in Vegas and I think it's pretty much the same all around. They have HUGE portions for a fair price and the taste is decent. A lot of my friends love the Andy's Fried Chicken because it was featured on Man vs Food. I, on the other hand, am simple and definitely cannot eat that portion size so I just go with the basic breakfast.

4d4vDjZTd1otWmnLp881sg.text: Big portions but wasn't impressed with the food. Got the corn beef hash skillet.  The taste was ok but not something I'd go out of my way to eat.

W_6XlsysrYyfw50LKzmAcg.text: We came into Vegas and I seen this on Yelp. We're finally got to go and it was amazing! You'r in Vegas so the can be a wait but they took our name and texted us when it was time. The food was good proportions and tastey. Presentation of the food was also spectacular.  Everyone in our group of 10 eventually got to this place and loved it.

O-J-xmiLm_8vsXclmlLM6g.text: This place has the best breakfast anyone needs ! Every single thing on my plate was cooked to perfection. The quantity was huge and neither I, nor my husband could finish our plates . I ordered their farm scrambles of ham, spinach and cheddar which came with griddled mashed potato , fresh fruit garnish and homemade biscuit . I also added gravy for the biscuit . My husband ordered their signature or the most popular dish - Andy's Sage fried chicken which was humongous and delicious ! Also their service was on point... our server was so knowledgeable and thorough with everything with honest opinion which helped us make our orders. Definitely coming back to this place . Canada (Vancouver) needs one of these! It's Ah-may-zing!

YIhI1oHt4jxLXV0wXBwluw.text: Food was amazing!!!!! So much to choose from. Very convenient location down town: we will be back! Super clean. Loved it.

Kj9nm6k3KbQOLl9AuxhIqQ.text: Good food and plenty of it! We love going when we are in town. Service is always fun and great! Fun atmosphere! Be ready to eat because to portions are ridiculous!!  I try something different every time. This time I went the grilled cheese with bacon... WOW!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yY1SwZbwMqxNNGQSpISzRw.text: *The 2 stars is specifically for the rude hostess. She ruined it from the get go*  We come here every trip to Vegas. Showed up at 8am, the restaurant was not full. Told the hostess we had a party of 3 maybe 4. She had the worst attitude. She told us we "needed to figure it out". We could see an empty booth and said we'd take the available one that we could plainly see from the hostess stand. She sighed, walked away to apparently see if there was something available. Came back and asked if we wanted a booth or table when we had just said a booth. I have NEVER in 5 years of coming here had such a bad experience here. If Du-pars was still open at the Golden Gate across the street, we would have left and gone there. Our waiter, Jeronimo, was very apologetic so he is the bright spot. He gets 5 stars. However, one of our breakfasts arrived over cooked but cold. What the heck is going on here today?  We may be finding a new breakfast spot. Which is disheartening. We usually love this place. I hope others have a better experience.

WcpkGay_HjztlS-EurpqPw.text: Such big portions. Definitely want to come on an empty stomach. The food was great. Good service and friendly staff. Affordable as well.

gl9UjYKWSA5FPivV3dttBQ.text: If you are on a diet do not eat here or any places recommended by the Man vs Food guy because the portions here are massive.  I did not see an empty plate busted away by the staff there when they cleared the tables.    Food wasn't bad but it wasn't spectacular. The massive portions even out the prices. Service was excellent when we visited.

_NlCIy9p_1wGzPL6V12WWg.text: Always a solid choice for brunch.  We were able to walk from our hotel.  The wait was about 25 minutes on Saturday at 10:50AM. They have fresh-squeezed tangerine juice as an option...so cool and different from most breakfast/brunch joints.  It was a nice way to start our day in town.

esraWWy9mIgdQ5SYwkfSQw.text: Ordered beef hash and spice chicken sandwich. The food was good with big portions. Couldn't eat it all. Staff was friendly. Best food spot we could find nearby that wasn't fast good. Prices were moderately priced.

o2PsWkxDx5EtQasOtfgTqA.text: Went to a different location a couple months ago and this one is by far way better. The food was amazing. I had the big chicken pot pie. The service was fast and excellent. This is definitely the place for breakfast brunch and lunch. Yummy!!

SGECWcFm4YcLhWm8NOA_OQ.text: Phenomenal, we went to the other one at the Linq and that one was just as good.  Got the meatloaf last time on the server's suggestion and got the Chicken Benedict? this time.  Will post a pic in a min.  It was almost or equal to the meatloaf.  Chicken was crispy, egg was perfect and biscuit was from scratch not to mention the mashed pot.  HUGE portions and not crazy expensive.  Got the chips and guac for $9 and was like how good could this be?  It was da bomb, it came with a hot red salsa that made the deal worth it fo sho.  Will be hitting up the one near me very soon.

vXlFjx3eR1BHJWh4cUpL0w.text: Pretty good place to eat if and when you are in the mood to really EAT...serving are pretty much big and you can order one and share it ... check it out .. for me it's just like a diner....again if you are into big servings then this is your place to eat.....

7eZaqshc7mvvbi8PgWhKKQ.text: Here we go ...  I tried three dinners and even though it is a lot of food , nothing is great . This is over a period of time since they opened in San Diego .  The pastrami sandwich was not good and is now off the menu , the famous meatloaf is not good at all , and the sage chicken is over-hyped in the press.     This is a very well hyped restaurant , so you will try it out for sure .... but will you be back ???

NlT92c2gG_b2jNR1vWVw4Q.text: Love this chain! After a year's hiatus, had dinner here after listening to "80s Station" bang out some tight, clean 80's classics.   The fried Salmon with carrots & griddled potatoes was the bomb. Perfectly cooked with a light crispy corn meal coating. Portions are always huge here, so it usually takes a bite out of the cost (still "reasonably" priced by Vegas standards...). Come here for bkft, but the whole menu is available all day!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Salmon! Great!!!

z_RSx-cZp2l6YEiHopYHfg.text: You better be really hungry if you plan on coming here. Everything they serve comes in huge portions. You really can share a dish with someone unless you are extremely hungry. We came in about 10:30 AM and it was packed already. We had to wait a good 15 minutes or so. They have a really big menu to choose from, basically all the breakfast food you could think of.  I would definitely recommend coming here at least once. If I lived Vegas, it wouldn't be a place I come often.  Food - 4/5   My Chicken and Waffles were great. That sage paired very well with the chicken and syrup. My only disappointment was that they didn't give me enough syrup. Also, that watermelon ice tea was on point!!! So unique and refreshing! My SO had Corn hash and she was disappointed. The beef was not cooked crispy like she wanted. I am guessing they cook everything with a twist here so everything might be made in a different way.   Service - 5/5 Our waiter was great. No complaints.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Chicken and Waffles!!
