kzAFyixmaVxq_OVkUzEhEg.text: Loved this location and how it wasn't congested like the one at the Linq. I was able to be seated right away and our waiter was extremely pleasant. It was busy but it wasn't a chaotic busy. Food came out quick and it was okay. I ordered a dish that had egg whites scramble with salmon....I didn't like the salmon but it wasn't the worse thing I've ever tasted! I'll go back!

oigCyp1UX2QcW0ZhekBUlg.text: Wow...All I can say is WOW! This place is freaking delicious! The portions are humongous so do share! HH is located inside the Plaza Hotel near Fremont, btw.  So... first we ordered the Chicken Fried Steak which was so darn good! Recently we've been trying CFS at various restaurants we've visited w/in 3 states and this one is definitely in my top 2. The potatoes under the the gravy were amazing as well!  Second item we ordered was the French Toast dipped in banana cream, w/ pecans and fried banana. This was so delicious, no syrup was needed, so sweet as is.  Can't wait to return!  P.S. If you stay at the Plaza Hotel they give you a lil coupon book that has a coupon for $5 off your bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak atop of potatoes lathered in gravy w/a biscuit! Friggin&#39; amaz-az-zing!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast dipped in banana cream w/ pecans. Delish!

B-rpLJjaI21sE7FTdfie6A.text: This trendy little spot is located at the and of the Fremont experience inside of the Plaza Hotel. The ambiance is industial gothic with perfect lighting, diamond plating, steel topped tables and vlack and red coloring.   For breakfast today I went with the banana and pecan infused french toast With two over easy eggs 2 slices of bacon and fried taters. The french toast was perfectly gridle friend to a delicious golden brown, topped with one whole in the skin banana and a generous amount of pecans a mouth watering delight! Bacon is bacon and eggs are eggs, both perfectly cooked to order. The fried taters were perfectly crunchy but lacked seasoning. The coffee was a 2 bean roast with the most awesome Caffeine punch around. Fresh squeezed orange juice tops it off. Grade A++  The waitstaff was friendly and the time to order and for the meal to arrive on our table was less than 15 minutes.  Over all on my next return to Las Vegas this is definately on my food eateries list.  Dayne

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indiana breaded hand pounded pork tenderloin sandwhich.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon waffle and scrambled eggs
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon waffle scrambled eggs.

J9TpGSwb0yVF6BewbIfldA.text: If you are into a hearty breakfast, and you also enjoy being told "Ask us about our beers" as you are seated, you must consider Hash House in the Plaza Casino for breakfast or brunch. My experience here was based on this, and I left completely satisfied and beyond full. If you're a party of 6 or more, you may have problems getting a table, so do consider the bar, especially if you want a beer. The selection is varied, the bartender knowledgeable.   Obviously with a name like Hash House, the lure - and the top items on the menu - will be the hashes. These are huge, served in iron skillet-pans. They aren't your traditional hashes with the meats and potatoes nicely cut into small cubes. This is more like pulled meat with whatever else is included, on top of a pile of home fries, usually with 2 eggs and a jumbo biscuit with a large sprig of rosemary growing out of it for garnish and optional flavor. One person in our group opted for pancakes instead, and he was told not to order quite as many as he wanted - and rightly so. The pancakes were larger than the plate, probably larger than a Frisbee.   The price of breakfast here, not counting coffee, was perhaps a few bucks more than a breakfast buffet at one of the better hotels on Fremont St., but I left here equally full and more satisfied in terms of quality. If I had to label anything in the area as "best hangover brunch," a hash breakfast here would win.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted chicken hash with a pine tree growing out of my biscuit.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash.

KYomewpauPiXLaz-37PVKg.text: It was time to leave Las Vegas, so we met up with everyone around 10am at Hash House A Go Go in the Plaza, we again were a party of 12, but 3 of our guest needed to order, eat and leave to go catch a flight back to Cali.  Our server was fast and friendly, understood they needed to go, got there order out to them fast and dropped the check off  without any issues. I love a place that can work with you like that.  After checking out the menu, I found out that it was a full menu, you could order lunch as well as breakfast, I was happy for that because this time I was not in the mood for breakfast, though their biscuits and gravy are killer!   I went with the BBQ chicken sandwich, bbq chicken breast covered in sauce, topped with onion rings and cilantro on a whole wheat bun, I sure wasn't trying to be heathy, but this was what I wanted! And for not additional price you can swap out the fries for their famous mashed potatoes, just do it!!! Those mashed potatoes are the bomb!! So good!  The sandwich was perfect, so dang tasty, I could have gone for a little bit more sauce, I liked saucy, but other than that, it was delish baby!  My friend ordered the chicken and waffles, and if you haven't seen them, they are huge and had some waffle up for grab, heck yea I tried one, that waffle was stuffed with BACON!!! OMG, BACON stuffed waffle!! Man next time I come back Ill have to remember to order that!   I really enjoy Hash House, it's a definite stop whenever in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed potatoes
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq chicken sandwich
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles

jzgJxkJvMNo1aK-QZOlgLA.text: We always eat here when staying at the plaza. We've never waited in line, the food in in large portions and delicious!  I usually get the chicken, mozzarella , and corn hash which comes with some eggs And a large yummy biscuits. The scrambles are eggcellent too. The juices are fresh squeezed we love the orange and tangerine and the coffee is fantastic. I've had the s'more mocha( you've never seen anything like this) and the ice tractor coffee.  Wait Til you see the pancakes! They're folding over the plate!  I've seen burgers, sage chicken and waffles all piled high at the tables around me. You really can't Go wrong! Try one Dish today and A new one on your next visit!

Fao0ZaFpYXBVobddDjTo3w.text: My family and visited this restaurant on Saturday and since this was our first time here,  we were really looking forward to a fantastic experience like we've had with all other restaurants we've visited these past few days. Especially after we've heard nothing but good things about this place. So you definitely will not leave there hungry, BUT if you get Donna Server #516 beware. Her customer service skills were very unprofessional from the minute we sat down. I watched and heard the waiter (had a ponytail) the next table over and he was very friendly and actually explained a little bit of the menu and even asked if they've been the before.  Didn't get any of that from Donna. Too many things to list regarding her poor costumer service,  but the worst one was when we were checking out. She brought us our receipt and didn't say one word if she was going to take our payment or if we pay up front. So we waited for her to come by, and we asked her if we she took our payment or do we pay up front? Her answer was "well I gave you the receipt, I'll take it". Just because she gave us the receipt, doesn't mean they take thr payment for you.   She walked away, so I put my card with the receipt.  She came back and to a table near by without checking on our take and walked away again.  So now we're waiting longer, so I started to get inpatient by this time. She went back to the same table and started to take their order, so I excused myself and let her know we were waiting for her. She replied "um I'm taking there order" so we proceeded to walk out to find the manager. As we were walking away she was making comments about me to her customers at the  table. I got the managers attention told him what happened and he apologized. As I walked out of the restaurant and looked over at me laughing and waiving.  I felt that she was mocking me, so at this point I was very upset so I went and spoke with the manager again and he apologized again. IF I ever try this place again I will definitely make sure I don't sit at any of her tables.

tUQB2ahw3Ej3orRnTfWtnA.text: The food was great.  I had the Fried Chicken Salad, very tasty.  The service was awful.  My food came first, then 15 minutes later my husbands came. In the mean time, the waiter came up to me and said the reason why we dont have our food at the same time, is because there are no heat lamps.  First of all, I never made any comment on why my food was the only one on the table.  I guess he needed to rectify the mistake, but after he said such a ridiculous statement, I replied, "we didnt have this problem at the other Hash House".  He walked away,  Then the manager came up to the table with my husbands food and told us the same thing about the heat lamps. OMG. no reply from me.  They werent friendly AT ALL and spoke to me as if I were a total idiot.  Next time I will be heading to the Hash House on Sahara.  They managed to get our party of 8's food out at the same time and were very friendly  Helpful Hint: You should have started the other meal first.

nIMx8kVL895L-2cgoIpVVA.text: 1.food very bad 2. Glass.. Dirty 3. No hostess for over 5 min.  4. Waiter forgot what he was doing.   Food... First attempt cold. 2nd attempt warmer for some of it. Salmon dried out... Old. Drink. Floaties... Yuck. This place just made my stomach curl. Table was sticky, food crusted to it. Never eating anywhere at these establishments.  Staff unprofessional, though they act liked i would expect from this kind of rat hole.

QUJuxMoptHiSlUtUh_VbKw.text: I really liked this place.  It bills itself as an American breakfast with a twist.  It sure does have a nice twist.  I had the corned beef hash.  Nothing normal.  This hash has monster chopped fried potatoes and the corned beef was not little chunks of beef but long tasty strings.  The twist is also the meal comes with cantaloupe and a slice of orange with a sprig of sage in the toast.

kJ_z-UNsKwwY7zH2xft8Vg.text: I had never been to a Hash House a Go Go before but have read plenty reviews for their twisted farm food and decided to try them out for breakfast while I was staying at the Plaza.  I don't see why all the negative reviews but I had a pleasant experience here.  The service was friendly, no one dropped my food on the floor.  The coffee was piping hot and the level never was allowed to hit the bottom.  I really enjoyed my basic breakfast.  My husband got an apple pancake and the thing was huge.  Even he could not finish it and he is usually the one who finished my plate when we go out.  Now that is a lot of food.    I forget what was here before the Plaza remodeled, but everything looks new.  The place is near the check in of the hotel and right off Fremont street so it's an easy walking distance if you happen to be staying somewhere else or even if you wanted to park at another casino.  I'm not aching to go back but I would eat here again.

ysAgNdI5nrz6WzIGv2YzFg.text: i went here on friday night around 12AM with a party of 8. we were already staying in downtown vegas, so we decided to go to this new location of hash house. ive been to the one in san diego so i expected the same. it is located in the lobby of The Plaza hotel, which was recently renovated. the lobby looked pretty cool. like an old hotel trying to be strip worthy. anyway, we were seated right away. there were only a few other parties in the restaurant at the time and we were seated in a long booth, which kind of was annoying if you were sitting in the inside and needed to get out to go to the restroom or something.   anyway, the bf and i ordered the sage fried chicken benedict. i had this at the san diego location and it was pretty good. the bf hadnt had it before, so we decided to split it since i wasnt that hungry anyway. the waitress says "that will be a $2.50 charge to split it... or you can get a side order of something if you want..." so i look over the menu and all the side orders were $4.50. maybe if i was hungry, i might have just ordered a side of fries or something but i knew i wasnt gonna eat much so we just decided to suck it up and pay the $2.50. i should have just not said anything to begin with and just ate off the bfs plate. oh well. you win some you lose some. this benedict came with a chipotle sauce on top instead of the usual hollandaise sauce which was a bit spicy. personally i think the dish tastes better with the original sauce.   my cousin got the meatloaf sandwich, which was a huge sandwich in between 2 or 3 inch slices of bread. the meatloaf was actually pretty bland. my other cousin got the sage fried chicken, eggs, smashed potatoes and biscuit. i forgot what its called, but it was basically like the benedict but without the sauce on top. my cousin asked for a side of gravy and the waitress again said there would be a charge. no thanks.   a friend got the fried chicken sandwich, which was the sage fried chicken in between the same 2-3 inch slices of bread. he said it was good. it came with a side of fries which i tasted and thought it was pretty salty. another friend got a regular breakfast plate of eggs, smashed potatoes, ham and biscuit.   i wanted to try the chicken and waffles since it has slices of bacon within the waffle. but they stop serving the chicken and waffles at 11PM. boo. oh well, its okay though because more than one person after wards said that the waffles arent that good anyway.   overall i was disappointed. i wont be back and i dont recommend it.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage Fried Chicken, Smashed Potatoes, Eggs and Biscuit

unVVKRM9QYQwmLjp6yR8qw.text: Alfie our server Alfie was awesome. We had the sage chicken eggs Benedict as featured on man vs food. Holy shit it was good. Mother in law had the banana French toast. She loved it. Come here!!!!!!!!

8rOjETGj0tHm4Ra12cx_pg.text: I love going to this place for breakfast. I don't normally like pancakes, but I always order pancakes from them. They have options for both meat eaters and vegetarians, which can be rare sometimes. Keep in mind, the portions are huge, so we usually split an order.   The reason I'm not giving this location a five star review is because the service can be pretty bad. The last time we went, we received our check, and she never came back to take it from us. Luckily we paid in cash and did not need change. Most of the servers don't seem very happy to be there. I have only gone to the Hash House in this location, so maybe other locations are better about this.

24Iar-dCwQuMa-ZygnIXUw.text: Worst breakfast ever :( . I am so disappointed. Had their special with eggs, meat, potatoes and a pancake. The pancake is too large and tastes terrible. Fried eggs are tasteless. Bacon undercooked. Potatoes terrible. Coffee bad.

3rKUte9m2okuKZqdySactg.text: I can't believe that people gave this place that many stars. Just went to sit down at the bar to get a drink before leaving and was ignored for well over 5 mins. There was a girl standing about 10 feet away making olive garnishes that really couldn't be bothered to so much as acknowledge us or let the bartender know we were there. Someone came by and haphazardly asks have we been helped. I say no and he says oh she'll be over in a minute. Again another employee couldn't be bothered to let the bartender know we were there. We got up and left, I was over it when there were 4 servers standing 15 feet away from us and still no one cared to serve us. It's quite a shame, my sister (with me right now) and I have worked in the service industry for 10 plus years now and still currently do! We're good tippers! Maybe the employees there should learn a thing about being a team that COMMUNICATES with not only their guests but their coworkers as well. Extremely disappointed considering we literally wanted two drinks and would most likely tip 10$ on those two drinks if the service is prompt and friendly. We love hooking up our fellow service industry people but we can't do that if you deliberately ignore us. FAIL!!

_JRvsloZ7VoYrJ85ln6pBw.text: Food was excellent.  Service was "eh typical"...would have been higher review if their "world famous: bloody mary had lived up to the reputation.  I put them in the top 5 WORST I've ever had the misfortune of imbibing. Wouldn't ever ordee it again and am warning others to fo the same

1Iezdrhmlkt9zSarhymPIw.text: Got the meatloaf sandwich which was excellent and HUGE!  My buddy got the pancake which was good and HUGE!  I would go early because it does get crowded.

qiCxhbbAr3DwUIND7NTRQg.text: Why do some people love this place? The food is a greasy mess of heart stopping crap. Yeah, yeah the portions are huge but if it's crap, who cares? The grilled cheese sandwich was OK but the cheddar potatoes on the side were a tasteless mess other than the cheese. My buddy got some sort of breakfast covered with white gravy that looked like an Exxon oil spill. If all you want is a food orgy, knock yourself out but in Vegas, there are so many better choices. I should have gone across the street to Du Par's.

h_F-5CPE1EwHmqLbb4_dyw.text: So very disappointed, everyone brags about this place...got seated right away, took a long while till we got asked about our drinks, just coffee. Finally brought to our table, hubby ordered corned beef  eggs, biscuit. Took forever and a day to get his order, the waiter simply forgot mine, brought hubby a large plate with his meal...I told him not to wait his food would get cold, as I watched him eat, the waiter finally came back to see how we liked it...I asked when my order as coming, he said you did not order anything, I clarified that indeed I had and that he was suppose to give the avocado part to my husband, which he never received. He say oh oh hey yeah oh wait I will bring it now, we waited another 10 minutes then I told the waiter forget the order. He said no I will bring it right now, I insisted no. So I tried to share some of my husbands breakfast, yuck if I had wanted hash I would have ordered hash, biscuit was hard and bland, no butter no jelly. Nada... Will NOT be going back after all the raves. From fam and friends nope wont to ever again. Was not impressed if I want a tree of rosemary on my plate I can stay home for that, I have a rosemary bush outside. Blahh

Gnde5yKSlB-xJmNQZw5Nag.text: I had heard the food was good and the portions were big.  The food was great.  The portions were huge.  I had the meatloaf sandwich, when it was brought out to me, I had to devise a strategy to eat it, it was so big.  But eat it I did, the whole thing, although it wasn't pretty.  Might not be the place to take a first date, since there is no dignified way to eat eat this sandwich.  But, oh lords, was it good.  Delicious meatloaf, a tasty homemade ketchup, and a fresh bun.  So, so good.  Fries were not bad either, but I could only eat about three of them after polishing off the sandwich.  Then I was fed for the day, maybe two days.  It was so good.  I ate at the bar, the bartender was very sweet and brought me everything I needed, including extra napkins.  I gave her a good tip because, well, she had to watch me eat that thing.  Place was very nice overall, cool decor with a lot of stainless steel.  So go there soon.  But only if you are seriously hungry.  You've been warned.

gUWqktM4M8z5RedKxgWx0A.text: I would have to say this would be the first time going to a Hash House a Go Go.  Which seems to be an okay place.    Located inside the Plaza Hotel, close to the front of the hotel.  You have a decent view of the Fremont street.  Also located next to the check in desk.    The restaurant itself, did look a bit small, but decent in a way.  Very well decorated and color scheme seems to be dark but warming in the same way.  Staff seems to be nice and entertaining.  Service was decent and average.    The menu was a bit confusing, but ordered a Tractor driver combo, that had eggs, bacon and pancake.  The waitress asked if I wanted one of their famous pancakes and got the Apple Cinnamon pancake.  The wait was decent, and when the food came, I didn't realize how big the pancake was.  It was bigger than expected and it was actually good.  I wasn't able to finish it, but it was decent and presentation was good.    My recommendation, its a good morning place to have breakfast.  The food was cooked decently and the portions are bigger than usual.  If you are in the area, try it out.

qOIjGSTn2kZGBfqPa93Guw.text: Lots of food. One plate can be enough for 4 people.  Chicken & waffles were good with the exception of the chicken being a little under seasoned.

RAgIrruxT4gfgeaeS5lU_A.text: Huge portions of good food! I had the grilled pork tenderloin with glazed pecans and honey mustard. Came with mashed potatoes and veggies.      Good service.

MJmZ_03C17RxkXHr2ZxVcw.text: I don't know about this place for most days, but if you're hung the hell over after staying up until 5 or 6 AM on a gambling/drinking binge, I can't think of a better hangover breakfast in Vegas or anywhere else. The bloody mary was great, was fresh and had plenty of spice. Half of the table, at the recommendation of Man Vs. Food, got the fried chicken benedict. This is the ultimate heavy hangover food and, although they could've dialed down the spice in the sauce, was tasty. The other half of the table tried the chicken and waffles, which were a bit disappointing: the chicken was a bit dry, and the waffles, despite having bacon in the middle, were just ok. It was a bit expensive though. Breakfast for 5 (not everyone got a drink) for $100. See a full review and pictures at bayoucitybites.com/2011/...

mGt8QCMX0V4JYnLF_H3Ujg.text: What an amazing experience! The food was unreal ! The chicken & waffles was the best I have ever had & that's coming from a expert. The wife ordered the chicken Benedict it too was amazing! Warning the portion sizes are HUGE. Enjoy !!!!

PLEjCbu5vFyMY_fImeZDZg.text: First time we had ever eaten here and had never even heard of the place, it was the restaurant at the hotel we were staying. We both ordered what we normally do at other restaurants and were stunned at the amount of food we were served!!!  I had a bloody mary which was the best I had ever had.  Our waiter, John, was very friendly and an excellent waiter.  He was so good and the experience was so positive that the next morning we ate there and asked to be seated in his station.  He even remembered us!!!!  We will making HHAGG a regular stop on all of our Vegas trips, even if we stay at a different hotel.

9irgqqDiVj2gwOFc6a_xxA.text: Great restaurant, huge quantities and fair prices.  Always a go to breakfast spot.

fIFlv1VLWx1h0YHXlA7rHQ.text: HUGE portions and amazing prices! The food is high quality although for those that may have blander taste, it may seem like a strange menu. I would urge you to consider it though because whatever you order is sure to please. My go-to is the quesadilla here and it's large enough for my husband and I to share and feel stuffed full! Highly recommend this place.

C481c6Ad7bCWd9eIsh1F1A.text: If you're hungry this is the place to eat.  Located in The Plaza Hotel and Casino in downtown in Las Vegas, which is where we were staying proved to be a convenient place to get some serious farm food!!  The HH bloody marys started off the morning perfectly.  Not too thick like some tend to be, but with just the right amount of heat.  Tasty!!  It was closer to lunch so we opted for burgers.  My buddy and I could've shared one, they're so huge!  I had the blue cheese with bacon and side of fries.  Two patties covered in their thick cut bacon and melted blue cheese stuffed into the huge patties that dwarfed the buns.  We're talking ginormous!!  It was delicious.  My friend and just had a discussion about goat cheese on a burger, and lo and behold, goat cheese and jalapeno!!!!!  It was a truly delicious way to start and end the day as took the other half back to our room to enjoy later!  This is not my first time here and everything is delicious! Don't get me started on the drink menu, but I had a watermelon kiwi lemonade.  YUM!

wOf1zjx_Q3WmNs4gEZpf3g.text: Bad service from the hostess. She was rude and not friendly at all. Good food though.

y23MlhdSrzsYzpo9Ogwnow.text: Large portions of mediocre food. Got three times as much as I needed. If it tasted better I would say twice as much as I needed but my corned beef hash just didn't taste as good as it looked. The Bloody Maria was excellent. The service was slow. If I ever go back it will be just for the Maria. No need for big plates of blandness.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My finished breakfast. Big, boring food.

gLvoYPtnjHjrJHJwaqWKkA.text: I was kinda scared to try this place because of all the scathing reviews, but I was optimistic and thought maybe the brilliant reviews had some merit. Doh! The food was ok and in ginagorous portion sizes. The appetiser portions are big enough for a decent dinner. The corned beef in the corned beef hash was really tasty, but what was with the watermelon and pineapple slices with corned beef, potatoes and eggs? The fried angel hair pasta that comes with every entree was just silly too...I don't know if it was just poorly executed...has anyone else ever seen sticks of fried angel hair pasta with dinner? The whole branch of rosemary as a garnish was weird too.  The service was pretty good. That and the corned beef are saving the place from one star.  Don't know if I'll go back...most likely not with so many better places for less money.

7RPaasAGGxqFTFE9Pzporw.text: Ignore those stars right there.   I know no other way to do this, than to split Hash House A Go Go into two reviews.  Review 1: solid 4 stars... maybe even five for the food. Whenever we visit Vegas we eat at Hash House, usually multiple times.  Their fried chicken is the stuff of dreams, and their BLT Blood Mary holds a special place in my heart.  Seriously get that Bloody Mary.  It's a meal in itself.  And the chicken and waffles.... there's bacon in those waffles.  Inside of them.  It's a breakfast miracle!  Review 2: 1 star... service. Can I even give service a star when it doesn't even exists at this place?  I image their training manual reads something the the effect of "screw it, I'm drunk".  Now here's your block t-shit, get out there kid!  I honestly do not know how my order is ever taken, and how the heck my food ever makes it to the table,  I believe the kitchen staff must have excellent hearing and have devised a way to cut the floor staff out of the process all together because anything these guys touch goes to crap.  Did you want another beverage?  Well, assuming you ever get the first one, too bad!  You will never see that server again! Someone else will drop off your food and run away from the table.  What's that? only half of your table got their food? Here's the check! Seriously guys, I submit myself to this neglect every time, the food is worth it and I'm on vacation so waiting isn't an issue, but maybe you could try and get your crap together.

20AMP8apSBSyTFGzyry9jw.text: I only felt the need to eat here twice. The first time, I was expecting a lot after hearing nothing but good things. I found the quality of the food to be lacking. I decided to chalk it up to a one-time occurrence, and went back the following week. What I figured out on my second trip is that this restaurant values quantity over quality. If you're looking for OK food, but plenty of leftovers, this is the place for you. Otherwise, I'd say your money is better spent elsewhere. I tend not to eat anything I take home in a doggy-bag, so I probably would only go back if a friend was visiting and really wanted to give it a go, and wanted to share the meal.

zOtWYwb8b6SFGdxi1A7jLA.text: This joint is awesome. They have large potions large enough to share. The  chicken n waffles is the best I ever had. I just wish the waffles were a bit crisper, but I guess the bacon in the middle of the waffle made up for that.  Roscoes' chicken n waffles ain't got nothing on this place! NOTHING!

Ibqza37e9FUy11kKrogC2Q.text: We went here for breakfast on Friday morning. Delicious! Loved the homemade biscuits and jam. The country potatoes were very yummy too!

Ehz6RQiXgD6XNLECb4yruQ.text: Rude manager, her name is Kara. Report her!!! If she doesnt like to work with people why is she even working there.

TFsUEYo1Bc9Pio9cRLogzg.text: My expectations were high and the food was just so-so. Got the chicken and waffles.  Chicken was pretty good, waffles not so great.  Don't feel the need to revisit.

7jEQS6gkuiu05omj6MxeUA.text: Located in the lobby of the Plaza hotel, it's by far the shining star of the restaurants in that hotel.  Its on the pricier side but the portion sizes are huge.  We had breakfast there and loved every bit of it.  The only downside is if you're staying in The Plaza, you can't really take any leftovers back to your room as they don't come standard with refrigerators.

kMDSZGo2x8hG0CEFMd4RDw.text: One of the most outstanding breakfasts I've had!. The service was a little slow but the wait was worth it! The Siracha cream sauce was outstanding!

6n98cIzUZpH_KG1KZnNwdw.text: We were the Saturday after the 4th and our server completely ignored us! We had to chase down the hosted who then reminded the waiter about our table. 20 minutes after arriving, he shows up with a lame excuse about not knowing we were in his section although he took every order to our left and right.   Then while waiting for our food, a major fight broke out in the kitchen. I'm not just talking punches, the table closest to the kitchen said someone got cut. A horde of security guards arrived and yellow-taped everything in the kitchen. Then they escorted the bus-boy out. The same guy that had bussed the table to our left (did I mention that they had arrived AFTER us!)  After the free show, our food arrived; one plate at a time. The waiter insisted the kitchen was delayed after the fight and judging from the yellow tape we gave them the benefit of the doubt.   Then my salad came with bacon, which wasn't on their menu description and to which I have an unfortunate allergy for. So, I had to wait some more for a fresh salad. However, when it arrived, it was amazing. The biscuit melted in your mouth, the salad was crispy and fresh. At our table, we had a couple of dishes. The fried chicken was amazing, the waffles and French toast were favorites, and the ingredients in everything were very fresh. Come hungry though, the portions are NO JOKE!  We were annoyed with the service (they get minus stars; below 0) but the food was top-notch (5+). So average it out to a 2 star experience. Would we come again? I don't know.... maybe we would order out... But might just avoid them all together, at least for a while.   PS you can get you $5 in parking back if you validate with your receipt. Ask the hostess.

Xljbx0ZFTxeguVnJJfWbkA.text: O.M.G they said it was big portions but big saying this is big is link saying the grand canyon is just a break in the rocks . My wife had a plate of sage fried chicken and I had a plate of the meatloaf we knew we wouldn't finish but at the end it didn't look like we had started.  tip come hungry and share a plate with 5 of your friends good food good service good $

Bc_xVZWIdX_8gPBFkpw95w.text: Come here hungry. The portion sizes are enormous. The prices are very reasonable. Service was quick and efficient.

3Nr0FwAgUwiMICEC8Wq1wA.text: I'll keep this short and sweet since we ate here twice in 4 days. It's convenient, but admittedly feels over priced. The food didn't seem like anything special to me, but the portions are huge. The staff is slow. We were the only two people sitting at the bar and we didn't see our waitress again after she dropped off our food. The second time we were in a booth and had to ask three separate people for coffee refills. I can't say I'm very impressed.

zaE6FXKwOqBOjGt8WrbZhg.text: I strictly dine according to Yelp ratings and reviews and this place deserves 5 stars. We showed up around 11 am on Sunday morning, the wait was about an hour but well worth it. We tried their famous Chicken and Waffles and I loved them. The serving size is large and could be shareable. Their bloody Mary's are delicious. The service was great, atmosphere was excellent. I highly recommend. Good work hash house.

7MjqcAdAEkvUj5_YDRL2FQ.text: Not your grandma's pot pie.. this was awesome!! fresh veggies, chunks of chicken and Mash potatoes

gfKN8EOYe_zxx6zrdz688Q.text: This place was packed! The atmosphere was fun,  the servers were friendly and attentive.  The food portions were huge and very very tasty! My husband had the chicken and waffles and I had sunny side up eggs and sausage all seasoned to perfection. We will definitely visit this place again.

uE3QyX-HdfsP2RwAkflbgA.text: Awesome! They have huge portions.. You've been warned! I got the Texas Rancheros Eggs Benedict and it was delicious, but also way too big for me. I recommend splitting it with someone special.

eQkY8AUziorxRrXxfpQ77g.text: Had a great experience highly recommend there was a pink haired girl named Lilly I believe she was awesome I definitely recommend and thanks Lilly you were superb

tXMzqtTsQcSTd5E5Mw5uzA.text: Green fried tomato chicken salad was fresh and crispy! Ham and cheddar burger with over easy egg was hot and huge! Ice cold Local Silver State brews hit the spot!

krZOixhUdM6EwRscgrWkwQ.text: The food was good. This is more about the excellent service we received on 12/18 @ 9:50pm. O cannot for the life of me remember our waitress name, but she was f'n phenomenal. She came over and said, kitchen closes in 4 minutes if you're hungry (in a polite non threatening way). I actually offered to leave because I hate doing that, but she said absolutely not, stay! I asked her for a suggestion, took one of her recommendations, and it did not disappoint. My daughter wanted a fancy schmancy ginormous hot cocoa and she suggested the smaller kids version which was the exact same. Yes please!!! Food came out piping hot and she didn't over stay her welcome but came around just enough times to help. It's like she had this intuition to serve. Love it! Note: portion sizes are ridonculous. I ate a 1/4 of my hash and fed two more people.

EBYrJ_zROttaMcPB8dCYag.text: What an awesome place for breakfast/brunch. Definitely coming back here. Their portions are huge so keep that in mind when ordering. But honestly, I don't think anything you order here would disappoint. Plenty of options to chose from for every craving. If you're in the Fremont area of downtown Las Vegas, make sure to check them out.

Wyh0IGptJZINaKCriBbYYQ.text: Never come here !!! Worst management ever!!! Ed should be demoted as a manager. He is horrible with customer service. Food was cold and his response was the food is made to order is there anything else I can help you with and walked away. He really needs to get a new job where he doesn't have to deal with people at all. Not worth the money spent here at all.

Ta6UsTWDVBT7tz5vhAVEuA.text: Always a winner. Huge portions,  delicious. All over town now, but this location is the fav and more original

Hml9uVRWpxE_a3Ulaa4UOQ.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE. Came in around 10 o'clock on a Friday. REBECCA was my server.   I started off ordering french toast with scrambled eggs and bacon. I specifically asked for my French toast on the side... I don't like syrup touching my eggs  The food takes a little while to come out and of course they bring it out all on one plate.   Next I ask for some extra syrup. They only give you your tiny bit with your order...  I end up waiting maybe 5 minutes and REBECCA brings me a side of butter. When I asked for syrup????  She apologizes and said she will bring me more syrup.   So I wait and wait. I watch her bring out water and food to other tables. Continue to wait. Keep in mind I'm not eating food. I'm waiting for my syrup...  REBECCA DROPS THE CHECK... MEANWHILE THERE'S PLENTY OF FOOD ON THE TABLE BECAUSE I DID NOT GET SYRUP!!  So disrespectful. I ended up asking someone else for syrup and eating my cold french toast. They're lucky I didn't leave without paying. I hope she didn't expect a tip

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny amount of syrup they give you with the French toast

zxpN8UA_rSBBK-glqIzzIg.text: Initial wait time  Wait time to be seated was 2 hours but we had a party of 13 so it was understandable plus we got to walk around and gamble at the casino while we waited they sent 1 person from our party a text once they were ready to seat us  Expect a long wait time but well worth it!   Service  Everyone was very friendly  and eager to answer any questions we had on the menu.   Restrooms  Since this restaurant is inside of the casino you must use the casino restrooms when you exit will be on your left hand side next to subway   Decor Restaurants is decorated like a barn you can see pictures of farm animals and will find barley on your table   Drinks I was amazed at the grand selection of drinks they have a lot of great alcoholic drinks and non alcoholic drinks from chocolate smores not chocolate to bloody Maury pay 15 bucks and you get to keep a neat hashtogogo cup  Food Get ready to share the portions here are huge. They still manage to decorate the plate with the huge portions. Everything was delicious. I went with a group of friends we all ordered plates to share we ordered following chicken and waffles  Snickers pancake French toast  Chicken Benedict  Roasted chicken   Everything was delicious my husband was not to found of the roasted chicken since this plate was healthier than all of the other options we ordered. If you are worried about calories this is not the place to go to but if you are looking for a great breakfast this place it a must visit!

Even after a walk bye, like she  totally forgot our conversation 3 min earlier.  Not very busy either, Saturday afternoon.  Just not very good service!

p38KZ517z0OaaJy9TwzQZg.text: For a place that has Hash in it's name I expected great hash brown potatoes.  Not so,  these taste like they were made last week.  Very cute waitress!

OOHllvBXc4iiJaPq74zqvQ.text: First time here but I've been wanting to go for some time now. I sat at the bar otherwise it would have been a 30 minute wait. No wait for the barkeeper and I ordered a cold coffee and water to start. For food I ordered chicken and waffles. Pretty good amount of food and tasty too. I finished it all but one last waffle. I just couldn't do it. For dessert I got a white Russian. I would definitely go back. There's so much on the menu I want to try.

CRerrvHcozO0a3JTOfmOtQ.text: Love this location and the food was absolutely delicious!  My boyfriend I had a great time here. Portions are huge so you could definitely split one dish between two people unless you're that hungry

_cYK3lWQngJbGjfrvmumpw.text: We checked in and were told a 30min wait and we'd get a text when table was ready. We wasted time by playing roulette.  After an hour we decided to check in.  They said we'd been removed from the list since we never answered our text.  We never got it because they wrote our number incorrectly.  We waited another 15 minutes for them to get us a table and said the manager would make it right.  Well he did and took 50% off our bill.l, which was truly appreciated.  Food was good and glad we split our meal as it was too much for one person. We got the biscuits and gravy.

14Ebxyt4COsdtOlrYJrb5g.text: I ordered the "Andy's Sage Fried Chicken - Hash House Farm Benedicts." It came with Fried Chicken, which was slightly too crispy but cooked well, bacon, raw spinach, raw sliced tomatoes, mashed potatoes, biscuit, scrambled eggs, and topped with a chipotle-like sauce. All the components were stacked on top of each other. The price was $16.99.   I gotta admit, the fried chicken was good. As good as some fried chicken places in LA. So there isn't a really huge surprise. And the fact that cooking fried chicken at home tastes as good... doesn't really justify the reputation this restaurant holds. After the delicious fried chicken, the rest of the story was bland. Mashed potatoes were worse than most places, especially a dish holding a $17 head. Similar to the raw spinach, the raw tomatoes were both bland and lazy. And the tomatoes were especially hard. The bacon was over cooked and old, and added a horrible texture to the dish.   The large size of this chain restaurant may be contributing to their descending taste. All in all, I would rather hit the other well-known eateries (Nacho Daddy, Freedom Beat, Pig Gastropub, etc) rather than starting your day with a large, unappetizing brunch.

LmwsCu_zFPYWs6Z9HAQ-1w.text: This is my absolute favorite go to place in Downtown Las Vegas.  Very small and crowded place, but the food makes up for it.  My waiter Eric also the bartender was amazing.  He was warm and welcoming and making my drink exactly how i ordered it.    If this was a larger place i would have made it 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5szmUy6BhPv4bH3KiZbbnw.text: This place is so good! The waitress was super nice, and was glad to give us her favorite dishes and drinks when we asked. She also told us that the dishes were big enough to feed two people at least. We didn't listen and still ordered separate entree and had a lot of leftover's. It's right off of Fremont Street so it is local to everything. I absolutely loved it and one hundred percent recommend it to everyone.

JOxcrYwULCVR8vRyPWzx_A.text: We tried the Famous Fried Chicken Benedict an good thing we shared it. The flavors really went great together. I'm just now doing my review however we were there on April 17th. The restaurant was quite which was nice and service was good we have also been to the one in Reno before. 9g0fuNUOY9kLafaP_Ttmeg.text: Known for their large portions of breakfast foods (courtesy of Man vs Food), we came here to fill our bellies with 'cakes and bacon. One can always walk it off with a stroll along Fremont.  The bonus here wasn't the fact that the prices are very decent or that the cakes were bigger than our platter but that here, they use fresh ingredients.....and a lot of them.  The Tractor Driver Combo was served with fresh fruit, the cake had huge blueberries (and not the frozen with syrup kind) and two eggs cooked perfectly.  The service was a-ok, oj fresh squeezed and the bar area (where we sat) was kept very clean and orderly.    Bar is open seating.  If a table is preferred, plan at least a 15min wait as this place is popular.    5 stars for the music (Skid Row and The Scorpions for breakfast?!?!) and service,  4 stars as the potatoes were too "soft" (requested crispy).

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

06jvFIKNfWvsNryJDqTRCQ.text: Sixteen people on a Thursday night for dinner, two of our colleagues' birthdays and our last night in DTLV.  Shame on me for forgetting our server's name, but he was awesome (update: It was JACK! Jack is awesome). I'd only been to Hash House about a million times in San Diego, so wasn't sure this location would live up to what I remember. It was the same, but different. And it was awesome.  There was no skipping a beat on our orders and all of the "no onions, dressing on the side, skip the such and such..." type requests.   I had the Margie's Famous Crab Cake Benedict - a blue crab cake on top of a HUGE biscuit, mashed potatoes, sliced tomato, fresh spinach, minus eggs, sub avocado and asparagus all topped with a jalapeno cream sauce. IT WAS HUGE (as is everything at Hash House).  Everyone else was super happy with their food, too. We had a contest going on and if you were there, you will remember us all placing bets on our tiny co-worker to finish the chicken and waffles plate. She did it! The whole restaurant was cheering her on and letting her know they want to be her when they grow up. It was one of those nights your face hurts from smiling and laughing so much.   We finished with two Snickers Bread Puddings and a rendition of Happy Birthday then hit the casino.   A big thumbs up to them for taking care of us and enabling our shenanigans. Round two next month!   Hint: It's inside the Plaza Hotel on Fremont

EsLFvIviCO4yDigZK9fvaw.text: This place is a big no thanks. The wait staff doesn't know how to handle even a mild rush. It took quite a while for us to be seated, place an order or get a refill.   I ordered an egg white scramble with fruit. The serving of eggs was small and tasteless. I don't think they used salt or pepper even. The fruit was mostly frozen fruit and just mush. The melon wasn't ripe and the banana was completely green. Eggs and fruit should be the easiest meal but somehow they couldn't even do this right. I didn't even finish my plate and ended up getting a snack somewhere else after we left.   What a waste of time and money.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg white scramble with fruit

qIDuYNbUpdWcYvlz0s2cCw.text: Great location and we were seated fast for a Sunday .  I did get the Louisiana hot chicken , and couldn't eat it because it was to hot. I wish the server would have cautioned me . I did eat the sides it came with which were enough since the portions are so big.  .

MaEE6ESS5KXv-16CT58ZsA.text: The food is great!! But I swear the 3 girls at the front need to go. No social skills, don't speak or smile. They pretty much ruined my visit to this location

_H-Yv-ZqxLAipx1fM1uUGw.text: While staying on Fremont I ate there last night. Overall a great experience I knocked off one star because I didn't like the carrots that I was sorry with my meal... I got the steak over mashed potatoes with onion straws onions and green beans. Great server she was very friendly I like the fact they had a three dollar happy hour for a beer.  Will definitely return

cPvfP4dU0rwJ6GWcVkucaQ.text: Early dinner today,so easy to get into. We split the huge double mushroom and Swiss burger and an order of sweet potato fries. Meals are huge. Splitting was just right and we didn't have to carry out leftovers. Mark did a great job, friendly and professional.

ajn9YLkvwMVPQ6USiuq1fQ.text: I've wanted to try this place for a few years and I said when I visit Vegas, I will try this place. I decided to try their Sage Chicken & Waffles and while it was delicious, it was far too much. It consisted of two decent pieces of chicken and four waffles and I would've preferred if they made one in half the size (i.e. one chicken and two waffles). As someone who also loves Nashville Hot Chicken, it was nice to know I had that option but I didn't try it. My breakfast could've fed two to three, maybe four people, which means for me, it was overwhelming. Tasty, but too much for me. I will come back and try a hash or a meat loaf breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tasty-but-overwhelming Sage Chicken &amp; Waffles.

0vLo8-llcCD4KVyk_Gx1KA.text: So much food! Okay, I heard this place was good and the portions were gigantic. I had to see for myself.  I arrived on a Thursday shortly after 10a and the there a lot of people waiting. Thankfully Bar is "FCFS" so my friend & I got lucky right away. I ordered the chicken & waffle and it was delicious but way more than my petite stomach can hold. Food came quick and service was good at the bar. I observed the waiting list moved fairly quickly so don't be discouraged by the line.  So this is a great place to share meals: chicken & waffle was 2 fried chicken breasts + 4 waffles so you can definitely share.  Enjoy!

x8idSUl-4sKkwXVHU_kDCA.text: I was really excited to visit Hash House A Go Go based upon pictures of the food I have seen in the past. The food was good, but not great.   The menu is very large with lots of options. Heading into the meal, I expected to order the Sage Chicken and Waffles. After browsing the menu for a few minutes I settled on the chicken and waffles.   The chicken and waffles look a lot better than they taste. It may have been a lack of syrup, but the waffles were dry. The chicken was good, but had a few small bones, which was unexpected. It was way more food than I could finish, very filling. I finished a little over half the meal.   The service was great and our waitress was very attentive.  Overall, not sure I will return.

QNiuOQP98eGdiPNNtAxdzg.text: This place is really, really good.  Portions are enormous as the pancakes are as big as your head. I got a pancake along with 2 link sausage, 2 eggs And an extra plate.  My wife and I split the pancake. As a matter of fact they tell you that most menu items are enough for 2.   The plates that other folks around us looked tasty as well.    Next time we go, I want to try the one of the sage fried chicken meals.    BEST of all was the waitress.  She was amazing and I'm upset at myself cause I can't for the life of me remember her name.  She alone alone added the 5th star to this review.

mjWqVMhxc-I-LMsAtih7Zg.text: Hours said open till 1am on Fridays ... Really?! we get there -- after dealing with traffic on the 15 due to a bad accident, construction and broken down buses on Fremont and main streets, barely any parking on the Plaza Hotel parking structure -- only to be told that the last guests of 8 people were seated at 940 pm. We all waited, we were right after that group, the hostess disappeared and only to reappear to tell us at 943pm that "we seated the last guest at 940 pm" . Really? You turn away paying and starving clients?! then to make matters worst??! she had no idea about the restaurant's coffee -- which was the reason I actually graced this hotel in the first place -- I was told that this particular location for this restaurant sold the coffee beans. NOT!! The hostess was totally clueless and kept disappearing to find someone with answers. Yeah don't go here unless you want to be disappointed or ignored. Oh and to put that point on that exclamation mark of a scenario ... 22 mins of walking around the casino hotel to get to this place, we left since we were "turned away" and had to pay $10 for parking??!! Unbelievable!!! Stick to the HH location in LINQ where service -- welcoming and courteous staff --  is awesome. At least, paying $9 for parking after eating a great meal and staying for about 2 hours was worth it at the HH location over at LINQ.  "One star" was given only because a "no star" review wouldn't allow me to post my review!!

d2bxxQrbTVvx9oy0re5_4Q.text: Our waitress was exceptional.  I forgot her name.  I want to say Natalie but I'm probably wrong.  She had a great attitude.  Very nice, offered recommendations, she came by frequently to check on us even as busy as it was, she was very attentive.  I've been going to the location in San Diego for sometime and I enjoyed my experience just as much as I do in San Diego.  Great job Hash House!

4VHhoeLopIh0D83DZM_PQA.text: We had good food for breakfast. Large portions, good biscuits, the breakfast price point was high for Fremont. Coffee good, staff was stretched but hustling, mostly keeping up with the tables. Good but not great Bloody Mary

F5Jjd8EY5W-_JuhJG-1yAQ.text: Bloody Mary was delicious , so good I had two. The food was not as good as I thought it was would Be. More Mash potatoes than anything else. Service was great!

E2OlTrKLBA2FZjxoSoXbtg.text: Amazing hash.   Fresh preserves for the mile high biscuits:)  Great Breakfast off Freemont street.

cDVUNyVnGfFlRxER8fiKqA.text: Others in my party wanted to go here, and I had heard mostly positive things about it, so I didn't object.  If you like big breakfast and don't mind paying $15 to $25 per person for it, this place will make you very happy.  Service was good, food was good.  So why only 2 stars?  It's not you, it's me.  Personally, I'm not really into going out for breakfast, and when I do, I often get non-breakfast food and I'd rather go someplace inexpensive. When I splash this kind of cabbage around a restaurant, it's because I am getting dinner, and when I eat this quantity of food before 6pm I feel like crap for the rest of the day.  For these reasons, this place wasn't for me.  There are plenty of affordable breakfast options within a 2 block radius of 1 Main Street.    The cheapest thing I found on the menu with any amount of protein - and by any I don't mean very much - was the bacon waffle at about $9.  It was good for what it was, but I wasn't really into it.  With coffee, tax, and tip that's like $14 for breakfast, for something I wouldn't otherwise have ordered.  I didn't see anything else I wanted for under $10, which is my hard breakfast limit.  Others in my party seemed very satisfied with their monstrous plates of chorizo and eggs, etc.  and their bacon bloody maries.  Some of them got a waffle on the side as well.  Rolling in coffee, cocktails, tax, and tip, I think most of them were spending around $25 to 35 each by the time they walked out of there.  Next time, I'll opt for the Cafe Cortez coffee shop or the Main Street Station buffet.

beiNSdW_aVNxoom-3_aEDg.text: After having a great experience on a previous trip we just had to go back.  The menu is pretty small but pretty much everything is good and the portions are HUGE!  One order can feed two people.  They do have a late nite menu but the portions are slightly smaller  The reason for the 3 stars was the lack of service.  Although the food tasted great the wait time between the first order and last was at least 30 minutes and we all ordered at the same time.  Some orders did not have fruit even though on the menu it clearly states that it's supposed to have it.  Was told by the waiter that on that particular order does not come with it.  After requesting for a refill on water our waiter passed by our table 4 times avoiding eye contact until he came by with the pitcher of water.  I'm not sure how good the service is on breakfast but the service for a Saturday night was pretty bad.

ygR8eJ16QIsM-5292FrpNg.text: They serve up some huge portions but does it help that it's huge portions of very mediocre food. I think this place is popular just due to their oversized portions and interesting plating but not so much on the actual tastiness of their food. The chicken and waffles were probably my favorite dish that I tried.

LNRJxa2jJO0llbZjXTAGtw.text: Our server Monique was very informative and friendly.  When we asked about something on the menu she knew exactly what was in the item in question, with no hesitation wish we came across more servers like her.  My husband ordered corn beef on a bed of potatoes that was a HUGE serving and he said it was delicious. Only complaint he had was that they didn't have any hot sauce, but by the way he almost liked his plate clean I doubt it was that big of an issue.   I wasn't very hungry so ordered The Tractor Driver Combo  (2 Eggs, Bacon and 1 flapjack)...should have known by the name it was going to be a big serving.  The pancake was so big I only ate half.  Was very clean and service was great, and the food was delicious.

qFhizXO1zCavOU7ytN8Cpw.text: Great location - right inside the Plaza hotel  Huge portions and amazing breakfast food for the prices.  Been to a hash house in San Diego and this is just as good as I remember it.  You could definitely share a meal for breakfast.  Our server was really nice and attentive.  Definitely worth going if you're in the downtown area.

9O4TtVlIR_WbKUEo30PVZQ.text: This is a must when in Vegas, I've found this location to be the least busy I've always managed to get right in. Food is amazing and portions are enough to feed Africa.I recommend getting a bacon waffle because bacon makes everything better. While the mimosas are pricey they don't skimp on the alcohol,I also love the electric lemonade. Haven't had a bad meal or experience yet,I look forward to the next time!!!!

6MP5qBFT3QsvyMm39cTO9A.text: always worth the drive up to hash house at the plaza when in vegas. the plates are enormous, more than enough for 3 adults to share. i always get Andys sage fried chicken benedict and a cup of coffee. and i always need a to-go box! the sage fried chicken is well fried, smothered in cheese and sauce, hefty strips of bacon on top of fluffy scrambled eggs, biscuits, and amazing mashed potatoes!!!! its wayyyy too much. but too good to say no.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. andys sage fried chicken

MVhg_ATB5Xju01mEAWJB7A.text: My husband and I loved the very nice presentation of the food. The biscuits were very tasty as well as was the chicken and meatloaf. We will try the stacked foods next time. Great place to eat at. Staff was great and very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For my husband&#39;s Birthday, this is where he wanted to start his day.  Good food. Friendly staff .

CbwNFt3Vmd7RLwuwO5JBzw.text: THE. WORST. SERVICE. AND. SERVER. EVER!  IF YOU EXPECT TO PAY FOR GREAT FOOD PLUS SERVICE...  THIS LOCATION IS NOT THE ONE TO EAT AT!  I'll start off by saying the food is GREAT!  HOWEVER, the sole reason for the 1 star is for the service, or should I say the lack of service!   Let me start by summarizing the volume of business that I witnessed, since one may be quick to assume that it was busy.  -Upon arrival and walking to our table in the back of the restaurant, there were only a total of 4 tables sat up front and in our section, 2 more tables finishing up.  -Once we were seated, it took our server over 10 minutes to greet us just for our drink orders.   -Once we were ready to order, I bring it to our server's attention, and my exact words "my son is allergic to shellfish, can you please note that when putting in our order".  Instead of agreeing, our server, REBECCA, decides to ask numerous questions and give us a hard time about it! -After I order is placed, we do not see Rebecca again, until after our food was delivered by members of management! -It takes 45 minutes to get our food delivered to the table.  Our order: 2 chicken benny's, a ranchero benny, a regular breakfast platter, a chicken salad, and kid pancake combo. -Not only did it take our food forever to come out, but our food was delivered in increments of every 5 minutes.  Whatever happened to serving an entire table all at once?!?!  -I had to ask the manager serving our to look for our server so I can place an alcohol order.  He complies, instead of offering to take my order for me. Once I finally ordered my drink, I take notice that she IMMEDIATELY, NOT STEP TO THE BACK TO PUT MY DRINK ORDER, but IMMEDIATELY goes to a table next to us where her other co-workers are eating. IN THE CUSTOMER DINING AREA, and proceeds to EAT with them, instead of putting in my drink order first!  After five minutes of eating, Rebecca, our server, takes notice that I am looking at her, and she steps to the side, to which I believe to place my drink order, and then comes over to us stating "I'm still waiting on your drink order, I don't know what is taking so long", after I had witnessed her go straight to the "employee lunch table" first.   -My wife asks for something very minimal- extra napkins...  Rebecca, our server, does not come back with napkins after 5 minutes.  Instead we had to get up and "interrupt" the other servers eating and ask for napkins.   -My question is: since when do servers eat in the customer dining area as a group?  Every restaurant I've worked at or managed has a specific dining area for the employees!  TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE, CUSTOMER SERVICE EXPERIENCE!!!  I apologize, but did I mention at least the food was good?  Too bad the service negates the quality of the food they serve.

sMtWxYh-pARnwKqZkWsC4g.text: First time here! First impression was the smell wasnt too pleasant. Smelt like they used a dirty rag to clean our table. We moved and then were greeted by a very nice server. We got the Kokomo meatloaf sandwhich. It was delicious! Huge portion!! Highly suggest it. Would be back but hope that the smell goes away.

4SruQLobICvid5XAOrCG9g.text: The Cobb salad was big enough for 2 meals. Nice fluffy pancakes and a combo on the kids menu. Decent choices. Marginal service and the wafting of cigarette smoke from the casino. It was convenient. But that's it.

MRiagy6JWGZ_k6E8hChuCA.text: Very large portions, tasty food, and extremely reasonable prices. Especially for Vegas! Great place.

vu2gbY0cxYu_90kWymtJSw.text: Zero wait time, showed up at 730 am, and showed up hungry! Great service, clean environment, good suggestions by our server, and a very clear menu with abundant choices. I went with the Machacas and my husband the Chicken skillet. Our food came out within 10-15 minutes (can't be sure, we were too busy trying to plan a fun day) and was plated beautifully! My Machacas had skillfully prepared eggs with beef and tomatoes and onions...I had no idea eggs could be that fluffy! Fried potatoes and a large tortilla complemented my meal. I received the jalapeno sauce/salsa on the side and requested a side of limes to help cool it down. Delicious!!! I ate almost every bite of the eggs despite the gargantuan portion! Even though the potatoes were crispy and flavorful I couldn't even...my husband's skillet came with a soft and succulent biscuit the size of a softball and was paired with homemade jam, mixed berry possibly? His response? Perfectly warmed and moist ;) Yum!! His chicken skillet was chock full of onion, pepper, and asparagus served over the top of crispy fried potatoes, along side of two eggs done just right. Cleaned his enormously portioned skillet/plate! Bottom line, go early, realize that great restaurants become busy, and the food tastes farm to table fresh! Great coupons if you stay at the Plaza, but even without, very affordable restaurant experience! Thank you Hash House!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Machacas with jalapeño sauce on the side! Unbelievably good!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skillet, awesomeness!!

vhLXpMkDx9opT0jc1Qz34Q.text: The most amazing food!!  Best crispy chicken I've ever ever ever had!!  The Sage chicken and waffle was amazing!  The waffle had bacon and the chicken breasts were sooo juicy and crispy!  I must revisit.  Till we meet again Hash A Go Go.

0kZSkzeXJP3PlI1LWkF7Ag.text: The French toast is scrumptious! Didn't get to try the Bloody Mary and I'm totally bummed about that because I hear they are amazing. Will have to come back.

ZiW6suxOunpYrcgTN1hSdw.text: recently stayed at the plaza downtown for the first time and also eating breakfast there. hash house a go go is sooo freaking good. I ordered their french toast that had this banana taste to it with eggs and bacon. it was sooooooo good!! and I know water is water but there's is really good. so refreshing!! and I love how they add decorations to the food. it's a plus! definitely will eat there again!

ZBnTsNZ44aPdcH6zvW-trw.text: Great corned beef hash !!  This is a lot of food to eat. Really good.  Service is a little slow. Don't asked for any changes on your order, the chef won't do it. I asked if they could change the cheese on my eggs from Swiss to cheddar and was told Chef wouldn't do it.  They will leave items off but won't change things. Food is good !!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash, yum !!!

oImpn-j7SjsUyVUv2y4uLQ.text: Went there a couple weeks ago for dinner before a show.  I ordered an appetizer for my meal, my wife ordered the meatloaf sandwich.  I anticipated the sandwich would be more than she could finish, so the appetizer was the right choice.  Meatloaf was tasty, as was the appetizer I ordered.  Had we ordered full entrees, there would have been way too much food (keep that in mind when ordering).  The prices were a little steeper than I wanted (I was looking for a trendy-dinner experience, yet prices were closer to $20+ a plate), but I attribute that to the portion sizes they provide.  Service was ok.  Our waiter hung out behind the bar talking to one of his colleagues a bit more than I would've liked (i.e. we could've used refills on a couple of occasions when he was chatting), but it wasn't overly intrusive.  I'd give this place a 3, but my wife would give it a 4, so I'm rounding up for her.

3uY7pYDvXRpVzlIwIg0Pcw.text: Love their breakfast!  Had the chicken asparagus hash which was excellent. Also the steel cut oats and fresh fruit was huge, with lots of fresh fruit.  Portions are large so if do not have a big appetite definitely recommend splitting a meal.  Service is also good so when I am looking for breakfast downtown this is my go to place!

PKJ_6n1OD1c4B2Jh5U6RQA.text: Not only does Hash House understand serious portions, the flavor of their food is off the charts as well. Huge fan of all of the burgers, and the fries are hot, crisp and salty. The Bloody Mary is killer and comes with a whole strip of bacon. Don't sleep on the iced coffee either, it is the bomb!

Qd9Qc1cuezpa_-cPm78ZoA.text: Decent food. We arrived and the bartender wasn't there yet so I didn't get my s'mores mocha until halfway through my meal. The service was kind of lacking, but the portion sizes are decent and the food is as I would expect at a diner.  The basic: The potatoes didn't really have any flavor and the chopped onions sprinkled through them were raw (ew to raw onions), eggs were a little under easy and runny, the biscuit was hard and broke into pieces and there were so many chunks of peach/apricot that it was hard to spread the jelly...but the chicken sausage was pretty good. Very filling.  S'mores mocha: was a little bit disappointing! Didn't look like it does in the photo on the menu, and there was so much marshmallow it was hard to get to the mocha itself....  All in all... Not that great...

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores mocha
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The basic: 2 eggs over easy, potatoes, chicken sausage, biscuit, and fruit

oYbpaXNInz2zrSOGw8XxAQ.text: Amazing fried chicken & waffles!! Done like it's suppose to & can easily be shared worth every penny & I will come back every time I'm in Vegas. Worth the wait THANK YOU for the unforgettable best chicken and waffles I've ever had. Bloody Mary's are bomb too!!!

rJMXb1jMxHv44Ghtcm3akw.text: Large portions and you'll leave satisfied!  My fave is the chicken and waffles.  Coming in second would be their benedicts.  I've never had to wait here long and the servers are always checking in on our table.  Bloody Mary is a hit!

0WVQZFOXxZaY43cRt7yTCQ.text: Who ever doesn't like this place is CRAZY! I used to live in SD and would go there all the time. Having one in Vegas is just perfect because you need the large portions for a hangover. Chicken and Biscuits are always a fave, along with their french toast. Bloody Mary's are also a must here they know how to make them. Anyone looking for a good breakfast and large portions must come here. Plates can easily be shared with 2-3 people.

qh5amsMcg5E7_vexOk61pw.text: The food was hot and flavorful. The drinks were nice and strong and our server was super friendly and attentive.

3UbHQJtxliTJULEfqFWsOw.text: Wandering around the streets of Fremont, I was hungry (surprise). I ended up here because I was looking for brunchy foods. I ordered a shake and the Snickers pancake with eggs and sausage.   As we waited for our food, my eyes grew large as I saw plates coming out of the kitchen. I wondered how I was supposed to eat it all! Luckily, my kiddo and I had agreed to share a plate.   The shake was presented beautifully and full of all the creamy, fatty goodness you would expect. The pancake was very large with bits of Snickers throughout. The sausages were flavored well and balanced out the sweetness of the pancake. The eggs were hearty to round things out.   Overall, I was completely full when I left.

vLKekAWUf9UN5q-_zxt0_g.text: Delighted by our waitress (Sonia) and her knowledge about the menu and recommendations.  We decided to get the HH Bloody Mary and the BLT Mary!  Great options.  We split the chorizo hash and it was really good!  I'd like to come back and try the Man vs. Food chicken!  I am happy that we made the trip!  Well worth it!!

0ColiwOU3vuX_LQ6cEjB5w.text: So glad we went to HH for dinner, but almost didn't because of the breakfast/lunch description. They do dinner quite well. As far as we could tell, it's like some hipsters took over Denny's and added an interesting beer list.  I had the meatloaf, and regret to say I couldn't finish it. It was the best meatloaf I've had, but enough to feed a little-league team. I did crafts with the rosemary spear and spaghetti pieces as an added bonus. The side veggies--carrots & green beans were tasty and well cooked. The meatloaf sits on top of pan-fried mashed potatoes and is smothered in gravy. I loved it.  The other dish was the sage/bacon chicken & waffles. Also too much for one; it arrived with ample, moist ("real") fried chicken, bacon in the waffles and a few strands of green onions. The chicken & bacon were finished, but a waffle or two didn't fit. Judged: very good.  Be careful what and how much you order. The mains are splittable from what we saw.  Great beer list with several varieties rated 90%+ on the beer sites. The soundtrack on the house system even played the Pixies and other 90s indie rock.  We're planning to go back for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf

TgOKhoyFZ8Uh4VynrgtYKg.text: Set in the Plaza hotel, casino floor.  Nice retro set up.  1) Mimosas were small, but simplistically tasty 2) world famous sage fried chicken and waffles was great!  The chicken was so moist and delish!  HUGE portion, prob something to share next time- definitely a repeat.  3) Texas rancheros was good, loaded with mashed potatoes which was too much, even for my texas born and breed hubby.  Service was quick and food was hot!  Place was clean.

5HAT4EIYo4DnLVw-yDvTpQ.text: Looked up this place and saw the pictures and reviews, let me note clear, the internet is a lie. I took my family here for brunch on Monday the 5th of September, the service was horrible not once did the waitress come to our table to ask if everything was fine or to bring us water (as any other place would) or even refills, the good was horrible, my Niece and wife order fruit bowls and the bananas' were not RIPE (green) and brown on the inside like if they were frozen, the blackberries and blueberries were all squashed. Would you let a child eat a NOT ripe banana? Come on! The "chicken pot pie" the chicken is actually turkey! I asked to then speak to the manager where he told me " that's how the bananas are there fine" and for you guys I shall upload the pictures. I recommend here to no one as I'm still extra disappointed in the establishment.

wDoYNCziUmvD20kqiZXGcg.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in Vegas.  This one in the Plaza Downtown, and on the strip in the Linq.  Any of the Benedict's are awesome.  Nicely presented on the plate.  I also like the HH meatloaf.  Meatloaf for breakfast might sound weird, but it's a big slice seared on the flat top and served with eggs and potatoes.  Pretty good. Prices are reasonable, considering the portions are large.  If you don't have. Big appetite, you're better off splitting with a friend.

0-OxWYxEd6pArHNunoVMBA.text: This place always amazes! Unique combinations, extra large portions, and great drinks! Had a farmhouse scramble ,  and loved it!

k7fweFve9qkHISQwEywWeQ.text: Had an old school hot chocolate to start. ($4.99)  It comes in an oversized cup with four full sized marshmallows floating! Ordered a Farm Scramble - Hardwood smoked bacon,onion, avocado and Swiss )$12.79). Comes with a biscuit and jelly and crispy potatoes.  Meal was fabulous, more than you can eat! The potatoes were the only spoiler as they were chunky and not extra crispy like i requested.  Meal portions here are Huge so sharing is my suggestion.  Free refills on coffee ($2.99)
