jKMQjuNH1kWFtgLiTq46hg.text: A pretty solid Vegas breakfast. The portions are huge. I had the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and eggs and a biscuit. The chicken was great. The potatoes, less so. Good service considering the morning mayhem

1uPNNRn9_n4-dencH8X43Q.text: If you don't go here you are missing out. Prices are great for the portions you get. I would highly recommend splitting meals. You will probably split a meal and still have leftovers. Our table got several different items. The banana French toast was awesome! So delicious and exactly what you want if you're craving something sweet. You get three huge slices and can get items on the side if you want. I got the bacon, avocado, onion, and Swiss farm scrambler. It was super good! Biscuit looked awesome! I wasn't too impressed by the fried potatoes - they weren't very crispy and I didn't end up eating many. My friend got the meatloaf hash and really liked it. She could only eat about half of it. A couple people who are Bloody Mary connoisseurs got the BLT Mary and were impressed - and these people have Bloody Marys every weekend, so they must have been great. The most amazing thing was the Andy's Save Fried Chicken Benedict. Oh. My. God. It was on man vs food. This thing could easily serve four people. It was so damn good too! The fried chicken was perfect and had a good spice to it. The combination of everything was on point. I have literally thought about it each day since trying it. You will not regret it - just make sure you share! Also, be sure to get the 25 oz Budweiser in a paper bag. It's too classy to pass up.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 25 oz Bud in a bag. Can&#39;t go wrong for breakfast.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado, bacon, onion, &amp; Swiss farm scramble. Potatoes were a disappointment and not crispy, but I really didn&#39;t have enough room for them!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s Save Fried Chicken Benedict. Out of this world delicious! Enough to feed 3-4 people.

q4k4Ll97VXbog1rW3EneiA.text: Great place if you want breakfast in Las Vegas, Loved their Breakfast/Brunch some of the biggest portions of food. They play nice music the only thing I didn't like was the waiting room a big mess and very little seats for people to wait but overall a great restaurant. They had a great well organized menu with very hard working employees, Definitely would eat here again.

CGcWp2i_ljsfg4cYpzgwUA.text: When a coworker of mine heard that I would be going to Las Vegas, they told me about this place right away, and after hearing them rave about the food, I definitely had to check it out. This location is the one in downtown Las Vegas near Fremont Street, and it is also located next to a casino. We were seated pretty quickly and had great service throughout. The menu is nothing short of overwhelming with all of the great dishes that they had to serve. Once we made up our mind, we ordered and even our server advised us that we may have been ordering too much food. He was absolutely correct. Their portions are HUGE and even sharing one order of the French toast between 4 people was barely enough. My group and I had the chicken and waffles, one of the benedicts, the tractor driver combo, and the French toast. It was easy to see that we would have a lot of left overs. The food itself was very tasty once you got over the fact that everything as huge. The food definitely had a lot of flavors even though the presentation seems a little rushed. It is definitely a great place to have a bite to eat and just a heads up: you may need to call someone to cart you out of there once you're finished.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GyCXSnQnyZM-AutIrnTdnQ.text: Been here twice now, but needed the second trip to make sure I wrote an appropriate review. Before ordering here please be aware that this place serves HUGE HUGE portions. I didn't even come close to finishing my plate and I have  pretty big appetite. Prepare to split or share food because they won't do a half order.  We stayed at the Golden Nugget in Downtown Vegas so Hash House a Go Go was an easy 5 minute walk. Not 100% sure what the parking situation is here, but most hotels have Valet, and I think they have there own lot somewhere down the street.   On this trip I order the Sage Fried Chicken. Again, huge portion. The sage really came through on the chicken and the sauce was amazing. The chicken was fried, with a great crisp on the outside, but not greasy. It was placed on a bed of egg and bacon, which was followed by an enormous pile of hash potatoes, on top of two home made biscuits. The potatoes are great but there is way too much of them, and the biscuits are fantastic. Unfortunately the biscuits are stuck under the pile of potatoes so in order to eat them with the chicken you have to rescue them from the bottom of the plate.   My Fiancee ordered the French Toast. One order comes with three huge pieces of French Toast topped with a caramelized banana and pecans. She ate one and a half pieces of French Toast before calling it quits. Overall she loved it and would order it again after trying a few more things first.   I found the menu hard to read because it was wayyyy too cluttered. Also, we were there on a Wednesday at 11am with basically no body in the restaurant and the service was kinda spotty. We got seated right away but it took a while for someone to get a coffee order. We then had to get a busser to ask our waitress for a refill. We also needed some extra plates and had to ask the host to find our waitress for that as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sage Fried Chicken and the French Toast. Very tasty!

8Ym2aC8Hj1P6DcjsookoOw.text: I love Hash House a Go Go!  Although I haven't been for a long time, when I did last eat there, I had leftovers for days!  I ordered the chicken pot pie, which is the size of a small dog.  I do NOT like onions, chives, or scallions of any type, even if they are just garnishes, so I specifically asked for none of the above and my pot pie.  It came out perfectly and was so delicious!  Everything I've ever ordered there, I have liked.  I will definitely go back soon!

Cife6k6n3z5ySkLPSKMdzg.text: Don't like leaving bad reviews so will just say that our experience wasn't impressive. Long wait for food in a half empty restaurant and was barely warm when it arrived.Should of sent the food back really but just wanted to leave after the wait.  Put us off returning unfortunately.

nCEAyMFn86bbDF7LymwqJA.text: I went here for breakfast this morning and it did not disappoint!! I ordered the tractor pull which was two eggs, potatoes, and a massive banana pancake.  The service was excellent.  The best part was that I had a massive headache (not from drinking) and it really helped me to feel way better.  I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vpaUNZpTn4XJ0ULC6sPH6Q.text: I was excited to come here as I am a huge breakfast food and Bloody Mary fan and saw all the food pictures and the raving reviews. And, my friends and I came here after a long night of partying and we were hungry so you know everything automatically tastes better. We could not have been more disappointed down this road of food mediocrity.  This review not reflective of our servers or front host, they were attentive, friendly, and did a good job. A couple of us were first served the BLT Bloody Mary, it was served with a half slice of bread and mayo...why? I don't think anyone was going to make a sandwich with a half slice of bread with the bacon and tomato and if we did, at least have it toasted. Perhaps the bread is for dipping? Again toasted would keep it from getting too soggy. The Bloody Mary itself was lacking in spice and had little depth of flavor, it was more like plain V-8 juice. At least it had bacon?  Speaking of bacon, we ordered a side of it to share because we knew whatever came with the drink could never be enough; because bacon, that's why.  It was a thicker type cut and on the slightly saltier side which was fine to go with the bland drink but not on its own. We left some bacon behind...nooooooo, this little piggy went to the trash.   Two of my friends had the rosemary roasted chicken hash with asparagus. They stated it tasted more like pulled rotisserie chicken with a few underwhelming spices thrown mixed in. Some of the asparagus pieces were fibrous. The "crispy" potatoes weren't crispy any longer and seemed like they had been sitting out ready to be used instead of being made to order. Definitely not what they were expecting.  I had a similar experience with my "healthier" mushroom, artichoke, and sun-dried tomato hash except my was served luke warm and my crispy potatoes were over cooked and downright soggy from the veggies. The veggies didn't mesh and seemed like they were all prepared separately them thrown on top and made to sit there until all my fellow cohorts' food was also ready. The eggs that came with it were made well from the over easy to sunny side up. The fruit was sweet and fresh. Sadly, the best part was the biscuit, I enjoyed it with the jam (not sure if it was homemade but it was good) and my friends liked it with the  gravy. The issue was half of all of our biscuits were starting to sog up from being in the bottom of the skillet and next to the fruit. The top half of the biscuit was light and buttery and very enjoyable. It would be better to serve it separately or on top of the hash.  We were all sad the hash from the was the worst of what was ordered from the Hash House hence the 2 versus 3 star rating.    My other friend had the pancake with a side of ham. Did I say pancake? I meant GIANT pancake. This thing was large enough to soak up all 6 of our alcohol poisonings from the night prior. For being so large I was impressed that it had some good volume rise to it and evenly cooked. It was a little more cooked than I generally like my pancakes, but that's completely understandable given it's huge size.  It also went very well with that jam I spoke of earlier. This dish is not for the diabetic. Well done hash house.   The corned beef hash sandwich with caramelized onions was handsomely sized and filling and the fries that came with it were meaty and good. The rye bread was a little too thickly cut and some of it was left behind. My friend stated the flavors were decent overall.

dRRW79RVegB18jzF7PUgqA.text: The thing that makes hash hash a go go unique is the huge portions.  I am talking these portions are big.  Usually that is a negative for me because often then sacrifice quality for quantity,  but I found that not to be the case.  The food is pretty good.  Pancakes, chicken, etc this place is a good place to take family/friends because it has a wide variety to choose from.

R1d2mtu_J1WQpHJTO0dG-w.text: We've been to Hash House on Sahara many times, but this was a first for the branch at the Plaza. Generally, reviews haven't been as good for the newer venues, but we were happy to have experienced good service and good food. Surprisingly, they were willing to accept the restaurant.com certificate that we'd bought for Sahara but, alas, our $50 one was too big for the two of us to use, and the $10 one turned out to be good for breakfast or lunch only. And we were there for dinner. Hubby and I shared a burger stuffed with roasted red pepper and smoked mozzarella. The burger is a double, so it was really easy to split. We also a portobello mushroom sandwich with peppers, pesto, and goat cheese. Both were terrific. We didn't have to wait long to be seated, served, or to get the check, which was welcome, since our reason for being at the Plaza was to see The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas. And we finished dinner with time to spare.

ArvbgXnCZ3cthrri5dzoUw.text: After picking up my bib packet for Saturday mornings 9/11 Remembrance Run 9./11 K race I am running, the lady & decided to grab some mid afternoon lunch. Being in the eclectic people watching mecca of the west (also known as Fremont Street in Las Vegas) we settled on checking out the newly remodeled Plaza Hotel, and our first foray into the quirky "Hash House a Go Go" which just opened recently.  After getting welcomed and seated we both decided to feast on this big, bad sandwich:  "INDIANA FAVORITES  Big O'crispy hand hammered pork tenderloin sandwich With onion, pickles & of course ketchup on a whole wheat bun served with your choice of side. You'll think you're back in Indiana!"  So when Tommy our server came to take the order, we rolled with it.  Except I made a fatal food service customer error.  I asked if I could have some *lettuce* added to the above.  See, as a former Hoosier, I grew up with pork tenderloin sandwiches. The staple of VFW Post lunches, greasy all night diners, and fairs & festivals. Except, as the HH description notes, it is not served with the 'traditional' IN combination of lettuce, tomato, and mayo. Understanding this, I figured I would compromise, and make just a minor deviation.  "Can I get lettuce added to mine also please?", I asked.  *pause*  Tommy: "you want lettuce on yours also. Uh, well, I can add it, except it would come as a side, so it will come as a "side item", and its an additional upcharge for $2.00. Did you want me to do that?"  Me: (silence while mentally calculating how two leafs of iceberg lettuce retails out to $2.00 in food service). "Um, no that's okay, I can't justify that".  Good thing I didn't ask for tomato and/or mayo then.  The meal came out and as described, the hammered tenderloin was HUGE. Mind you, this is how it is depicted.  Mine appeared a bit differently: Less fanfare in the presentation. Which was still okay. With no pickle. The thing is HUGE. And wasn't too bad taste wise.  Tommy was a great server. Brought a refill of drink out before less than 1/4 remaining- always a gold standard. Pronounced my last name on debit card spot on, which can be difficult.   Tommy also said "I checked with the manager about the lettuce and she said that they could not do it without charging extra... which I don't agree with personally".  So all in all, this particular server is on top of his game. The food was decent, yet not remarkable. And my bill for the sandwiches, soda, lemonade and the fries? A staggering $39.00 for lunch with no adult beverages.  That's right. Kind of a pricey lunch for what you get, however I guess the portion size makes up for it.  With that said, the fact that you cannot make a simple addition like iceberg lettuce is the reason I will not go back to HH in Las Vegas. I can buy an entire head of lettuce for about 99 cents. I understand restaurants making profit, and certainly addition or substitutions can cost more. 50 cents extra? no problem, I guess. I come from an area where tomato is a seasonal item and can actually cost more off season (i.e. 'deluxe' on a burger). I guess for the same price I should have ordered the hamburger which comes 'deluxe' instead.  My point to the review/rant is that customers in restaurants often do need to make substitutions or changes out of dietary concerns, and I get that. However the server discussing it with the manager and her standing firm on that kind of a request for such a simple item is a bit out of line. I can get lettuce on by $1.29 BK double cheeseburger for nothing, because it is an inexpensive item. An upscale restaurant needs to have *some* flexibility to its policy on adding "vegetables" as a side item. Had I ordered a "side of lettuce", then I would expect to be charged more for it because that is known as a salad. I should have asked to trade for the pickle I never got on the sandwich instead and called it even.  I don't make a policy out of speaking to managers. The last time I did so (calmly and as we left) it led to a fight in the relationship, and I don't need that hassle either. So what is one to do?  Vote with my money.  And that is why I will not be back to Hash House A Go Go.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Tenderloin

iK-IE-ZgwSzpHqSsHjc-iw.text: I come here every time I'm in downtown las vegas! Normally i get the sage fried chicken & waffles. This time, i tried something different. I got the rosemary chicken hash which was a pretty good choice! I didn't even finish it all....i was stuffed! My server Martha was exceptional!

9s3gMrowteG8EhSJo7TJHA.text: The food is huge here and absolutely delicious,the service fantastic, the hostess was very helpful with a bit of extra special attentive to us also with a tat of history about the place,I had 14in. flapjacks w/ banana cook inside, with scramble eggs,one chicken sausage,the little lady had french toasts w/ cook open face banana w/ pecans on top.Parking can be a problem downtown,but if you park at the Plaza Hotel parking lot its $5.00 take your ticket give it to your hostess get validation then you have to take your ticket to the hotel cashier cage to get your money back........that's a lot of work we 're going to try one of the other two Hash House A Go Go where there is free parking.

p4Al3U5m9obfsC2RRMqSKg.text: Three words:  oversized, overprocessed and overpriced  That really sums it up and there is nothing else to say, but if I don't type more, Yelp won't add this as a review b/c its too short.  No desire to ever eat at Hash House again.

CvQPPGQb8yVKEvbLI5HlhQ.text: 5 stars is not enough to rate the Hash House. Seriously the wait was non existent, servers were helpful and friendly and the food left me speechless. My bf and I both ordered the 18oz rib eye. That's 18 whole ounces served on a bed of pumpkin mashed potatoes. The steak was cooked perfectly and tender and flavorful!! My husband gets the griddle eggs and bacon with smashed taters. The taters are very tasty. So worth coming. If you go to this location of course your going to pay $5.00 for parking. nZnvpfjTNv8hiHQteWkslg.text: Last Labor Day weekend 2015, when my family and I came to HHAGG, we had an awesome dining experience.  Fast forward to July 4, 2016, and the dining experience is A-Gone-Gone ! Wait times were longer than 20 minutes, and so we chose the counter. The brunette server was A-Horrible Mess! She waited on everyone around the counter in speed except us. It took 30 minutes before our food came out.  I shared my concerns with the on-duty manager, and he did nothing to apologize; he made excuses for her and the lack of service we experienced.  I am making it known today that HHAGG is just that - hashed and gone.  We won't be back, and I'm sharing with others to don't even bother to go here.  One star is too many!

uzDSNhRJ13umi4_k8p9O5Q.text: My boyfriend and I came here for brunch on a Sunday morning at 11am. We were told it would be a 15 minute wait, which was totally reasonable and I'm sure shorter than what the wait would've been elsewhere, but we decided to eat at the bar and were promptly served. My BF ordered the pork tenderloin Benedict and I got the HH original Benedict. Both were amazing (and HUGE)! The roasted red pepper cream on the original Benedict reminded me of shakshuka (which I love). We would definitely both go back!

qfabyp8xnCCvVlxxyElBHQ.text: We went on a Monday afternoon, no wait to be seated and helped by our helpful server. The menu seems smaller there than on their website. He chose the sage chicken Benedict and I chose the pork tenderloin Benedict. We both chose the famous Blt Bloody Mary, it's served with dry toast and mayo and garnished with Blt. The glass' lip is lined with what tastes like imitation bacon. It was disappointing but aside from that the experience was pretty enjoyable.

ikjeqY0rCipq0yiPPkcDeg.text: Amazing food..great portions as in share size portions.. this one doesn't have the best wait staff but it's definitely a stop for anyone that is near by.. oh and if you go in the main lobby doors, you won't be accosted by the time share people. ;)

phqnSbVwhhAr_Tvg_LoxEg.text: From 6/2/16   Came to Hash House A-Go-Go because we heard so many good things about it, plus we were hungry and this looked like the place to be.   We were seated, looking through the menu you could tell this was not the place to go if you are counting calories because the portions are generous.   I ordered the Vanilla Waffles with a side bacon. As I suspected, the portions are big and delicious, so this was going to be one of those meals you can't finish, but leftovers are fine by me anyway.  I enjoyed this place, and could see myself coming back here at some point

EjNSyZP3hlE04XV_JzauCA.text: Well worth the visit. I guess I didn't realize that Man v Food did a piece here. The fried chicken eggs Benedict with maple reduction was excellent. I highly recommend for a hearty breakfast, nice brunch time visit or late lunch with friends.

95_ykkJQIkir9kXydtoUSA.text: I was so stoked to try this place after seeing it on T.V. Looked so tasty and innovative. I ordered the meatloaf and my girl ordered some pasta. We both didn't care for the meals and ate very little. They did only charge us for one entree and gave us half price deserts which was nice. The crazy thing was o brought the meatloaf home and even my dogs wouldn't eat it . I'm sure there are great items on the menu but stay away from the meatloaf and pasta

M0KYczRMxSOjEtCNkSk7ug.text: Best breakfast type food on Fremont street. Like the classics and the new twists on them. Big portions, so be prepared to be full. The sage fried chicken is great. Jack, our server was a very prompt and helpful waiter. Would highly recommend if you are staying in Fremont street.

sFFb6e0oj87eXH5R-7QOtA.text: The first thing the server told us was that the portions were large enough for two and to keep that in mind when ordering. He was not a liar.  I've seen big flapjacks before, but this one took the (pan)cake. It was not only large in diameter, but thick throughout. We ordered the blueberry flapjack and it overflowed the plate. As big as it was, it did not lack in taste. I especially loved the crispy outside which added a nice texture. Only thing I would have appreciated, considering the size, was two syrups.  We also ordered the Chorizo hash and it was okay. I think the best thing about the dish was the massive biscuit. Would have been nice to have had some jam.  Overall, the food was acceptable. But as for the experience, I prefer to dine without inhaling smoke fumes. I guess that's inherent to dining in a casino, but if you have the option to dine at another location, take it.

zoDACqxZYdyPw6kpu9hp9g.text: The guy on the plane told me I had to check out this place.  Guess what there is one in my hotel.  I ordered pancakes for dinner!  The blueberries were fresh and big.  It was the size of a medium pizza.  I'm back tomorrow morning for their signature  Bloody Mary.  A whole strip of bacon, whole stick of carrot and a whole celery stick!!

r4F9RupFbnGNDTT_8d_-Bw.text: Runner service great, wait service not. Water took forever. Fries snd bacon bacon both good. Bread pudding a huge letdown...dry, dry, dry.

umgRwr9PbF0xOM8p5H4Waw.text: I felt the service was not stellar at all. Waiter rushed in and was like, can you hurry up. I had never been there before and I asked a question about the menu, he seemed irritated that I had asked anything. In my opinion, they should give you a hint that the portions are HUGE and can be shared. There was so much food left at the table and 3 of us ordered the same thing. Some of the food coming out of the kitchen did look good but with the service we received, I do not think I will go back.

Y0HZsr-1PDA_k-0HchyGNA.text: I have not been impressed with many restaurants in the casinos on Fremont, but this was a great place to eat for breakfast.  I spent under $13 for lots of food. Everything was tasty and cooked perfectly.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Basic&#34; with bacon and biscuits and gravy as a side order.

PMPzQ0oo_9XyQfqCHt7RFw.text: Not sure what the big deal is. I think I had the driest, saddest meatloaf I've ever seen in my life and my mashed potatoes looked and tasted like they'd been sitting under a heat lamp for awhile. Friend got the BBBLT and basically ended up just eating the bacon out of it. Service was subpar and server never asked how the food was and disappeared for long amounts of time. Didn't get water refills. Fries were good. Maybe the other locations are better. Oh well.

-vbZLY4Xnpp02NnVu89EFQ.text: I had heard so much about Hash House, I had to make a stop while staying downtown recently.  Busy at breakfast time, but we were able to get a seat right away at the counter. The portions are enormous, but I'll admit the flavors let me down a little. Everything was good, but I had really expected something really memorable. I had the Meatloaf Hash, which I couldn't finish - and that doesn't happen often! - I would have liked a richer flavor in the Meatloaf, but it was still good, which chunks of Potatoes, Onion, Pepper, and topped with a Sunny-Side-Up Egg (my choice) it made for a heavy breakfast. I also couldn't resist trying the BLT Bloody Mary. I don't like Bloody Marys, and I didn't particularly like this one, but it had plenty of kick, and a full Leaf of Lettuce, slice of Tomato, and thick slice of Bacon. Not a cheap beverage, but when am I ever going to have the chance for one of those again!? I still think it's a "bucket list" restaurant, but don't over-hype your expectations, and you'll be fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf Hash

h2rwUOcEn0QJLjzJf3_GpA.text: So I was excited to try this hip, cool comfort food breakfast. Here is the breakdown:  The food was a solid four stars. It was really good and a little different.  The service was three stars. As in many Las Vegas eateries, they just don't seem to pay that much attention to customers.  Th kicker, though, was the parking. You pay $5 for the Plaza self-park as you enter the lot. Then you get your ticket validated by your food server, who tells you to take it to the booth for a refund of your parking fees. There are no further instructions - or signs - telling you that it isn't the parking lot booth where you paid. No, it's the cashier booth in the casino. So that's three stops to get your parking fee returned. Oh, and the parking lot is about a hundred yards from the hotel - past the Greyhound station.

vPFRrO6k6ynH-CgGKJLpPQ.text: This place is as crazy as Las Vegas.  The twisted farm cuisine is darn good and the portions are as big as the Grand Canyon.  The staff was great but it did take a while to get all our food.  Could be that they had to go butcher more chickens but it was worth the wait.  I had the meatloaf- darn good.  Others the crazy chicken waffles - also good.  There were no "lunch losers" at our table.  If you want something different and are really hungry- this is the place.  The good news is that I was too full and tired to get in trouble.

7RVXkxRPJFU9_hkYJ3nLJw.text: A must stop for incredible, delicious, gourmet food.  I always stop here because the food is so good.  The portions are HUGE so unless your hungry, really hungry you might want to share.  This is a hidden jewel at the end of the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vt2B-FxiY346ayZ0clOE_w.text: My husband and I came here after hearing rave reviews about the burgers. He ordered the Smoked Bacon, Avocado & Cheddar Burger and I ordered a burger with sweet peppers. The portions were huge. We immediately cut our burgers in half to save for later. While the portions were generous the taste was just OK. The patties didn't taste like they were seasoned at all. The ingredients were fresh.  Our three year old enjoyed his grilled cheese sandwich.  The service was prompt and the restaurant was clean.  I think we'll give their breakfast a try and leave the burgers to Tommy's.

_sbLr8wSjCyKj0fqU0teaA.text: Sage fried chicken and waffles with bacon inside of the waffles and syrup to drizzle on top....as well as crab cakes with a pesto pasta? Call me a run on sentence but those two entrees were running tasty on my taste buds!  My brother and I shared both entrees since there are HUGE portions at this restaurant.   We are two big dudes so we were satisfied with our order. The food was a delight. Lol who says that? Me.

fe_miOGLxyqoEQQdaTfYwA.text: The highlight of staying at the Plaza Hotel was eating one of the most exciting breakfasts that I've ever consumed. Who here gets excited about breakfast? Moi! It's eggs and meat and bread and starches. Every lovely food group that I've ever loved all on one plate.  I had the corned beef house hash. It was by far one of the greatest meals ever and an unexpected breakfast dish. It had a huge portion of corned beef topped with some Swiss cheese.  I've never been a Swiss fan as I think the aftertaste of it is quite outputting, but with the saltiness of the beef, the cheese worked well and was mighty tasty. There was also a huge helping of potatoes, your choice of two eggs, and a biscuit. All in all, it was enough for two meals for me. I'm one of those people that usually can't finish a normal sized portion, let alone a breakfast big enough for a caveman BUT since there wasn't a fridge in the room, I forced myself to eat it all and walk around with my pants un-buttoned for the day.  The prices are a bit steep in comparison to other breakfast joints. Our breakfast cost around $40 for two entrees, a coffee and a fresh squeezed orange juice. In the future, I'd get an entree to split and that would help with the cost and the super sized portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo hash breakfast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash meal

tikz-MWqWmO4GkgKVBugwg.text: Ordered the corn beef hash and am completely satisfied. The meat was perfectly seasoned and shredded and the dish came out in a hot skillet. Friend ordered the chicken & waffles --- another huge portion of food. We are currently experiencing a food coma, still at the table lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S17YuoU2xkub20mfZyvXVA.text: We have a large group in town for a family gathering/vacation and have frequented the other hash house a go go's in the area. Upon arrival the place was nearly empty so we got right in. Our waitress started out spunky and nice but it was only a front. She brought waters and gave us menus. As we were looking over what to order and who was going to spilt what we noticed the people behind us had Mac n cheese (which was not on the menu). If our waitress had explained that there was a happy hour menu we would have known. She came and got our drinks and food orders and told us we couldn't move seats. I guess they do their check ringing by seats. About 20 mins pass and still no drinks. Drinks finally arrive followed by our apps and food. Nearly all at the same time.  I ordered the BBBlt with salad. Salad was great. But I've never had croutons that were soggy in the middle. Outer portion was crunchy but inside was gross! Cut into my BBBlt and there is a hair attached to one if the tomatoes. I sent the plate back and the waitress asks if I want a replacement. On the other side of the table a meal was dead cold. The waitress sends it back to the kitchen.  We all finally get our food back and enjoy as best we could.  Side note: ranch is .95 per container!   Checks arrive. My meal was not comped. When I asked the waitress she said that they do not comp meals since I asked for a replacement. Wtf!   We went round and round. After getting the manager involved the meal was finally removed. But the waitress kept coming over to tell me why she couldn't comp it! She said I was committing fraud since I requested a replacement sand which.   All in all...we won't be back and if you hair in your food...well you are paying for a replacement sand which.

kA-4M-jJe1H6Eq5UuFQ5mA.text: Definitely not for the weak stomach, or faint of heart, and most DEFINITELY those on a diet.  The portions are HUGE! And what's even better, it tastes amazing. Friendly service and great food, who can ask for more...well maybe ask for a doggy bag because you won't be able to finish what is in front of you.  Great for breakfast, and probably great for lunch and dinner.  Husband had the sated fried chicken and waffles.  WOW, a work of art...and who would have thought that fried leeks could taste better than onion rings?!?!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash browns...real shredded corned beef
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage fried chicken and waffles

9uH0EzYyJY4xkK1Cu4BIKA.text: I love this place. I normally go to the one I'm San Diego Ca, so I was pleased to see this one in Vegas. Never a bad time here, the food is GREAT, portions are huge, and the drinks are delicious.   I always get the Sage fried Benedict when I go there , it is a meal fit for. Queen.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage fried chicken Benedict delicious.  This place never disappoints.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s 12 o&#39;clock somewhere.

fnyj9-6m3e30U2uS5DeZ_Q.text: Love hash house a go go.  Creative and delicious menu.  We have never had a bad choice.  One of my favorite things are the Fried Green Tomatoes.  Unfortunately they are seasonal.  If you are lucky enough to get them they are big and juicy stacked on top of a big chunk of watermelon.  They also come with a delicious sauce.  The quesadilla is huge, I can't believe they found a plate to fit it on!  Not your typical quesadilla, it comes on a bed of mashed potatoes.  If you have a car or are staying downtown try out this location.  There is not a huge wait like the one on the strip always has.  If you want to experience the full menu come between breakfast and dinner.  The menu late at night is limited although still good.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast. Andys sage fried chicken and the special of the day!

VwzZ9lOFreMALQgPwJ2eKA.text: This place is amazing. I guess I'll start off by saying: I have a huge sweet tooth. So, it was only natural that I order the Snickers pancake and a spiked kiwi watermelon lemonade. Ah.Maze.Ing. oh my gosh. The pancake was huge--it took up the entire plate. The lemonade was so tasty, sweet, delicious, and came with a huge slice of watermelon. Service was a little slow (I was out of water for several minutes) but the food was so good, I kind of didn't care.

ePWQ2IM6klZ5y4cbbXqecQ.text: Over rated.  Food was average overpriced 3 dollars for a cup of average coffee. Service was very good that was the only plus here. Don't waste your time here

bKQr55Kt_5Amc4h65mQA4w.text: As good as the Hash House at the Imperial Palace/Quad/LinQ whatever it's called now.   Actually, this one is slightly better because when we came there was absolutely no wait for a table. I think it was a Monday though so that may have helped as well.   Food was consistent, just like I remembered, and service was good. It's a bit out of the way from The Strip but worth a try if you want to get away from the usual crowds of people.

kVJjEDCOX6mLxZ_8k7kEGg.text: This place is awesome. Husband and I tried to go to the Strip location but it was an hour long wait (no thanks), so we hopped on the bus and tried Downtown since we were headed there anyway. Walked straight in and got a table, and we had finished our meals within about 20 minutes! Which is not to say they were bad meals, quite the opposite.   I had the sundried tomato/goats cheese/basil scramble which tasted great and fresh, and came with a side of potatoes and a biscuit. The size of the meal actually wasn't huge, which I actually prefer as the size of meals in the US can be a little scary for a foreigner!  I saw the flapjacks on another table, they were MASSIVE and didn't look overly appetising. I think the hashes and scrambles are the way to go here.  Service was good and attentive.

szREaH-vXNF7vVIJt7Jowg.text: *** Pros *** * No wait, walked right in * Acknowledged, seated right away - drinks served quickly * Delicious breakfast! I had the HH Original benedict with long strips of bacon, fresh slices of tomato, plenty of biscuits, 2 beautifully poached eggs, a gorgeous red sauce (creamy pepper), garnished with a sprig of rosemary, slice of orange and pineapple.  *** Cons *** * This HH is located in The Plaza, a very old hotel/casino near Fremont Street

MMm6XGrpwUYG43vn5Oi_7g.text: You absolutely must try this place. It is delicious. The portions are huge - one plate will be big enough for two people to split. Even their drinks are enormous! Servers were fast, attentive, helpful, and friendly. Fun place. Wait time is around 20 minutes. Would love to come again.

pBultW5kFKrk-RD8pw3vrg.text: I freaking love the hash house. Since it's so epic, we'll usually go here for "epic" occasions. Our most recent visit was on my BFs 30th for brunch. What a great choice! Our whole group was impressed and in awe over the huge and yummy selections. I am now a fried chicken and waffle fan. Seriously, their sage fried chicken is like OMG the best friend chicken I have ever had. Dreaming about that...

EdptaTphNsy-fd-ZkQiJOw.text: First, PORTIONS ARE HUGE!  Second, PORTIONS ARE HUGE!  I say that because I read the reviews on here and saw that they had big portions, but my wife and I still ordered separate meals (I'm a big eater and usually eat mine plus whatever she doesn't eat of hers).  Here, we could have shared a meal and still needed a box.  Food and service were great!  I don't know how they think up these crazy concoctions, but they are delicious.  HHaGG is now a must on every future trip to Vegas!

BdOP72NTUxPvu2i9C85GSQ.text: Omg if this isn't the most delicious place to eat ever. We stayed on Fremont street and wanted to try something new. There was no wait and the food was awesome. HUGE size portions for a reasonable price. We went for dinner and back the next morning for breakfast. Everything is good here and their potatoes are to die for! Drinks are a reasonable price too!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Worlds biggest pancake! So good! Couldn&#39;t finish it!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge avocado burger and cheese covered potatoes! Only $12!

5RO4O1OZNl6n_QpbDlOS-g.text: Water!! The basic need for a human. What does it mean for your waiter to not serve you water for more than half hour? It's the middle of summer!!! It's HOT. Could it be that he doesn't like you? Could it be that when you walked in with your girlfriend, who happens to be Caucasian, and you are brown that he didn't like that? It feels like it. Other tables received water. Tables around you that were seated AFTER you. The table NEXT to you got  a beverage. But your table didn't get WATER. He came twice. Once to ask if you wanted drinks. The second to take the order. Yes, we wanted water both times. Did we have to get up and try to flag you down? No!! You passed us numerous times. Didn't even look our direction. In this day and age, you shouldn't have to worry about being denied service because of your ethnicity, skin tone, or anything else for that matter. This sure feels like it. It's sad.   Sad. I reached out to corporate. Wrote them basically the same thing. No response. Wouldn't you want to address this? Seems that this establishment needs some work on customer relations. I'll be certain to pass this along to those I know.

wK2swni0lpFCo0i140HoCw.text: Very good place to eat. Portions are huge.  Prompt and professional service. There was a wait for a table but thankfully this location is in a casino so we were able to pass the time fairly quickly. Will definitely go back here for breakfast on my next trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast breakfast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6r5qux3VmyYl0TbHQ1J6Bw.text: I've been here a couple times already and am finally writing a review.   The first time I came here with a group of friends, they didnt have a big table for our party of 10. So we had to split up and sit separately.   Recently, I came here around 4am and the place was half filled. There was no wait to be seated and there was probably a 10 minute wait for the food.   I always get the Sage Fried Chicken & Waffles ($18) which is basically fried chicken and waffles. The fried chicken was really crispy and good...just wished it had more flavor. The waffles were not fluffy at all. They seem to break apart quite easily. And they were crumbly when you cut them into pieces. The waffles weren't soft and smooth. Other than that, I really enjoy their breakfast selections here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dQ6ERnZy1F06XCWa5yHa_w.text: Visiting from Seattle, came here because of Man vs Food. The service was outstanding, but the food didn't live up to the expectations set forth by the show and the community.  You should definitely come if you like large portions and want a unique experience in dining. The quality was also quite high, although I feel like their fried chicken was made with too much breading.   Overall, would come back.

sWS0EJhGFqI80F4vKumhbA.text: So, here's an update to a review I made on this place a few years back. We were in Vegas again and decided to have brunch at the hash house because our previous experience was a great one. This wasn't the case this time around. The service was absolutely horrendous. I think the server kept forgetting items (5-6 times) and chalking it up to "they're working on it now." From when we finally received the bill to when we walked out was 32 minutes. No bueno.   Overall the food remains to be pretty decent, but unless I have a random 2 hours to kill, we probably won't be back, at least to the Linq location. One and a half thumbs down... happy eating!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon burger... &#34;That&#39;s a HUGE BITCH!&#34;
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tractor combo with French toast!

N3uJLeEEAoOOEXcs4ETDaQ.text: Yum!  We went to this location while on vacation and the food definitely held up to expectations.   The atmosphere was great with appropriate decor and there were not tables crammed in everywhere, which added to the feeling that you weren't smooshed in.   The hostess and server were awesome and super friendly. The meal itself moved along at a leisurely pace and we didn't feel rushed.   We all had some form of scramble and potatoes. There wasn't a clean plate to be seen.   Well worth the stop if you are down on Fremont.

EE3Gxxu4NMAMZPtekdnzwQ.text: This is located right at the entrance into the Plaza Hotel where I was staying. So when I walked in, read the name realized that "hey I saw this place on Man VS Food" which kinda made me happy because I always wanted to try out one of the places Adam visited.   We got seated right away, and as I walked to my table I looked at other dinners food and wow, the portions were HUGE! LIKE everything was baby size HUGE. Kind of intimidating. The decor was cute, I liked it. I ended up ordering the basic breakfast, which comes with eggs, sussage, crispy potatoes, fruit and biscuit. I ordered that because I did not want a huge portion. And I was right to order it because though it was a medium size breakfast I hardly finished it. The eggs a were good, the biscuit was very delicious and moist and I loved loved the sussage! It was so juicy and flavourful, the potatoes were really good too. Overall I enjoyed my food. Def give this place a try.   Make sure you share you plate because it serves at least 2-3 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food!!

wb1-Tx8kf9ZFo2avAidgGA.text: Been wanting to try this place for a long time. Glad one came to downtown. It was my last meal before departing back home. Got a table for 1 and was seated right away. It was breakfast time so not very busy. As I walked to my booth I noticed how large the portions were. Especially the pancakes. Wow. Like 12-14". I had heard so much about the Chicken n waffles that my mind was pretty much made up before I sat down. I did take the time to look over the menu. Lots of variety and definitely plan on a return trip to sample other items. The Chicken n waffles come out and boy what a plate of food. The couple across the way looked and started to laugh at how large the portion was. Easily could share with a 2nd persons and maybe even a 3rd. Chicken was seasoned and breaded perfectly. The four waffles infused with bacon were like desert. Salty with a little bit of sweet. I was only able to eat one piece of chicken and one waffle. So that means one piece of chicken and three waffles made it to the airport to finish on the plane. Much better than peanuts and Fritos.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No caption needed
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Pj2OvLfBu2kHhR3ozaXSvQ.text: The presentation of the food was amazing. The portions are insanely large that nobody was able to finish a full entree themselves. The food was pretty good. We ordered very unique dishes that had the option to be good or bad, but they did a great job! I would definitely go again to try another dish from the expansive menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u_6FGH0ZhVA62PsX-15XwA.text: I signed up to follow Hash House's Facebook page and was able to score a BOGO coupon. And even though it was right on a holiday when we went for lunch with my boyfriend and the coupons are not valid on holidays, our waiter talked to the manager and they made an exception! I loved our experience here from the minute we stepped through the door. Be prepared to wait a little during lunch time, but the wait went by pretty quickly for us. Our waiter was super nice, and kept checking back to make sure we had everything we needed. I had the BBBLT which was huge!! My sandwich was served on nice fluffy milk bread. For my drink, I really enjoyed Hash House's Mango Pineapple white wine spritzer. It was very refreshing on a hot day. My boyfriend enjoyed his downsized burger, which was just one patty of certified angus beef, and he was able to finish it. We will definitely be back to this exceptional place on our next trip to Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My BBBLT garnished with rosemary and served with fries.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My refreshing Mango Pineapple white wine spritzer.

JpRWRKwRi5QFb2jse4LmpQ.text: Best crab cake with biscuits and eggs and mash potatoes. Located by Fremont St. Definitely a great brunch spot, last minute.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake with mash potatoes, and biscuits
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

CqwI6UQNvLsIswyEdOt0GQ.text: A lot of food but mouthwatering every bite ! Worth every dollar  . The Bloody Mary was a meal in itself. I skipped eating dinner and would go back and highly recommend this place to everyone !

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak

MEuomVtCApo84dCzCLMORA.text: Quick walk from our stay at the California hotel. We arrived around 7am, seated immediately, greeted by our waitress quickly who got our coffee set up quickly, yeah! My husband ordered the traditional french toast with side order bacon. I ordered a large oatmeal which came with fresh fruits. The orders were HUGE. He wasn't able to finish. I got through all my oatmeal (comes with brown sugar and milk) but couldn't finish all my fruit (honeydew melon, cantaloupe, strawberries, blueberries, black berry, mango and oranges)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oatmeal with fruits
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side order bacon
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional french toast

dDmLv2D2ZCvm6TwisFPB0w.text: This place is a legend so I had to try it. Known for their large portions and fun meals. I was trying to be healthy so I ordered the Cobb salad which is low carb. The salad had a beautiful presentation, but tasted awful. The salad was drenched with salad dressing, I mean sopping. So much that the lettuce was soggy. The chicken on the salad was so salty that I couldn't even eat it. It was almost inedible. Definitely the worst Cobb salad I've ever had. Major disappointment. Definitely quantity and not quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb salad

fEDBq7NecoPJ7Jqv6c0t6Q.text: Big food....yummy food...do yourself a favor and SHARE!!! The porkchop sandwich was the star! Even though they don't have gluten free options my son also loved his double bacon burger...minus the bun....plenty of meat and toppings!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porkchop sandwich and double bacon burger

VR0h8Jxji896jc1kTHR3EQ.text: Had high hopes but my burger was drier than a bums lips in the Las Vegas desert. Over priced and not worth the hype.

c7IV4nwX4P966UH2tu6gkA.text: I've got to be honest I was very unimpressed with Hash House A Go Go. We were here dropping my mother in law at a pickle ball event and thought hey let's get breakfast. My wife had eggs that were barely cooked and we had to send them back it didn't even look safe to eat. I ordered a Nashville chicken sandwich and it was the hottest thing ever. It was so spicy it was almost inedible. I understand any thing Nashville hot should be spicy but this wasn't the usual spice. This tasted like ghost chilies or worse. I've heard many good things about this restaurant but sadly today was not their day.

UR2xK0HcYJkmnaQ_QZZqqQ.text: The food is delicious, and the portions are HUGE. The service could probably be better, but this is also a very busy restaurant, so staff can't really be too friendly. Just a liiiittle bit pricey, but for the quality and quantity of food, I'd say it's worth it!  My only regret is that our hotel didn't have microwaves, since I was probably only able to finish half of my meal at the time.  :c

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Texas Ranchero
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

boCiKNh9_FiPlCiV4KSNSg.text: I continue to be impressed with this franchise. We had the bacon cheese burger with fries and a mixed green salad and wings. Burger was cooked to perfection, hot as were the fries with a great flavor to the meat. The wings were nice and meaty and the portions were plentiful.  Oh, can't forget the bacon soaked in maple appetizer...party in our mouth...wished they opened earlier then 3 pm is my only gripe..

L3FDx3y7Ku_6zEkylg3lHg.text: I mean it's okay... been there twice, bad service. Portions are HUGE so feel free to save and share but you won't be BLOWN away, it's more of a fad thing

J6jMZVIpB2LUqh0IBmG-fw.text: This is my favorite place to have breakfast in Vegas. The buffets are too expensive especially since I cannot possibly eat that much food. At Hash House you get super large portions and freshly made. The service is exceptional and the atmosphere is all Vegas!!! You might get lucky and see someone famous as well. The only negative is they do not participate in the app Nowait. This should be a place you should have breakfast when in Vegas!

R7_7jaDUFDgbB8BVDaoa7w.text: When visiting Fremont, you really should have breakfast here.  The portions are huge. The menu hilarious and varied.  We had a group of 5 of us, they told us it would be a 45 minute wait. They got us in within 20 minutes.  (You give them you cell number and they text you when your table is ready)   If you're a midwesterner at heart and want your beloved monster size pork tenderloin- you will find it here.   They service is a little slow for your food but they aim to please. We had a birthday boy with us and they baked him a fudge cake while waited. Exceeded service expectations!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big fudge cake.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork tendeloin
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken and eggs.

7Y5Q7NXY7eMT_ZwpiKzixQ.text: This is exactly the right place to go for a Vegas hangover cure for breakfast or lunch... Barely has a wait, staff was friendly and attentive (brought that Bloody Mary super fast!) and within just a few minutes after a drink and some delicious hash, I was back to feeling normal - relatively normal anyway, I mean it is Vegas.

V-gP9l3Zc8txvckEBGmQxg.text: I would pass on this place.  The hash was not good by any stretch! They shouldn't name their place after a dish they don't know how to make!    To critique the dish that I cannot remember the name of: The potato's in a hash are not mean to be so large they taste like a plain steamed potato by the time you're getting to the middle. They needed to be cut about a quarter of the size they were when they were served. I did end up having to cut them and eat them with the other foods on the plate and the flavor was very bland. The biscuit was very dry and hard.   There was nothing special about what I ate at this place.

Hd9tyw3e6metEl-mayCtTw.text: This possibly the worst experience I have EVER had. We were a party of 5 and we were told 30 min wait. Looking inside there was plenty of table tops open they could have easily pushed together to accommodate but I didn't push it. 30 min went by and still no seat. They said they are clearing the table now and it would be 10 more min. Now 15 minuets go by and they are still working on cleaning the table. I told them to forget it and they just looked at me with blank stares. No apologies, no let's make this right it up as just "whatever". Also notice the party of 6 that put their name in after us were seated and already had their drinks. WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!!!! They don't even deserve 1 star

kqJiI14fS6qaaSgPjsesZw.text: Great service and wonderful food! Our drinks were strong and our food was on point... Trust me when I say split a meal! Meals are outrageously large... Great spot to eat!!!

aoKFXHTlOzT18v7ImzaZsg.text: I went there on vacation and the service was great, wait time was minimal even when they were busy and the food was great, especially the fries.

Ca2n32v4q-h3SFzOavjjdQ.text: Always busy!  Great food!  Their burgers are huge,  all their plates are really platters.  The chicken and waffles are a must!  Trying Andy's Special today with a side of gravy for my biscuit.  This is comfort food all the way!   Yummo!

pG7QQgmYIQjGnXYwt5wFVA.text: I've actually been wanting to try Hash House A Go Go for years now, having first read about it probably a decade ago. We didn't quite make it on the last trip, so this time I was determined.  Our first attempt to hit the restaurant failed miserably, as we attempted to eat at the location on the strip around lunchtime and the wait was well over an hour. A few days later, we stopped by the location inside the Plaza on Freemont and the wait was a reasonable 15 minutes. (As an aside, I love the system they have. As soon as you put your name down, you get a text saying you're in the system. And then when your table is ready, you get another text. It's amazing.)  Obviously, I just had to order a hash, so I went with the Corned Beef ("Corned Beef, red onions and swiss cheese"). It arrived pretty quickly and it was enormous. The tender meat was slathered in cheese and onions and was, of course, quite irresistible, while the two sunny-side-up eggs were cooked perfectly. The dish was also accompanied by a soft-baseball-sized biscuit and a cup of homemade peach jam. (That jam is amazing, by the way. It basically tastes like a peach pie in jam form.)  My only real complain here is that the food was not hot when it arrived to the table. It had clearly been sitting under a heating lamp for a few minutes and that's a shame.

rXepUDRRReuOtY93qmpRZA.text: Service is always on point. You always feel like you're their only customer. We got there early, so there was no wait. Be warned that the portions are huge!!! Way too much for one person to eat and you almost feel like you're wasting food. You, of course, can bag up the leftovers but if you're staying downtown what are the chances of you having a fridge or a microwave to warm it up. The bloody Mary's are to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. breakfast

nOKk3PeoG-qjms2UNHaS7A.text: Great food!! And amazing service!! I will be coming back again, so many different items to try!

yQprYH1-XEocZeDogwca2A.text: I have never had a bad meal here.  I've had a hash scramble, the chicken n waffles, basic breakfast, and an omelette.    Never disappointed.  Most meals are just under $20.

LSJrlp5vXOwmjj14Cvs1hA.text: Had Margie's Crab Benedict and man it was good. The portions at this place are extremely large! This picture does no justice to the size of this dish. I'd say one plate is definitely shareable between two people. The flavor was terrific! There was something really comforting and homey about this dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n63hk0yQjHe1MFKrJ_VLxQ.text: Good place to blow $15 on a tasteless and disgustingly large pancake full of sad little dried out blueberries. If you request real maple syrup, they will say yes and then bring you artificially flavored and colored corn syrup anyway.

Lq0TE-8-TaPRLr3vRy04_Q.text: FREAKING AWESOME!!!! We're from the Midwest, but the size, the flavor, EVERYTHING was crazy perfect. ONLY ORDER ONE DISH PER 2 PEOPLE. It's that much food. Try the meatloaf. Prices are super cheap. Especially for a casino. Don't waste your money eating anywhere else. Make sure you take time to read through ALL the menu, that'll fill you up on it's own.

YFzagvAv9GgI5hX1bMCvAQ.text: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day and Hash House A Go Go gives you a huge heavy portion of food that will last you for the rest of the day. I have been here a couple of times and it is definitely one of the better breakfast/brunch spots. My boyfriends and I were staying in LV with some of our friends and we were really hungry. I put our name down for 8 people and they quoted us 45 minutes. Honestly, totally expected for the time that we arrived. Luckily they ended up calling us  in 20 mins.  They ended up putting us at 2 separate booths of 4. We didn't request this, but I guess they were trying to accommodate us as quickly as possible. The server took a long time to come to us, but once she was at our table she was very nice and attentive. We ordered a round of mimosas and my boyfriend and I split a Ground Turkey Hash Brown entree that came with smoked bacon, onion and smoked mozzarella. It also comes with crispy potatoes and topped with 2 eggs and served with fruit and a biscuit. Oh man, thank god we split this. It was WAY too much food. Both me and my boyfriend could not finish it, we even gave part of it to our friends because their food was actually a really small portion.  Overall, it was a pretty good experience and I would be back here again if we were in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo hash

oiSIpao3OmANj1NOK0ZW8Q.text: A gem in downtown, try it!   I know there are more than a few of these places around. We've been to two in Vegas through different trips and it doesn't fail to delivery quality, real, homemade style food. Portions are insanely big and the off kilter take on hometown, scratch food is just right. Waffles and chicken are a no-brainer to order but you can't go wrong with anything. Heck, the crab cake is on par and this is a hometown food place in The Plaza; they're doing it right. Salads are huge, ingredients fresh and dressings yummy. Go ham on the whole menu, don't think you can go wrong.

KAvZZ0psi_cJvuxZKFobZA.text: This is the worst service I've had in forever they seat us and then when we are ready to order our server forgets about us so I had to go get someone to take our order. Then new waiter is  nice but it is very slow.

T17AIzb3UTaFL_Wmj08J8A.text: My first time here! I was really excited to try it, since i've heard nothing but great things!  First of all the service was EH, she forgot my boyfriend's beer, messed up his food order, she never came back to see how we were doing after we received our food, never refilled our waters, and never put a smile on her face. She was not friendly at all. Ruined the experience a bit.   When the food came out, it was huge! Everything had potatoes, and a huge mound of them! Out of the 4 of us not a single person finished them. Felt bad for wasting all the food. Looking at everyone else's plates around the restaurant, theirs were full too, super wasteful :(   I also didn't get the colored spaghetti noodles sticking in everyone's food? I bit into one of them on accident, yuck!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Machaca hash
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Benedict

DpZi4kM9V154HFIGKXKqCg.text: I have always known this place to be a good spot for a breakfast/brunch. The portions are big and the food has always been consistent. They get busy on the weekends.  Located inside the plaza hotel in downtown Las Vegas, it is in a great location.

2PzfK8WLRZ7mqL5VXpTaGA.text: Great food! Amazing Bloody Mary's! Huge portions. Nice atmosphere. Decent price. A very good hangover location :)

j8UsXQ4_fZGKyWnIEAQ4lQ.text: Came in a few weeks ago with my sister... the food is amazing!! The portions are huge and again the food is fantastic!!  Well worth having to deal with downtown! The parking at the Plaza is kind of crappy, but that has nothing to do with the restaurant! (just a tip: if you drive a truck, you may want to consider using valet. we didn't and the parking garage is really tight). I will definitely be back, great place to eat, fast service, and great quality food!

aDbEfSvBaVa00woC4QS80w.text: Wow !! The Sage Fried Chix Benedict dish was ORGASMIC !! Huge and I ate the whole thing ( Never ate the rest of the day) Every bite uncovered bacon or eggs or a biscuit, this is a close to glutanny as one could get and walk away unscathed !! This dish was a work of art and the chef a rockstar in my mind, wish I took a photo of it !! I will return and you should too !! Plaza charges 5 bucks to park but get the tix validated and the main casino cage gives you your 5 spot back !! "Nuff said !!!

x3U7hGBknevuWzSAY_TPOA.text: Went there twice.  First for breakfast.  We heard about the portion sizes so we shared a corned beef hash and eggs (with lots of other stuff).  It was more than enough. Then we went with friends, for dinner. One person ordered the meat loaf... it was enough for at least two hungry people. One person ordered the chicken pot pie (at which point the server asked "Do you know how big that is!?)... actually it was enough for all four of us! My wife and I ordered a small side salad (to share), and a hamburger (to share).  The salad was just right, and the hamburger was enough for three people. I quickly came to the realization that a family of 4 (or 5 if the kids are small) could eat cheaper than at McDonald's... $14.99 for the chicken pot pie. I found the overall quality of food to be average, but the quantity enormous. One other thing... As a senior citizen, I have yet to buy in to what the younger people are doing to themselves.  A server in restaurant with tattoos and metal things sticking through noses, eyebrows, tongue, etc., is not an appetizing sight, in fact it's an appetite depressant.

LJn5Wa5BLY45LsKuM_6otQ.text: Great food and service every time!  Was sad that they closed the M location but glad they will have a new location opening soon in Henderson.  The Bread Pudding is the best. Save room for that! Looking forward to eating here again soon.

DDC7WF90SWFauJ1CihJI8A.text: So good dont know why others are hating on it was so tasty and huge portions!

R5Q9ENluRbx7kB5Rt4JtEw.text: OK place with big portions.  The wait staff is crap...must be the management teaching them how to be crappy...or trying to make more of a buck.  The food comes in high quantity...but not quality.  I can do without the mashed potatoes, biscuits, and iceberg lettuce.  My Cobb salad was kinda smallish.  No butter for the biscuits.  No sweet-n-low.  I've been to the original in San Diego and it was really good there.  Something must be up with management or something here.  We ate here twice...but will look elsewhere.   In the hotel.  We were warned of a wait at certain times.

NUjOX0PiAD0x0PDxmYzuXg.text: Great food! Ate here because it was conveniently located in the Plaza Hotel. Had the Chicken fried steak, yum! Big portions, nice presentations, average prices for a hotel restaurant $9-$15 average for breakfast. We had a coupon, score! No complaints

gR4A-ni6wgDT4itQ8lkh8w.text: Like this place! Great food,huge portions and great customer service! If your really hungry this I the place to go!

vYpA_WyW5FIByDae2FRlKQ.text: It really is THAT good. Size of portions are huge, do split them. Great service, I believe his name was John, very friendlyand knowledgable.

5CqHQtJb5C13CxKnX9KUXw.text: I want to eat souch more and to try everything at this lovely find which markets itself as twisted farm food. I had the tractor pull: one massive apple cinnamon pancake, eggs and bacon. It was superb. The pancake was crisp on the outside andoist on the inside. The bacon actually tasted like pork, not just salt.  My friend tried the fried chicken with waffeks and ate souch that he felt uncomfortable for like an hour after.  The wait was long to get in, but breakfast well done is a rare treat, so I'll say its worth it.

AHEO-U0Ccu7W3qPpQJDBFQ.text: Went here once for breakfast and again for dinner the next day.  Breakfast was great and as many other have mentioned, the portions were huge. Where this restaurant took a turn for the worse was dinner.  After the great corned beef hash, I had high expectations for the pork tenderloin.  When it came out it was a total wtf moment.  Everything the menu said came with the dinner was there; except it was sandwiched between two huge pieces of pork; A huge mash potatoes, cheese, veggie, mushroom pork-bun sandwich.  I don't get it but whatever, let's give it a try.  To my disappointment it couldn't hold a candle to the hash but to my horror I spent the next seven hours vomiting uncontrollable while I lost what I'm guessing was several feet of intestine and my dignity in the other direction as I fought two friend I had dinner with (ordered a different dish then I) for toilet time because they were violent ill as well.  You know the old adage about what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas...along with the lining of my stomach and my ability to establish eye contact with my friends.

OkIl4fCIUoZtQiVU3B3Zvg.text: Great food, good prices and LOTS of it. Had pork and the chicken and waffles (you have to do that if you visit here). Be prepared for huge amounts of goodness. Good service too. Located inside the Plaza Hotel on Fremont and Main. Open way late.

GF4euULzZXrN5iN6CDUz4A.text: I was so impressed when my food came out that i had to take a picture, which i normally never do. I orded the original benedict, but i also got to get a glimps of the adjacent tables food. All of the plates were huge and reasonably priced. The plating was impressive and a little fancy for just a breakfast plate. The benedict was unorthdox with tomatoe cream sauce but so good. If i lived near this place this would be one of my goto places and will repeat visit everytime im here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Benedict. Mashed potatoes with homemade biscuits smoked bacon poached eggs and unique tomato cream sauce

8lGdHvfZJ9ua3VWzLaqD2g.text: I wish I could get in the door to review the food but I do not like waiting and there is always a long wait. at least 30 minutes.   One day though, I'll get my foot in the door. and the food better be good

m8dDl0n8LjGi1vu_UmVWgw.text: Firstly let me say we love Hash House, we have been to almost all of their locations in Vegas. All of them have been five star experiences and I would have given this one the same except for the obnoxious odor proliferating through the casino hotel it is located. We valet parked and had to walk through the casino to get to Hash House. The only way I can describe it is that it smells like the worst, most overpowering, perfume that my 70 year old substitute teacher would wear back in the 3rd grade (and if I can remember that smell from 20 + years ago you know it was bad). You know the kind that would give you an instant migraine. That is not Hash House A Go Go's fault but the smell is there and makes it hard for this one to be as appetizing as the rest. The food was as good as usual, but ugh the smell. The food gets the four stars. If you want to try Hash House I would try one of their other locations, at least until they change the scent in the Plaza.

LYi8HWYLfLoOSpQNuXD0QQ.text: Horrible Horrible Horrible customer service.  Went there with my wife on March 13, 2016 at 1:30 PM.  Waiting a half hour to be seated (no problem) and then the host sat us down.  We wait another 30 minutes to be greeted by our waiter or waitress.  Never happened.  I informed the host that we hadn't been helped yet and he informed me that this was not his job.  In disbelief I actually waited another 10 minutes, to still no avail.  I fist bumped the host on the way out, told him thanks for the great customer service and then went to a real restaurant where they are happy to have you in their restaurant.  If you're a guest and are hungry, avoid this place.  If you're a manager of the restaurant, fire them all.

csgftqU6QuS6OfwLh1MxGw.text: Always have liked this place... Portions are HUGE! Each plate had a tree of rosemary skewering it. The honey buttermilk busicuits are to die for. My friends said their pot pie was a little bland... But it came with a huge hat shaped pie crust and that mostly made up for it.

doNXK2mEYu52dbVm5O0oyA.text: Big portions decent service but food was only ok tasting and pricy if had better for less

h5Vwj0l60IubRplSXw5UFg.text: this past year i tried both this hash house in the plaza and the one on sahara.....idk maybe cause it was the first time....but the sage chicken i had at the plaza..... OMG it was sooooooo delicious!! i could not stop eating it and i wanted to personally go back to the kitchen and congrat the chef....it was unbelievably good!  the second visit to hash house was at the one on sahara....it was also good but idk the one in the plaza tasted better to me for some reason.

fA3Oc_UXP8ooSoQeEsNyQQ.text: Had Andys famous sage chicken. Huge meal. Very good. Wife had one of the hash meals. Also huge serving. No complaints about this place.

NX-TX4DFKTNsN_-RZEs8pA.text: We went out of our way to try this place, and I felt really disappointed. My biggest complaint was our server Rick. From the second we sat down to the time we left, out experience was completely frustrating. When I asked if the chili sauce on the Crab Cake Benedict was spicy, he put his hands up and said "I don't give my opinion, last time it back-fired". I have never experienced that from a server and we asked if he could bring a side of the sauce to try. He seemed bothered by the request, but brought the sample. It was spicy! I ordered another item and asked for an Orange Juice and Coffee, but forgot both items. I finally got my coffee after I was done with the meal, but we had to leave since we had been there such a long time. The food wasn't anything special and the wait to get in was ridiculously long.

hJm8Xg4sVV8gwWeB3spWdw.text: My favorite go to place for breakfast. Portions are huge, can be shared among two to three people. Pancakes are awesome. Andy fried chicken is by far the best dish I've had there.

rCfxezPHKmzKzXuWkWhbSQ.text: Super nice and accommodating staff. Yummy food and huge portions (I should have shared my plate). I got bfast bacon scramble with grilled mashed potatoes. The biscuits and strawberry jam are homemade, best biscuit I've EVER had.

cXUYE9aF-IdTZqqrV9x1Jw.text: The smoked salmon hash was inedible it tasted and looked like old fish. Waiter never asked why I never touched my food  Disappointed. The rest of the group loved their food.

ykrSTai10YKOR-bMzQj1Hw.text: I've heard a lot about this place so I decided to give it a chance while I was in Vegas. We went in and waited about 15 min to be seated. Finally got in, and we were attended quickly. The menu was a bit overwhelming, but I was able to narrow down what I wanted. It was about noon so they were serving breakfast and brunch. I ordered biscuits and gravy, and my boyfriend ordered the hammered tenderloin pork sandwich. The portions are HUGE (I took a pic). I also ordered a mimosa and it was delish. It was good food, but nothing to boast about. Maybe I need to try something else but it can be overwhelming because it's a lot of food. It was worth the wait, and I would go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hammered tenderloin pork sandwich and biscuits and gravy

jbuvqtGChw6yCFj0NRdutg.text: Very disappointed, overpriced, eggs undercooked, steak overcooked, service deplorable. Snotty front counter person and table very dirty. Save yourself the dissatisfaction and go somewhere else

O2-7ttPHcyT0PD7kVUetUw.text: I've been here the last two times I was in Vegas and the food is consistently excellent. Lots of options in the menu. Beware that portions are out of control so save your appetite. I would recommend making reservations as it is always crowded. Highly recommended!!!!

uDf1xM8e9BzwtDwN6rb7IQ.text: I forget what our dish was called but it was the combo breakfast with banana French toast. The portion was large but not crazy large. But it did feed two people. It was really good. They serve the banana hot in the French toast and it's still in its peel which is good actually bc the banana didn't get brown or slimy during cooking heat. The eggs has some brown spots from overcooking in my opinion and the French toast was a little soft and either needed more egg or more heat or both. All that being said it was still a great meal. And we had 25% off a food purchase of $25 or more and our food was under $20 but with non alcoholic drinks it was $35 and the waitress took our coupon which made me happy.  Ambiance is ok. Plaza is kinda eh and the restaurant feels fairly chain-like but overall a good time and good meal. Great coffee drinks but we paid for it $$ at $7 and $8 a pop.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9NTpWYWUPamEVgFsoX2Xqw.text: Delicious food. Words can't express the flavors here!  Would come here over and over and try something new everytime. The portions are over the top. It really feeds 2 people. I hope people try this place.  The staff actually is very pleasant and helpful. They know their  menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cornbeef hash....
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uncle&#39;s Pancake
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s Sage Fried Chicken

ICrK1zgq8tjk7aqj7_6TSA.text: The food here is good but the portion sizes are grotesque. After seeing what was being brought out to other customers, my husband and I decided to split the Texas Ranchero and a side of fruit. We're both good eaters, and we got stuffed while still leaving easily 1/3rd of the order on the table. For one entree! The pancakes we saw being brought out were literally the size of a large pizza. It's so incredibly wasteful, both in terms of the amount of food that must be thrown out every day and that they're charging $16 for an entree that only a linebacker could attempt to finish. How about cutting it in half and charging $8 or $10?

r_xU9_kTKKWOVehermHF2A.text: The service was weak. The food too salty and the eggs slimy. The ice tea was so bad I sent it back. I'll never eat here again

xwczcfXffMNbfRFv70v40Q.text: This restaurant was recommended for breakfast, we went for dinner and everything was good except from my fork to my mouth. The service was awesome and the presentation of the food exciting, it is something you would see on Man vs Food. The portions are HUGE, enough to share with at least three people, if not more. I ordered the Benedict and it was easily a four people portion. I love a good eggs Benedict, but this dish was lacking and I could only eat a few bites. Pretty dry from the biscuits, to the chicken and bacon which was way over cooked. This place gets great reviews and has celebrity credibility, I'm sure it was just the fact we were there so late. The restaurant prides it's self in being "farm fresh". I'm going to tell you, it was not farm fresh quality and I wouldn't go back, nor recommend this diner joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge and gorgeous creation of the waffles and chicken.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benedict was great presentation, but dry and bland.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon sage chicken a good pick

cR_SoxUSnvB2QoAnbBVnQw.text: Portions was large and presented nice.  Food tasted ok imo.  The coffee tasted really good like Starbucks. I enjoyed that the most.  We ordered the chicken and waffles, the smoked salmon benadict and the regular breakfast with bacon and eggs.  Chicken and waffles - really looks bigger and better than it is.  try pull off all the breading and really look at the size of the chicken! The meat is soooooo small. I had better tasting chicken from the supermarket.   Smoked Salmon Benadict-  tasted ok but had only had small pieces of salmon and mostly had this mashed potato bedding.  The sauce tasted really good but that's because tasted like  was made of pure butter.  I was blowing gas out my a$$ all day- had to have been from this food.  Yikes!  The standard breakfast was the best out of the three. imo.  Overall,  this place felt like not clean.  The carpet was really dirty like nobody went sweep for days.  My whole family was sneezing from who knows what.  As soon as we left, they were ok.  I don't think we be back again...All show no go...

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon benadict. Sauce on the side.
