Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

SfCZ8j5UGdUyb50YXevAEw.text: The staff seemed like they didnt want to be there and the food was far from what i would call good quality. The meals are good value for money and you could definitely order 1 meal and share it (we took most of our food home in a takeaway container). We ordered the machacha scramble which was overly seasoned, and the andys sage fried chicken which was dry and bland. The venue is nice and they had the best coffee iv had since iv been in las vegas.

YwarmFTqlYk1AEptDlsbLA.text: As a local SD Hash House Patron .... it was Bobby? Who told us to try the Vegas spots.  This one in Freemont held up the service and food as the one in SD!  A huge huge shout out to Kenisha who made our large party feel at home and immediately made us feel like we were at the SD location!  Food is spot on as usual, but the extra added welcome from Kenisha made it all that more special!

hMY4_hymFPntt0YUcYM2vw.text: WOW!!!!  Super huge servings here!    DO NOT GET AN ORDER PER PERSON!!  Do family style dining, it'll be more filling that way.    I tried the Fried Eggs Benedict and the Slow Cooked Bar B Que Porked Ribs.  The benedict is a must there.  I mean it was on Man vs. Food!!!  There are so many ingredients in the dish..there's bacon, eggs, mashed potatoes, spinach, and chipotle sauce tops it off.  The ribs were cooked to perfection.  It was flavorful and came off the bone easily.  What I did not enjoy was the mashed potatoes that was over loaded with horse raddish which was almost like wasabi.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slow Cooked BBQ Ribs.

XlHivczGnPIXIsgOi-j-cQ.text: Nice portions, you need to split things. Very tasty & came out hot. Nice ambiance, inside Plaza Hotel downtown.

dAFGFPxjM03qG8mXxUMLkg.text: Chicken and Waffles for my wife and the Pancakes, sausage and eggs for me. Seriously the Chicken and Waffles would of been sufficient for both of us.  I wish someone would of told us about the large portions.  However the large portions and  ambiance of the food was fun. I recommend this place if you're and breakfast lover.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wRyydZWYFF8OwMCQyS9UIQ.text: Hash House A Go Go is my favorite spot for breakfast on Fremont.  The Bloody Marys are fantastic, and the meal portions are very large.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH BLT Mary

aOlm-FUG2tlw2fW5snwvXg.text: I like this location.  It's located right next to the dome entrance in the Plaza Hotel.  If they seat you near the entrance, you can see out onto the street.  Great people watching.  Not as impressive as a space upstairs that overlooks the Fremont Street Experience, but pretty good.  Also, you can get breakfast here anytime.  They will only serve the eggs scrambled after a certain time, even on a eggs benedict.  But still, if you want breakfast but didn't wake up until noon, its a good option.  Definitely try the chicken eggs benedict.  It comes over one of their fresh made biscuits. A little spicy and oh so yummy!  Yes, the portions are huge.  But guess what?  One person does not have to eat it all. To go boxes or sharing are both options.  And the best part?  Free wi-fi! Definitely a fan of that.

DBG6CE02buUIEPpS5RqdzA.text: It was my husbands birthday and he had been pestering me to bring him here so what the birthday boy wants, the birthday boy gets. It was pretty slow, it was a Tuesday night so there were only about 3 other tables occupied. We were seated quickly and our server came out right away.  The menu itself is not very big. For drinks we both decided on the mango iced tea. It was decent but I don't think I'd order it again. I decided to go with the bacon, avocado, cheddar burger, my three favorite ingredients combined, I couldn't resist. After asking for our more than helpful servers opinion, my husband decided to go with the kokomo. About 10-15 minutes later our orders came out, we were surprised to see the fairly large portions. My mouth was watering, longing to take that first bite. As soon as I sank my teeth into my burger I was let down. The burger was so bland, I couldn't taste any seasonings at all. It was a total let down, I couldn't eat half, I politely took the remainder of the burger home only to throw it away. The fries on the other hand were some of the best I've ever had.   I don't think I'll be stopping by again any time soon. Next time I think I'll try the breakfast to be on the safe side. We had great service and decent food minus the burger.

RL-UysUHokzrBKNKFKhAew.text: Holy crap!!!  Serving sizes are ridiculously huge! We had the sage chicken and waffles, and the chicken pot pie. Absolutely delicious, both dishes.  Our server, Alfie, was also very helpful and courteous... experience was awesome.

Z29gZH70V-RiPnn6GQmAVg.text: We are semi locals in Vegas and have eaten everywhere.  This is best place we have eaten in years.  Tons of food, no skimping on fresh ingredients, great menu with breakfast all day.  As an example, a side of mashed potatoes comes in a hugh dish, chock full of bacon pieces and other stuff, with full slices of bacon on top, whole thing buried under cheese toupe.  Prices reasonable.  highly recommend.  Have bottled beer and fancy drinks.  I suggest they add beer on tap. Wish they would open places in Los Angeles area.  Would be a hit.

nhdhDmH5VfJli5o_8NCHDw.text: Second time we have been to Hash House and they both have been delicious. Service was fast and nice. We enjoyed the fries chicken and waffles. So much food! I suggest splitting and getting a side salad to round out a shared meal.

-tcOhBrjeZJFoNfUnzKWtA.text: Think about splitting a plate. Orders are Huge.  Located inside of the Plaza hotel, this location is somewhat small. I can see how this place can easily get packed on a busy day. I even spied a rack of those waiting pagers restaurants give you along with a 45 minute wait time.  Luckily for us we were here on a Wednesday morning and we were immediately seated. My boyfriend & I ordered Andy's sage fried chicken wondering if it would be enough.   The dish was very attractive when it came to our table about 10 minutes later. Sage fried chicken with a maple reduction on top of bacon which was on top of mashed potatoes. There were 2 eggs and a biscuit on the side. It was served with jam & butter.  Everything was really tasty, but not to the point where we were thinking "Woah, we need to come back here the next time we're in town!". It was more like, "Cool. I've been wanting to try this place since I saw it featured on that show. Not bad.". Still, the price of one dish that could serve 2 people was not bad by Vegas standards.

JoN8FA1Sl0TdYoQnssS0XQ.text: I seriously can't complain about anything the food was as amazing as well as the service! I highly recommend the chicken with waffles. :)

adcxmepbIOq9-VTOMe3_Wg.text: My wife and I came here after a show on the Strip and drinks at the Fremont Experience and it was the perfect end to the evening, at least for me. We were both craving a snack and a cocktail waitress recommended Hash House. Funky decor and vibe to match the clientele. Apparently, we were sitting in the booth where Neil Patrick Harris ate. I didn't see his autograph, but my wife tells me it was there.  We just wanted a snack of some kind. I was disappointed in the small dessert menu, but I followed my wife's lead and got the biscuit and added the gravy. My wife suddenly took ill from a long night and we had to change our order to go. The waitress was awesome and by the time I came around with the car, my wife had paid the tab and was waiting for me.   When I returned to our room, I had my food and have to say that it is my new standard for biscuits and gravy: not too much goo and just the right amount of savory sausage. The biscuit was light and fluffy and I went to bed happy. Kudos.

hFm7saCcC9jsIrNSOVC4hg.text: This is our last day here in Las Vegas and I wish that I would have found this place sooner. This place is SOOO GOOD!!!! Great atmosphere, great waitress, fast service and the food is SOOO GOOD!!!! Try the banana brown sugar flap jack - the best! Reasonably priced and family friendly, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brown sugar, and banana pancake. To die for!!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom, artichoke, and spinach hash.

fzNcv1oLLH_MEg_KvpvLFw.text: *Note: Order what you definitely want as the serving is HUGE!!! If you can't eat HUGE servings...you can DEFINITELY share it as it can feed 2 people!  I love everything in the menu... it always give me a tough decision when ordering.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH Original
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smore&#39;s Mocha

IKfaI55TiVgf4QfxsMyipg.text: Awesome! Don't need to say anything else but go on an empty stomach. Third time here in 3 years. Can't wait til next year.place is clean staff are nice food is great

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I barely finished mine ..and makes 2 meals for my wife.and it tastes perfect

eCYJ8-A8P216hg4Ihcz5ag.text: My friend and I decided to give HHAGG yet another chance and this trip was the deciding factor I will never eat there again.   Service was HORRIBLE,  1. Waitress dragged her feet walking to the table, didn't even get greeted for at least 5 minutes, looked like she was still half asleep, didn't smile, NOO customer service at all.   2. Asked to start off with two waters, started to also ask for a Bloody Mary, she walked away before we could get the words out, even when we tried to grab her attention. (Fastest she moved all morning)   3. When she finally returned with waters I asked what types of vodkas she had, she didn't know, my date literally got up and walked to the bar to check it out, because waiting for her would have taken to long.    3. I asked for extra olives in my BLT Bloody Mary, was told no because there was no way to charge for it.... I didn't really think my request was to out of line but moving on.   4. Received my Bloody Mary, asked for worchestire sauce, she replied, ooo I don't know if I can get that.... Again... What?!?!?   5. Asked another server for worchestire sauce... Never came.   6. At one point the server said I'm sorry I worked until 1 last night and then was rescheduled at 8 this am. And while I understand that this situation sucks, I didn't make the schedule, or come to a place of business to receive slow, bad service. (She told all her tables this sob story)   7. My food came out cold. At this point I knew my date was already at wits end so I decided not to say anything else. But it wasn't even like sort of warm, it was cold.   8. When we mentioned our dissatisfaction to the manager he kind of seemed lost and confused. He did offer to comp two bloody Mary's (which we later had to have removed from the bill because our waitress charged us for them)   9. Our waitress never even came by to check if everything came out well after our food was delivered.   10. I unfortunately did not get the food runners name. But he was the ONLY part of this visit that was a positive experience, when he brought out the food he was happy energetic asked if we needed anything else, he also cleared our plates when we were finished. And I had asked him for the manager he actually came back to the table to tell me he notified the manager, and came back a second time to double check the manager came by. (With no disrespect, he was the African American food runner for the morning shift on 11/16/2013, he would make a great waiter)   Again, this was the last time I would eat at hash house, worst dining experience by far.

ZTdc22qtgSME39cpCNs1vg.text: One of my favorite places in Vegas- a must every visit. They give you a ton of food, and it is delicious. My favorite is the banana French toast!!!

8uvrO7bjHQSgrvuIEi8g_g.text: Monique was awesome, True definition of what a server was. Honest with her recommendation and definitely glad I asked! Those hostess could use a pep talk!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s safe fried chicken is the best if the best, still 75% left without a single crumb of room in my tummy!

mcicq3q15eChBGz7mjy3ZQ.text: Wow...Wow...Wow... I cannot say enough about Hash Hash. I ate at this location on 3 occasions during my recent trip and was never disappointed. Actually had the trifecta, breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The trucker breakfast plate is amazing, including the pancake that is bigger than your head. I had the Meatloaf sandwich and it was to die for. The sides are are also crazy big and outrageous. The mashed potatoes with bacon and cheddar could easily be a meal in itself. After our 1st meal we did figure out that one entree could easily be split among 2 people (with room to spare). When staying at the plaza the coupon book has a good deal in it. There are also discounts available on restaurant.com. After a couple hours of BJ I was also able to secure a comp meal for 3 here from the Pit Boss. Don't miss it and don't believe the haters. This place rocks!

CA8gYlcOOvkB9fn2PjLysw.text: The only reason I got food to go from here was to take care of a hangover. I've been to another Hash House on Sahara back when I lived in Vegas...still not impressed and disappointed. Today's plate was bland. Sausage was too soft when I bit in. Like undercooked and soft. Also I cannot understand how an establishment can't season their food. Put some damn flavor in there. I've gone to mom and pop diners with more flavor and delicious plates here. Only gimmick is cause Hash House has big portions. Whoopdeefreakindo.

P7VVNivFGqoiOnD_8p7_qQ.text: This review is based on a pick up order. Besides the long wait time (reason for 4 stars) while being transferred to the bar to place my order,  everything went well. The staff was friendly and efficient. The guy who took my order was patient with me and gave me suggestions. I was told the meal would be ready in 15 minutes and it took exactly that.  As I walked in my food was being brought out. Will definitely order from here again if he need arises.

PWcVaCaXv_BhlzBid6ZpgA.text: So I just may have had too high of hopes for this one, but Hash House A Go Go at the Plaza hotel in downtown LV was just okay.  We went in for brunch at around 10AM and there was no wait for 6 people. Our server was quick and answered all of our questions about the menu. Before we knew it our order was in and food was on the table. The huge plus about this place, besides the fast service, was the portions. You can easily share an entree between two people (and probably still have leftovers). Unfortunately the food did not wow me as I had hoped it would.  Hearing so much about the sage fried chicken and waffles I didn't even need to look at the menu to know what I wanted. Maybe the cook was having an off day or maybe this location was not the right one to try, but what arrived was less than noteworthy. The sage gave the chicken breading a unique flavor unfortunately once I cut into the chicken (which I believe was a boned thigh) all of the breading fell off the chicken making it a big skin, syrup, mess with flavorless chicken. The waffles had strips of actual bacon in them which would have been pretty awesome if the bacon was cooked a bit more.  Nothing really memorable here and no raves from our group.  Next time I'm in Vegas I might go back, to try something else at a different location.  Pros: Quick and helpful service, huge portions, decently priced. Cons: The food.

98rdx8fqjTRLekwgRi3YSg.text: Food was amazing and so was the service! Large portions at a great price. I still have 2 more days left in Vegas but I'm betting that this will have been the best meal experience for the whole trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s sage fried chicken benedict

Rs0lHgQI3_HF1iGO3XKy8Q.text: Three Stars because:  1. The portions here are HUGE. Literally they can feed you for two meals.  2. My boyfriend and I got seated in the booth next to Barry Bond's and Neil Patrick Harris' photos. 3. No wait, we were seated right away - we went at noon 4. When I asked for a small plate, they gave me a nice huge serving plate 5. Food is pretty good and displayed nicely  Cons: 1. Parking sucks around here. We parked at Las Vegas Club and paid five dollars. But then again downtown Las Vegas doesn't have free parking.  2. The waitresses were really pushy. They were really just trying to get us to order and rushing us to leave. It was down time too. Almost no one was there. Rude in my opinion.  Okay. So I had trouble making up the list of Pros and Cons, but overall I give this place three stars. Would I go back? Not for a while, but I would if I had no where else to go. Maybe it's because we went to a not so popular Hash House A Go Go in Vegas.  My boyfriend and I ordered two dishes. At first we were originally getting just the Man vs. Food Favorite (Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict), but then we saw people order the burgers and had to try one so we ordered the Fresh Mushroom and Swiss 1lb Burger.  Fresh Mushroom and Swiss Burger: The burger was actually kind of small. I didn't get any sides with it, but overall I'd give it 3.5. I've had better burgers. This one was just blah. I guess what got me was mushrooms, I love eating mushrooms, but this burger barely had any in it. It consisted of two meat patties, barely any mushroom, and one slice of melted swiss cheese. And in the end it only tasted like a burger I could get at any fast food store.   Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict: Overall it was good. The portion is humongous! My boyfriend and I could not finish it, but if you like CARBS, you'll enjoy this. It had bacon, mashed potatoes, scrambled eggs, biscuits, very little spinach, fried chicken, and some spicy sauce to finish. I have to say it was pretty good. It definitely had that spice to it! Overall I would give it 4. It's pretty unique, but you should eat it all. Don't eat leftovers of it, it sucks.   Tip: You should wear elastic waist pants because food portions are huge. You'll definitely feel it after eating a meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh mushroom and Swiss burger

POkkMq4RGsyGE5DCAmkR7g.text: Nope, not yummy. If you THINK it's yummy you are a terrible person who should be locked in a dungeon forever. This place is very much about the gimmick, you know, GIANT, decorative portions of not very delicious things. I've been several times and I think there are so many better breakfast places nearby (Babycakes, Egg Works, Cracked Egg, etc.) Last time my omelet was really dry and completely flavorless despite me adding a zillion extra ingredients and my biscuit was dense and heavy like a carby hockey puck...no buneo! Really this is expensive, icky quality buffet food made to look pretty on a plate. Um..pass.

nufy5AgDu3hozbojzqg7dA.text: Horrible customer service. Manager would not substitute toast for eggs despite having an allergy. Would not even discount the price for not including eggs. We we told that we could purchase something else and what did we expect coming to a "farm fresh restaurant". We are locals and will not be eating there ever again. So disappointing.

5AHS592vzaGTCIlDUGComQ.text: Super huge portions. Will get sick if you eat it all...lol... Kidding. Ordered a cheesecake but the inside was still uncooked, runny... Yucky. Waitress was kind of rude. Won't go back.

tRiufUi5R61Lo2PQxGLMHg.text: Kicks traditional breakfast up 100 notches. So good, different if you choose and a fair price. Location cannot be beat. Plaza hotel has come so far pretty fast. Check it out and avoid the overpriced buffets downtown. A much better deal.

9ZjPc-v6hkyx_cjtFzJdSw.text: food was great. i just had the basic breakfast. i am from Indiana originally so i had to eat here no matter what. i have been hearing about this place for a while.  i stayed at the Plaza for the weekend and totally didn't even know i was staying in the hotel with the Indiana restaurant.  only probably was that was a non smoking restaurant that is in the middle of a smoking casino and has no walls separating it.  weird. service was very strange too.  they didn't seem to care too much about anything.

ZzDDLWUCps5f8UNrI_aN0w.text: The waiter said that the sun-dried tomato & artichoke hash was his favorite vegetarian hash, it also happened to be the only. It was bland and pretty much all of the ingredients were tasteless. After asking how the food was and walking off before I could answer, I spent ~20 minutes trying to flag him back down to get something else. The replacement was an equally bland bacon-less version of the original benedict, which was doused in equally bland red pepper sauce, and had a mammoth (and dry) biscuit instead of an english muffin. The waiter happily took away my food when I said that I didn't like it much more than the first dish, but when the check came I was informed that 'his manager' had refused to let him take off two items from the check. When I told him that it was 'okay' and that I'll just never come back, he smiled and said 'sure'. $14 poorer and no less hungry, I left and plan, as I said, to never go back.

xcyeZnJiniYNP2BbsZYm3w.text: Stayed 2 nights at the Plaza- this restaurant is in the lobby so we had breakfast here.  Great food- way too much of it!  Breakfast was so good and fresh that we went both days - the second day the service was a little confused - half the place was empty but we had to wait since they were short staff??? On a Sunday morning??? Other than that-  I would suggest breakfast- they make their own " homemade" biscuits that are amazing!!!!!

cKH__HjAOfdCBvsJdrJqQQ.text: I wanted to love it here. I'd heard about it for ages. We tried the BLT Bloody Mary. I love the idea but the drink had a sweetness that (to me) comes from cheap tomato juice with corn syrup in it. One friend ordered the corned beef hash and it was out of this world. NO complaints there. Another friend and I split the Chicken and Waffles.  Large portions and no problems splitting.  (Hash and splitting is why I gave a 4, not a 3) When I eat C&W I like a combo of sweet and savory/salty. The chicken was tasty, but not really great fried chicken and the waffles had no sweetness as a contrast. We were underwhelmed. I would go again - and place a different order. Our service was quite good.

xceH1RAb2kv30rfWhyc2fg.text: Went on Easter dinner after church mass. It wasn't crowed and had dinner with in-laws. The food was excellent and filling. Service was actually great compared to what others say. I ate at 3 different Hash House A Go Go and all 3 have great food. This particular place at the time we went had great service. But like all places, there are times when service is not all that, but I guess we caught it a great time and my in-laws enjoyed there first experience @ Hash House A Go Go a great one!

O_nge0NQOnp4k4-s8E1Q8A.text: Had the sage chicken Benedict and was ok,nothing great. I expected more as this chain is highly rated by many people. The portions are huge! More than enough for 2 people! I'll try again and order something else to give a second chance.

8us-hRovXOQLJ6yW51wTpQ.text: if you're looking for a BIG breakfast than this is the place for you.  The chicken benedict was masive but delicious and the hash dishes were wxcellent.  This is a "stick to your ribs" kind of restaurant.  Add a bloody mary if you're recovering from a wild night.

kT8vs0MhK5GlxyMPwkfv2g.text: Last year when my friends and I dined at here the food and service was excellent, this year it was completely different. We had dinner at the Hash House a Go Go on Thursday April 25th. Our waiter was a male, one of the persons in our party of 3 ordered a coffee and the waiter brought her out a cold coffee of old coffee to our table and told us that a new batch would be ready in 8 minutes, a half hour later we needed to track him down and ask him for the coffee. When we ordered our food I asked if could get sauteed onions on my hamburger our waiter replied I could ask the chef but he will not do it, we were all thinking are you kidding us your chef will not Saute onions for a burger, sounds like this chef needs another job to us.  We then were anticipating hot biscuits delivered to the table like last year, instead we each got a cold, old and very hard biscuits, no butter etc. delivered to the table to accompany them. This restaurant does not seem to feel the need to care anymore. Our food arrived, it was fair at best, and we did not see our waiter until he delivered our check. We were very disappointed that he did not bother to check in with and see how are food was or take the dishes off the table. I was tempted to bus the table myself. Based on our service and the attitude of the chef we will not be back.

rm6FgxPelVr6twXHOzfKAA.text: Was with a group of 6... Took a hour to be seated. Within that hour we already decided our food but it took another hour to get out to us!! Service was terrible! Couldn't even keep our drinks refilled... The burger was tasteless and greasy and my fries were soggy.. It was just terrible overall!

GeaZKwwICiuXVS4w6d6j3Q.text: seriously gorgeous food, and tastes amazing!  Staff could be a bit more friendly, but the food makes up for it

sX3C1pobLkbxdpC-A5idTA.text: "The food channel lied to me". The chicken and waffels kind of suck and it took lil over 20 min for my food to come "and no it was not busy" maybe it was the cook I don't know I'll give it a try one more time. "maybe"

jbEkh_FGY6r0A8dgTOhRXw.text: An oasis in the desert. The service was excellent. The food was delicious and we had a great time. The best restaurant in the plaza hotel.

QSZNS-Hm_Hy8a166ckLN6Q.text: Food: 4/5. Service: 4/5. chicken & waffles; sundried tomato, goat cheese, basil scramble; meatloaf hash.

ZfTKw01k-PeLZ2YCp4gcoQ.text: I loved this place! I went here with my girlfriends Saturday around noon with an incredible hangover.  We wandered in the Plaza in search of the McDonalds, but since it was closed and we didn't think we'd make it much farther looking for food, we decided to stop in Hash House A Go Go.  Looking at the menu I thought the entrees looked a little pricey, but when we got our food I realized why.  The portions were gigantic.  Like some of the biggest I've ever gotten at a restaurant.  Which was awesome for my hangover.  I got this really incredible Watermelon Kiwi Lemonade that was both delicious and beatiful.  Our server was amazing.  She was so fun and really helped rally our tired hungover group.  She went out of her way to add litte touches that made our meal better.  One of the girls had a bloody mary that had food on tiny swords. After we broke one in a tiny sword fight, we asked for one more.  She brought enough for everyone in the group which was rather large.    I would definitely go back here next time I go to Fremont street.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. watermelon kiwi lemonade was so delicious!

IX3LDisCyRbvnjZXb7Erhw.text: Average at best.  Slow service.  Big potatoes which are nice.  I suggest 4 people coming and sharing 3 meals for hungry eaters.  The flap jack is a bit doughy.  All in all decent breakfast and large portions for the price.

nJD10wAFmNwDZ0T4dBF8PA.text: The portions here are obnoxious. That is the first thing written and noticed about this place. It is their thing. It is an odd thing to have. Personally, I would aim for excellence in food, environment, or something like the same, but HHAGG shoots for ridiculous portions that even the hungriest of Americans find it difficult to finish. (And boy are there some hungry ones out there!) The food is decent enough - better than your average chain restaurant. The decor is sleek. The service is fine. BUT CHECK OUT THE HUUUUUGE PORTIONS!!! OMG! LMAO! JPIA! I have found the dinner to be more appetizing than their breakfast (which is the opposite of what they are known for). The time I tried the highly recommended chicken and waffles, I was underwhelmed. However, I am not really a chicken and waffles type of guy. The dish just perplexes me. The food is satisfying enough, just do not expect to be wowed by anything other than having more food than you can eat. (Which is a good thing.) (I think.) (Sometimes this country confuses the hell out of me.)

bIiN4WmfOe4jL8xEksPvGg.text: I ate here twice on my last visit to Las Vegas and it was really good food. I had a giant waffle and one of their hash scrambles. On my first visit we got there right before brunch was ending and I wanted to order off that menu, but our waiter never came back and then I saw him go over to 2 other tables of people seated after me and then he disappeared into the kitchen. Luckily my boyfriend went and got another waiter to come over with 1 minutes left to order brunch. Very nice waiters, but I would have been very sad if I could not have ordered off that brunch menu. Second trip my food was accidentally given to the table next to me and the man didn't notice so he started eating it! But it was not a big deal because they made me a new one and even took it off our bill - which was very nice since many places only apologize for mistakes and do not comp the meal. Overall the food is great and I would come here to eat again!

2ajTgdjp9XCZKd5RJRVsLg.text: We visited HH while in Vegas because of the great reviews. We went on a Friday mid morning. The service was absolutely horrible. I had to ask another wait staff to find our designated waitress because we had waited for 10 minutes without seeing her to greet us our take a drink order. Then she disappeared again. The bartender brought us our drinks. Again, I had to ask another server to find our waitress so we could order food which took forever to arrive. (I think she didn't submit the order timely). The food was okay but lacked flavor. Everything seemed pretty bland, even the red pepper cream sauce lacked flavor. Not at all a pleasant dinning experience.

m-IklLyca16Ktqdm7gqwiw.text: the original is bad and i'm mad at myself for letting a friend drag me to the plaza location against my better judgment.  i'm giving the place one star because there is no ability to give it a zero.  answer me this: how can mashed potatoes with cheese and bacon have no flavor?  it's really an amazing feat but hhagg pulls it off.  the meatloaf sandwich also suffers the same fate.  these dishes could actually be edible if the cook would discover salt and pepper.  my buddy (who is much less picky than me) was suckered into the chicken and waffle dish.  I previously made that mistake, but given his forgiving taste buds, I chose not to steer him clear.  the highlight of the evening was when he commented that the field of fried leeks piled on the dish tasted like hay.  he then proceeded to ask the server if the owner of hhagg also owned a rosemary farm.  priceless.

g6bUfXb96wdhx9sJr-AlJw.text: Good portions. Service ok. Food quality questionable. Still a new location so maybe they'll get better?  Sort of expensive.

uKeXS2cinb3Byc3oakM3fg.text: come hungry! big meals! but prettty good deals...lol but yeah love coming here good tasty food

6eny-EsWGTP9eovFgI7KNA.text: This was our first stop for food in Vegas for the weekend.  It was also our best.  Stopped in Friday evening around 7'ish.  No wait to get in, place was about 3/4's full.  Service was very good.  I ordered the Sage Fried Chicken Benedict.  Food was very good and there was tons of it (like others have said).  One of the people we were with ordered the Meatloaf, I took a bight and it was equally as good.  The wife ordered as house salad for herself and shared off of my plate (and had food left over).  Price is a little high but for Vegas it's reasonable and if you kind of share like we did, it's a good deal.  Total bill for 4 of us with tip was $70 (included drinks/beer too).  Certainly will/would go back again.

6FU1Uyu4WD3xAP0LQF_7hw.text: The food for the rest of my party was excellent and what I expected, but my dish SUCKED!!  I ordered the turkey leftover meal, but got 4 thin slices of turkey.  Measly portion??  At HHAGG?!!  Don't think I will eat there again.  If you offer a holiday special, don't make it the most expensive but chintiesta f***ing thing on the menu!!!  Avoid any specials! Used to be a fan, now a hater of Hash House A Go Go.

IPGqyAG6jvc8BaIqKiWfLA.text: The place wasn't busy but having a horrible time with service.  Never did know who are actual server was, as one person took order, one person delivered coffee, and the manager brought one breakfast for my sweetie, and I had to wait about 5 mins. for mine.  Food?  If you like a big (awful) doughy biscuit that looks like it came out of the pillsbury doughboys butt, then this is the place for you.  Ham, spinach, cheese scramble had a big glob of partially melted cheese on top with a few leaves of raw spinach thrown on to complete the order.  We will never go back.

7Pw9cknNKNbN1OPzXintpg.text: the food was great, and so was the service; however, the reason this wasn't a 5-star review is because of the dirty silverware. My buddy had crud all over his spoon, and as well, dug out a piece of spinach lodged in his coffee cup. sick! i also didn't care for the "jelly of the day" as the only jelly option. i just wanted some grape jelly, yet the only jelly available was some peach-strawberry abomination. disgusting!

mARrLuYBmYdtimGiHex7mQ.text: Was there 8/23/13 and 8/24/13 Best breakfast, great service and better food. It's worth the time or drive any day of the week. Banana pancakes my wife enjoyed  and the country fried steak was  great.

U7EtpebFG3kNbAtTB4bu6A.text: I'm writing this short review of the Plaza location of Hash House because Travis K's post caught my eye on my welcome page. Let me start by saying that my wife and I are huge Hash House fans. We go to the West Sahara location regularly and have been to to the M Resort location as well and never had a bad experience. I wish I could say the same for our one trip the the new Plaza Hash House. The food was as great as it is at the other locations, but the service was very poor. There wasn't a friendly face in the restaurant, our meals were not served at the same time (lunches for the 5 of us arrived over about a 15 minute span) and it took nearly 20 minutes to get our check after our plates were taken away. The couple that was with us enjoyed their meal, but were so put off by the service that they said they probably wouldn't return. We assured them that the other locations didn't operate like the Plaza location. And no, I'm not a hyper-sensitive Yelper. I worked in the service industry for years and I understand the difference between a busy establishment where people are busting their butts and maybe it causes me to wait a few extra minutes. I have no problem with that. This restaurant was about half full and there was a lot of standing around going on. Hopefully the owner of this location will take some of these reviews about the poor service to heart and make some changes. I hate to say it, but my guess is that the employees of this Hash House are from the Culinary Union which for me would answer a lot of questions.

l5U6L577y75WaahJwRscXQ.text: we tried this place and 4 out of the 7 people eating in our party got sick.   The restaurant manager tried to claim that food poisoning only happens in 12 -24 hours. Which may be True for salmonella or e. coli, but can happen very fast for things like staph bacteria poisoning. Within 20 minutes, actually.   The manager refused to believe us, refused to give us any satisfaction, and when we had to run off to vomit instead of continuing the conversation, yelled more useless facts about salmonella poisoning after us. I'd like to see his food safety certificate, I'm sure it's out of date.  Also, the service was deadly slow and the prices expensive.   Awful, awful place. Avoid at all cost.

uAV3gn1oCD1bIuKIoPcW8w.text: Wanted to try this place the last time I was in town. So, I was excited that they opened this one since I was staying here. First time went and sat in the restaurant. Service was not so good. The busboy had to call the waiter to take our order. When the waiter came, he had an attitude. Ordered the Roasted Chicken Hash w/ asparagus, garlic, rosemary. The amount was huge. It was good..... but it felt the pieces where a bit too big. Like they just peeled the chicken off the bone & It was a dry. I went a second time to give the place another chance. This time ordered it to go. I got the Corned beef hash & eggs. I guess they don't have knives in the kitchen becuz the corned beef was shredded into big pieces. With the size of the pieces, the corned beef was tough & chewy. The only good things was. the eggs where perfect (over easy) and the toast was perfect. Oh, they only have marmalade if you eat in & honey if you order to go. The portions where worth what you pay for......

ucRi385dcR6a2rWa9926bw.text: I love the HHAGG out on Sahara.  Go there almost every time I am in town.  Stayed at the Plaza and apreciated the fact I could stagger out of bed hung over and enjoy a Hash House breakfast without driving to the other side of town.  Service was really poor.  Took almost 15 minutes to get drinks.  I ordered a HH Bloody Mary.  Now, I wasn't expecting Grey Goose or anything, but I've tasted better rubbing alcohol that the house vodka they used in this.  Server was never anywhere to be found, but a hostess did a good job with the drinks.  Food quality was good, but portions were smaller than at the Sahara location.  I was with a friend who is a bit of a grumpy old man so I'm sure his attitude didnt help.

xurSi1_9eHbJIkpoMmhTkw.text: First of all... I am not the type to talk bad on a place.. that is ofcourse until they treat the customer like crap... which is the experience I just had at the Plaza Casino Hash house.  They entice casino patrons to eat there by offering discount coupons upon checkin... then find every excuse not to fulfill them.  We had a four top wait 10 minutes just to be sat (at the front hostess stand) The short haired african american girl that worked at 5pm 1/9/2012 likes to talk more than work. Then we waited for another 5-10 minutes just to get a server and put in the drink orders.  At 515 pm... they then stated that our 10 dollar coupon would not be honored.. even though we clearly were there before the 5pm cutoff... the server even remembered us from a previous visit... and should have known that we are excellent tippers!! What an idiot... I hope you enjoyed your tip that we deducted the ten bux from!!!! Bahahahhahaahhahahahaha (pause for deep breath) hahahahahahahahahaahahahahaa!!!!.  Food wise.... do not order your own portion... SHARE!!!  The portions are HUUUUUGE... and perfect for 2 people... save your money for the casino or alcohol.  I will never be back, and will be spreading the word to everyone who considers this Downtown Vegas Hash House  location.  Very Very Very poor service and the manager of the place should take notes from Adam (GM) in the Oscar's restaurant upstairs!  Go to Denny's or the Mcdonalds inside the casino before eating here.... Not that I expect any changes, but the owner of this location should consider why the restaurant is suffering. PATHETIC!!!!

ZoPwBODQSmjsvH9MVkv5Fg.text: food was good, the portions are huge , the service here is alittle gloomy compared to the hash house in the Imperial palace.. however this spot is extremely less crowded since it is located downtown in the Plaza hotel. .

RZ49SAdu2hY1QLte0vxJcg.text: I really had high hopes for a good meal. We went at breakfast time. We sat in the bar. When we saw what the neighbors next to us had we were very impressed with the presentation. So we ordered. My friend ordered the chicken eggs benedict. Still had high hopes he took a picture. I ordered some kind of Fried Chicken with a biscuit. Neither one fo was impressed. After we left we both thought wow that was horrible especially when I think our bill was $48....Of course we had 2 Bloody Mary's. My friend said it was good. I had never had one so i ordered it. Took me all day to get that taste out of my mouth and I only had a few drinks of it and gave it to him. Oh well no I know. May give them another try some days but I guess that would be if everything else was closed.

RN5c1HUPmGzqID_TQ305OA.text: We ate here based on rave reviews. Although the portions were indeed huge, the flavors were  underwhelming. My husband had the portobello mushroom sandwich which was pretty flavorless. I had the salmon salad. The salmon was cooked nicely but the horseradish cream dressing tasted like sour cream. The service was slow and nearly every staff member including the manager walked by the dirty table across from us for nearly 30 minutes before it was finally cleaned. Disappointing.

kqCEqNfxCQVMS4knJNS7qw.text: This was our first time at HHAGG. The service and food was great. The portions are large and the presentation was appealing. Restaurant appeared clean. Two can split an entree, especially if you cannot, or do not want to carry 1/2 your meal home with you. We will definately return.

T897PA6H58HhzuOVG_ombQ.text: To put it simply...the best breakfast I had in Vegas.  While the buffets are good at filling you up with huge plates of food...the quality can be a little lacking. Hash House A Go Go will cost you a little more, but the combination of huge portions and great tasting food will satisfy you.   I had the Corned Beef House Hash...which was quite delicious.  Although huge, I was able to put most of it away.  Of course I walked around for a couple of hours feeling quite stuffed.  You can tell just by the look and taste that everything is prepared fresh...no canned stuff here. My brother had the sage fried chicken benedict dish...which he raved about.  It was even larger than my plate and he couldn't finish. My mom had a basic breakfast of eggs scrambled, biscuit, hash brown potatoes, and bacon.  This was too large for her and she couldn't finish either. One thing that you have to try if you come here is the Watermelon/Kiwi Lemonade.  I didn't order it, but had a taste of my brothers...it was delicious and quite refreshing. This location is convenient if you are staying downtown as it is located in the Plaza hotel lobby area.  There was no significant wait to eat here(we waited about 10 minutes for a table), but we went on a Monday about 9AM or so...so could be different on weekends or at different times. Highly recommended.

NUseHbQlPALgKLwuleH-PA.text: So I always make it a point to go here when in Vegas. Today went to have a late breakfast. The restaurant was half full at best. I was told there was a 20 minute wait for my wife and I. When I asked why because there are so many empty tables. I was told that there are several parties coming in that had texted ahead. When I said I am a customer standing here. they replied sorry, they texted first so you will have to wait.  I won't be dining here again. Plenty of restaurants in Vegas to choose from

FT888J56kA5wFs0WNXaVnQ.text: HUGE portions, big menu selection. Great breakfast after a night of gambling or drinking. The stars of the breakfast orders at my table were the banana-pecan french toast and the meatloaf hash (though it is not over hasbrowns but diced breakfast potatoes). The blueberry pancake was good and one pancake is enough for a person - at least 12" in diameter. Fast, friendly service and they treated the child with us nicely, providing crayons and an inexpensive kid's menu. They also have a hefty military discount.   The downside was that it was very loud - with competing music playing from the casino and overhead. :(

2ldoCFzbG17-tL5kSCe_tw.text: The food here all comes as giant servings, unique, and tastes delicious. The service was just OK. We sat at the bar for lunch expecting faster and friendlier service. Didn't really get either. Food came out fine and was delicious as expected. We do recommend the menu and the taste. The Casino that the restaurant is located in is really kinda a dump. Low class casino, claims to be renovated. Not really. However, it's worth walking through the Casino to have a meal at Hash House.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffle Stack
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;More hot chocolate with four full size marshmallows

k4-JIiEMSgaNji5tzwBWCw.text: We both had bacon and eggs for breakfast. My wife's eggs were scrambled and mine more over easy. You cannot fry eggs and serve them with burnt edges. My wife's scrambled eggs were good. I was hoping for more than just two pieces of bacon. When you serve bacon it should not be sitting on the shelf for more than an hour before serving. Cold bacon? Toast poor. Will not return there in the future.

2FtZkPrYLtpj1KOkf_o2ZQ.text: Always a great meal no matter what location you are at. And seriously who complains about large portions?!  Best banana pancakes I have ever had. The only bad thing is the wait so just get there before 10 on the weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana brown sugar pancake

qESFv8ZgpyBdLq0VBbK2Bg.text: This review is for anyone with food allergies, specifically gluten free.   Before our trip to Las Vegas one of our foodie friends suggested we visit this place. We were excited when we accidentally stumbled upon this place. We came at the last minute on a Saturday morning and didn't have to wait long to be seated. That's the end of the good from here. I HATE leaving bad reviews. I work at a hotel and used to work at a restaurant, so I understand this industry, but what we experienced was so beyond "bad" service I'm at a loss for words. I originally wanted just to send the owners an email, but I couldn't find any contact info...Then I thought that others with food allergies need to know. I want to point out that I'm not looking for anything from management, I just want other gluten free travelers to know about my experience here.   I have Celiac Disease, so if I eat anything with wheat in it I get really sick. Before we even got sat we asked the manager that was on duty if they had anything gluten free that I could eat. He said "Yes of course. Everything is made to order so you should be able to find something." Perfect! So we were seated. Our waitress came over and took our drink order. I asked her what she recommended that was gluten free and her response was "Uhhh...umm...we don't have anything gluten free." From there it was back and forth with her and the manager we talked to earlier. All I really wanted was an egg, bacon, and some hash browns. The manager said the hash browns come pre-packaged and seasoned (what happened everything made to order?) and would have to check on the label. When he came back he said they were gluten free. Then the server came back and I told her what I wanted and she said  "No, he is wrong. They aren't gluten free." I have never had an issue with ANY restaurant I've been to about trying to find out if I can have something gluten free. If they don't that's fine and I'll find a safe place for me to eat. But the lack of communication between management and the servers was the worst I've ever experienced. I was to the point of tears and had to embarrassingly ask where the restroom was so I could pull myself together. After that we never saw our waitress again. I could tell she was upset with us, but really? She never came back by to see if everything was okay or offer refill on coffee. We saw her chatting it up with the table behind us. We waited for nearly 10 minutes before she came back to give us our check. When we did finally see her she threw it on the table without even looking at us or saying a word. I have never felt more humiliated in my life! There are SO many great restaurants in the area, this one isn't worth the headache (and tears) for people with food allergies. We won't be back.

g2BXu0e7s90fuAksRazYtA.text: Amazing portions!  My wife and I shared the prawn app and the chicken and waffles entree and left stuffed!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PzBTDDO4ReyYgvTzH-bL4w.text: AVOID THE FRIED ANGEL HAIR GARNISH! Which comes with the lunch and evening entrees.   I saw a photo of a giant waffle and had to have it! It was only served during breakfast and brunch hours though. The prices are really high for being inside the Plaza casino. The portions are big and their food is unique. I never had fresh squeezed tangerine juice before and it was sweet, not too tart. My BF said the chorizo hash was spiced just right and was one of the best breakfast items he's had.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant vanilla waffle
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit cobbler
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boston hash

t3hDJpXI82Rz6CLk-g-xhg.text: They have hot tea! Says "bulk prepared" on the menu but then came with a great individual fresh tea bag and pot. Honey on the side, but can ask for milk if you need. Yummy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely pot of English Breakfast tea. Honey on the side
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main dining room, facing Fremont St

a1THuOBmnHSXoBUoHarcgQ.text: This place is amazing.  The food is HUGE and amazing with the flavor combos.  I got the Andy's Sage Chicken, which was very good.  I can't wait to go back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage chicken.  Amazing
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon pacakes

pIJXqQ1PSxYQfxq7hlwDPQ.text: This was the only place in Vegas I repeated on my trip and I went back three times. The Sage Fried Chicken was perfect. I have dreams of it!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s Sage Fried Chicken

A4kM0e-UyqyMI9novQCT-A.text: After getting off a redeye to Vegas with two girlfriends, we were extremely hungry and in need of coffee.  Stopped by because some friends told us that this was THE place to go.  First off, it's a pretty nice restaurant...for where it's located.  It was clean and there was no line (7 am in Vegas, go figure).  They get a start for that.  When I say that we were extremely hungry, we were.  But the portions of food are SO extreme, I don't know how anyone finishes their plate there.  This is the restaurant of gluttony.  The three of us could have shared one meal and still had leftovers.  Other than having a massive amount of food, there's nothing special about this place.  The biscuit was rock hard and tasteless, the hash was nothing special, and the potatoes were MEHHH at best.  The food took almost 25 minutes to come out.  I'll never go again and definitely not recommended.  Especially for you Hawaii people who know a good hash.

Y_bi2xtXmSOUHCVdFM-iDA.text: Mucho deliciouso the food is pretty darn legit, good and big serving of food, really filling! Taste like authentic mexican food

2z1QHUXkut5L_LmVCrJFEw.text: This place is crowded today with huge groyos. The bakerfamilia is in the spot again...

5Dj5_IAWO5yRB-AMQ6OWWQ.text: Server was cheerful and friendly and we were seated at table right away ..BUT my food was served cold and not a single person in our party even thought the food was even average.. A large portion of food does not a good meal make..

bBoA963w81da3TaehVPPAg.text: So far I've eaten at hash enough times to where I could be an expert on all things hash house.   This particular spot has the same amazing food I know and love but the staff is a little less than good.   Ordering is difficult. Be simple.....otherwise the heads may explode.

ivN3_orXA4mhrP7dpia2ug.text: I've been to 3 different Hash Houses in Vegas, and this was one of the best, we got seated immediately, too, which is a bonus in itself.  We ordered 3-4 plates between the 5 of us and it was too much food. The portions are huge and it was all delicious.   The ribs were delicious and tender, the chicken was juicy, moist, and tasty, and the mashed potatoes were the bomb.

C7Uvflkx7M0DXMEzZB24gw.text: My boyfriend and I went twice, once for dinner, and another time for breakfast (using our restraunt.com coupon). For dinner, I had the griddled cheese and he had the stuffed burger. They were HUGE, we were not able to finish them. Delicious though, and our waitress was very nice. We tipped her a little extra. I also tried their strawberry lemonade margarita and it was AMAZING. Breakfast was a little more disappointing, but not because of the food. I had the pancake combo and he had the chicken and waffles. Also huge portions, but at least we (well, me at least) were able to finish them. I also tried the kiwi watermelon lemonade which was also amazing. Our waitress that day was nice at first, but getting the check took forever. When she finally came back it was to confirm that we were the people with the restraunt.com coupon, then she was gone again for another 10 mins. It got pretty annoying, especially because we had finished some time ago and our plates were already gone. The waitress the day before had a party of 32 she was attending to, yet she was still able to tend to our needs in a timely matter!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage fried chicken and waffles
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiwi watermelon lemonade

bxhUftOTrwmBHi4z7tyo7A.text: This menu is to die for!!!! Me and hubby shared a plate, large servings. I had the bloody Mary and it was bomb.

_4dzpBzO0LZ3AWenuBjptw.text: Chocolate chip pancakes weren't on the menu but they made me one anyway, I had a VERY nice waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bZ_sHi8teDESvMLdfm1CWQ.text: The friends love this place. I on the otherhand went for breakfast, got the breakfast and wasn't totally stoked. The eggs were ordered over easy and we're pretty raw in the center, on both plates. If I return again I will get the eggs scrambled and won't be as disappointed. We sat at the bar. Service was good. Just a shame about the eggs.

F38J5mhI8vBaM44pX_0NgQ.text: Food was ok a little out of the box but creative. Prices seemed a little high but you will not leave hungry.

-Xx6NCWvyz6kMfsoka5mlA.text: The portions are huge!   I agree with the reviewer who said they should offer sharing.     I think there was a "basic" breakfast on the menu that was like $9.99.    Had a scramble and it was great.  Everything in the plate tasted good, the eggs, bacon, potatoes.  The potatoes were perfect, no hash browns here.  The biscuit was huge, and the homemade strawberry jam was delish.    I have eaten at most of the breakfast spots in downtown Vegas, and this place is now one of my fave places.

04BeA3KA7B2LqyoixM-8Fg.text: What becomes a legend most? If you have ever heard anyone mention Hash House A Go Go, it's usually followed by exclamations of the portion sizes. Not the delicacy of the, well anything. You'll never hear anyone praise the chef. And you'll probably be looking at someone who the word "Sansabelt" is usually proceeded by, "where are the..?" I'll just say it, this place is for fat people who are probably cheap but think they're too good to go to a buffet. Or their too lazy to make the eight trips back and forth to get the same amount of food you'll get on one entree here. Or too embarrassed.   My uh food was ostensibly an egg Benedict. I think Benedict Cumberbatch was buried somewhere between the potato farm and the layers of some weird cheese pancake that was covered in the exact same chipotle they serve at ISIS training camps to get new recruits to hate infidels. "Eat so you can taste the hell that is the American Southwest! Death to America!" I totally would understand after eating this.   Wait. There's more! It's 110 in the shade but the chef/menu committee decided to remind us that somewhere it's Christmas. How? You ask. By impaling a 7ft Norwegian pine smack dab in the middle of my food. And probably poor Benedict Cumberbatch buried in the goo. Who does that? Why? Norway should revoke the visas of anyone currently terrorizing their pine forests. Have some national pride. Don't let Hash House ruin people's memories of your...hmm...ok, you have nothing.   But I digress. This gawdawful concoction had so many levels of early 21 st century cliches that it should be cited as non ada compliant as there's no elevator to get from top to bottom. Did I mention the tree in the middle of it all? Oh. I did. The "gravy"... Chipotle is not to be used on non combatants according to the Geneva convention. That's been standard since the war in Grenada. If Rumsfeld should be on trial the person who created this time culinary bomb ought to be in the docket right next to him. Hell, I'd spend the night with Dick Cheney and his mean straight daughter rather than eat this again.   Oh yeah. There's chicken in here somewhere but I never got near it. After a portion of potatoes that could have saved half of Ireland during the famine I was too full to get poor Benedict Cumberbatch to move over to let me power up the ol' chainsaw and cut off a piece of the  Flintstone size buzzards breast. Sorry. So very sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Norway, your national treasure is being plundered by #hashhouseagogo

5z5xnVHkIljNtVfmq6N2xA.text: Tasty food! Found this place on Yelp weeks before I came to Vegas. I love going to local joints when I travel. Strong advise you to come here with an empty stomach. Portions are  huge! Waiter was great and helpful. It's near Fremont too, so great time to walk off the calories ;)

anbbBbBJ0IvLiL4z59CmzA.text: Stopped in for breakfast while visiting Vegas and staying on Fremont Street. We stopped in relatively early (9 AM on a Saturday) and we were able to get a table without waiting.  Staff: nice, friendly, courteous, and timely Restaurant: average ambiance, clean, spacious Prices: pretty good relative to other Vegas restaurants Portion size: very large; good place to split a meal  The food itself it fine. A friend had the HH original benedict, which was huge and covered with red pepper cream instead of hollandaise sauce. There was a lot going on with that plate. It was OK. My husband had the basic. Eggs were cooked just fine, and the bacon was pretty ordinary. The biscuit was pretty dry and definitely needs a good amount of butter and/or preserves. I had the sundried tomato, goat cheese, and basil egg scramble. It was a nice flavor, with lots of sundried tomatoes, but I didn't see or taste any basil. Accompanying crispy potatoes were pretty bland, and accompanying fruit was a single slice of orange and a single slice of melon (I was expecting a bit more).  That being said, I didn't feel like I was completely ripped off after eating here. The problem with Vegas restaurants is that the convenient, no name places in a hotel/casino lobby is that they're convenient but extremely overpriced and serve terrible, terrible food. Hash House prices are OK, and the quality and portion sizes are reasonable. I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH original benedict

q5dmrja_EkieuYMok1ensg.text: There was a super long wait. The waitress wasn't really helpful but omg the food was amazing. The waffle was perfect and bigger than my face! Will probably go back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle!!!!!

EarrAJ86g2zolXkN2Q_JkQ.text: Hash House is consistently great whichever location you go to. This location has no wait, unlike the other ones. Huge portions usually means sub-par food, but that's not the case at Hash House.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom and Swiss Burger
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s sage fried chicken Farm Benedict

aiWnx93Tm__pxjn1VcfyfQ.text: We came in with a big party for my daughters birthday, had a reservation, our waiter came by to check on us, his name was Roberto and he was AWESOME.  He took drink orders and did not mind taking food orders for appetizers from some and waiting for others to come in later to get theirs.  The entire evening, he was very attentative and really cared about our well being.  He also had other tables besides ours, and through the entire night his attitude was above reproach.  He was so good at what he did he should be a manager not a server.  I have been to many places and our server here was one of the best I have ever had.  The food was aweseom as well, the portions are way more then one person can eat, so we did a lot of splitting.  At the end of the meal, he made sure the cake we dropped off earlier was ready for us.  When we were all done, he was nice enough to do separate checks for people who wanted them.  I am telling you at not time did his attitude ever change from AWESOME!!  He is a True asset to this company and I made sure he was well compensated for putting up with the crowd we had.

Uvg48FSeQk-c-Yfxt1oh3A.text: Went here Sunday. My wife had a ceasar salad with chicken. Our food came out in 5 minutes which we thought was almost too fast.   Ended up in ER from food poisoning. Not a great way to end our trip.

w1SFtYJM6zCuTULFqBFHFA.text: This is a great little restaurant if you want to upgrade from a Dennys or IHOP.  Great food and decorum.

oRTFazyWTz3DxxGT4nhcdQ.text: This place is delicious! Portions are big and food is great. I got the banana French toast it was delicious!

3q2NbXDwgyMMQEcKokRAVw.text: I do have to say the portions here are huge. This location is very popular and crowded but they move people in and out really quickly so that wasn't an issue at all. The price of the food was a little high for the quality of t in my opinion. My girlfriend and I shared the Andy's Famous Sage Fried Chicken and honestly it was not meeting my expectations. I'm not sure how you dry out fried chicken while simultaneously under cooking then reading but they pulled it off. The mashed potatoes under the dish were bland, boring, and honestly just didn't belong with the dish. There were 3 pieces of spinach so why even bother putting it on.  On the plus side: the Caramel macchiato iced coffee was great. Service was exceptional. And the presentation was really well done.

a04EbF45U3-h6oMQN04rXA.text: Make sure you bring your friends because it will take 2-3 people to actually finish a dish here. The potions are HUGE. A ridiculous amount of food really. On the plus side it was really good food. (Diameter of pancakes are about 20 inches)  Bloody Mary wasn't very good. I'm a fan of spicy bloodys with a ton of garnish but these tasted sweet for some reason. Gross.   Service was ok. Probably could have checked on us sooner but overall fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger and fries
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

CHU2Ha0YCM6Xjvpv-e4dKw.text: Portions are crazy large.... Split if you can! Food was amazing. Ate at the counter and was treated very well. Only down was one hostess was a bit of a negative Nelly.

5yfGl8My6bcChGXu2JDUNw.text: Great food. Only reason to go to the Plaza. Entire family loved the food . Good price and huge portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;more Mocha was great! Great food too. Huge portions and the entire family satisfied. The only reason to go to the Plaza.

Mnquqz3yy-dj_OFbj6QeYg.text: I absolutley love the chicken benedict. The Benny is consisting of fried chicken, bacon, mashed potatoes, grilled cheese, and Smoothered with gravy goodness. The serving is huge so share it with a friend if your a lightweight. Or just unbutton your pants and pig out solo... always my choice! The pancakes are also a great choice, not only are they massive in size but the pack tremendous flavor as well if you happen to not be in the mood for a gargantuan benny. One of the top 5 breakfast spots in sin city in my humble opinion.

XfqVWJHFM33vTAYJzg_Jlg.text: Easily THE BEST breakfast I've ever had. I originally ordered the #1 Farmers scramble but it had WAY too much onion in it for my taste. I switched it out for the Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict and WOW!!!! Absolutely delicious. Full of flavor. HUGE portion. Could easily feed 3 people for $18! It's worth it though.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict

EqKOQJcK96x5TNX8Cp0T0A.text: Huge portions! Epic food creations! Quick and friendly. Ate here multiple times and it was killer!!!

RJ6T7G0_Ly5JXMKWOaMUtg.text: One of my favorite places in Las Vegas. You'll leave full or with a to go box because of the portion sizes. I had Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict. It changed my life. It was that great. They have a Bacon Bloody Mary and it made my day better. Overall, this place will always get my money.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried. Chicken. Eggs. Benedict. The life changer. Almost a bad picture because of my cousin being a dick.

DjyakhRGqZwKA0K42SUh_g.text: Went here the morning after NYE this year after staying in the Plaza. This was my 4th or 5th visit to Hash House, but my first visit at this location.  From past experiences,  I knew not to order the Sage Chicken Benedict, as it's dry and tastes like baby puke. I'm a big Benedict fan. So that's a let down. So my first choice was another random breakfast, but there was something in it that I didn't like,  and they wouldn't modify it. Back up plan was the salmon Benedict.. it was just gross. Dry. Fishy as ever. Stunk. I wouldn't call it a Benedict. Hollandaise sauce and eggs on top of bread of some kind is what it should be. Not dry potatoes, dry biscuit, and dry protein covered in puke sauce. Large portions of that does not make it better. Service was mediocre. Energy sucked. My dining mate also was not happy with his food. It's large portions of eclectic concoctions that don't mesh well together.  If you do go here, stick to pancakes or waffles. Their savory dishes leave much to be desired.

nP0QN6AN_DlQsVRrXKrJDw.text: DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION! They have very ignorant & selfish people. Our waiter was a big rude female dog! && when I asked to talk to a manager he was rude as well! I just hope they didn't spit in my food! Save yourself & just go to a different location!

3TyEXb4xWpzlb6XbX0AtNg.text: Great Food!!! Huge portions!!! No wait, same great food and service.   Had the Kokomo Sandwich (meatloaf) and it was amazing, also had a basic breakfast -at only 8.95 it's a steal!!! The biscuits are TO DIE for!

BM_P2rd1D9WwIZ24dGVK1Q.text: Went there for a birthday lunch for my boss.  Asked for water with lots of ice. Got four ice cubes. Asked for a glass of ice, never brought it. Ordered the Basic, breakfast with sausage, got bacon. When we were all finished (there were eight of us), our dishes never got cleared off the table. Waiter brought the bill, over $100, we all put in. Waiter came back again to get the bill/payment and we weren't ready, still no dishes cleared.  We were finally finished with the bill and put it down, the waiter came by and scooped it up.  We finally got up to leave and left a full table of dishes.  It was at least 20 minutes from the time we finished until we left. Unfortunately I was not in charge of the bill or there would have been NO tip. Terrible service, waiter didn't listen.  Will never go back.

5ELKW3MzADz7mrdYMSwXcg.text: My husband and I arrived to hash house a go go at 815am on a Friday morning. So we were expecting a bit of a wait. Hostess gave us a pager and said it would be 30-45 minutes. Not a problem, I said and asked how far the range was and was told to stay on the main floor and not to leave the casino and it would work. After over an hour I returned to see how much longer our wait was going to be. Come to find out the hostess had forgotten about us and had skipped us. Not a problem l, you were busy, that's understandable. We get seated and I try to order orange juice, only to be informed that they're out of orange juice. How, on a busy Friday morning are you already out of orange juice? Oh well. We order our meals, a basic and apple cinnamon flapjack with whipped cream. Oh, now you're also out of sausage and bacon? Well that eliminates a good portion of your menu. After being seated for about 5 minutes 3 booths near us were seated. Yet somehow all 3 ordered orange juice and got it. Before my husband and I even got our drinks. After waiting for 45 minutes for our food to finally arrive, my potatoes are cold, my husbands pancakes have 4 paper thin slices of apples that are nearly blackened from being burned and there's no whipped cream. I try to ask for a side of hollandaise sauce since there is a section on the menu for eggs Benedict, but much to my surprise and chagrin I am informed that there is no hollandaise sauce in the restaurant. After we attempt to eat and decide it's not worth the hassle and ask for he check we still have to wait an additional 20 minutes for an incorrect check. Needless to say we were not impressed nor will we ever recommend this location which is a shame considering every other hash house a go go I have been to (multiple locations in Las Vegas and the Chicago location) I have never had such horrendous food not service

C5N1epM47dMFGKhB64Sivg.text: I want to give it 5 stars because the food was absolutely delicious. Perfect for sharing in a big group or even taking some home to remember what a great meal you had. Our waiter however on the other hand was horrible. He didn't write down our orders, some of which had changes to what was listed on the menu.  As a former server, making sure your guest gets their order right the first time is key. Not forgetting what was said, coming back twice to correct it and still bring the meals out incorrectly.  What was even more frustrating was that we didn't get our drinks filled as needed or when we asked for extra plates, condiments, etc we were forgotten, or had to ask several times, including asking other servers for help because ours was no where to be found. Also, we were charged for items we didn't ask for and also were charged for BBQ sauce that was not BBQ sauce.  The hash house in the quad hotel and casino was a bust service wise, however the food was delicious.

NLmiPDsc8PUrvM_dOQLKQw.text: This place was on my list to check out in DTLV...and it was pretty good. Service was slow, even though only myself and 3 other tables were there, but the food came and I was happy. Huge portions of standard-faire breakfast items...of course had hashbrowns. It is located right in the front of the Plaza casino and is nice to envision Old Vegas here, that's why I like the Plaza. Basically drunk food, but in a good way.

HbH6AtW1QDylqQG4plkQGA.text: How can anyone dislike this place? Huge portions, good food and good service. Just found it by accident and was very satisfied. Portion was so big and tasty I couldn't stop. Had to when I started to sweat. And great beer selection to top it off.

NOhVqSlWODNMWIs7vck4cQ.text: Really good food. Excellent, in fact. The portions are huge. Thankfully our server, Bryan, let us know immediately so I could split a meal with my lady. We had the bacon, avocado burger. Excellent. This has become a new must-stop for us when we are in downtown. And we're in downtown a lot.

YxUtz_0xQTPbJyZQ0OxIGg.text: Terrible service. I got a seat right away and he took my order but after 30 minutes, my food didn't come and no one came to update me that it was on the way. It wasnt even that busy.  When I started to get antsy, I couldn't even find anyone to complain to!  So I just left.

pIm30xgZBsgb2YyDYzWP6Q.text: The food was excellent and a great bargain, especially considering the massive portions.  My father had some of the fluffiest pancakes he has ever had.  I look forward to coming back next year.

ahYy6YIt6nuKnhCvCP070w.text: I know Zappos is putting a ton of money into downtown, but no one is really putting out exceptional food downtown.  I had friends in over the Holidays and they are staying at the Union Plaza because they remodeled all their rooms with the furniture that was suppose to go into the fountainbleu, so nice......Super nice rooms!  Got a little pricey around NYE, but room rate next day dropped to 59.00 for a Bellagio quality room.  However...........this was the BEST food downtown by a long shot!  Best food on Property and super nice waiter...Home made tasting food that is quality.  Real veggies  NOT frozen.  We did dinner and three brunches.  Huge portions too!

B7_OLYaQKRpHQ0OFrdnlmw.text: My family had been going here for years - this last trip the service was beyond bad and the food was mediocre at best - I tend to not leave bad reviews after only one bad trip and many good but the response I received from management via email after not getting anywhere with the supposed manager onsite was to imply I was lying about the length of time it took for our order, original beverage orders and subsequent refills and the actual meal itself - when I responded to that was suggested I go elsewhere and that he serves a number of people a week without incident - after reviewing other yelp reviews it seems that something is going on there and they indeed have a problem.  So beware - there are not that many similar restaurants on Fremont and as our Vegas trips always include at least a day on Fremont we will be looking for another standard to eat at - have visited three to four times a year for about 6 years - I even took a group of 20 here for a birthday breakfast I loved it that much!  Too bad!  We visited August 7th around the noon hour.

-9iwHWYcQF05kBvgkN7MWA.text: This place was soooo delicious from the salad to the chicken and waffles, I actually ate there 3 times... definitely going back there next time...

dWfaWmBXdmq2azHITalzRQ.text: OK, as stated before we are big HHAGG fans but the last two times, while here in Vegas, not so much.  This time orders were wrong, 2x, things forgotten, long waits for orders.  This is sad for us.  This place was unique and so good before they exploded with so many locations.

Elca-v33-GqX3kEyWZ2IWQ.text: Got the sage chicken & waffles with 2 friends, one of my friends also got the sage chicken & waffles.  Now we are both sick with a fever.  The food looked disgusting too, not very tasty, this place blows.

ZabU3mfOgNljDGiUfRQB5g.text: We decided to try hash house a go go after reading several positive yelp reviews.  We were a little put off when we got to the Imperial Palace location at approximately 1 pm.  The line/wait was insane and the crowd was already extra loud and extra drunk.  Blame it on Sunday afternoon football I guess.   I called The Plaza location and was kindly informed that there was no wait at the moment. We made way over and were seated immediately.  Our server was awesome and attentive and the food was delicious!  My husband ordered the chicken and waffles along with a side of biscuits and gravy, and I ordered the infamous Andys sage fried chicken w/spinach and chipotle cream.  EVERYTHING WAS SO GOOD!!  I accidentally ordered the wrong Andys dish and I offered to take it to-go while I ordered the correct dish, but the gentleman who brought my food over said not to worry about it and got the right dish out to me in no time.  It was extremely nice of them considering I was the one who made the mistake.  Service was a little slow towards the end but not enough to make me think anything less of the place.  We enjoyed our dining experience there and definitely look forward to going back!

flRSZORHcqB-OvoAyY63fw.text: LV native now, and was 1st year I decided I needed a cooking break on turkey day. I realize nothing is as good as homemade on Thanksgiving, but went in with an open mind, given this restaurant's positive reviews. Made an unnecessary reservation, as the place was virtually empty when we arrived, which was lucky, as whoever took my reservation only hours earlier, didn't write it down.  The waitress arrived quickly and took our order quick as well, as we were all decided we would order the turkey dinner. She was a little off putting, as in not friendly, which I would later realize the reason, we we were arriving at end of her shift on Thanksgiving.  It took no more than 5-10 minutes to receive our plates. Looked decent, but tasted not so decent. The turkey and stuffing were moist, but there was probably about an ounce of gravy on the potatoes. I asked the food runner if we could have more, and she rolled her eyes and said "I'll have to check with the kitchen." She brought back for three of us about one more ounce of gravy to share. The mashed potatoes served with dinner were like bricks that seemed to be sitting the entire day, were not warm, and lacked any flavoring such as milk and butter. Vegetables served were carrots, green beans and a small ear of corn. The corn was cooked properly, but the carrots and green beans were virtually raw, and the carrots were so tough I couldn't cut with a knife. None of the vegetables arrived with butter or any seasoning, just plain and hard; reminded me of my kids' school lunches! The dinner was to come with cranberry sauce, which it did in a tiny ramekin usually seen in restaurants that put ketchup in for fries. There was approximately one tablespoon each. Given my kids love cranberry sauce, I forfeited my tablespoon so they could each have an extra 1/2 tablespoon; what a joke.   For dessert we ordered pumpkin cheesecake and pumpkin bread pudding. When I ordered dessert, the waitress indicated she was "going to get out of here," and I believe the bartender was going to finish up our table. She brought us the check, my tab was approximately $80, and although the food was sub-par and she wasn't the friendliest, I gave her a 20% tip. She was never seen again.  Meanwhile, our pumpkin cheesecake arrived immediately from a food runner. My kids and I had a few bites, but it didn't taste like cheesecake to me. Rather, it had a strong taste of cool whip in the filling. My two little sweet freaks didn't touch it yesterday in the fridge at home, and I'll toss it today. After waiting 30 minutes for anyone to pass by to get their attention, I managed to get two hosts' attention. Our bread pudding was missing in action, and at about the 40th minute the food runner returned with the bread pudding. I told her no way, wasn't paying for it, as I just told the host 10 minutes prior same, and was waiting for the manager to return my bread pudding money.
