He did ultimately run a new check canceling the dessert charges and apologizing for our waitress taking off before ensuring our dessert was delivered. Obviously, we were forgotten about. He gave us the bread pudding, but no one has touched it in the fridge.   The entire experience and food were subpar, and given this restaurant's reviews, I had high hopes, and a crummy buffet would have been a far better option for the price. Because of this experience, we will never dine at this chain again.

-jL1RWnyjOXunc_BDx1Zfw.text: We had the opportunity of being served by Rochelle who explained menu portions and her personal favorites. We took her advice on the Sage Chicken & Waffles, as well as the chicken and hash chorizo! We were stuffed beyond measure. Thank you Rochelle for an enjoyable dining experience! If you stop by ask for Rochelle, she will take good care of you!

xmL0T1k8A-sVuXcx43bg6Q.text: What huge portions! I got the blueberry and pecan pancake which was honestly about 12 inches in diameter !! No joking !  And my girl had the bisquits and gravy, also a HUGE portion. Food is very good! A must go if you stay downtown.  And the prices are good as well

z-bMeZoDGMv8xMYc9C6kZA.text: Food was good. I didn't order any of the main attractions (chicken and waffles) but the blueberry HH pancakes were delicious, biscuits and gravy very good, Bloody Mary good (bloody martini not ) , the chorizo was ok but nothing special. Our waitress was very friendly and very busy. We did make the mistake of going to breakfast around 10 am on 4/20 (didn't think anything of it until we left our room) and the wait was long. But it seemed like everyone had "waked and baked". The next day we ate at 930 and had no wait whatsoever.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not the best Bloody Mary, but it was good.

u-2P-T8HvCy2RI7JXV6bzQ.text: I'm mostly giving this place a 5/5 because it absolutely deserves higher than the current 3/5 rating!  We went this morning (a Sunday morning) around 10a and Only had a twenty minute wait! They were friendly and accommodating to our party of five including a baby in a stroller. Our waitress came over almost immediately and service continued to be quite quick from there. Since I'd been to another location before, I know how large their portions are. My husband wasn't eating, so the rest of us shared a bacon, avocado and cheese scramble and a side of chicken sausage. It came with one huge biscuit, strawberry jam, crispy potatoes (you can get mashed if you prefer), a wedge of cantaloupe and a wedge of orange. The absolute best part of the meal was how cheesey and flavorful the scramble was! There was so much cheese that when you pulled a bite away with your fork, there was a lot of gooey, stringy cheese trailing behind. Yum!! Major win!! I was also impressed with the chicken sausage  - two HUGE links.   Like I said, I've been to a Hash House before. And I enjoyed myself. But I have to say that this visit was what made me feel like I need to come back more. I will certainly think of this place when it comes to having breakfast when family is in town. There are other dishes I need to try! The table next to us ordered the corned beef hash and it looked great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, avocado and cheese scramble (so good!!!)

dGOK4ItfPMVBsnqPkUtNAg.text: There are 6 of us visiting Vegas for the first time. The food was exceptional, the price was fair and the portions were huge. It was so good we had to come back.

m-_f52R1f0GJXkEKGlYxFg.text: The portions are a bit ridiculous but it's so good you don't mind eating it twice.  The wait list was somewhat disorganized and longer than I wanted but once seated, the service was fast and friendly.  I had a Farm Scramble with Ham, Spinach, and Cheddar.  The griddled mashed potatoes were a nice touch.  Next time, I'm going for a Hash and maybe a BLT Bloody Mary.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT Bloody Mary

VPZ8DTkEqPwEGVS2exalHw.text: Sat at breakfast bar. Great service. Food was yummy and huge. Seemed to come on about 4 cups of mashed pots. Brother ate most of his and he was fresh from starving for 24 hours for weight in for Power Lifting Worlds. (He didn't finish his pots either!)

FuE3vT0S-7aUUTvRWy2xVA.text: Visited the area again last week & ate here 3 times!  One night brought 10 other people who all loved it!  Chicken & waffles was the big favorite with the chicken pot pie coming in second place.   I loved the sage chicken Benedict.  Coffee is great,  service is excellent.

_UxIGkahtCPjclHJFomIJA.text: Ridiculous portions at a reasonable price!  Since this is almost the only decent breakfast at this end of Downtown Las Vegas (Dupar's closed and MTA requires walking through the homeless hoard), I expected the standards to be less than stellar. I mean, really, they have no competition.  What I found was a delightfully clean, efficiently run, full service diner. Kudos to the Hostess (I am sorry that I did not get her name, BUT, she had purple braids, so maybe that will identify her?) who made arrangements for us to accommodate a dietary restriction for someone in our party. This was real customer service! Our Server made his dislike of the accommodation clear, but adhered to (it looked like he complained to the Hostess). We were also impressed by the older gentleman in the red shirt and jeans who brought our food. His demeanor was that of Hoosier and someone who had a stake in the place. It is great to see that work ethic. A solidly nice, homey, experience.

OTtdRtuOmE3tzIsQI8yu7A.text: I had a pretty good time eating at the Summerlin location and the one in the Linq casino.  This one is located in the Plaza hotel downtown but this time around, for whatever reason, it wasn't all that thrilling.  Perhaps because it was the one meal in LV on this trip that I decided to take the trashiness of the food down a level?  At around 10 AM we did have to put our name on a waiting list but it only took about 5 or 10 minutes before I got a text telling us to head back to the host.    The waitress and staff were kind and definitely kept our water and coffee full.  No problems there.  Mom and I split the Healthy Start with spinach, mushrooms and onions and a side order of Biscuit and Gravy for $5 (to offset being TOO healthy, you understand)!  The other half of our party ordered the Crab Benedict.  They brought out the Healthy Start but when they found out they had mis-keyed a Benedict with Fried Chicken instead of Crab, they corrected it within minutes!  Great service, no question.    The issue was really the food.  It was just good, not great.  To the point that we didn't order anything decadent which is kind of the point of eating at Hash House A Go Go, the two people who ordered the Benedict didn't have anything much to say and one of them could only eat a little because the sauce was too spicy for her.  We did have the biscuit and gravy but it was also just okay.  Nothing great.  We ate because we were hungry, but we'll probably try something else next time when staying downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of Biscuit and Gravy
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Healthy Start with spinach, mushrooms and onions

G6_IoE0mzh3R5SweF8kjkQ.text: Huge food at food coma city!  This place is just ridiculous...in a good way.  We've eaten at this and other locations several times on various Vegas visits and it's always good.  This particular trip on 3/26/17 was not the best.  I ordered the Hand Hammered Pork Tenderloin and it was great until I found the 2 bone fragments about 10% of the way through.  I wasn't really that hungry so I intended to take half back to the hotel to eat later, but when I pointed out the bone to the waitress she took the food away and got the manager.  He took off 1/2 the price of the entree (which was well over $20) which was fine, had I had more than 3 bites before it was taken away.  So, I paid about $12 for about $4 worth of food.  Crappy experience, but all the others have been great, so I'll chock it up to an off-day.  My fave is still the Sage Chicken & Waffles, but the pot pie, meatloaf, chicken fried steak and pork tenderloin are all outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s Crispy Indiana Style Hand Hammered Pork Tenderloin (the name and the meal are a mouthfull)

XaEqrSm80HQSTywS8gMCMw.text: Honestly I would have given this place 4 stars- but the service has been so lacking.   The food is great and it is HUGE. Chicken Pot Pie, egg scrambles, I haven't had anything here that was ever less than fantastic.   The service though... man. I've been here multiple times and it's always the same. Waitresses act too busy for you and rarely checking on you. The person I was with ordered a different scramble (omelette) than I did, and the waitress repeated the order back to us. The runner then brought out two of the same scrambles.  We let them know this wasn't what was ordered (the runner, since our waitress was no where to be found & couldn't be bothered to bring our order out to us)  They finally bring out the correct order but are SO condescending. 'I would have bet on my life that this is what you ordered. Enjoy.' Uhhh. Good thing you didn't place any bets then because it was definitely not what they ordered! Or what she repeated back to us.  Don't expect any refills, you probably won't get any.

5oIfrB8EErphRon7-xEwxA.text: The Hostess was rude and wouldn't even acknowledge us when we walked up when our table was ready. When seating us, she wouldn't even respond to our thank you. Waitstaff was mediocre just like the food. When our food arrived, it was cold.   I will not be back to this location.

74XZCJAY0nW2-7ZIlgsgFQ.text: Wanted some breakfast and found this place. Saw the menu and was a little overwhelming to make some decisions (which is not bad). Ordered a basic breakfast (eggs, bacon, biscuit and potatoes). The only thing I liked was the bacon. Scrambled eggs were under and the potatoes were suppose to be crispy...not. Are server was nice but once we got the food, we didn't see her again until I put money on the table to get our bill. Don't waste your time and money here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tractor breakfast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basic breakfast

71_kOnOLW3rUDZC2m27KJQ.text: So this has always been one of my favorite places to eat with my wife (your going to want to share) but when she suggested we have our daughters 21st B day party here I thought it might be really expensive but after looking at the menu w did it.   As usual the staff was awesome. I mean way above their normal good service. Rachel was so awesome it really added to the experience and management kept coming around and making sure our group of 30 were all being served and happy.   Since we typically share, I haven't tried too many dishes here because my wife is not big on trying new things. OK, I'll say it, she likes it simple and she likes it that way. Today I got see some new dishes. One of the most amazing was the chicken pot pie. That is definitely my new order. Oh wait, my son had the corned beef sandwich, maybe that's next. Another friend had the salmon and that looked really good. Oh man, this party may have blown my desire to share.  Thank you HH staff for making this a memorable event.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sean&#39;s chicken pot pie may have won for best dish!

QfdQ025TTrTvTAdWcHUEWw.text: Huge portions!! It's a good thing we shared our plate. Tons of flavor in every bite went about 1130 very busy. Can't even remembered what we order . It had chicken biscuits gravy all over. Ooh man we loved it. The kids menu comes with a cute tractor toy for an extra 4 $ and it looks like the one on your table with all your condiments in it. Great for families and children.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BXBZMgkr1DK8oOUnj-vqDw.text: Food used to be great.  But tonight was a complete disaster. 6 people and only one person enjoyed their food   Must have a new chef

4CVNcBbYomswnXBOPccFHA.text: We were a little offput bu the reviews, but it was close and we were starving. The inside is like a 90s style diner. Probably could use a bit of an update.   The menu is pretty large. Our waitress warned us that if we picked anything, we would probably want to share it. Thank god she told us pr we would have been overwhelmed.   We ordered the chicken fried steak plate. Dang, was it good. It allegedly had sausage gravy, but it tastes like bacon gravy to me. It came with rustic style mashed potatoes (meaning not whipped) that were DELISH.   I do have some gripes which aren't much. The CFS plate comes with green beans, but uou only get like 6-7 green beans. 3 cups of mashed potatoes but only a handful of green beans? And the biscuit. It was so.dry. Painfull dry. Even dousing it in the jelly it was like sand.   Even with the gripes I have to give it 5 stars because of how good it was. My husband honestly wanted to go back the next day and said it was at the top of his CFS list. We are from Texas, so believe me, we know chicken fried steak.

NkT5KlSpWD8dweZqE1qnLg.text: This place. Great prices ESPECIALLY when you see the portion sizes. Food is AMAZING. Just put your name in and wait, you won't regret it. OMG and get a mimosa

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NSXoR4vxbqlJQD6HgIbWbA.text: Loved it for breakfast!! Service was a little slow but we were in no rush. Food came out fast even with it being packed.

ACkcFtFSpH8T8TR0T0cRgQ.text: Ended up here twice on the last trip to Vegas cuz it was in the hotel (The Plaza) & I'd enjoyed HHAGG before.  Second morning in Vegas, ordered "The Basic" with eggs over medium , bacon, griddled mashed potatoes, biscuit & side of gravy.  Breakfast came out with cubed potatoes & when I pointed it out, the runner promptly brought out a side of the smashers...not very griddled but whatever, they were delicious.  Biscuit was a little dry so I was glad I had the gravy for dunking. It also came with marmalade which was pretty tasty.  Breakfast was decent & more than I could eat...this being HHAGG and all.  Dinner the next night was Sage Fried Chicken & Waffles (Two sage fried chicken breasts with hardwood smoked bacon waffle tower, hot maple reduction and fried leeks)  Chicken was tender & juicy with a nice fried crust. It's not boneless...in case that's a make or break for you.  The waffles had a crispy crunch with a fluffy center and BACON!) but needed more syrup, which I got right away upon on request. The syrup reduction tasted more like teriyaki...I wasn't a fan of that or the leeks but that's just me.  Again, too much to eat.  For both meals service wasn't too attentive. They kind of just take your order, check back once shortly after food is served, let you eat your meal then drop off the check. Not a deal breaker for a casino hotel restaurant.  All in all both meals were tasty but I think the main appeal of HHAGG is the huge portions & I'm more of a nibbler. Large servings & buffets are lost on me.  That being said, try it out, the food IS good & if you love hearty portions, THIS is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Chicken &amp; Waffles. In the background is the stuffed meatloaf.

Lgl-HNFfXqZ9xsZHi7HOiQ.text: Amazing food, very generous portions amd super friendly staff. Thank you Christy for your expertise,  everything we had was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGE chicken fried steak!

bYL5PoIOWkKFFTx0pXtGKQ.text: The breakfast items are HUGE and tasty.  I had the Man vs Food famous Sage Fried Chicken Benedict and the sauce was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s Sage Fried Chicken Benedict (back dish)

hXOghWJxmZ4kzsN-JETxDw.text: This is our umpteenth time going here and usually tradition to get the sage fried chicken Benedict or the chicken and waffles. My girlfriend had a coupon and well they didn't honour it on mobile phone so the server told us go upstairs to business centre and well we were charged $3.99 a print out so ended up saving $1 basically but oh well the food was well worth it.  If you can download and print the BOGO dinner but only valid M-F. You basically save about $15-25 depending on what menu items you choose. We were almost there for the happy hour $3,4 drinks and appies!!   We had a reservation which was unfulfilled. The hostess seemed stressed out so we didn't even bother. Reason why I have given Hash House a 3/5 is because of the wait for the food. One entree came and the next came out 36 minutes later. But worst part was to try and pay the bill took 18 minutes timed. I could've been a jerk and just ate and left and not paid.   We had plenty of leftovers because by the tile last entree came we were stuffed from The chicken and waffles, so the bums along Fremont were very happy!   I suggest you make reservation or come early, or else WAIT WAIT WAITTTTTT

D5OnJK6YAUXmmdDgnrPK6g.text: After reading several reviews we decided to split a skillet. The chicken had a lot of dark meat which surprised us. It was nothing special. The salsa they serve with it is actually more like jam and had a very sweet taste as opposed to spicy.   Had to ask for butter for the biscuit since it was not served alongside with it. Server never checked on us to see if we were okay until we were done and he brought our check! I had to ask for more coffee at that point as well. He was apologetic and super friendly though.  Definitely better restaurants in Vegas.

W7ZGSQSnsR88r-MvHScfdQ.text: Absolutely delicious! I was intimidated. But I want for it and I must say, it was awesome. So tasty and filling. I will be back for it among other items I spotted around the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles! Yum!

1NjS88G6acoUpwbSXgo93w.text: This is a review strictly for the service here at this location. Checked in around 1030am on Saturday 6/15. The 2 girls working the front told us it's about a 30-35 minute wait. We said okay and put our names down. We checked back when 40 minutes passed and was told there was only 1 party ahead of us. Time goes by and we see 2 large parties get seated. We checked on our table for the 3rd time for our party of 5, and the girls didn't seem to have an explanation for why we were bumped from the list. We even brought it up that we waited over an hour and that we were told 30-35 minutes. Didn't seem like they knew what they were doing, nor did they care.   After all that we finally get seated on a tiny booth (they put a chair at the end). When our food arrives we mention that this won't all fit on the table and the waitress says "you'll figure it out". There was a bigger table available and no one offered to move us there. Instead they told us to "figure it out".  Such a shame considering the food was good. Won't be returning to this location due to the rudeness and terrible customer service we received. Don't recommend.   The girls working between 1030am-1pm up front need a customer service class, as well as the blonde waitress with the glasses working that shift.

1XSki72ECyu5gEV6-yLFqw.text: Full five stars for this place. I've been hearing about it for years and it did not disappoint. The food is fresh and delicious. I've eaten there four times now and it was great every time. I've sampled the country fried steak, the chicken and waffles, the hammered pork tenderloin and the fried chicken eggs Benedict. I'm not stopping until I try the whole menu. The service is always quick and friendly and the portions are massive. the concepts are unique and the flavors pop. This will be my go-to place to take people who come to visit when I move to NV. Also, their red mashed potatoes are straight crack!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LI7jyAqEBv-UZU12ZrU_cw.text: My husband declared this the worst breakfast he has ever had. I think he was exaggerating. But certainly it was up there. Let's start with our arrival. When we asked for a table for 5, the hostess seemed to move in slow motion, with no mojo, no get up and go. Just like someone might move if they were a robot on the slow setting. I've never seen someone who just didn't bother when people were waiting. She somehow had to look around with her eyes slowly to find a table that was free.   And then we got a table, and we ordered our food, and shame on us for not knowing exactly what we wanted to order the moment the waitress asked. I think this delayed things a bit because she didn't come back after that. No, we were off the radar and we had to wait and wait until we could see her again. And then we ordered and waited more than 45 minutes for our food. It was interminably long. Our waitress disappeared regularly. The coffee guy was consistent, an amazing gem of a man, who was always on the job, ready to fill up our cups.  Now on to the food. My husband hated my food. He said the beef was weird in the hash. He didn't like any of it. I actually really liked my biscuits and gravy. The biscuits are so tall and flaky and delicious - it's a shame that the delivery mechanism to get said biscuits is so poor. My overeasy egg was perfect. It was an overall delicious plate of food so I can't fault them for that and I've given an additional star for that. Oh yes and for the fact that our food arrived hot. I was panicky after reading so many reviews saying their food was cold. Ours was hot! Another worthy star.   One more thought - my son ordered a kid's burger and that didn't include cheese. We didn't think to order it with cheese so when it arrived, it had no cheese. And by the time, we lifted the bun, which revealed no cheese, the waitress was long gone. Well, here's where things went right. We asked another waitress for a slice of cheese to put on the burger. She disappeared and a long period of time followed. Seasons changed. The next fall season of TV shows were revealed and still we waited, but here's the beauty part. When the cheese did arrive, they delivered it hot. It had been melted on the grill and we could actually move the slice onto the burger. No cold slice of cheese to add to a now cold burger that had been sitting with its metaphorical cheese in the wind. Win! And so I bring you a happy ending to what was a rather frustrating breakfast experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle minus one square that was quickly eaten!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage gravy. So good

YciYoFVIR-46CGQJbT3WHQ.text: Terrible service.  We were excited to eat here because my brother had raves about the food.  After we sat, it took 15min for server to come to table.  When they brought our order out, the food runner accidentally dropped my dish on floor.  My wife finished her meal by the time mine was remade.  When my order finally came out it was wrong.  During this entire time, the server hadn't stopped by the table once.  Server (Kristy) did not even offer to discount or comp my dish.

9WympnYogGEwRnSmhqrgdg.text: Great food! Amazing service. My best meal in Vegas! We enjoyed it so much. Short wait, text when table was ready!!! Great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips, guacamole, and salsa
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom &amp; Swiss

26yAA61PO4yXVjqniX47oQ.text: So one of my relatives decided to visit Hash House for brunch. I had been to the other location (at the Linq) maybe 10 years ago. I didn't remember the food being good, just that the portions were ridiculous.  The portions are still ridiculous, and the food is not good. They did a bunch of things that were just meh. Why did they skewer the breakfast steak? Why did they overcook said steak? Why did the salmon scramble contain barely any salmon, and when a piece was found, why was it dry as all hell and super fishy? Why were the dishes brought out at different times so we were stuck waiting for others to get their orders? But hey, I had eggs over hard and they were done correctly.  The only pro was that the service was very good. Though they gave us all biscuits by accident, they quickly fixed this.  I guess if I had to fish for another pro, it's that the portions were huge so the prices were not as outrageous had they been smaller portions. I wouldn't go as far as to say avoid this place at all costs, but to be fair there are plenty of better options for breakfast in this area.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef

swJUooeoT0OjJJyvYhRumg.text: Well I was excited to come here but was very disappointed when we got our breakfast. My bacon avocado and Swiss scramble and her chorizo scramble was not very hot at all. It was actually kind of cold. We told the waitress that our meals were cold and she just brought us out some hot hashbrowns or potatoes. When she came around again we told her that both meals were cold and we want to new hot breakfast meals. Manager came over and asked what the deal is. He told us he would get us some new meals that were hot in 15 to 20 minutes. My scramble came out about 15 minutes later and her scramble came out about five minutes after that. They were both hot this time.  Ron the manger comped both of our meals. Our waitress did not even come back by during our meals to refill our empty water glasses. Oh well so sad. I probably won't go back but the manager did a great job of making us happy.

N6rh26yodBkaQTN1dhh13w.text: My rating is off what I had today. The famous sage chicken and waffles. It was hands down the most flavorful chicken and waffles I have tried. The chicken was crispy and very well and heavily seasoned. The waffles were made with strips of bacon inside of them and were not soggy until Inpoured the warm maple syrup on them. The fried green onions gave for a nice presentation with out an overbearing taste. I loved it.   Also, my server was great too. I forgot his name but he was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finally going to try the FAMOUS CHICKEN AND WAFFLES!! It was amazing and easily shareable.

NuCXR8jL8-va-vbpUWXaPw.text: HUGE HUGE portions! the service was pretty good for a slow monday morning. Coffee was decent and our server was great. However, the food was cold.....i mean its slow the least we can get is hot food. The thing was that the food was actually good, could've been a full 5 star experience if it wasn't cold.  This was the only downfall for me. Bill wasn't too expensive. My wife and I shared the plate.

HuB7deVompyGnOtN6XnHKw.text: WOW!! The portion sizes here are as big as Texas! I couldn't believe the stacks of chicken and waffles brought to the neighboring table! IqqvxjsvY8q3-GayZp5lWg.text: A friend told me this was the best place for breakfast in Las Vegas.  Now I've eaten at some pretty good places so how much better could this be?  Turns out a lot better!  Unless you normally eat a dozen eggs, whole slab of bacon and 12 pancakes, you are in big trouble...LOL!  They have a great selection of foods from their meatloaf omelet to sandwiches and pancakes.  The food is fresh and full of flavor.  For those who enjoy chicken and waffles in the morning, c'mon on down!  Their pancakes are light and fluffy.  As Al Roker said in their menu, "They're bigger than my head!"  Just one 10 inch pancake will be hard to finish let alone 3 of these monsters.  The servers are wonderful and the food comes piping hot.  Speaking of which, their cocoa comes with marshmallows in it.  Real marshmallows and not those little thimble size ones with a rich chocolate flavor.  The dishes are large enough that you can order one plate and share it.  Great place and I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a sample of some great dishes here!!!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N9soYepqYR16fRbvxeTxjw.text: Okay one of the best meals that we had in Vegas. Because we are tourist we didn't realize there was one closer to the our hotel on the strip! But who cares, we took an Uber and enjoyed the ride. This place was packed and I understand why, we sat at the bar and the 2 female bartenders (one had a similar mine, Cherie) are drinks were on point---BLT Bloody Mary (the bacon). We order our food and never expected what was served to us... check out the pics! The portions are large enough to serve 3 people, so share your meals. I will go to Hash House A Go-Go every time I go to Vegas in the future!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT Bloody Mary and a OJ
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Bacon, Bacon.... it tasted like candy to My mouth
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles

OLkxUBny1w0XGpN9COcwgQ.text: First off, it's so nice having a breakfast restaurant available in your hotel. Second, it's so nice it's a Hash House!! Got seated right away. Looked around at a nice clean place where everyone seemed yo be enjoying their breakfast. The waitress was sweet and always there for us. Food was plentiful and tasty-perfect breakfast! No complaints.

kRfQqa0AhmUgCJGrmvJ-BQ.text: I visited this restaurant two years ago today. I had an amazing experience. The service was great and the food was even better. I have never tapped out on food. I suggest ordering the chicken and waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FNCY0nb1Z8kbSa9q8xtNaw.text: The food is good. The portions are from another world! I do not think many (if any) can eat all of it! Had the eggs and chicken benedict,.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs and chicken benedict

CvFaJYBgdZbnWLSH8ibuYQ.text: Amazing food here.  But make sure you are either EXTRA hungry, or you are going to go somewhere you can put your leftovers for later.  Coffee is good, pancakes are good, taters were good.  I wish I would've had more days in Vegas, because I would've gone here several times.  If memory serves, and to be honest it was a little fuzzy at that time, I got a Tractor combo with blueberry flapjack and lemon curd.  I remember it being incredibly delicious.  It was SO good.  Everyone else's food was good as well, and the portions are ridiculous.  I know it's their thing, but I kinda hope they box up left overs for homeless people.  hah   Certainly go, this makes the short list.

ssQkEKOMOd0SDyWNI1OrJg.text: My sage fried chicken Benedict was amazing!  Portions here are HUGE!  I wouldn't recommend the stuffed burger.  It was very bland!  Also the BBBLT was plain and was totally shut down by my sage fried chicken Benedict plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super huge portions!  This was the Sage Fried Chicken Benedict which was yummy!

UB37AhDnIKHghXLaHv2xDw.text: Best drinks ever! The super nova, Bloody Mary and kiwi watermelon are winners and the staff are great too. Hearty breakfasts are served so come hungry or share a skillet.  Chicken and waffles are always a treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Supernova!

ErbHfRXpP2EazLH7w8-_Yw.text: This place was mediocre. The food was just, well...food. Nothing to really be to excited about. There was really nothing wrong either, it just didn't "wow" us. It was clean and the staff was friendly. Everyone was smiling and attentive. It's OK but probably would pick a different place if I had other options.

6pDLg6iy4wjTV6rf9fTgIg.text: Decor is interesting, and they bill themselves as 'farm food with a twist' or something like that.  That translates into 'everything we serve is so freaking big you won't ever finish it, so just get over it'.   I ordered the BBBLT with a salad and could only eat the side salad and took the entire monstrosity of a sandwich on the plane ride home.   Ross got the cheddar, avocado, and hardwood bacon-stuffed burger, with fries.  HUGE and delish and he didn't finish it all.    Both sandwiches came with a huge steak knife stuck in the middle, guess to keep everything in place during transit.    Overall, I'd go back - would like to try their breakfast next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar, Avocado and bacon stuffed burger with fries
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBBLT  with salad - HUGE

L6Uf3RfoAbUt6Wo7NcR1kQ.text: I was very disappointed with our meal at this restaurant. Not only was it an inconvenient walk from our hotel room, but it was very hard to get connected to the restaurant. Once I did call, the man who took my order was incredibly friendly and when I picked up my food he was very helpful and made sure to label everything and included extra sauces and utensils.  The food was okay. My Caesar salad was a definite disappointment. The dressing was horrible, the chicken was good, and the lettuce was warm and on the verge of wilting. My boyfriend ordered Andy's Sage Fried Chicken & Bacon Waffle. It was all right, but was over-priced.

AMQ9Y63gva7D5Q3qgADzpw.text: Our second visit to the Hash House and it was well worth it! The portions are HUGE (bring a friend and share)...... Prices are good.  Wished I had known they had a Gluten Free menu. Instead I ordered what I thought would have been GF and asked for no bread. Come to find out, they do offer GF bread. Wish our waiter would have asked/said something when I modified my order.  Would recommend every day!

6P2wu5o5KsUK_eAPeCpi1w.text: The food is enough for 2. I ordered the grilled cheese with bacon and tomatoes. It was awesome. The fries were hot and fresh and the spicy bar b que sauce around the plate was spicy. Our waitress Monique was very friendly and attentive. Always making sure we had everything we needed.   We don't get to Vegas very often but when we do we always come here for a meal

kyceiv5Jt2qUe7UbV3mspg.text: The food was great. If you want pancakes I advise you to share with someone because they are HUGE!

48ju6_dw_BH4FCYo0F6gQA.text: Located in The Plaza Hotel Casino in Downtown Las Vegas. So this place is a little nuts. The portions are huge. With all of that the food is great and interesting. I had the duck breast it was a little chewy but still very good. The only issue is the price of drinks, they are downtown (otherwise known as the land of cheep drinks) and they should drop the prices accordingly. If you find yourself downtown and want something fun give this place a whirl. Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili Crusted Duck Breast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now that&#39;s what I call a biscuit!

CsE2VrxVih-VeGFNCjN3Mg.text: This place is a must whenever I visit Vegas. Massive portions of delicious food for reasonable prices. The Sage-friend chicken and waffles are my go-to dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nVepcanlsWQrFC12EWZ1MQ.text: Good was good. It's no lie that the portions are huge. They mean it. Unless you're a competitive eater, share.   The waitstaff was a little lacking. But friendly. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Benedict.

bcUb5YxlHaPE43FsxW-fSA.text: They gave me a water and when I was about to take a sip, I saw a lipstick mark on my cup smh. NASTY

DXjotJkBZIUydqQSpITpkA.text: I thought from the pictures and description that this place was going to be great. Not so. A lot of the hashes and food is dry, it needs like a sauce or cream to make things better. The service wasn't great.   There are too many other breakfast places to go to in Vegas, I won't return.

wT39fU8e-VSpifbPekeIyQ.text: The Food was okay...and the waitress was nice, but the hosts and the servers were terrible.  I went to the restroom to find that my party had been seated so I asked the hostess where my party (gave her the name) was seated, she gave me the side eye  and said "I don't know, go inside and look."  When the food arrived the server so clumsily placed a plate with a pancake and eggs on the table that the mini pitcher of syrup on top of the pancake toppled over and spilled into my friend's lap. The server just stood there as my friend and I were scrambling to grab the two napkins on the table to wipe syrup off clothes, arms, fingers and the table.  I said "can we get some more napkins!!??" She said Oh ok...came back a few minutes later with a small towel to wipe the table...to which I replied "syrup is all over our clothes, I need a damp towel and more napkins because we used them all trying to clean up your mess!" When she finally came back with the towel and napkins she asked if we needed a new pancake....in my head I'm thinking are you serious right now?...but I said "well as you can see all of the syrup spilled...so no we don't need another pancake but can you bring some more syrup" "ooh!" She replied "ok!"   Needless to say I will not be going back.

H1cB4V2tF2TvsNlXk4DMhg.text: Gotta stop here every time I see Vegas! I wish we had one in the DC area! Good service, great food and drink selections.   Pistachio Mint Iced Coffee 6.99 Electric Blue Lemonade 9.99 Salmon Scramble 13.99 Snickers Pancake 8.99   43.20 plus tax

0RBmRnh8b0HyORYsEkbVDQ.text: Although the portion sizes and bloody Mary's are amazing here, the service is very much lacking. My boyfriend and I ordered dessert and breakfast as our entrees and they brought out my breakfast first, but never brought out my boyfriends breakfast as it "took longer to cook". They ended up comping the breakfast and both of our drinks, but still.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody mary and electric lemonade. And yes, the glasses are slanted if you pay extra for the signature glasses
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scramble

FnPywO4TMjnBykgDE_dVDg.text: I dont know how they do it but no other place can u get so much DELICIOUS food at such i low price. I go to Vegas every month and this is always our go to place. The service is wonderful and they give u way to much food.I just wish that they had half portions available i feel so bad about the amount of food that gets wasted here its ashame. We've had breakfast,lunch and dinner here never a bad experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hella burger and fries
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. God i think she had some kind of tenderloin
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think this was a chicken fried steak

-O8GqD2W5f3l8m0GaU5z0w.text: Very good. We had a large party of rowdy adults and our server played along very well. The food was really good. The portions are very big and can probably be split between two people unless they're hearty eaters.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flapjack, 14&#34; of flapjack !!

rogtA1lV-dWswkjLmKdM7Q.text: When in Vegas this is the place to go or be for breakfast or brunch. Great food, huge portions, cool place to hang out. We go every year.

uXwT3Arz8ZjfqoguM28V0Q.text: WOW!!!! Thia was by far the best place I had eaten during my week long stay in Las Vegas. Our server Roberto was spot on. Actually out of the whole week the best server we had our entire trip. Try the meatloaf sandwich xoxoxo amazing!!! The chicken and waffles by far one of the largest meals I have eaten.  But I got a box to take it home. It was just so good I couldn't leave it there to waste. One meal is enough to share. This hidden gem is a must try along with the Freemont Experience. Best day ever I must say!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picture doesn&#39;t compare to taste. Best meal ever!!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cGiX-bBIFhfTlj2tvt_s3g.text: good service.  expensive for good-quality edibles rendered .  many choices on the menu.  even their spectacular big biscuts couldn't render a 4star

zKpNtsTlSOVBVbma73c44g.text: I love this place!!! Ever since I saw this on man vs food I had to try it. The first thing I got of course was the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken I tell you what one of the best things I've eaten in awhile. I've been there 3 times so far and have never had a problem with service or wait staff. I've also indulged my craving with the Apple Cinnamon pancakes yum yum! I recommend you try it at least once. Not everyone has the same experience as the next person but from my experience so far not a bad one.

nVjMzWVqJpLouH58zTwriw.text: Terrible customer service. I asked to substitute toast or a biscuit for eggs because of an egg allergy & they refused. They said I could order lunch instead (all breakfast entrees came w/ 2 eggs). Or they said they would leave the eggs off and I could pay $4.50 to my $13 breakfast to add a biscuit. The manager was rude & not concerned about losing our business over substituting a five cent piece of toast for 2 eggs. My party of 4 walked out & will never go back. It's obvious they prey on one-time tourists & don't care about keeping local repeat customers. Additional side note: the casino is gross -- u will leave reeking of cigarettes, parking was horrendous, location was scary.

g_fxSM6ZgqUODySTZzvvhg.text: Went here mainly because my boyfriend and I were craving some chicken and waffles. Super large portions, good price, food tasted pretty good too. The restaurant itself was pretty home-y (although it could have gone better if the tables didn't resemble medical tables, but I'm just nit-picking here), and our server made sure we felt right at home. The reason for the three stars is that I've only tried one dish, but I will be coming back!

cCytY_YB0wGzNj7u8gEYcQ.text: Love this place!! The bacon waffle has strips of bacon, not bits like other places.

FanCCvk8w4U4hC_fjTF4xw.text: Our party of four visited the Hash House twice.  Breakfast and Lunch.  The burgers were touted by the waiter as, "the best we would ever eat."  A bold claim, unjustified by the finished result!  The burgers are huge, and that's all.  The two patties were both cooked bone-dry.  I had to remove one so I could choke down the other.  The seasoning and additions did nothing to make up for the overcooked meat.  We decided to try breakfast another day.  Once again, the huge portions did not disguise the trend toward over-cooking here.  I have had Denny's breakfasts better prepared.  It may be a problem of this particular location, but with all the options available in Vegas, you could only do better anywhere for the price.

tkf7l47M0SOO-o8QHymzOA.text: Um... YES!!! How awesome that they opened another Hash House on Fremont!!! (inside the Plaza Casino) The food quality and portions will blow your freaking mind! EAT HERE NOW! (thank me later)

TdfQPyDiv8pRXFNrRklI4Q.text: Food is always great here, portion sizes are enough to share. Service has been a little off with our last two visits.

CQyzx6Kt0OS_OM6TbYYauQ.text: Dishes are huge so better to share with someone! We ate andy's sage benedict eggs (or something like this) and it was really good...Orange juice not that good though

k86KPo3pl5t08fi_araM6Q.text: Wait way too long for mediocre food and moderate service to iffy service.  Not to mention LOUD.  I get that it's Vegas in a casino, but c'mon.  Too loud to even talk normally.  Not worth a special trip.

AwUdeKvMFumMhgaOxrvPnA.text: With New Years 2012 at a close, where to eat with a mild hangover?  THIS PLACE!  Portions are HUGE and the presentation is awesome.  3 people ate and left thanking the hangover gods for bestowing Hash House upon us!  I had the french toast, with some sort of mashed potato thing that was awesome and I think something else came with it, but what can I say, the night before was rough making my memory a little hazy.   If you had a great or rough night of drinking in Vegas, you too will thank the hangover gods for Hash House!

q9kWyKFH-W23T4KkhTuvcQ.text: This place absolutely rules. I got the man vs food favorite and it was the breakfast of dreams

I7tvWSXZ5X57L0SD4r6WnQ.text: Food was delicious, portions are huge, staff was friendly.  I had the pan seared chicken and I would definitely recommend it. I can't wait to go back and try something different.

DOZWVKN2n4CAp7mtkhxiaw.text: I've eaten at Hash House A Go Go on the strip & it was awesome but the one  downtown has the WORST service ever. Not busy but we waited 10 min for a hostess. Another wait to clean a table. Greeted by a lackadaisical waitress who was smacking gum. Took our drink order, brought us cold coffee & hot orange juice. A full 10 min later she takes our order.  We wait & wait, no warm up on my coffee offered. The MANAGER brings my husband's order & leaves. 10 minutes later my food has not arrived and my husband's is cold because he refuses to start eating without me, plus his order is wrong. Another 5 minutes, gum smacker shows up, says she will bring more coffee. Where's my food? She will check. More waiting, finally back with her gum a snacking and her attitude  ugly, says my food will be right out! I don't know when my order came because we left as did the couple across from us that was also waiting, watching & waiting some more.  We went across the street to Duprey's where we were greeted, seated, served and stuffed in 20 minutes. Great pancakes. Our waitress was a doll. Do not go go to Hash House A Go Go. Skip it & go to Duprey's.

BiKYXDSBwlXaBpHyvjC8JQ.text: My husband and I went for breakfast. The first time we both had the basic breakfast and everything was great. The service was very attentive and we were so pleased we decided to visit again.  Unfortunately, we did not have a great experience the 2nd time. I ordered two side orders...biscuit and gravy and scrambled eggs. My husband ordered oatmeal. After about 10 mins. a couple came in, were seated, ordered, and received their meals of pancakes before we got our food.  Our server never said a thing as to why our food was taking so long. He came with more coffee, but it was cold. When the food did arrive, I asked why the food took so long and he said they had to bake the biscuits.  Are you kidding me?  Needless to say, we will never go to this place again. Not worth it...there are plenty of other places looking for business.

dNZ9jzyY5KAdlWqOAnsVvA.text: I ate at the Sahara location years ago and remember it being very delicious & a nice menu of different items to choose from. Well a few months back I tried the downtown location and was truly disappointed. Food was not as good as I remembered and service was horrible. I don't think I will be eating at this location again.

kSpEp-hcjX1Y43TGCRTx_w.text: I'm really bummed to give this two stars.  I've been coming to this location since it opened.  I go once every couple of months, but I won't be returning.  It seems that the food quality declines every time I go.  Yesterday, my salad had a few brown, wilting leaves.  The biscuit was delicious, as usual, but they no longer keep the peach jam on the table.  I had to ask the server.  The server finally brought one little side of the jam, even though both my husband and I had a biscuit.  Overall, the service was slow, the food was meh, and I won't be going back.

S-Uy-Nmwkz119dUW1Ygiyg.text: Had a late night breakfast at Hash House a Go Go and my first experience was very good!  I ordered the pancake and a side order of fries!  My boyfriend ordered the cob salad and his brother ordered the grilled cheese with tomato and avocado.  Our server, Melissa was very pleasant and delivered the drinks and food in a prompt manner.  Portions were huge!!! The food tasted so good and very reasonably priced!  We will be returning for sure!

zPyvfGJhn0eGH505rRePkw.text: A nice change of pace to get some HH food without waiting forever at their W Sahara location.  Same menu, same big portions, service could have been a little better, but it wasn't terrible.

9geVZHxy6Hd_B7XAgjRceg.text: First let me say the food was great. I had a large group from out of town that wanted to eat downtown and I suggested hash hash a go go. When we went to settle up instead if asking for separate checks(pain in the @$!) I asked the waiter to apply cash a a specific amount on my credit card. He made a mistake and charged my card three times the amount. He fixed it and we left giving him a 20% cash tip. To my surprise the initial charge was taken/held from my bank and when calling the manager Leilani she was not pleasant. I am very patient and she interrupted me and basically said call your bank on Monday and they will release the hold. She gave the obligatory I'm sorry but was rude and said we hold 20% on top of the total regardless.. we left our server cash. If you are going to hire people in a management role hash hash make sure they receive empathy training because this manager was void of it! What if I really needed that money over the weekend? Not returning to this location.

hklAJQrogMEnLIVvv98Sxw.text: Everything is really, really good. My favorite is the sage chicken benedict, but I've also had the tenderoin, home made corned beef hash (so delicious!), chicken and waffles....delicious.  My husband was not impressed with the chicken pot pie but everything else has been really unique and tasty.  We took friends who also raved.

GCGldQ-uPtkTCW3fFGFbRg.text: love this place.. always have had a good experience.  plus portions are outrageous but food is still good.

H-9JNjXXO2kZc4gxqPu6cA.text: Stopped in for some breakfast/brunch on our first morning in Vegas. My friend had been before and said she was craving it - so we visited.   My first impression was that the restaurant was dirty. The carpet looked old and the menus were a bit rough/worn out. It was also very HOT in the restaurant. Their air conditioning did not seem to be working properly. We had to ask to be moved to another section of the restaurant.  The prices were pretty standard for Vegas $10-20 for each meal. I ordered "The Basic" which came with sausage, toast, eggs and grits. All were pretty good. My sausage was very tender and flavorful. The grits were not bad, but not as good as we make them in Charleston!  My friend ordered the Farmer's Breakfast (?) which came with a MASSIVE pancake - one that we split. It was pretty good but I found it was tough to cut...a bit rubbery. Not fluffy.  I will say, our waitress was completely on her game - always quick with the refills, extra napkins, clearing plates and bringing the check. She was a star.  I'd probably visit again if I was nearby, but I would not make an effort/go out of my way for it.

AKTrYuau6IxUGK41SqdBqw.text: Huge portions, share share share! So good, great flavor in glorious proportions! Take a friend or mate to experience it with you. Take a ton of pictures too. The staff is so welcoming and the food is fast and hearty- I would recommend this place to anyone staying in Fremont or on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YVW6DQxmqss1zrkMkLPEUg.text: Wow - everyone talking about the large portions are correct!  And I guess since I'm repeated it, it must be that overwhelming when you see the plate of food placed in front of you.  Keeping the review short - the food is all farm grown and very fresh.  For example, their apple juice is freshly made so it's cloudy with a little bit of pulp - kind of like fresh squeezed orange juice.  It's not bad mind you, just stating a fact.    The food we has was delicious though.  Eggs were especially good probably due to being fresh from the farm!  Service was as good as you would expect.

HmXKv5TtmgyA0sPSiSDIDg.text: We went here to celebrate my brothers birthday Father's Day and it was a great great choice. I've only been here once before but that was several years ago I am glad that we came back. Our server Christy(or Kristen) was awesome! She was very pleasant and funny!! We went for breakfast/brunch and I must say their menu is unlike any other. It's very over-the-top and tons of food which is awesome! You totally get what you pay for and I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-VDtlOfNGx27hgKEYoN4lw.text: Great place for breakfast. Serving sizes are generous. I recommend getting the hash which comes with eggs, fruit and biscuit/jam.  Cappuccino was artful and tasty. Good beer selection. Perfect for dining alone or with others. Wait staff is friendly.

16FvvzMCqDcimn7eGqcbKA.text: Food here was amazing. Great prices, HUGE servings. We tried the meatloaf hash, avocado scramble, French toast, and the huge famous chicken dish. Everyone in the group loved their meal. Also the watermelon kiwi drink was very sweet, but very good. I got the non-spiked version but I bet the spiked is out of this world!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ECLMm19JCFfKDiDBHyqcqQ.text: My son and I were staying at The Plaza so we decided to have thanksgiving dinner here.  The food is good with large portions,  but I felt it was extremely overpriced for what we got.  $18 for turkey and stuffing?  Wow.

BXuDm7FwMfEv2O1qwnLj9Q.text: So good! Everything I hoped for and more! This was my first visit to the Las Vegas location. Great service and food, just like the Dallas location. Our server, Rebecca, was great. She had a quirky, Vegas vibe that added to the experience.  The quality of the food is consistent. We couldn't eat it all (of course), but that was never the goal.  We had candied bacon, chicken and waffles and biscuits and gravy. Everything was hot and delicious.

DD2kyCc7Thd45c9EYbXuwQ.text: We first learned of Hash House A Go Go at their original spot in San Diego it is small but very well set up. We have eaten at the ones in Vegas even the now-defunct one at the M Casino they are always great experiences the food is huge and beautifully prepared. The service is always good to Great and the prices are adequate considering the size I would definitely suggest one entree per 2 people if not 4 people. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars as the restaurant smells so badly of smoke from the casino and actually worse than that it's perfume smoke as they must be pumping some kind of perfumy air out to cover the smoke smell which actually makes it worse

KJhKGQGi-2nBLokwQKpdRg.text: Service was great. They were quick and friendly. The only thing is you have to pay for parking (@ the Plaza Hotel) portions were super huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tnhQ5fqkgT2aVF7ak6PzzQ.text: I had higher expectations for this place. I've seen it on TV and thought it looked amazing. It was just okay. We might have ordered the wrong thing (a scramble and a hash) but it didn't live up to the hype.

pYGsGZWZemIV-fJ7ZCOypQ.text: Hash house never disappoints. Every since I saw the episode on man vs food I knew I had to try it. I ate this location before but never did a review. So I went a second time and they deserve the 5. Ordered the sage fried chicken . The sauce and mash potatoes next level. The portions next level lol. At the airport now and still eating my food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a1tQvTgtEsfrWtup4C8JKQ.text: My mouth is too small!! Couldn't fit all of the food in!! I'm all seriousness though, the wait times are a bit excessive. I don't know that any pancake or waffle is worth an hour wait. Xoxo EatWithReese

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vneD68ra1zOkPwjIcM7xZw.text: Not happy with the way this company treated us as consumers. Called from the other side of town in bumper to bumper traffic after calling first to get information about wait times and was turned away. They say someone right in front of me and said they couldn't seat me. So upsetting. One more party if two people would not have changed one thing. Such a disappointment.

mxfqUUTkQE99_jKBz2QfEg.text: If you want huge, gigantic, farm-sized breakfast or lunch this is your place.  I wasn't hung over, but I can imagine this is the place to cure that too.    I looked at the table beside us and a lady ordered a country fried steak, one of my personal favorites.  It was enormous and I am not exaggerating that.  I chickened out, and ordered their take on a Reuben with their hash, omg, it was huge and good.  I actually had to make a strategic choice to either consume the meat or the bread.  Otherwise, I was going to leave something on the plate.

VvDT2fXiq9M5FzWfKM5srw.text: This was just a place we found while waiting to check in. The staff was friendly when we entered very early in the morning. My wife and I began with a delicious and spicy HH Bloody Mary. Large and flavorful. Beware: plates are very large. In fact, they get larger as the day gets longer. I had the corned beef hash and it was tender, spiced great and almost put me in a food coma. My wife had the steak and eggs that were cooked well, with a side of mashed hashed. She was pleasantly satisfied. They have fun food menu items that won't disappoint. The serving size is remarkable. One plate can feed at least two.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash House a Go Go
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef with eggs and hash
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs with mashed hash

EdVMqSb8KsY5GFrho_saVQ.text: This is one of the better spots on the strip where breakfast is done right. Big generous servings (some of those plates can feed two people) and great tasting. Their Mexican breakfast selection is pretty authentic(I'm Mexican so I know) and their flap jacks are puffy and baked very evenly. The menu is very expanded and definitely gives IHOP and Dennys a run for their money. They're open 24hrs and that's very convenient. It's inside the Linq casino. Sorta hidden but not a total labyrinth.

1KqYD_r3fa8NELdXv_xxgA.text: I have never had Waffles and Pancakes until I visited this place. Whoa ! Who knew it could be that good, I always thought it was an odd combination but it works. You can't beat bacon INSIDE a waffle, right ?

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RyP4Dcf86_YKixa9lEE3dA.text: If you are staying at the Plaza (or just near Fremont St) EAT HERE! It's soooooooo so so good! Ginormous burgers, amazing fried chicken, huge portions and decently priced! Dinner can get a little more pricey but almost everything is under $20. Our server Monique was so sweet and funny and took great care of us. I would stay at Plaza again just to be near this restaurant. It's a meal I'll remember for a while!

KdoTyALNyTHHzuM90zpczw.text: Hash House A Go Go's an America Sports Bar. Spacious. Great for groups. Loud ambiance. They're famed for great signature drinks: cocktails and mocktails. I ordered a high seller, which was delicious.   Also, they're memorable for their sage fried chicken too. It's on a souvenir T-shirt this month only.   Tiffany was my waitress. I probably drove her up the wall. She was so patient with me too... Their avocado toast is considered noteworthy and preferred over the salad choices. However, the macaroni 'n cheese wins over the avocado toast. I ordered sides: house salad with mac 'n cheese.  The side salad was a 2-cup salad with cucumber ranch. Their dressing was flavorless. The macaroni was fantastic.They have better things on the menu... However, I cane seeking a light vegetarian meal and found it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash house side salad
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &#39;n cheese side
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table dressings

Ru1un7aY8kkDXnCY-hGfIw.text: The service was good, but I wasn't impressed with what I ordered.  I felt like some fries. (Yeah, I know I should watch where those fries land.) on the advice of the server, I went with the blue crab sandwich. It looked good, but I found it too "bready" for my taste. The lettuce could have been crisper as well.   The fries however, were en pointe!   Presentation was good until I saw the wilted lettuce.  I also ordered some kind of tea with vodka....hard pass on that as well as the sandwich.   I saw a line there today after church; I may give their breakfast a try tomorrow & will update.  Weeeeellll I had breakfast there. All I can say is the the food was tasteless. The biscuit was large - but not good. The egg was okay (after all it was only an egg) and the eggs were plentiful but not seasoned. The bacon was crisp -- just like I like it (almost burnt).  That's just me and my weird tastebuds.   The highlight was the grapefruit mimosa.  That's a real winner. If I EVER go back, it will be for the mimosa ONLY.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basic breakfast with the biggest biscuit I&#39;ve ever seen
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue crab sandwich with fries. In the background was some kind of tea with vodka.

ANNIGuDVQOymW4aTe-BoIw.text: PROS: Great happy hour speacialS $5 apps and $3 drinks  Staff is supper friendly and generous Food very tasty and comes out quick and hot  The guacamole and chips are the best for $5 Huge bucket of crispy fries  Clean place  Great drinks  CONS : Bar is small only a few seats to sit on Must eat AT THE BAR to get the happy hr deal Fries pickles not worth the price. You only get 5 slivers

lQqs52U5VutbVL3iZhTHig.text: All hype and no flavor. I think people just like the huge portions and the amazing plating. I got the fried green tomato stack and I would have been happier if they kept they chicken salad portion because it lacked and did nothing to help the tomatoes. The good service and Happy Hour prices saved this from being a 1 star experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried green tomato stack
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink menu is extensive

nU8ettyllZkPk56PHE5DOg.text: Got a coupon in the mail so decided to try out this location of Hash House a Go Go. The restaurant is fairly spacious and the interior farm-themed.  The menu is extensive as always, with breakfast, lunch, and dinner items served all day. Prices are on the higher side, but remember that the portions here are gigantic. I eat a fair amount and even I always have leftovers.  The food is tasty with good flavors. The sage chicken and waffles were good, though I would prefer slightly crispier waffles and maple over plain syrup. The burger was huge and included two patties, but the meat was a bit dry/overcooked. I don't consider the dishes here mind-blowing, but this chain is definitely known in Vegas. This location is also standalone and not located inside a casino.  Service during this meal was genuine, warm, and very attentive. The waitress checked on us regularly and was excellent.  Overall, a solid dining establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #2 Twisted Burger.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage chicken and waffles.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior.

yWH78G16UrN9NFasGuFrXA.text: This is a go to place for us in Vegas. Portions are too big but service is great. We were seated immediately at 9. Our server misty was exceptional.  Totally recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Share plates.  No extra fee

fyZxlXMKMuu439ojmfYIEg.text: Ok, how excited was I when I opened the menu and saw NEW- Chilaquiles.  Ok I'll tell you.  Damn! I was excited.  Even though my server didn't talk them up too much, I went for it.  And glad I did.   These things were piled high with goodness.  Nice and tender pork, eggs, guacamole and other nuggets of love.  give these a little mix to bring all the flavorful goodness together and you might just fall in love! Thank you HH for renewing my faith in humanity!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash House Chilaquiles.  These things were awesome!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What, what, what?   Ok, now I&#39;m excited.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q408Wv07JL-MjzKlERimog.text: The portions are middle America portions! It can feed a family of 4. That said, the food is delicious if you want to soak up all that alcohol. Or if you want to drink and eat more, their drinks menu is pretty nice.  There's a nice selection of mary's too like the bacon mary. There's also a show of drunken white gurls crying if you come around 2/3 AM.

ClpzB9zyP_2va4O9d1zWjQ.text: Short wait, 10 minutes on a Tuesday morning. Misty, our server was fun and full of energy. Crab cakes were wonderful. Huge portions so my sister and I shared.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake Benedict

mAc0BQsGdpsp7rTFdyUV_Q.text: Good for a picture. Bad for your taste buds.   Known for its VERY LARGE portions of breakfast food, there always seems to be a long wait. Which is why I opted out my first few trips to Vegas. So imagine the disappointment when I waited so long to try somewhere that was such a letdown.   First, the restaurant itself is fine and wait staff is ok. It sort of reminds me of a Denny's but the atmosphere is a little nicer.   They call their fare 'Twisted Farm Food' and that's accurate with things like the 'BLT Mary' that is a Bloody Mary inspired by a BLT with a piece of lettuce bacon and tomato in it.   Ok so I have to just ask. Why is everything doused in sage? And when I say 'doused' .. I mean it. We ordered the fried chicken and eggs with the 'famous fried chicken and waffles' .. which yes ... they say 'sage' in the description but I couldn't have known it meant you'd essentially be eating sage with chicken and waffles for texture. It was just so bad.  On that note. The alcohol was good. Maybe that's the catch.  Excessive drinking in Vegas leads to the huge portions looking appetizing and being so drunk you don't necessarily care about flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak

vNdW8zXynQ4Yey97OPwDrw.text: This place is a highly recommendation from me for breakfast!!  The tractor driver is what I had and it was HUGE!!!  The pancakes are bigger then normal but delicious! Salad bowls come out huge as well, I saw from a neighboring table.  The price of the food is worth it and I will definitely be going back to enjoy more of the menu options.  Our waiter kept checking on even though he was busy with his section being full.  He kept our glasses full and asked if we needed more time to finish our food and if our food was prepared to our liking and if we needed to-go boxes.  I don't remember our waiters name but he really was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L0IZ5U8dl3cx20NCaqPqPw.text: Not exactly in the nicest part of town but unlike the other locations there was no wait. I was so happy to not have to wait 45 minutes. I had to split the chicken and waffles with my mom it was such a huge portion. The fried chicken was done well and quite tasty. My mom enjoyed the fact that there were slices of bacon cooked into the waffles. On the downside, she was served non hot coffee. My Dad's homemade corned beef hash was really good. There was cheese cooked in it and the biscuit was gigantic. My son had a bowl of Cheerios. You can't really mess that up. We had a nice experience here. The food was served quickly which was helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles. (Waffles have bacon slices cooked inside)

9ZFSx14bsuJYwe2OlDdCqA.text: Always super awesome. Food is so good and big and delicious and and and. I bring new friends here every time I'm in Vegas and everyone always falls in love. Must stop.

cEG2Q5Y1q4Zaz141gvKJkg.text: Met up with some friends here before we donated to the Vegas betting system. We had eaten before but something caught my eye. Meat candy!! Sweet glazed thick delicious bacon. This establishment is worth coming to just for that! So I obliged my heart and gut and was a happier guy after this experience. Really, try it. Eat a vision doesn't compare to the actual experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Candy!!

LPjUVq4-MlWKQhqQB265DA.text: This is one of our go to chains in Vegas. Ideal for first time visitors, you really get the grand Vegas experience with their outlandish portions and great presentation. Service is good, food ready quickly and any dish can easily be shared so don't let the prices scare you off. Their famous chicken and waffles is a must, they have plenty of options and a wonderfully diverse menu for everyone. Worth checking out!

mrcAVYIWpEuA1kXBJDYTaA.text: This restaurant is located at the Plaza. Walked by it a few times throughout our stay in Vegas.  Finally decided to try this place out and im sure glad we did.  We were here for happy hour di we ordered some stuff off the happy hour menu.  We had bud lights but it comes in bottles di the server was nice to pour it for us.   I have to say I think my eyes was bigger then my stomach which is always my problem.  I always order do much food but we barely eat half.  The chicken tenders in the bucket was 5 bucks that's darn good deal.  It was moist and juicy and it looked so cute in the silver bucket. We also shared the twisted burger. It was enough for us to share.  Cooked perfectly to my tasting.  The mac and cheese could've been a little more cheesier if that's even a word lol. It just looked so plain.   The Cesar salad was also good the dressing was delicious.  Service was okay our server could've checked iiib us more.  We'r wanted another dub nook but we were ask done with the meal so I've decided to skip it.   We will come back and bring a group of friends to try different things of the happy hour menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XAvMRPkVXZxMOyKsPJRgGQ.text: I love hash house.   The food is great! The service is always great! Everything is massive and they have such a huge variety on their menu you can find something for everyone. Their breakfast quesadilla and grilled cheese are some of the best I've ever had. It's really hard venturing to other menu items when these two are always so solid and delicious.  Last time I was in Vegas, we stayed at the Golden Gate Hotel and ate here way more then I thought we would. Nothing is overpriced. You pay for exactly what you get. Quality and all. The drinks are even great! I love that they have so many options and even fun / funny drinks (such as PBR in a paper bag, etc.) The bacon bloody mary is amazing as well.   I HIGHLY RECOMMEND hash house if you have never been or even if you've been a million times. This location is great and gets busy, but i feel like it's never busy enough where the wait isn't worth it.

JYTiU8Gtq47nwUAc-N7jLg.text: This place is absolutely incredible. I wish I lived closer by so I could come here ALL THE TIME for breakfast. It is seriously so good. I went with my family and every single one of us were seriously satisfied with our food. The portions are so, so huge, and you definitely get your money's worth because of how giant the portions are.  I ordered the chocolate chip flapjack, which came with syrup and butter. It was so fluffy and light, and cooked perfectly. I also got a double shot of espresso Mocha, and it came in the cutest mug and was so good. I would definitely come here again, even though I ate so much my stomach hurts! So worth it. PS; our waitress was so sweet and awesome. She recommended food to us, which was definitely helpful with so many options.

WLC0QJk3zWz3i4yeMBhMbg.text: After our terrible experience at Denny's we needed a good place for breakfast and we definitely found it here. Our waitress was on point! She took excellent care of us and everyone else around. The biscuits and gravy was outstanding! I'd give all 5 but the Chilaquiles bowl was awful. Perhaps my fault for ordering a Mexican dish at a more traditional food restaurant.  Overall amazing experience, I'd absolutely recommend and we'll definitely be back!

la5bkVUxMUd3F2ZmMGHfeg.text: This place never disappoints. I've eaten several different things here and they were all good.  The portions are so big, they are easily shared.  The location on The Strip always has a wait, but the location Downtown we were able to be seated right away! Service was good.

YJiccl8UT_xv-heeovs4UQ.text: Had breakfast here for our last day in Vegas.  This place was recommended by our friends from Alaska . We had the Man vs Food breakfast special... it was excellent! Service was a little slow but once they Took our order they were attentive after that! I would definitely come back and recommend this place to everyone that is by the Fremont area in Vegas.

uGDn7km6sXBQ8NlAC3chhg.text: Brunch was amazing! I mean the banana French toast was mmmmmm so good and it was a huge portion like Texas style !! Topped with Toasted pecans and baked banana !!I mean you can't go wrong getting this !! My cousin got the waffles and chicken which was two big chicken Brest and 4 waffles !
