UvMuov3t-blHHyP3hbYQww.text: The food as always is great, But the kitchen sent out 1 part of our meal, before the rest. The server was fun. And the drinks refreshing!

pNSYwY-EZ-3FcM__7oLL8g.text: This place is amazing! Huge portions. Never finished my Sage fried chicken Benedict....maybe a 1/4! But so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage Fried Chicken Benedict

WAWhTFc2p7FQ0XSZJYJazg.text: Good food! Kind of overpriced and the servings were huge...share with someone and you'll be good! Drinks are fine and it was a cool experience.

UCtlzjcW4xiNrZrbhPre-w.text: After watching Man V. Food- Las Vegas, I knew that this breakfast experience was going to be like no other. And oh-my-gawd... the food and the portion could easily feed a village.  The entrees were enormous (3 people barely finished 1!!!), and the flavors were just as bold.  I now understand why Adam looked like he died and gone to heaven, because the twisted food was beyond amazing.   Ordering Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict was a no brainer since it was the focal point on Adam's trip. And boy, it was nothing short of steller. The nutty corn-flake breading and thick creamy gravy over the bed of mashed potatoes and buttery biscuit was lethal.  It belongs in it's own category. Deadly, but totally worth it!

_bvE7J0cQ8e_LYsPjQEn9Q.text: Hash House a Go Go is one of the top brunch spots in Las Vegas, specializing in massive portions of fresh from the farm food with unique culinary twists. And ever since it's feature on Man v. Food, it's become a destination spot for curious foodies like myself. So I couldn't resist this and made then my first choice for breakfast when staying downtown.  After much deliberation of the many wonderful-sounding breakfast items, I went for the item they tout as their best-known item, and the one that was featured on Man V. Food - the Sage Fried Chicken Benedict. It consists of a HUGE sage fried chicken breast, fresh spinach, hardwood smoked bacon, tomato, mozzarella, chipotle cream and scrambled eggs, served on a bed of mashed potatoes and a split biscuit. Eyeing the portions of the other dishes - the biscuits and gravy are insanely huge - I knew I was in for a challenge.   This thing was RIDICULOUSLY HUGE - see the picture I included. And everything was, for the most part, excellent. However, I really couldn't taste the sage in the fried chicken all that much. Everything gets piled together and mushed together after a few bites. Also, the biscuits were a bit hard and there wasn't enough sauce for them soften up, so they were mostly discarded.   Still, I ate about 90% of the plate, and promptly put myself into a food coma. My plans to go over to the Nugget for poker were delayed by a slight nap and digestion period. This is a great foodie "destination spot" and somewhere that you can literally split a plate between two people and both be completely full. I can only imagine the amount of food they throw out here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The famous Sage Fried Chicken Benedict. Yup, that&#39;s just one portion!

2o81kJDW2xPRX7t8PKteyg.text: Great breakfast, service was awesome and good prices for the portions. I wish they had one in Colorado!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect with a mimosa!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good!

Ro1WeJAXB1pch92b1-oYeg.text: The building has an odd smell and it was covered up with a lot of air freshner, this was my biggest hold up. Then again, most places downtown do have that same smell, it wasn't repulsive...just enough to catch your attention. Never in my life have I had the 'WOW factor' when getting a food item out as I had with the chicken and waffles here. It wasn't just us, pretty much everyone was looking over as it was being served with the same reaction. The food was INCREDIBLE. Everything in this pile had distinct flavors yet blended together perfect. It was honestly unlike anything I've ever had and I'm itching to go back. My mother and I split it and were more than full. This isn't your standard meal! We went around 2pm and we got right in. Staff was friendly, nothing exceptional but no complaints. All food being served looked equally good.

FePuThbr1l3rtNshkrG1ow.text: This place is over hyped and over loved.   We were seated fairly fast. But it seemed they gave us too small a table for 3 adults and one child. And knowing we had a toddler with us, it was not so kid friendly. Items all over the table, in reach of the high chair.   My server was not so friendly, not so attentive and just wasn't on her game. But I told myself, it would be worth it. Everyone raves about this place. But I should have trusted my gut.If you start off with a poor server, then it can't get much better.   The server kept rushing and rushing us. RUDE!!! So we ordered and per suggestion of the server, I ordered the Sage Fried Chicken Benedict. My husband ordered the Tractor Driver Combo. For my son, I ordered a grilled cheese off the kids meal.  Let's break it down.  Chicken Benedict = Dry, Bland and piled high with "mashed" potatoes. I quote "mashed" because right in the middle of my mashed potatoes were two whole potatoes that somehow were forgotten. The egg on my meal was dry and tasteless. They could have cooked it in the microwave because that is sure what it tasted like. The fried chicken was hard and dry as well. No seasoning to be found.  The best part of my meal was the melted cheese all over the dish, in fact it was the only thing i found appetizing on my plate. The next best thing on my plate were the biscuits. They were pretty fresh and good. But they were not the "highlighted" or "featured" items on my dish.   Grilled Cheese from kid's menu = Let's admit it. Most kids are picky. Their palletes are not developed and they love and enjoy simple things. So why in the heck is Hash House using thick cut, hearty bread on a kids grilled cheese i have no idea why. NOT KID FRIENDLY. So i asked the server if we could replace the fresh fruit that came with the grilled cheese with french fries. The answer was no and if I wanted fries, i would pay additional. Fine, whatever. I got to feed my son.  The fries came out and they were delicious. Hence why they get the one star. I ate more of the fries than I did my own meal.  Tractor Driver Combo = over cooked pancake, sausage was still pink in the middle. The eggs were okay. However severely over priced.  The whole time we were eating we kept smelling curry and could never quite figure out why. There is no curry on the menu from what I could see.  We will not return to Hash House A Go Go in the future ever.   Just a friendly tip, none of the servers here seemed to helpful. They all milled around gossiping and talking.  One even told us we were in the thier way but we were seated at our table. I couldn't quite figure that one out.

pbu57Gq24SrDTsGWGlYDGQ.text: I could not believe how much food this restaurant serves. We had an amazing breakfast and a great server, Rebecca!  Just had a little wait getting butter for our biscuits, but we not only got our butter, we got fresh biscuits.  We even got asked by Rebecca, if we wanted dessert. Haha!!!  We'll be back again, I'm sure!!

Dkqzg4wdHJkZ9jUNHMi7Cw.text: I had the Fried Chicken Benedict that was featured on Man V Food. I split this with my wife ( and we can put some food away!) and we had trouble finishing it. This dish was by far the best food I've had in a long time, with that said it gets a well deserved 5 star!

OpOCEBF-pXY6u8KEIFUDyQ.text: Come hungry. Huge portions.  I found this on Yelp and was craving a big breakfast.  I was NOT disappointed.  My husband loved it and he is a big breakfast critic.  This was beyond big portions and everything was not only cooked excellently but the presentation was well done as well.  My kids could not finish anything, btw.  So I strongly suggest you order 1 item for kids to share.  But this is a great breakfast spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate chip kids pancake feeds at least 4 kids. Super thick fluffy and good.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash is like a Reuben on crack.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttermilk pancake is HUGE.

HCcXIchIHMvi7ehBUjOiOQ.text: Great restaurant and food, horrible location.  The Plaza is old and dirty.

9OnyhMAV3XtPcatVpaMXDg.text: Jerry is a great server, Chris the manager is a super nice guy, Cory too, and the chicken and waffles are absolutely amazing!

SDoz1qi2sdFLqTSClGWe8w.text: I liked it don't know why there were bad reviews though I did just get the chicken eggs Benedict which was enough to feed me a few times as well as being frickin' amazing. Our waiter Paul was really nice and made sure we were happy.  Our food came out really quick and price to quantity to creativity ratio was splendid.  The food was not gourmet quality but most definitely better than iHop or Denny's in my mind and had a unique taste to it due to their "from scratch" slogan. Perfect for a great hangover breakfast that leads to a nap and more drinking then eating all the leftovers when u get home.

hGeihZCuQD3RnOZExLnRGQ.text: We love this place. The portions are huge! So bring your appetite! Or split a plate with someone!

Ay0m5V5W7wpyU5sUxuojbA.text: So I was pretty disappointed at Hash House A Go Go. How can you go wrong with breakfast items.  You can when everything is a mess and there is no flavor. sigh  Ordered coffee: taste burnt/old sitting there Scramble eggs with bacon, avocado and Swiss cheese with crispy potato: They literally mean SCRAMBLE. Everything was just toss together. I like my food neatly separated. And it's not like I ordered an omelette. The crispy potato was soggy with no Flavor what so ever. Hash Smoked Salmon with sunnyside up eggs with crispy potato: The smoked smoke has such a lite tip of smoke, the potato was the same soggy and flavorless.   When it comes to food I devour my plate like a wild animal with a piece of meat. But at this place I only took a few bites and didn't want to eat anymore.   I do like that fact that the portion is big but if it doesn't taste good it doesn't matter if it's big or small.  Wasted my time and spending $30ish for breakfast. That's a No No..

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hash smoked salmon with sunnyside up eggs
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. scramble eggs, bacon, avocado

oOXK3GdoXi9QLwqUapCPmQ.text: Pros: -Huge Portions -Great Customer Service -Delicious Hot Chocolates - Overall Decent Prices  Cons: -Food wasn't the greatest  I heard great things about this place and was hoping the food would be amazing, but it fell a bit flat for me. I went for breakfast with a group and got to try a little bit of everything, but I wasn't super impressed. I think I'll get lunch the next time I go.

7DpY68uXvjsdKEcwJdLpJQ.text: Recommended by a friend after my hungry husbands 3 day softball tournament. We shared a fried chicken eggs Benedict and left satisfied, and full! Huge serving and bill was under, $20. Definitely going back, burgers looked yummy as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i5N6ZXARhEc0X4J0eee6hQ.text: Amazing Service, Realistic prices, Large Portions along with $5 mimosa's. Old Vegas is where the Turnup truly is

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scrambled Eggs w/ Smoked Bacon Avocado, Onions &amp; Diced Potatoes.

3kX3Jj35N2qARkfongGv7w.text: We come here every time we visit LV. And each time it exceeds my expectations. Some of my favs are the chicken and waffles, chorizo hash, and the Snickers pancake. The bloody mary's are good, but I wish there was a smaller, less expensive option. The mimosa juice options are really nice touch. My friends really enjoyed the oatmeal and benedict's. Love this place.

95niQw2RH3z-WXiySHnJSw.text: The brunch spot! If you've never been..I suggest to try this place out asap! I wish they had one here in LA. Their most popular dish is the sage chicken & waffles..a definite must try. They opened a few other HHAGG restaurants but this place has no wait! So if you don't like waiting 45min-1hr..sometimes 2 hr..this one is located inside The Plaza Hotel in Fremont. Good service, place is clean and bomb food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage Chicken and Waffles
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash House Benedict

SBDiQjbptzNWjVWU9OeoOQ.text: Hands down the best breakfast I've had. They use local ingredients and the portions are huge. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. The wait for our table wasn't long maybe 10 minutes but they were busy. Our food probably took 15 minutes.  That's a good turn around time.  The decor was cute and inviting. The hash and Benedict sauce was to die for. The biscuits were huge and flaky and the bacon was thick and tasty. Everything on the menu is huge so don't underestimate the size based off the menu. They serve real cream with your coffee too! Did I mention I love this place?! It's a must go for Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sooooo much food and worth every bite
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tasted like syrup! Delicious;)

DV6Jithl5k3Mcv6Nar6fxQ.text: I was taken here by a friend who is a Vegas local. Although I never eat this LARGE. I thought the idea was very cute.   I ordered the bacon stuffed waffle with fried chicken breast. And it was HUGE. lol. See my pic. The waffle was delicious. Can't wait to try it at home.   But the chicken breast not so much. My chicken breast kind of bled....!!! How? I can't really say. But it was not cooked through. Maybe the slice was to BIG but after seeing a little blood I was done.   He waiter (I forgot his name) but he was kinda blunt and didn't really care that often times we were trying to signal him. He joked about the water being from some local lake. I didn't find it too funny because it tasted like it was from the toilet!!!   I would MAYBE try them again just for the sake of changing this review.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I barley put A dent into this meal.

ksehGfUPKA7gKMl7RSd38Q.text: We went to the one at the Plaza in old town because we called the one at the Linq and it was an hour+ wait. We sat right down at this location. For all the hype I wasn't that impressed. There was a lot off food but none of it was amazing. The food is like what you'd expect at a standard diner restaurant. But it wasn't crazy expensive and it came out quick for the size of our party. My wife's french toast was the best thing on the table imo.

pog5J1FMKRGvy0UzLqqzjQ.text: Consistently good. You can't beat their sage chicken, whether it's with waffles or just eggs. Huge portions! Fast service too.

EdCoN1v8Tv7CtSRe5WLyNg.text: We went there after checking Yelp during our trip to Vegas....turned out to be a home run! Crowded waiting areas but was only about 20 minute wait. Food was amazing! Service was good and place was packed on a Tuesday morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My son Ardennes the Brown sugar pancake combo..no syrup needed!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

It_RM-p5dgVku4pJg7PmJg.text: The food is so good here that we came twice on our trip! The atmosphere is very "dinerish ". We had the chicken and waffles the first day, my personal fave. The portions are sooooo big that my husband and I shared and STILL didn't finish!  The second day, we had fried chicken eggs benedicts, my hubby's fave. Again, we shared and STILL didn't finish!   I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B1zqBClSz5uGUQDjBvnn7Q.text: The portions are huge and sharing an entree is wise.  Food is tasty, but the waiter we had was not so attentive to checking for drink refills. I had to ask another server and a busser for iced tea refills. That is what made this place miss a 4th star. But again, good food and great portions. SHARE an entree!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie... Excellent saucy taste and broccoli! Crust was more like a sombrero filled with awesomeness...
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Mini&#34; burger and fries... Fries were pretty tasty!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Pancake&#34; (singular) and eggs, with bacon...

v0mckpKz6NGlKYmpeKwMYw.text: Great service and great food. The only downfall is the ventilation. Casino smoke seeps into this cute cantina. Food was big portions but a little pricey. My partner got the BLT but what made it so high were the lettuce cups they put on the bread.  The pancakes are falling off the plate huge and I got a bowl of oatmeal that was big enough to feed the three bears that also came with a side of fruit to make a fruit salad. If you are staying there it's a good way to start your day if you want to be full. The nitro coffee is great but the regular coffee sucked.  They could also use a better sound system.

C0BvJQdg0QHvDMuJtzuC6g.text: Unprofessional as ever! How can you tell someone they'll lose their table if the entire party isn't present but you're running your mouth while we're waiting to be seated. I asked was she the manager because clearly she was talking like head hancho. However, the lady next to her watching her run her potty mouth was the manager. What a joke! I ALMOST FORGOT TO ADD THE FOOD WAS DISGUSTING! My plate, my friends and boyfriends.

g9ChMn_eIONg01_jljGpGg.text: This place is insane. Everything is huge. Can we just about the sage fried chicken Benedict specifically ? I was starving when I sat down but as soon as the plate came out I instantly became overwhelmed. It has more layers than Shrek !!! Biscuits bacon fried chicken mashed potatoes eggs all smothered in this amazing chipotle cream. Topped with a tiny "twisted" little strawberry. This plate was featured on man vs food, and now I know why !!  I'm a little upset that they don't provide wheelbarrows to help me to the car !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not even close
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sage fried chicken Benedict. this was featured on man vs. food.

iolVPD5CTkxAst26Usyzrw.text: The food is OK. The portions are HUGE. The service is TERRIBLE. I had to repeat myself several times for the waitress which after the 5th time was terrible. The waitress rarely checked on my party. I did not enjoy the service. I ordered the red velvet trucker combo with ham. It was only ok. The waffle lacked flavor, but the ham was good.

VNbdFvw02xGd3V8zGWn_uA.text: This is a place to go when you are STARVING the portions are ridiculously huge. I had the chicken pot pie which was to DIE for! Highly recommend if you ever get the chance

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ay2WpFpoo3rBJJntyz95Yg.text: The chefs at this joint are AMAZING! I had the portobello burger, it was the best I have ever had! A must try if you like mushrooms. The servers were nice and helpful. The food was worth every penny!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello Burger was absolutely amazing! Best I&#39;ve ever ate! I give mad props to these amazing cooks!!!

irIXMpZwSHIgRfljhysgUQ.text: My husband and I went here on a whim after we missed the local breakfast buffets. Holy. Moly. Why haven't we come here sooner?? EAT HERE NOW.   Our server Alfie was amazing. His service was timely and suggestions were spot on. This place DOES have the best chicken and waffles we have ever had. We also had the French toast - uhhhh YUM. Shared hot chocolate and the caramel mocha. Both sooo good. If you want tasty food, great value, and great service, come here!! And ask for Alfie.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast with banana and pecans
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle tower
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel mocha

iA_MpwiUOuW5o52ULIXe_Q.text: The food here is always great! Service is spectacular the quality of the food itself is high grade. Just a awesome spot in general. Chorizo and eggs are a must try. I normally to eat chorizo anywhere else bUT home and the hash house changed that.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo plate AMAZING!

WBZbtOdUmblCY5dgW_2L1A.text: Fantastic food, great price, great atmosphere, great service, HUGE portions of delicious hashes, benedicts, sandwiches and other treats. Biscuits with FRESH jam are unreal. The banana brown sugar flapjack was delicious. It was enormous and had a crispy crust of melted sugar on it like a creme brulee with large slices of ripe banana in the batter...it was 15" across! Corned beef hash was incredible. Even the coffee was excellent. High recommendation - I do not give 4 stars lightly.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana brown sugar flapjack!!!

J9b2Vz6qFMeUm1qXgOt6VQ.text: I hate to say anything bad about this place, because the food was so good, but damn the service is sooooo awful!  I think we spent a total of 3 hours here! and 3 of our orders were butchered!   I ordered the roasted Chicken, garlic, onions, asparagus and rosemary house hash and asked them to add mushrooms to it. They forgot the mushrooms, but that was the least of my concerns after they ruined 3 of my friends meals.   One of my friend's ordered Andy's Sage Fried chicken which is one the menu favorites items, and he never got any fried chicken with it! Wtf?! We told the server twice and he still never got his fried chicken....  Another friend ordered eggs benedict without bacon, because she is a vegetarian and after sending it back twice, we figured the 3rd time would be the charm and guess what it still had bacon on it.  Oh and a 3rd friend ordered a house hash as well and asked for no cheese on it, and they brought it out with a shitload of cheese on it *sigh*   We asked for those 2 meals to be removed from the bill, and even that took another half an hour to get taken care of.   I had such high hopes for this place and they failed! Such a shame, because no one wanted to waste any time eating there again after all that. Good food, kinda pricey, but terrible terrible slow as hell service.  Good luck getting what you actually ordered here! The only thing that I ordered that came out quickly was my breakfast Jameson shot, go figure.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken house hash

tT_RloRiSCrKXEo2XKL3cA.text: Best breakfast I have ever had. Went twice while in Vegas for 3 nights. Had chicken and waffles and crab cake Benedict. Both amazing. Definitely share!

OAGB0GC-G3FKaTneN9oLIQ.text: Second time coming to a Hash house and it never disappoints.  WARNING: you have to come hungry, the portions are huge!  Part time I ordered the chicken Benedict it was really good. So good in fact that I took a nice long nap right after lol.  This time I decided to go a little healthier and got a salad, but with their famous fried chicken.  Everything you come to expect from fried chicken,  golden and delicious without being dry.    If in Vegas abs don't want buffet food but still want a lot of food try this place.  It does not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken salad

VvPH04YYZ8RcOimJdZXU7A.text: EDC food. The chicken (2 breasts or thighs? Can't remember!) and 4waffles were the size of my face and boy was I starving after a night of dance bf my legs off. Service and speed were excellent! Portions were humongous it was a days complete worth of food for me even w again. All the dancing!!!

HRUFT4PI-pPL4BjiIguNrg.text: Portions were great,  coffee was amazing,  service was excellent.  Bacon was kinda chewy and the "crispy" potatoes were mushy and needed salt badly. My eggs were underdone, but my blueberry pancake was phenomenal (and enormous). Get the pancakes,  but be prepared for a wait. Fortunately,  The Plaza has my favorite slot machine (Goldfish), so the waiting may be the best part of your meal.

Rk2ydaaWk0sIGIcVGgKFIw.text: We tried Hash a Go go's at The plaza. Pricey BUT Huge portions. I had stuffed burger adv, bacon and cheddar. My husband Had Chicken and Waffles. Everything tasted Yummy. We liked it alot. The waiter Bryan was Awesome!  maybe we went at a great time- 5pm, but service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon cheddar,  stuffed burger
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top view of Chicken and Waffles
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage Chicken and waffles- Was yummy and HUGE!

ZADORVuAcjGePg8sWJyaVA.text: What amazing unique and delicious food. Portions were huge. One of the best breakfast experiences we've had for awhile and we travel a lot!

eHuypBShcVmIazeMCVodaA.text: Crab eggs benedict was sooooooo delicious and easily big enough for two. Happy hour tater bucket was perfect finger food with our beers. Will be back for sure when we're back in town!!

zlDyu_-D0H6EIAdZa6IkTg.text: Came here to do a easy cheap breakfast and couldn't resist the urge to try something else!  The Country Fried Steak was amazing and more than I could handle. My boyfriend got the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict and that was just AWESOME!  The flavor was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The after photo.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portions are amazing here

rrUIWs7a62Mo7DRFHRg9Ag.text: Not my cup of tea although not the worse place to go to if you're paying my bill. I guess some like it though because it's very popular. I had breakfast here it didn't agree with me.

AwLXlLkXtPngSAvUZ2BRIw.text: The True LV experience!   Please note... 1 pancake feeds 2-4 people easily. They are 14" pancakes.   Great presentation of food and very reasonably priced for all that you get.   I got the basic breakfast for ($8/9?) and could barley finish it.   Must try this place out.

afPMbJSQD12tEwA1RNGV5Q.text: Wow they are not stingy lol they serve huge portions!!!! Definitely getting your money's worth :D  Had a burger and my bf had a chicken Benedict both of which were like I said HUGE and super yummy :)  We were there for dinner and with a $40 comp which fed 3. Myself, my bf and my brother. We got the comp from Las Vegas Club. We gambled there and they comped us $40 for Hash House at the Plaza.  Go go go!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The basic breakfast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon avocado burger
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Benedict :O it&#39;s huge!!!!

kkhPQ4X_0X5uwDBa33oxSw.text: We've been here several times and each time is better than the last! The meatloaf is delicious,  but the mashed potatoes will make your eyes roll back in your head! The crabacked are fresh and full of CRAB,  not filler! The fried green tomatoes are light and tasty.  We're stuffed! Again!

if8ZzdlGQkYsW9ECszolTw.text: Breakfast food !! Heard about this on the food channel and our hotel (the cal) was so close we decided to walk down and check it out!   Important stuff-  - located in the plaza hotel on fremont, this location shouldn't be too busy  - waited only about 10-15 mins for a party of 7 around 12pm  - HUGE portions, I would say definitely share !! Unless you're a large hungry man  - prices: quite reasonable for the size around $10-$12 an entree depending on which  Service- great, super nice & friendly  We got the avocado bacon scrambled plate ( something along the lines of that) lol and it was huge, it came with a biscuit, a slice of watermelon, a slice of orange, and potatoes. I split this with my sister and it was more than enough for both of us. We asked for no onions and they brought one out for us that did have onions :( but they gladly took it back and fixed our order! Overall the dish was mediocre, nothing to special in my opinion. It might have been because we didn't try their specialties but I was still kind of expecting something super delicious.   Anyways, overall still good. Might come back to try one of their specialties!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado bacon scramble plate

IsgczIP6KzMX9mHI7w2suA.text: Food was ok but note not to ask for any alterations on the menu.  Even if u have allergies..they said they could charge me more and put it on the side, I don't care about the upcharge but I don't want a huge bowl of it. She argued with me and said I would piss off the cooks because it's a new system and all her managers were there.  So I asked for a manager and she said they were not avalible.  I'm so confused..I don't want to come back..awkward

4KE8eKyEdU32w0u6wBf4Uw.text: Split the chicken and waffles with my wife and it was delicious and very filling. Didn't care for the bacon inside the waffles (Hey America, your bacon sucks!) but the chicken was cooked perfectly and very moist.  Good deal for $10 each and we couldn't finish it.

jGfAUJrYpdXFNHSUe7fAiQ.text: Been on my foodie hit list for a while and finally got to go for brunch.. Everything was really good. The biscuits and gravy was some of the best, if not the best I have ever had.. I highly recommend the chorizo hash, the chorizo was excellent.. Will be going back when we are back in LA..

2wxaEOFzzhVFy612e9hb1Q.text: This restaurant is located in the palace hotel and after coming here I'm extremely disappointed. To start off we had a group of 5 and we were told that a table for us would be a 30-40 minute wait at 2:30pm so we were offered the bar and said okay but if a table opens up to let us know. Well two 6 seater tables opened up and no one said anything to us until we asked and were told that we would be paying two separate checks one for our drinks at the bar and another from anything we ordered after we moved to the table so we just stayed. Then my wife was trying to order the HH Big Quesadilla and she wanted it without jalapenos because she's allergic and the waitress flat out said no. Then she asked for a Texas Ranchero and again she said no and she said it's because it's in the sauce. I asked well can we get a sauce without  jalapenos and her answer was "Uh...no." I was immediately frustrated and my wife just got up and left. It was frustrating because she didn't even take the time to go ask in the kitchen if they could! The food is good and you get large portions but it's not great or amazing. I'd take the time to find another place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xwVfQYfSPXtvZ7p-65lXog.text: Decided to have dinner here as we were staying at the Plaza. The fried chicken and waffles were absolutely delicious. Super crunchy but not greasy, waffles stuffed with bacon rashers. Very tasty,with fresh sage and rosemary. Service was prompt and super friendly. Go in hungry or share- portions are huge!

K7XznYhlAH8Vi1NRGnHz1w.text: Possibly my favourite place for breakfast in Las Vegas. The friend chicken Benedict is pure perfection. 1 will feed 2, don't believe me? You have been warned. Coffee is good. Service is great. Nice crowd of people. Love it here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Doesn&#39;t look as delicious as it is.

Ese43gDLEhw_1yBcdrqTUQ.text: During my week stay at the Plaza I must have eaten here at least 6-8 times.  The portions are INSANE but this girl knows how to eat so I wasn't worried.  That being said...I was NEVER able to finish my food and since the hotel rooms don't have a fridge or microwaves the left overs just go to waste.    The service was always wonderful...such a friendly and courteous staff.  I even had several waiters pose in pictures for me.  During my visits I had a meatloaf sandwich, farm scrambles, pasta, chicken...just a variety of dishes.  I loved everything I ordered.  If you're staying at the Plaza this will be your "go to" restaurant and you won't be disappointed!

Fpx2mHb7HG1OzKYauUClAA.text: I had the basic breakfast with 2 scrambled eggs, crispy potatoes, biscuit and I didn't get any meat but you have a choice between bacon, sausage and ham. I took a star away bc the chicken sausage is encased in pork so it's not really an option for those who don't want pork. Bummer. But what I got on my plate was more than enough food. Everything was GOOD. Scrambled eggs on point. But the star was the biscuit!! So so so good. Also had the s'mores coffee thingy. It was good but it was more of a dessert.

C_N8GCwj01W-5ypT18J4Bw.text: Great staff great food and a must stop when in Vegas. The chicken and waffles is amazing. It's huge and can be shared. Service is great too

SksqDzW3GlwPDBHHdqX1Nw.text: Ate at this restaurant because it was conveniently located in our hotel lobby. There was about a 20 minute wait for 3, which was fine. When we were seated we waited about 15 minutes before a server walked up to us and asked us if we had been helped. When we told her no she went to grab our server for us. When our server finally showed up she had a terrible attitude. She rudely took our order and walked away. When our food came out someone else brought it and filled up our drinks for us. She never came back until it was time to drop off the check. Terrible service on her part, but everyone else seemed okay. I had biscuits and gravy, just a side portion because their portions are huge, and my husband had a burger. The food was okay. Nothing stood out to us. Will probably choose somewhere else to eat next time. Not worth returning to.

k8LhsNMtq-lq9dn1IZImeg.text: Ahhhh Hash House. You are always on the mind when I think of brunch in Vegas. I try to stay health conscious and order egg whites.... but seriously that doesn't go well with Hash House. You gotta order the pork chop for breakfast. My friend ordered that and I think I enjoyed bite of her dish better than my whole entire breakfast omelet thingy that look like meshed baby food.   Just go with the big fat piece of pork chop. That thing could feed family of 4 and next time I go thats all I am getting. Plus maybe the beer in a paper bag. hahaha

mdPRNS1nSrZ7pNtjpNtCMw.text: We've been dying to try this place ever since seeing it on Man Vs Food. It was good, not the best, but good. The services wasn't great. Front hostess was snooty. Our server lagged and had no personality. The servings are huge! We ordered traditional bacon and eggs, with one pancake and a side of potatoes. It was more than enough for us two (women) and we didn't finish it all! My Bloody Mary was tasty too.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sadly, I didn&#39;t take a food pic. Just the beverage : )

ZWHb22KvJnNTWoiyTSNc5A.text: We stopped to have breakfast between our second and third legs of Ragnar Las Vegas. We were tired and hungry. The waitress got our orders and brought out our food quickly.  There was a guy 3 tables away playing with his chips from the casino. After about 10 minutes, we were able to figure out where the sound was coming from. As soon as we pointed it out to our waitress, she went and politely asked the guy to stop. Breakfast was great, service was even better. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas.

v-8i_lHjW6n_Z4brihac2A.text: Worst service ever! My husband and I came in around 3PM for an appetizer before going onto Fremont. We were seated by the host and then NEVER served. 3 different waiters walked by and didn't take even our drink order. We felt completely ignored and insulted. After 35 minutes we got up and walked out. My husband wanted to leave after 15 minutes but I wanted to see how long it would be before we were served. I'm sure the food is great from all the reviews but management needs to reevaluate it's staff. As we were leaving, we told the host that seated us about it and she just smiled and told us to have a good night! WOW...

ro-QPltazA8K-0lMjnbKEA.text: Poor service.  Close to $40.00 for 2 breakfasts!  Food was fine.  Nickel and dimed all the way!  Waitress served highest priced items for everything we ordered.   We wanted the $5.99 side of biscuits and gravy.  We got the higher priced full breakfast.  We ordered orange juice and of course was brought the extra large ($4.99). We complained to the manager who did take $8.00 off our bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n_ekvLFvhvMJs2_NlY1xcg.text: I use to frequent the Orlando location often and I was always curious to see how the Vegas location compared. To start off with the restaurant was understaffed on a Wednesday night. The bartender was waiting on basically all the tables. The facility seemed older and worn and it was lacking air condition. It was so hot! Apparently this is one of the "nicer" locations in Vegas. We ordered two chicken and waffles and the service was good considering there was only one waiter running around. The poor guy was making drinks, bussing tables, and taking orders. The Chicken and waffles tasted just like the ones in Orlando!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

rerC2PVARo8mlE_ic7UDHg.text: Just appetizers since I know portions huge.  3 large ribs, just OK.  Thin sauce and average flavor.  Nachos and guacamole.  Served in overdone taco shell and guacamole didn't have a lot of flavor.  Will return and try one of the highly rated items.

Nbyax23UXCtrWYMBhAkAHg.text: Love love love!!!  I recommend the meatloaf sandwich! The lines are crazy but well worth it! The customer service is excellent. The pancakes are the full size of a plate so bring your appetite. I recommend you bring a drink with you while you wait. They also prepare some pretty good Bloody Mary's! A must try. Been to the one at The Quad and the one on Fremont Street. I recommend Fremont if you don't have the time to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Snickers Flap Jack and the Kokomo. An amazing meatloaf sandwich. Huge portions! Delicious food and grear service.

KZusLz040y-yK6WKVfWKdA.text: I recently went to Hash House A Go Go. I was last there almost 3 years ago. I was so excited to take my wife, who has endured my many tellings of how good the food was. Well, I was severely disappointed.   We shared an order of the sage fried chicken and waffles. My memory must not be that good, because they sprinkled corn and bell peppers on the waffles. Yuck!   I also requested some biscuits. They were really dry and tasted like they have been sitting out for most of the day.  Everything seemed to be much better a few years ago. I will definitely not ever go again the next time I'm in Vegas!

Dfeo4qfJzz7Qrp_92SSyZg.text: Comparing this location to the Florida one that I've also been to, their quality and food was all very similar as I remembered it.  I had their chicken and waffles and their chicken benedict that was on man v. food and it's super good!   Hash House A Go Go are known for their huge-ass portions but if you're super hungry...... you miiiight be able to finish them lol.  At this location, I had their salmon sandwich (was trying to go healthy) but was disappointed in the overall taste.  Bread was whatever, I liked the crust on the salmon but it wasn't necessarily juicy.  Just a bit dry...  I'd only come here for their fried chicken-related entrees as they are the most popular and the chicken is always tender.  First time?  Get their chicken benedict.

p2lRZe_5SkNtMqNi7DCuhA.text: People seem to love this place; I thought it was terrible. Yes, the service is fast. The people are friendly. The portions are huge. But the food is bland. BLAND. Tasteless. Devoid of flavor. Lacking in the ability to please one's taste buds. And unexpectedly deep fried.   I had visions of cranberries and thinly sliced roast pork and house mayo when I ordered a pork tenderloin sandwich. What I got was something like looked like chicken fried steak slapped onto a flavorless bun with a pickle.  Tasteless, fried, crap in enormous amounts. Why do people like this place?!? Skip it.

CkZt7QDUs2iekgc6qx5Zaw.text: Portions are huge so share with your favorite person. Our server John was a cool Cat and had great service! The hash was great and get a drink it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh food drinks are worth it!

5gmMYbVlT0vw5Cv932uyZQ.text: Big fan of this chain  Great food in large volumes HORRIBLE service Greeter needs basic training  (Like paying attention to the person your speaking to, or actually finishing sentences ) Other locations have much better service

4jeLWqw40Y5A9h2H2ZNziw.text: Huge portions.  If the Plaza hotel had a refrigerator I could stretch dinner to 2 meals.   Some of the dishes come with giant portions of mashed potatoes, so ask for extra sauce or it starts to seem dry.  I have had 3 dinners and breakfast here and all good.   The blue crab cake dinner is awesome and so is the breakfast #1 scramble.  Bartenders have been friendly and make a good size cocktail.   Drink here before the plaza bar!!!!

v1DvkDnK0c8HlfMuuLgrhw.text: So good and the service was great to. Family of 5 and ate for under $50 and a huge portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

s2rQqewjKI8F_Bj8DTcR9A.text: This was an okay experience at best... I got the meatloaf sandwich... Way too big... But I guess that's what they specialize in oversize food... I might try it again... Service and the attitude of the employees was terrible... Typical restaurant inside the Hotel/ Casino... It was Halloween morning... But the employees are True zombies... The manager Cory was nowhere to be found...  Could not get refills on coffee or water... What kind of hash house doesn't refill coffee... The two hostesses were oblivious to the bad service. Instead they were in an in-depth personal conversation with each other...  It was also obvious my server Mandy did not want to be there....  And I said I would try it again... Definitely not this location... Maybe try the one that caters to locals....

nzbTWQwssb-ax_zlJjThVQ.text: This place never disappoints!  The third location I have visited and the food has been great each time. I wish I could review something else, but the only thing I ever get is Andy's Sage Chicken Benedict.  Give it a try and really consider sharing - it's ginormous.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage Chicken Benedict. Heaven on a plate - bring help this thing is huge

acCM8RqDjLOeugtRoyL0xg.text: Disappointed. Came here because I was craving an eggs benedict and based on the reviews I thought I'd give it a try. The menu has crazy cool options, but not that many pescatarian/vegetarian options. The Bloody Mary I had was disgustingly sweet. I ordered the smoked salmon scramble which was OKAY, but not as expected. They over charged me as well. Would not eat here again

hbkAtVW-VK-WhRDcM343fA.text: Unbelievable portions and decent prices.  My husband loved the chicken and waffles.  The waffles are cooked with bacon inside.  I loved the machaca with mashed potatoes!!!!   So good we ate their 2 mornings in a row

-UGGkrLKjWMdW2N9l2rb2Q.text: We were told that this was a good place for breakfast, we visited and was not disappointed, But what I didn't expect was the size of the portion. Wow, huge!!!  Next time I'll remember.  See ya when I return to Vegas

yyQfCRUvttfUGWw3ExUsCQ.text: Yikes!  Went to this location with my son, and we were stunned by the poor performance of the staff. The hostess steered us to sit at the bar (son is 15)...when we reported back that the bar area was for 21 and over, she argued the point.  We were seated under a blown speaker, which was making a terrible racket...we asked the manager for a seating change, she agreed and then never got back to us.  The food was fine, but the poor service and obnoxious broken speaker (why seat someone there?) overshadowed everything.  All of this was relayed to the contact email addresses on their web site, and no response was provided.  Solid pass on this one unless you are seeking incompetence and indifference. I walked in a fan and walked out shopping for new breakfast spot.

PYOFhBXeVtl5xmhH5ALbig.text: The server was amazing, she was extremely nice and helpful. The portions were enormous and the price wasn't exaggerating like everywhere else in Vegas. Over all it was a good experience. I had the crab cake Benedict and it was pretty delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q9kzNNBs4mKgpKVPr8QI2w.text: Wonderful service, seated immediately, beverages served promptly, served food in good time. All the servers helping each other. Great atmosphere & clean. Going back for dinner tonight. Highly recommend. Enjoy!

HIrR8wWSbFubYnnsdyRA8A.text: We went to another casino looking for a breakfast restaurant but we were in the wrong location. The employee at a different casino recommended "Hash House A Go Go." We were really hungry.  Long story short, I got the Sage Chicken with coffee. It was the best meal I had all weekend. We stayed at the MGM, I wish I would have stayed at the Plaza. The food was fantastic. Our waitress was friendly and helpful. The coffee was so rich and bold.  My next casino will be the Plaza and every breakfast will be at Hash House.

bSxdHHEQUl_rKO-Gkc5k8Q.text: Very very good food.. One plate can be for two people and more.. The waffles are the bomb, best in Vegas..

vsd5wSP2yj6t66AaGciCEg.text: The only thing that makes me sad about writing this review, is that I'm not sitting in the restaurant eating their food! I was skeptical about it because of my bias against the Plaza hotel (my grandmother goes there all the time, so it's because of her, not anything wrong with the hotel). But by far, this is the best breakfast I have ever had! And the service is beyond words! We loved our server so much we even took a picture with him! I think his name is John... I asked him if I could take him around in vegas with me because he was so amazing!   Like most people said, the portions are huge! I split with the person I was there with and we still didn't finish! The drinks are huge too! I got a mimosa and it had me buzzin by the end because it was a lot! We got Andys Famous Sage Fried Chicken Breast w/maple reduction, two eggs your style, bacon mashed potatoes and biscuits. But instead of mashed potatoes we got regular breakfast potatoes. The sauce was beyond words! It was a chipotle mayo, that I could have put in a cup and drank. Can't wait to go back and try other things!

FhK7tWVPYbVfkbl1Deik1w.text: This place is always busy! It's probably best to get their early unless you're okay with waiting a long time. Wait time varies by location and I think this location probably has the shortest in comparison to the others on the strip.   I was suggested to visit this spot for their massive plates and I was surprised with how big the portions were! I love chicken and waffles, so I ordered the sage fried chicken and waffles. The server will ask if you want the bacon in or out - of the waffle that is - and I got in. This was such a decadent meal. Four waffles with bacon strips sticking out of them and two huge fried chicken breasts stacked on top and fried leeks garnishing this tower. This plate is big enough to be shared by two, but I dare you to take the challenge and eat it all yourself - after all, this is sin city.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mile high
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage fried chicken and waffles
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YkD87wmPFbM0GGYEfF3jXw.text: Hash House has enormous portions. If you plan to eat here, either prepare to take home leftovers or to split the meal with a few of  your buddies. They're known for their chicken and waffles and also their Bloody Mary's, but we decided to try some new items. We ordered the rainbow drink, the Spiked Kiwi Watermelon Lemonade, and I ordered the Meatloaf Hash. The rainbow drink tasted delicious, just like juice, and it's oh-so-pretty that we finished it pretty quickly. The Meatloaf Hash was also very tasty, moist and delicious with spinach and cheese over a bed of taters. Honestly, you can't really go wrong with anything you order here, just bring your appetite and loose fitting pants.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow drink for the win!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf Hash

zat7P_W44PgmLDy4CKolaA.text: Was expecting a lot more for the money. Food was average at best. Waitress was friendly. Not worth the $$$

qcmE7bE_ATXO_HzYu326TQ.text: I've been meaning to come here for the longest time and finally, I decided to treat myself for breakfast.  I've always heard great things about this place and wanted to experience all the feels of this restaurant!  I went up to the host desk and there were two people there, one host on the phone, and the other just staring at her. After a few minutes of not being acknowledged I had to interrupt and ask if there was a wait.  The young gentleman apologized and told me the wait was going to be about 10-15 min. He did offer a seat at the bar, and since it was my first time, I wanted to full table experience.  After 20 minutes, I was seated.  While I was outside waiting, I noticed there were many people waiting to be seated, but while I was lead to my table, the dining rooms didn't look busy at all...perhaps they were understaffed today.   The waiter I had was a nice guy but didn't bother to introduce himself. I knew what I wanted and placed my order and my ice tea came out pretty quickly.  Not too long after, my steak and eggs arrived. The plating of my food looked like a piece of art work, very colorful and very appealing.  The steak was cooked to my liking, medium rare, but I felt the steak was very thin.   The grilled mashed potatoes were good, though a very huge portion.   My eggs were perfect! Sunny side has always been my favorite.   The biscuit was pretty huge, just shy of the size of a baseball. Served with marmalade and some fresh fruit tied it all together.  The whole experience all together was ok. Nothing stood out as a WOW experience.  The food, as pretty as it looked on the plate, didn't have any flavor. The dining experience from beginning to end wasn't a story worthy experience.   The waiter and the hosts don't engage any of the customers.  Three stars is a fare gauge of my first time HH experience.   The prices are a little more higher than any other diner but it's worth paying for if the food is fantastic and the experience is high level, not mediocre.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Time to be seated
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specials

L68B8vnCcyymtnzVaVAopg.text: Hash house A go go is perfect for lunch. Large portions that taste really really good. Great stop before heading upstairs to the jerky store at plaza hotel. We ordered a large Caesars salad and sage chicken & waffles with bacon. Everything was very good. From being greeted with a smile by the hostess to our waitress service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb salad!

6Au1O2MWhNQsij68mOLrYQ.text: First time here, was warned that the plates of food were huge, and it was correct, they have different combos of foods, you wouldn't think of, stuffed hamburgers, huge pancakes covering the whole plate, salmon omelet, and the list goes on and on. There was a lot of food,  so it's good to share between two people

1jq-VLavQIqO_VmgIUsKDw.text: I had the Chicken Benedict.  The order could easily feed two.  Glad I made the choice.  This place gets busy for a reason.

kCafbhnZJGtgGSpnbc5xrg.text: Went there Friday 3/30/2018. I ordered the fried chicken with eggs, hash, bacon and a biscuit. The chicken and biscuit were both hard as a rock. The chicken was dry and I had to chew it for a long time just to get it down. I was trying to impress my date so I started out using a knife and fork to cut the chicken but pieces kept snapping off and shooting to the floor. That was one tough piece of chicken. The eggs,  hash and bacon were good. My date had a burger...I didnt taste it but it looked delicious.  I did eat some of her fries and they were excellent.  By the way...this was my third visit to this location. First time that I left disappointed.

qQK103r45N_bfsF4taLksA.text: People were friendly, fast service. The amount of food is large! Lol I tried the sage chicken and waffles and it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sCj_sNKLHpmNbmaXnJrKaQ.text: This is like the cheesecake factory of vegas for brunch...there are no surprises in ingredients or chef skills here, but it gets the job done!    I knew portions were going to bigger than normal so I ordered on the healthier side.  The artichoke, mushroom hash was subbed with egg whites and fruit instead of potatoes at no extra cost!  I also had some of my hubby's chicken and waffles which is a highly recommended item since its their best seller.  The waffles are stuffed with bacon..and I liked that they used sage with their chicken.  really nice crunch and batter.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Tj1WZwErLGqpjT0EG1R05g.text: The food here was phenomenal, except I found a sugar packet in my iced water. The waitress was very kind about it and quickly gave me another glass of water. The portion sizes for this restaurant was very large. We ordered two plates that four people shared and it was already more than enough. We ordered two chicken dishes and they were very delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

29O5vxvulGLgt9Pf8OlBMA.text: if you are into not being served when it is slow. This is the place for you. never tried the food walked out after 20 minutes of no service

EAsBlLYXkzXqgjD459gt1Q.text: Nothing new to add...food is always great and HUGE portions. Been to the original in SD and two locations in Vegas and have not been disappointed.

qwwO-DcQ5bwkuyMgPYpILQ.text: The FOOD is HUGE!!  They have the same menu as the original location but the food didn't taste as good.  Not to say that the food didn't taste good, but I usually order one of the breakfast griddles with salmon and it lacked the same flavor as the Sahara location.  Nonetheless, the staff was awesome.  We were seated quickly, served quickly, and got our check right away as soon as we were ready to bounce out of there.  So nice to have a busy restaurant take care of you even those there are tons of other people to cater to as well!

EWw9O_byOkzQLUyYEumMPQ.text: Worst service after 4 days in Vegas. There was no wait, we were seated immediately, place was not full, 25 minutes later we don't even have a glass of water. I don't care what food guru has eaten here or how many things on the menu are named after him, you actually need to have a chance to eat the food. Better off with a breakfast buffet for much cheaper.

7Fkvd1jf-ON-J6-P2VzQ_g.text: Ben  "Awesome food. Huge portions. The cornbread sandwich was very good as was the portobello mushroom burger. Only thing keeping it from a five star was the service. Friendly but we didn't see her very often. All in all a good experience."

Hlh6lFt2cACe6KzctbfzsA.text: We have been to 3 other Hash House rest. & the downtown one was the worst. Service was bad, toast came way after eggs, coffee was  late & had to ask second time for it. Lettuce in salad was yellow, pecans sparse, slow service. We won't be visiting that one again. Go to the M location. Very nice.

KOFMSndG3o491Umwe_S8IA.text: 4 of us went for late breakfast as we heard such great things. Servers don't bring food, other support staff does that. We had 3 plates come to our table that didn't belong to us.  My husband's food never came, after asking our server about it, he checked on it. He unapologetically told us his plate was delivered to someone else. He reordered from kitchen, & it was again delivered to someone else. As the rest of us were finished eating, waiter said he would reorder again, we declined. He never got his food, he was not charged for his food. We never got an apology, no drink refills whole meal. Over all, very poor service. But, food we did get tasted great

vCc8ZpwvuNheydJ_UoFV4g.text: This was our second HHAGG experience. Great location, wait was only 10 minutes. Food was awesome! He got the Apple Cinnamon pancakes, large slices of apples baked into a giant cinnamon pancake! I got the Corned Beef Hash, large portion of shredded corned beef and swiss cheese over fried potatoes! Yum! Great service and reasonably cheep for the amount of food we got!! Will definitely be back!

OgmSUyQfT8F2NDEvnPm06A.text: Definitely the worst Hash House I've ever been to. Meatloaf was great, skillet was awful. Waitress looked like she hated her job and didn't want to serve us. We had a coupon for being hotel guests so we purposely ordered extra, and the waitress and manager said the coupon was for BEFORE TAXES so we were $1.20 short to use the coupon. Coupon didn't say anything about that, and I've never heard of it. We will definitely not be going back to this Hash House ever again! Also, there was an ant on our table, and while we were there another table was complaining to the manager too. Beware!

VTAIDJu5ydHeAI9XchPzaA.text: Great breakfast, at the end of Freemont St. Mall.  Waiter made excellent suggestions, A Bacon Waffle!  He kept the coffee flowing and overall made this dining experience a great start to our day. We will highly recommend this place.

zLQIHBP7KtvvQu9ycQbl0Q.text: Ate here every morning Great food ,huge portions, great price, try the"ggs bendict", "Sage fried chicken and waffles" "corn beef hash" .....mmmmm

up67QDtxs-A9I2knIsbBqg.text: The food is big and is good.. The service is ok.. Just don't ask to put chocolate chips in your pancakes because they get upset.. Like is a big deal. Other than that is ok..

OwrD3THEb4ch-hbWO_zKgg.text: Stayed at the Plaza Hotel. The first night we were looking for someplace to eat and little did we know that one of the best restaurants on the old strip. We ate here every day we were in Vegas. Delicious comfort food and massive portions. After our first visit we would only order one dish per two people and it was still more than enough. On top of that, the prices were very fair. Had one of the stuffed burgers the first night. It was good, but nothing compared to the meatloaf sandwich I got the following day to help with my hangover. Best meatloaf sammy I've ever had. On our way out, I picked up the eggs benedict. Perfect food for the drive home. My only issue was that it was always pretty crowded and we usually had to wait, avoid the problem and get the food to go.

JJQqCOmwYnkCRUOQlih1Qg.text: Absolutely delicious!  Fresh, home style cooking FTW! Ordered stuffed burger while my date ordered chicken & biscuits.  However, everything looked so great I couldnt keep my eyes of my neighbor's table.  Portions were outrageous.  Both dishes arrived hot & in a timely matter.  Service was great even though my date was extremely rude to the waitress (I would give the date 0 stars if I could).  Plates are about $15.00 each which is more than reasonable seeing that the portions would allow you to make three meals out of the one plate.  Not too fancy yet not as casual as fast food.  Would recommend as a group outing as everyone would find the menu & pricing acceptable.

fo1kBprr0vQHrtUSJCHCNg.text: Great place to eat. Had large portions prompt service . I'm for sure coming back to have breakfast in the near future .

DkCL3xvpd7i-MlAyF4HmZQ.text: My boyfriend and I decided to go out to a late dinner at Hash House, service was okay.  The hostess were friendly and welcoming, but leaning on the host stand a little to much.  We had to order off the late night menu, I got the grilled cheese sandwich, It was decent.  Way to much tomato and only one big chunk of avocado.  It was thrown together and sloppy, hard to eat.  Mike was our server and was good. Took him about 15 min to get my strawberry lemonade margarita, but was a very good drink for only $8.  All in all it was a decent dinner but hope for better service and food next time.

3zrGHo0zUNl1Z2igd6WtDg.text: Best tip for this place:  You need to be hungry when you go to the Hash House a Go Go! The portions are huge and the food isn't served on regular plates, it's served on platters. My husband and I both got the farm benedicts. He got the pork tenderloin and i got the sage fried chicken. The sage fried chicken benedict, starting from bottom to top-- spinach leaves, a split biscuit, griddled mashed potatoes, sliced tomato, bacon, fried chicken breast, griddled mozz cheese, scrambled eggs, and chipoltle cream sauce! It sounds odd but it's to die for. I don't think we even made a dent in the food it was so large. Two people can definitely split one meal, maybe even three people. I also had the old school hot chocolate which was topped with 4 huge marshmellows and chocolate sauce. Very good. The service was great and they gave you plenty of time to order. Everything looked so good it was hard to decide. The prices were excellent too especially for a Vegas restaurant in a hotel. For the amount of food we got, 15 dollars per benedict was very good. We probably had enough leftovers for 2 days. This will definitely be our first stop next time we're in Vegas.

Q9yolvZia-KiWyDli6W1BA.text: One of the best meals you can have in Vegas.We had Sage fried chicken benidict...so  yummy!! You'll have to bring your appetite, plates are humongous so you might wanna share. Next time in Vegas hit this place up first your tummy won't regret it.

v59uFgT8mh4fHltVhe1ohg.text: Great service, HUGE good food - really creative.  Found by accident, would totally return

xXjrrN_WnJisWa1c9gRbCw.text: The food wins every time!! Our first time in Vegas and we had to visit this place. The food portions are INSANE!!! I had the chicken and waffles and it was sooo good! Come ready with a huge stomach!!! The wait staff were pretty nice as well!

xRt7JBh9wm6OHWhrUfMuHg.text: Very, Very disapointed in this place. I ordered Pancake, Eggs, bacon. The pancake was ok, the eggs were burnt they were all brown, the bacon was way over done. There prices for breakfast are way way to expensive, especially when the breakfast was nothing special. The service wasn't great either, the guy kept coming to my table like 100 times asking me if everything was ok, I guess they dont believe in silent service or letting someone try to eat there overpriced breakfast in piece.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

son8HfT_qbhYnbpAHYg6_g.text: Amazing food, amazing service, amazing atmosphere!! We were seated and greeted right away.  Our server was very knowledgeable of the menu and had some great recommendations! I seriously don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu.  The food is fresh, beautifully presented, and bonus,  GREAT price! If you're staying on Freemont, don't bother trying any other restaurant! If you're not staying on Freemont, roll your hungover butt to a cab and GET DOWN HERE!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGE banana pancake! With carmelized sugar on the outside!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage fried chicken in a maple reduction!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom, artichoke heart, sundried tomato hash!

wLt5oFmf5FwpH04fKfRLEw.text: The food here is amazing and prices are moderate for Vegas!  Be warned - portions are huge.  I had the sage fried chicken sandwich, and it was delicious.  The fried chicken was tender and flavorful, and their milk toast is absolutely amazing.  The biscuits with honey butter they give as an appetizer were delicious as well.  I definitely recommend that two people share an entree, or maybe get several per table and dine family-style.  We went late at night and had absolutely no wait.  Service was decent, but the food alone is why I'm giving five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Griddled cheese with fries (left) &amp; sage fried chicken sandwich with bacon and cheese mashed potatoes (right)

u1AlCr2M_F5Ft_1oz1pbGg.text: Service was great!! We were going to order two orders of the chicken and waffles but the waiter recommended us getting just one because the portion was huge. That was nice of him!!! Waffles were thick and amazing, the chicken was nice and crispy but I like it seasoned so I added some salt and pepper. Also, I had a mimosa and that too was great. I would come back once more.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

CMFn6liEBYHPc6sa18weFg.text: I was staying at the Plaza for business and waited over 30 minutes for them to open at 7am and finally had to go to McDonald's for breakfast. What sucky management.

BrGi9GiDRcXbemkecEl3bA.text: You better come here hungry . the portions are HUGE and i mean HuGE!! You definitely get your moneys worth.The food tastes and looks amazing . the staff was really nice and the food came out quick . great family dinner.will definitely make this a new Vegas stop.

eFHQS3UWLI_v00_cGeGnVA.text: Large portions of delicious and wholesome comfort foods. This location never has a line when I've been at the Plaza. The only problem I encountered was that wait staff response time is a little longer than other Hash House locations in the valley. I think I waited about 10-12 min before anyone came to collect my check and credit card when it came time to pay. Because of that I'm deducting a star. Otherwise no major complaints because this place is great

xmtJ-dOP4wtQd-cyLZgjLA.text: Da bomb...the bees knees, heaven sent, the shiznitz, whatever you want to call it. This places is freakin amazing.  I kept it simple with a regular pancake, eggs, bacon and coffee (what a nerd, I know) and I was pleasantly surprised at how great everything tasted. My wife ordered the chicken and waffles and it was succulent and delicious. The portions are ridiculous, a couple can easily share a plate but I'm not sure you'd want to share though.  The fried potatoes were lightly seasoned, evenly cooked and tasty. The only thing that I had to do a double take on was the corned beed hash...honestly it looked more like shredded pot roast or carnitas than your typical hash. My brother in law ordered it and said it was good, just different from what he expected. Definitely check this place out.

HqLVquPBa2syfKpcT1_vGQ.text: Second time in two days eating here as we are staying at the Plaza. Our first server was excellent but this morning our server is trying to handle five table at once and we only seem him once. As soon as we for seared he got quadruple sat, a suffers term.   He never check on us to see if we needed more coffee or if everything was alright with our meal. In still waiting for the check and some one to remove my dirty dishes that been in front of me for 8 minutes.   Good food but our server is whack and concerned  about quantity and not quality

JhPEvzUgXr71DisYXhzziw.text: Clean place, prompt and great service, huge portions of food. Definitely share (thats coming from a food hog). The orange juice fresh squeezed and absolutely perfect. The coffee is hot and tasty enough to please my very picky grandmother and all the utensils and glassware are always squeaky clean. I love there use of herbs and spices in their dishes. I come to Fremont just for the Hash House!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Infamous Bacon Waffle!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The number one scramble with avocado ham and onions. Comes with a side of fruit and a large biscuit.

F2eZsuMleQnyQiRWp-3GCw.text: Huge portions doesn't necessarily equate to good food. I had the salmon Benedict with the Snickers pancakes (which were ok) and while i couldn't finish the pancakes due to the size, the Benedict was pretty much 60% mashed potatoes. The cream sauce was very sweet and didn't really go with that dish. Not my favorite breakfast spot.

zFkKrIzqdd55hZ5gePlBWA.text: Great food and service.  Tried the Man vs Food meal and it was HUGE! The chipotle the sauce is amazing!!! they use fresh ingredients, no hormones... and you can really taste the difference.  I have to go back and try the chicken and waffles. They have a special on Tuesdays for it.

YsPL3NMIGsMHM4tSUa1niw.text: I'm sorry but this place has just ok food,  ok service and very long to get your food.  If you have a free breakfast from the casino eat there.  If not go to the cafe.  Cheaper and faster.

7pp-7rH_u5y_j_IQx0PPPg.text: Rolled into Vegas for a girls weekend and looked up the best place for Bloody Mary's.  We went straight to Hash House A Go Go in downtown.  I followed the servers recommendations and ordered the BLT Bloody Mary and the Chicken and Waffles.  You will not leave hungry, the portions are HUGE! The BLT Bloody Mary comes with toast and mayo on the side and bacon lettuce and tomato in the drink.  It was like getting a little appetizer with the drink, I loved it.  The chicken and waffles were beyond huge.  The waffles were stuffed with bacon, what a great idea I am so trying that at home.  Overall the food was good, the Bloody Mary was great and the staff were all friendly and attentive.  Oh, don't let the environment (run down area) dissuade you, the restaurant is clean and enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The BLT Bloody Mary at the Hash House A Go Go.  It is a drink that comes with its own appetizer.  YUMMY

9PSi__kPGhNvSpbZEYWtwA.text: Great breakfast. Monique was our hostess and she is amazing, sweet, kind and quick. Really appreciated great service. Recommend the basic breakfast with grilled mash potatoes. Yummy!

qxNtJAgZxSzng01JBTeVJg.text: It features southern classics with a twist.  They serve LARGE portions here so plan on taking home what you can't finish. I had the Chicken and Waffles here and was unable to finish it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Hash House a Go Go Chicken and Waffles plate

l7hNWkGiJDZ6vDC7DnytOw.text: Sat at the bar for 15 minutes and no service. Apparently I wasn't important enough. Won't come back. This place runs the same as the hotel. Looks like they forgot about customer service. Thanks.

ldP1KZFgB_wBBYsZRqVUDg.text: Just an awesome Breakfast. Need to get that Banana muffin.The hash was a 10!!!!

eFHzcrpMaTVi5FasWf0YCQ.text: The food portions are massive! They're massive and they're delicious! I had the chicken and waffles and I tried a few other dishes of friends. I wish we didn't find this place on our last day of our 5th trip. Regardless, the place is good and I look forward to returning next year.

4z6oVI9b19d2zDfdeVffiA.text: Everyone else has pretty much said what there is to be said.  Not much of a crowd at this location (and why DOES the Plaza smell so weird?) I hear the Strip location is much busier.  Comically huge portions  but the food is just alright. I had the fried chicken hash and the fried chicken was indeed tasty, as was the slab of griddled cheese on it there but the biscuits and potatoes weren't terribly flavorful and there was just too much sauce.  I also had this huge pistachio iced coffee thing that wasn't as pistacio-y as I would have liked.

PlGQm3X401T1ybhP2oQTKw.text: As a frequent visitor to Vegas, we decided to get off the strip and make this a Vegas Throwback weekend in Downtown. What a fun weekend that did not disappoint.   Breakfast at Hash House A Go Go is a must!  Grab a seat at the bar for the best servers around!  Then settle in for a a fresh breakfast experience.  The avocado and bacon scramble is delicious.  Served with a homemade biscuit that could compete against any southern kitchen biscuit, a side of crispy potatoes, and fresh fruit is served on a platter and plenty to share unless you have a giant's appetite.   Add a fresh Mint Mojito and you are off to another great day in downtown Vegas..

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PXvMpBpeUVDcs8afQXilgQ.text: Hands down best breakfast for dinner I've had in years! While celebrating my besties birthday, we checked Hash House out for a quick bite...2 hours later, the entire group was beyond stuffed and had a ridiculous amount of leftovers. The entire experience was great. Our hostess was so sweet to accommodate our large group into several tables and our waitress deserved a medal for her ability to laugh at us and with us!! Drinks, apps, food, extra plates and to-go boxes (along with napkins and disposable silverware). Seems this is a general expectation for a dining experience but all other places were simply put off with our request for disposables or offered at a fee. No joke!! We will definitely be coming back again!

EUHiX6f5xcydvauDdeYVBA.text: Ordered the chicken and waffles. SO AMAZING. Our waitress was super sweet also! Awesome service and amazing food!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6zXTwSzTTxbQoyRcfTpkOQ.text: I loved it! I will say I kinda went into a little food coma. It was our first time there but I will definitely recommend this place to my friends and family.

is6uRYnokfHqSIRwJnEpew.text: Great food and drinks. Very interesting and unusual menu. Reasonable price for quality.  Service was a tiny bit slow, but maybe it was just me.

kpMHqDqHrFyIFPUmwYnGzQ.text: The sage fried chicken and bacon mashed potatoes were amazing. The portions are huge. We really loved this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the tenderloin sandwich!

yyaTRgTxIiGIiFHvtf3YQA.text: For a place with hash in the name, you'd think that they offer hash browns... spoiler alert, they don't.   I know that's not the same type of hash, but this place just wasn't my cup of tea. The stuff offered was just a bit too over the top and the wait was REALLY long to get seated. Not your traditional breakfast or lunch place... if you are in the mood for some off the wall dishes this is your place.

_T0xxAx9ub8FyqBv5AKbXQ.text: I tried this place a couple of times because it's the only restaurant at Plaza Hotel in downtown and I was pleasantly surprised. The menu is pretty big and their portions are huge. If you stop by for a happy hour you will save a lot of money on drinks.

ERF4Hnwg8z3uWDLyJC-muA.text: Love these restaurants.  Have visited both their San Diego and Las Vegas locations.  Sure, they have large portions, but the food is also delicious and fresh.  Do yourself a favor and give them a try!

sSK2YxGwZMJsbIq52XWliA.text: Was quite overwhelmed by their portion sizes here (huge!).  Certainly a great selection of food and drinks.  We were a bit overwhelmed by it but certainly were up to the challenge and managed to finish our orders.  If you've never tried this place, you need to!

b2vH5LSExsovbir-Sed1bA.text: Big portions, very tasty options. Delicious mimosas! It seemed to be reasonably priced for vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I did not expect a pancake that big, and with so much flavor.

PuQpawzGB37lqMN3RX_w5A.text: This place is actually not half bad, if you venture to their other locations. This particular location has a questionable? placement inside the plaza hotel and casino and is right in the corner of the downstairs, dragging in all the smoke smell and weirdos from outside.   Normally their service is pretty standard, but this location I felt was significantly slower and the staff was rude. The bar staff area especially. We sat at the counter because there was a ridiculous line, and the bartender didn't even greet us for 10 minutes. The counter is not that big, and she had help. So coming from a person who worked in restaurants, she's just lazy and probably shouldn't be working a fast paced place that counts on regulars (as well as tourists) and not being friendly or curious to customers, also a necessity.  The food itself took FOREVER to come, we had plans to go on a helicopter tour and were almost late for our pick up because it took an hour and a half to be seated, be greeted, order, get our food and bother the staff to pay. Our food was not brought out at the same time, actually my dad got his food about 20 minutes before mine. He had a huge breakfast with eggs, potatoes, pancakes and meat, this took almost an hour for him to get. All I had was fresh fruits and oatmeal which for some reason took even longer then his food....???  Needless to say this was the worst experience I ever had at a hash house in my 6 years living in Las Vegas and I won't ever be back to this location. Even asking them for a to go box, or where my food was after an hour, or getting silverware for my meal was a hassle to them and they were rude about it. My tip to this hash house- learn how to treat your customers or you won't have any to serve in the near future- Or servers to serve since no one will tip them.

_dO6URU_TbQmffmeVBXMhQ.text: Rachael was right on top of things when it cam to stuff we needed. I got the chicken fried steak again and Randy got the bbq chicken sandwich. As always way to much food to eat in 1 sitting. YUMMY!!!! I INCLUDED SOME PICKS FROM TONIGHT'S DINNER.   You definitely can't go wrong eating here. And the prices are reasonable too
