765slSuDsQfZCksEHp5v6w.text: Portions were enormous. I wasn't that impressed to be honest. The drink was the best part we ordered 3 that came with a Mug. They ran out so gave us one in a glass. At the end we measured and the glass was half the size of the mug. Rip off. The server was super sweet and said the boss wouldn't do shit about it, even from the start of running out of the promised cup. No discount, no free mug of another size. Nothing. A too bad so sad. For that reason I wouldn't go back. Not good business to rip someone off if your out of your advertised at the table mug. Chicken was good waffles were ok. Service was great. If you get something SHARE IT portions are HUGE.

N_O6b1yrJfunKM8lbWl7aQ.text: It was amazing! I ordered the Man vs. Food Favorite. I should've known it was beyond huge, but it was totally worth it!! I had a full to-go box filled for later. The mashed potatoes are spot on. Our server was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I must say it was amazing! Also, could feed 3 people.

D2_UYStW-MQp1X1LF4macA.text: I came here with my friends after once off them was raging about how good the food was and the giant portions.  The majority of the food here is fried, so I went for a Cobb salad. My friends ordered bloody Marie's, burgers, pork chops, and chicken and waffles.  The biscuits with honey were delicious. They were warm and so soft.  When their plates came out, it was a giant portion garnished with even more food. My salad came out and it was so sad and mediocre, the toppings didn't even cover the lettuce! It didn't even have bacon on it. So I had to order a side of bacon for my meal which was extra. Today I looked up their menu and the salad was supposed to have bacon. I was so disappointed in my meal, especially when the cafe at the Orleans has an even better salad with a much bigger portion of sides for half the price. Oh and bacon isn't extra there.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Marie&#39;s!

M-BHMFC_2769RD8njbULqg.text: Good for a meal "the morning after"... I did not get the hash so I cannot speak to that but my eggs, bacon and asparagus scramble was yummy and the biscuit was ridiculously huge - wished they served it with butter but I refrained from asking for it. Each plate had a sprig of rosemary on it so I felt it was kind of wasteful. The cousin got the pancake - yes only one as it fills the entire plate - see the pic- and is seriously the size of a head! The meals run $11 and up and the portions are grossly huge - just what one needs after a night out on the town.

My daughter ordered the oatmeal with us asking them to put all of the fruit garnishing on the side. They messed that up also. MtSJv9tGuFp2QWxFpNporg.text: Stacked!!!!  Go hungrier and more hungover than ever before.  Cheesecake Factory portions on steroids.  Yum

ouLL-xlnFWRzC2wS_N8dGg.text: This place is always good food but even more of an event..watching the huge portions get hamded out to everyone..the stuffed meatloaf was amazing...the cornbeef sandwich was big.and good too..a bit too much bread tho..a guy we saw had a pancake about 2 feet radius..no joke...

5h0Yx8wV8a0nzwRbMlMYvw.text: OMG the BROWN SUGAR BANANA PANCAKE!!!!  We went there twice on our last vacation to eat the BROWN SUGAR BANANA PANCAKE!!!!  The bananas are sliced in half the long way then laid on top of the pancake while it cooks.  Brown sugar melts on the bottom and forms a crispy crust!!!  There is no need for syrup!!!  MMMMMMMMMM!!!!

wEbhU3jrKPeQpnEycs27CQ.text: A complete shit house. This location took on the seedy atmosphere and aroma of the Plaza Hotel.  Indifferent employees milling around ignoring customers, junk piled on tables, floors and counters.  Looks like that TV show Hoarders or My Strange Addiction with the same weirdo people as employees.  Never greeted nor given menus after a long wait. "Ahhh, ya know what ya want?" we eventually heard from the server who never gave us menus, and while on the fly, never stopping then texting and vanished. No water, no silverware,,, the place a pig corral.  Dupars is just steps away in the Golden Gate is far superor with outstanding food and prompt service.  Hash House has to be the worst restaurant in Las Vegas. A shithole with horrible attitudes. Sad thing is, they know it and don't give a flying fuck.  But they are convinced an omelet garnished with blue pubic and red chest hairs will still bring in customers,,,, and they are secure in that thought.  Beware of fake shill 5 star YELP reviews from management, employees and founders families.  The internet fix is in.

rz6a2qzvPQR9vfLA3IFMPA.text: Great service, good food, nice atmosphere...the welcone and the wait staff at the downtown location from start to finish were welcoming and explained the menu and everything.  The food although it was good was way too big for one person, would definitely recommend sharing a plate.  The downsides aren't really huge downsides, your food comes out separately if you are in a huge party and it's A LOT!!!! Other than that would definitely go back :)

lSydWgdwurA1AQFHQE5YFQ.text: Ginormous portions of excellent, tasty food. Had the HH original eggs benny. Busy restaurant, but great service.

r9dDBq8SvzhpLw8xq1_Mww.text: Sage fried chicken benedict was the only benedict there, when I asked for regular the server was very rude and told me the only food they have is what's on the menu. The orange juice was mediocre at best and was approximately 6 dollars each ( for OJ!!!) don't go here if you want traditional. The servers were extremely slow and surly.

Zoa8qn3kbtXEZ2vWLEviqw.text: Do you love bacon?  Do you love 'Merica?  If yes come here.    Huge portions, definitely was full splitting a meal (and I'm a big guy) Delicious chicken and waffles (with bacon mixed into the waffle batter and chicken batter, I didn't even know that was possible).   Fried chicken benedict was pretty good too, this thing is massive. Service was great. Coffee was ok. Prices were very reasonable, $10-15 per plate  All in all, great experience.

I3xLUI2ZtTNYUXYn01Rn4w.text: Nice place. Food was good and service was good. Outmeal was big portion but eggs white was little bit small for me. But overall it was nice experience.

IvlL96jonKP2CiFiaDzRtQ.text: Had a bit of a wait for our table, but that's to be expected for a holiday weekend.  This location is just like the location on the west side of town.  Good food, good service, and huge portions.  I never leave disappointed.

kbLpPU5vH9NJgFPvT1Hk0g.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon. We didnt have to wait for a table, which was great, since I hear the strip location gets packed.  I had the chicken and waffles.  They use the bacon waffle with 2 fried chicken breasts and leeks.  The waffle was great, but the fried chicken was boring.  Definitely needed to be seasoned better.  Tasted like they just dredged it in a little flour and fried it.  Stick with just the bacon waffle and you'll be good.  All portions here are enormous, so its a good place if you're hungry.

j1hwlOZomx_2LeobEksVhg.text: AMAZE BALLS! This place is awesome! We ate twice in one weekend. If you have to wait, no worries, its WORTH IT! The food and service was awesome! We had a realy cool guy serving us and giving us a hard time but in a super funny way! The food was all HUGE so be prepared!  I are the Best BLT ever in my life. It was the lunch special. Jalepenos and Spicy Bacon. YUM!! Will go back again next time!

C5wNCxx6Pxl4k_v_6nnxtw.text: So we went again, it was worst that the first time.  Since they don't use trays they dropped my husbands breakfast on the floor. Another employee (not our server) walked up and asked my husband if he got a bite of it! WT...? (As if he took a bite and threw it on the floor or something?!?!?!) My husband said No and the employee said "That's f**ked up, dude" and walked off. I am not a prude but I do believe in professional language is a workplace.   So two employees come to clean up the mess, One has dirty dishes in his hand. I saw it coming. I was hoping he wouldn't. But he did! He put his dirty dishes on my table next to my plate of food! Gross!   Vegas has plenty of restaurants! Its service that makes it great or not! This place is a No Go for me!

aFsuky6x3SGzs-gCZHyEAQ.text: i know most people have an epic weekend of drinking when they go to vegas... this time i had a pretty epic weekend of stuffing my face.  we stayed at the plaza in downtown las vegas and right there in the lobby was a hash house a go-go. i've heard about this place and was stoked that i was finally going to get to try it out. (they've even been featured on man vs. food)   we get there for breakfast and i know i need to get hash... i mean... right??? they had a million things that looked delicious, including an array of mimosas and the biggest and most garnished bloody mary i've ever seen.  we decided to start with some mimosas.... my bf had the pineapple for about a minute when we realized he actually ordered tangerine, and i had a cranberry. luckily we made the smart decision to split a meal - the portions are unreal. we got the chorizo hash with a side of biscuits and gravy and bacon.    after a mix-up with somehow being charged an additional $580 on our room, the concierge gave us a $50 coupon to be used anywhere in the hotel. so the next day.... back to hash house!  after swooning over the 1lb burgers the previous day, we decided to split again. we went with the burger that was stuffed with mashed potatoes and bacon. we added some cheddar cheese and decided to get their house salad with cucumber dressing (yum!) and macaroni and cheese and fries (which we at least shared with friends).  everything was fantastically messy and delicious. somehow we devoured 99% of the meal, minus some burger droppings.... and felt disgustingly full for the drive back to reality.

AZitcGly1PqaC782r7MroA.text: Go ahead and put it on your To-Do list.  Fiancee and I split the chicken Benedict and we were both stuffed.  We also each had a BLT Bloody Mary, and even at $11.50 each, we were not disappointed.   The drinks have bacon, tomato, and lettuce accompaniments, so of course they are served with a slice of toast and packet of mayo so you can have a snack, too.  Highly recommend!  Portions are enough for 2 people to split easily.  You won't leave hungry or disappointed.

YrX1DHSSuTlGYKpE4i5hFg.text: Service was good here.  Luckily wasnt too busy. And don't be a cheap ass, come on people,  I only gave a $15 dollar tip on a fairly pricey bill and she came and hugged me from excitement for giving her her first good tip of the night, I can't believe people are so cheap. Anyway.... the food was good, just a bit pricey. I had the bone in ribeye medium rare and they cooked it right. Don't remember what my girlfriends sandwich was called, but it was like a corn beef sandwich kind of.  Big portions. Fun place to come with friends.

Rxyl2X-XTjB4VIIgZZ4sxQ.text: The food is decent but the enormous portions are unnecessary. I am not fond of leftovers especially when it's breakfast food.

jfdli0t6oe4IzgTtkavDsg.text: This is the absolute worst meal I've had in Vegas.  4 of us ordered, 4 of us barely touched the food, 4 of us disappointed.  Will not be visiting any of their other locations either.

mJD5Q1zMqId9P5IjUL7L3g.text: This is one of my "must eat at" when in Las Vegas. Very large portions, friendly service & staff, excellent food! Do your self a favor when visiting "old Las Vegas " at Fremont St. walk across the street and enjoy a meals.

4-9VWjbGcF-b1xLAEMX1lA.text: Did not disappoint! (Several) Friends highly recommended HHAGG for the perfect hangover cure. After a late night out it was just the ticket to recovery. Funky fresh options and excellent service. Bloodies are on point at 20oz and you can keep the cup if you want.  Sage Fried Chicken anything for your fried hangover fix. Waffles, Bene or the country classic which is what I had with maple reduction (bomb!!!!) and mashed potatoes---HUGE!  For a lighter option the skillet with sun dried tomatoes, artichokes and spinach was lovely and definitely easier on the stomach but still ---HUGE!  Service was on point and helpful. Walked in at 10am on a Sunday and got a table for 2 immediately. I'm sure the locations on the strip would have longer wait times but the food came out quickly after we ordered it and we were back out within the hour. We ended up walking around for a bit and then went back to the hotel to nap :)  If you're thinking about it, DO IT. Even if you have to wait, it your perfect cheat meal to splurge on in Vegas (like we aren't splurging on everything else in sin city anyways, haha!)

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage Fried Chicken. 2 eggs over medium served on a heaping pile of mashed reds with fresh fruit and a biscuit with strawberry jam...

fvESGplxd4IErIpEMkZo_A.text: Service was fantastic! Great food, pancakes bigger than your head. BUT! I mean a huge fat BUT! There are no hash browns at the "hash" house! That's right! No HASHbrowns at the HASH house. 1/5

EkTOGMvZ_GHgpzvgbJP8zQ.text: This place was so good. The portions were amazing, and the food was delicious. I ordered a latte with amaretto syrup for breakfast, and I got a latte with amaretto alcohol. It's Vegas so I should probably have been a little more specific. zZoUxiNyVjrOL8MKJRnUFw.text: I loved our first visit to hash hash house at the Linq. Today's visit was a disappointment. The hostess just pointed to our table without even saying hi. The kids pancakes were as good as we remembered from last time. The Ranchero Benedict I ordered was a mess Too much red sauce, probably my mistake in ordering. In general no one seemed interested in how anyone was doing at our table, I walked over to ask a busboy for a to go box. We probably should have gone to the linq but based on this experience I won't be back.

Some of them you can even take the glasses home.  Quick, beyond friendly and did I mention GREAT food??  It's a must stop when in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm.....stuffed meatloaf!! Stuffed with spinach and roasted red peppers!!

YaKkWJm9s7G4xySCDmBBwA.text: Had the chicken Benedict - it was a huge breakfast - more than enough for 2 and really good flavor.  Best breakfast ever!!

l5epsG3Tvegb6s-sH281uQ.text: We heard good reviews. We couldn't get past the terrible waitress lack of Mannerisms, smacking her lips and ghetto attitude.

i91Se6UB4ggf8dcT9H7d0g.text: This is my favorite breakfast spot in downtown Vegas. If you are with a buddy, I suggest splitting your meal as the portions are huge!   Our server was helpful, but never overbearing. The restaurant is clean, and is very casual.   I ordered the roasted chicken scramble with crispy potatoes instead of mashed. It was tasty, but definitely needed some hot sauce to kick it up a notch. However, the biscuit with their homemade peach jam was the star of the plate!  I would come here again for the cheap eats and large portions!

uDy5uIXDZNrh7h6HDly9xw.text: Food is really yummy.  I had the chicken and waffles and it was so good. I shared with my sister because it was a lot of food.  Their pancakes can feed 3 but taste great. The breakfast potatoes are also really good.   Love this place

IKWS_fey_r9Wy2XCut4skw.text: I was told about this place about a friend. She told me hat every serving was huge. I didnt think that it will be so much food. It really surprised me. The service was great as well. You have to get the pancakes. You will be surprised. I will go back in my next visit to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QbgSmLCiQst8Gnc74kCx1A.text: This was the house that "hangovers" built. A True Vegas necessity, IMHO. Every bite was rich and calorically dense. The quality could have been better. Dishes seemed assembled and warmed, rather than freshly made, but I'm sure if you're trying to soak up a night of bad liquor and equally bad decisions, look no further to bury your self-loathing.

XAzd3uXRuOeeqK7b8tRjZA.text: The Hash House A Go Go is a must visit! The food and the service never disappoint. Our server today was John and he is a super star! A very pleasant and genuine man! It was great!!

HdzDczKDnuAJQMgUYrCeIg.text: Second time coming here. The prices are high but the meals sizes are for two people. The wife and I shared the sage fried chicken breast. It comes with bacon, eggs, biscuits, potatoes, and spicy sauce. It was very good and we didn't finish it all. Give it a try for yourself.

0uikPVdGB-FJtOaZuztnKg.text: Hash House A Go Go in the Plaza is a family friendly diner with portions meant for sumo wrestlers and competitive eaters.  The food pile is truly a spectacle in a place where quantity seems more important than quality.  We tried the Fried Chicken and Bacon Waffles, the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict, and a House Salad.    The Fried Chicken and Waffles was average.  The chicken was crispy enough, but wasn't juicy and didn't have a lot of seasoning.  The waffles didn't have a bacon-y flavor, we wished they had just given us some strips of bacon instead.  The Fried Chicken Benedict was like three separate dishes piled into one--literally stacked right on top of each other.  One dish would be fried chicken and mashed potatoes, another would be a biscuit with gravy, and the last would be an eggs and bacon scramble with spinach, tomato, and mozzarella.  With all that on one plate you can't really distinguish one flavor from another, but you can make every bite different.  The House Salad was the standard bag mix of iceberg lettuce, nothing special.  If you do want to try Hash House A Go Go split a plate with someone and come for a True diner experience.

_7BkSQYYM_vagMDqYZEQXA.text: Great food and huge portions!! My friend and I shared a breakfast hash and we both were full. Such great flavor! Only bummer was yelp had there hours opening at 7am when they really opened at 7:30am. When we mentioned this to the staff, they didn't seem to care.

ZY0ym6jDPXCnyzyRKSVTHg.text: Visiting Las Vegas again, and decided to stop at this restaurant for breakfast/brunch before our long drive home. It was absolutely delicious, as always. I had the chicken and waffles, and hubby had the bacon burger. (It's a little pricy, but you're in Vegas) Okay, what you need to know, is that the portions are HUGE. They are shareable for two. The other thing, if you think Starbucks coffee is strong- this place out does them!!!! Their coffee is high octane... And you'll be on a caffeine rush for two days, lol, if not more!  (Maybe ask for 1/2 cup, so you can add milk and some hot water) If you like black coffee, you'll be in heaven. Our waitress was very pleasant, and service was great, as always.  We will definitely be back when we're in town again. Thanks for the good eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z-85065x8N14iVBg8X4iOg.text: Went there on a Sunday morning, place was nicely busy.. food smelled really good. After much perusing of the menu, we made out choices, scrambled skillet with grilled mashed potatoes for me and Crab cake Benedict for my friend. We kept hearing about the world famous "chicken and Waffles", and saw it go by a few times.. looked very tasty.. We didn't want to be left out of some world famous chicken and waffles so we ordered one to share. Our breakfasts were delivered and were of a very respectable portions. Both were very good. Have to say that Lo-Lo's chicken and Waffles still has this place beat. The chicken was good as was the waffle, but neither were anything special..  Overall, a really nice place to grab a bite... Oh, the bloody maria's are very good (but needed a little more horseradish :)

TPw3yGkvedecqhc3ZLs7PQ.text: This place is the Bomb! The food was awesome. The portions are huge. The service was great. A little bit of a wait, but its worth the wait. I will be back here whenever I'm in Vegas. Highly recommended. 5 Stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hasssshhhh!!!

2OgX8ft1yrV1TGzOwi3dIA.text: Meh, I went to one location one time and it was pretty forgettable. This experience wasn't much different. Place was crowded so we waited ten mins which wasn't bad. The host was loud but in a good way. Smiled a lot while she took us to our table. We were put in a booth along the outside of the restaurant. We were next to this glass that separated us from the casino. Worst part was how gross it was. Finger prints, mouth prints and food splatter all over it. I wanted to post a pic with this review but I really don't like those types of pictures on my Yelp. Honestly though we went early so we know t wasn't all from that day and with the amount caked on we knew it was sitting there for DAYSSSS. Maybe make it side work or a daily cleaning ritual because no guest should sit next to that while they are eating.  Our server I wish I remembered her name but she had glasses and blonde hair. Very sweet girl. A little quick to take our order. Other then that better service experience at this location than the other one. The coffees took forever which I know she probably doesn't make. It was the Caramel Latte and s'mores latte. For $9 the s'mores one MAY have been worth it but the caramel one wasn't. It was overly sweet and barely tasted anything coffee in mine unlike the other one. So kinda not worth it and had like 4 sips "/ pretty expensive four sips lol.  The banana French toast was good. The way the cook the banana in the skin was rad. Smear the banana on the French toast with a little syrup and it's amazing. The quesadilla we had was mediocre at best. Barely any avocado in it though I paid extra for it. The cheese over powered the eggs. The tortilla part was hard and not soft so I can tell it was sitting in the window longer than the French toast.   I don't see myself running back here anytime soon. At least I gave them another shot...

uudx9aB7e6MttEGrHtvEcg.text: Good breakfast spot in  the Plaza hotel. Good sized portions and tasty food. Always try and eat  here whether it's this location or on the strip.

oTpWqLQoM7crmYd1sOPpPg.text: Huge portions - not sure why half orders are not offered as we saw a lot of food waste.  Their entrees are large enough for 2-3 people (even in my tipsy state my husband and I barely finished one order of chicken and waffles)! Food was tasty, service was fast and friendly and it's got a great atmosphere.  Not only are they generous with the food portions - the alcohol too! My mimosa tasted only of champagne with barely any OJ lol.

FYeJ1kx047dpnTgEjHc-yA.text: With a name like Hash House, you'd think the hash would be the best. It's okay... think of it as machaca without the scrambled eggs. It's shredded beef over potatoes and cheese. Like I said, it was okay. Ironically, they do serve machaca, so I bet it's probably pretty good since the shredded beef was good.  The biscuit and fresh strawberry preserves were oh so good... and the portion was big enough to share.  In fact, all the portions were too big. My kids' pancakes were ridiculous. It was the size of my three year old's chest and impossible for him to finish.  For the price, it was a relative bargain: 5 adults, 3 kids, $80.00. Nice.

YRtPH5qDQco78qAmIvo45Q.text: Recommended by many folks but never made time to go when in Vegas until my daughters fastpitch team decided to have their Team dinner here and boy was it worth the wait. The restaurant was very accommodating as we where a large group and actually closed off a section of the restaurant for all of us. The menu is overwhelming as they have such delicious menu items to choose from! My Huckleberry sin drink was delish and my food was even better! I believe it was called the Blue Crab benedict? I literally could not even eat half and was stuffed to the MAX! Make sure you are hungry when you go here as their portions are out of this world! Our waitress was very attentive and we had excellent service.

dBu3WZIbf8TJACMldBFlTw.text: Finally a place that delivers on all fronts.  I am new to town and I have been trying places out trying to find my regular spots, well I found one for breakfast/lunch.  The food is solid, definitely not the kind of food you can eat everyday, everything is super rich and a treat.  Portions are huge, I took more than half home with me.  The real highlight was the service, which started at the host stand, with a young lady named Marcella, what a breathe of fresh air, she listened to preference on where I wanted to sit, was quick on her feet and made decisions quickly.  In addition to that she was constantly scanning the room and solving problems before they came problems, even things that I know were beyond her job description.   My server Christie was great as well, took a spill in stride, smiled and never missed a beat.  Food was awesome, service rounded it out.  I have found service and training to suffer, because there are so many hospitality positions, the labor pool is diluted and turn over is so high is hard to keep well trained people, Hash House figured it out, I'll be back.

3HpOkJ-NbOgDMmCTVMayvg.text: For me it's kind of hard to describe this place... it had a feel of a diner but the food of a higher end brunch establishment.  We had a wait but the nice this is they will text you when the table is ready so we took a quick walk down Fremont Street.  Once we were seated we were greeted by a super friendly lady who was very helpful.  Service seemed quick for how busy they are and we really enjoyed our food.  Highlights: Large portions, quick service, good food, pleasant service  Lowlights: Nitro Cold Brew coffee is a hard PASS. Don't do it... tasted watery and bland.  While I enjoyed my food they should really post the food they are going to add to the plate on the menu. I hate red and green peppers and made sure this was not listed anywhere on the menu. but when the food came out they garnished the entire plate with diced red and green pepper. I had to eat around it since it was already in the sauce.  Pro Tip: Portions are more than large enough for sharing, so save some money and share a plate.

nsOtbfqE7VSQm4N1r5OsYg.text: I have eaten at several locations of this restaurant, and none of them disappoint. The food portions are huge, the service is efficient, and the food isn't just all gimmick, it actually tastes pretty good as well. Huge free biscuits get you started, and that's enough to fill you up for a week. The entrees are huge, and delicious! The Fried Chicken Benedict and Chicken and Waffles are delicious and huge. Definitely worth a stop in if you are super hungry!!

GDkq4OqjOKv1gjm7MJveuw.text: We had a late night and being hungover we needed a hardy breakfast. Most of the good places were closed but we saw this place. We lucked out that we had to wait 2 min to get seats as when we left there was a huge lineup. We had the waffle with chicken on top. I'm so glad we shared it as it was huuuge!!!! It had bacon in the waffles!!!! This place is definitely worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffles with chicken.

FW83CClT55gCJ4jFvoz9JQ.text: Hash House A Go Go holds its place in my "TOP PLACES TO EAT BREAKFAST" list! The reason is because the portions they serve are HUGE and it's great if you want to do family style eating, where people split the entrees and share!  There is so much food to choose from. It's a little more pricey than your average IHOP but the quality and portion is bigger. Everything in the menu is pretty much $15+, which can be a little pricey for breakfast food. Although it is a little on the pricier side, the value is there because the food is really good and sometimes it's actually cheaper to share food amongst each other via split bill, which our server had no trouble doing!  Due to its name, I thought that this place was a quick grab and go type restaurant but it ended up being a whole restaurant, and I'm not complaining at all! Service was brilliant, as drinks were quickly refilled and the server was really helpful in helping me pick out some food.   This place definitely surprised me, and I will be coming back for many more breakfasts!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xRlzqv-idsPfnjij9vuJiw.text: Some of the biggest dishes I've ordered. You can definitely share one entree amongst 2-3 people. I highly recommend the blueberry pancakes and the crab cake benedict, or the chicken & waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5vX7V5igsIUh9v-dpHX6LA.text: Amazing!  Food portions large and tasty. Had to try the chicken and waffles. Very very good. Chicken moist and enjoyed the breading. Waffles had bacon in it! Son had pancake and was enormous. Toby our server was friendly and attentive. Great experience.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

Z6PbPV9aOesGW7Opc9AqvQ.text: Hash House A Go Go instantly became the "go to" for my girlfriend and I when we first visited Vegas, more specifically Fremont Street, several years ago. The menu features simple, mid-west style, comfort food. When was the last time you read a menu with references to Indiana?  I've come to learn that this "chain" originated in San Diego. Hash House is all over Vegas, but we enjoy visiting the Plaza location. If you happen to be in Reno, Chicago or Orlando, you too can enjoy their outrageous portions.  My youngest son nearly fainted when he saw the size of his pancake on a previous visit. And hands down, our favorite menu item is the Fried Green Tomato Stack. Sadly, it's seasonal and was unavailable this visit. However, we have never been disappointed by our selections.  This past weekend, we decided to make Hash House our last dinner in Vegas. We even ordered (and shared) the Hammered Pork Tenderloin. It features two giant deep fried pork tenderloins and some amazing smashed potatoes. Not to be out done, the Blue Crab Cake appetizer was deliciously moist and generous. And the molasses drizzle on the plate was practically licked clean off.  Great service, a fun quirky menu and atmosphere, and always delicious food are clear winners. Can't wait to be near another Hash House!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hammered Pork Tenderloin also included grilled corn
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super yummy Blue Crab Cake appetizer

S48RTWRBSsVNeJkcJ5I7BA.text: This place was wonderful, we got one entree of corned beef hash and we added jalepenos to that and a side of biscuits and gravy. The food was really tasty. We will back in the future.  Thank you

u8cI1TTClTATISBGDr7c-g.text: HUUUUGE PORTIONS... At a great price!! Such good food oh my gosh I love this place. I definitely recommend it if you're staying on Fremont street!! Actually even if you're staying at the main big strip it's awesome. I just wish they sold some of their shirts that said "don't smoke the garnish" it's hilarious I love it. I DEFINITELY need one of those!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M5L1dCbVpptlruX7amKw6A.text: TERRIBLE!!! Service was the worst and I dont know how but food was even worse... Do not go here!!! The only thing that was decent was the management. If you choose to eat here you are waisting you vacation time. If I could leave negative stars i would have.

_9grPBHEVk5XYeOqfSi8kA.text: This was our second time to a Hash House a GoGo. The first was at the Linq location. We must say the trip to old town to the Plaza location is worth it! The food and the service was great! The casino floor is close and they will text you when your table is ready if there is a wait. Other locations are crowded and the wait is brutal.   For brunch we had the crab cake Benedict and shared the humongous portion. It was perfect! The biscuit was delicious and we were skeptical about having the mashed potatoes instead of hash browns but as is, is the correct choice. The spicy sauce is ahhhhmazing. We also had to of the mango champagne cocktails. It was good. Very refreshing.   Service was great and on point. Surely we will be back again when in Vegas.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake Benedict! So worth it! We split the dish between the two of us and it was worth it! So amazing.

0Aj_7bqkq57-_WyfqdMDdw.text: If you are going to go to a hash house, I would suggest going to a different location. The food here was pretty eh, my dad ordered a bbq brisket sandwhich thinking it would taste bomb, but the meat was super dry and it was just mixed in bbq sauce. It also came with a salad with 2 pieces of SOGGY croutons, which was super dissapointing. I ordered the spicy grilled chicken which wasnt super bad but it did taste a bit dry. The fries that came along with it tasted pretty good and crispy. Overall, I would go to a diff hash house a go go location.

MHVXEHpCG98iTI5BPm4ASw.text: The service here was friendly and wonderful. The portion sizes are huge and the food is amazing! We enjoyed our meal and the prices were fine. I would recommend this place to anyone!

WD-oV_izj4C0sMZyK9_CZg.text: HOLY PORTIONS. This is THE place to eat your hangover away, but be warned, the portions are gigantic! I definitely could have shared an entree with my friend. But hey, I guess everything in Vegas is over the top, so it fits.   Be sure to order a Bloody Mary, too! This is one of the best I've had!

yl3Ay9s3fhsPRzFzyNpQiA.text: You know it was a great experience when you dig for the receipt to find the server's name. That being said...John, was fantastic and extremely on top of it!  This place has got quite the menu and the choices all sound amazing so it takes a good few minutes to make your decision. All of the food we saw served looked awesome. The drink choices were amazing too! My Husband tried this Jameson cold coffee drink (the Frigid Irishman) and WOW, you could feel the whiskey but the coffee gave it an amazing taste. I went with a normal warm mocha and it was delicious! This food though, I just can't get over the flavor combinations and serving size. My Husband had the fried chicken benedict and it was INSANE! Almost impossible to get a perfect bite because of the size of this thing but the taste was worth every single bite. I tried the French toast "tractor" and it came with pecans and maple syrup.  Again, our server, John was so on top of it and probably the best server we had our entire trip to Vegas this round. This place has several other locations we found out, so we can't say they're all this good but we were impressed.

3B1CB5dK3Njhlv0pyBMIAg.text: Great place I took my pops here for Father's Day and the food was good and service quick!

AY-u38ml5TyJ3mPh2fwjGw.text: Did a little Vegas adventure with da' boys and heard them talk so much about this place I had to go. Fast forward 24 hours after a mean night of bar hoppin' and other unmentionable shenanigans  and the Hash House A Go Go was a sight for sore eyes.  I ordered the corned beef hash with red onion w/two sunny side up eggs, and a large biscuit($14.79)  plus 1 Italian soda($4.49) The menu and portions of food are impressive. Prices good. Definitely go here the day after'.  I really enjoyed the hash browns and corned beef... the biscuit,,,, a little hard and tasteless. I maybe ate two bites of the biscuit . The rest of my plate was left clean as a whistle... as they say " Finger looking good "   Hash House A Go Go is located inside the venerable Union Plaza hotel. If your'e budegt minded or blew all your money at the tables stay here and eat here . There's even a Grey Hound bus depot nearby in case you wagered your car and need to get back home hobo style.

8tZr0TtIwbtLifgcefoKYg.text: Although the portions are great, the actual quality of the food is not. Their drinks are awesome, hot or cold, their desserts and pancakes are also good. But, their actual meals are not always done consistently and are hit and miss.

fzDKYFRcv3NgI28j0XibKQ.text: This is a really good restaurant!  They've got all kinds of cool and unique menu items. It's a little pricey, but  the portions are huge! So you don't feel ripped off at all, like at so many other places that serve gourmet food. They even serve Nitro cold brewed coffee, which is extremely rare at a restaurant.  We had the meatloaf, which was really good. It was so big me and my wife split it, and I was actually full afterwards. I wish more restaurants would serve portions like this.  Our service was not that great. Our waiter took our order, then we never saw him again until I asked another worker for our check. Some other staff member brought our food. No one ever came to ask how everything was ever. But other staff were around, and they were helpful if you flagged them down.  The main thing I didn't like is that this particular restaurant is right next to the casino at the Plaza, so it was incredibly smokey just like the casino. I hate really smokey places, and that's all you could smell here.  I would have given it 1 more star if it weren't for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meatloaf.

7gqcxSOBo2gYR2BrtiFQAg.text: It's becoming a tradition for me, stay at the Plaza breakfast at the Hash House. The food and service has always been great. After numerous visits over the years I recognize a few familiar faces with the wait staff. Which says to me it's a decent place to work, which reflects on service and the food.  When in Vegas I look forward to breakfast at the Hash House.

-JgxIuI-9Ju3ETEqBcT0CA.text: My absolute favorite breakfast place in Vegas! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. This is a must every time I visit Vegas.   Always has great service. Sometimes you'll need to wait, but boy is it worth it. I usually get the chicken and waffles and they are to die for! Melts in your mouth. The presentation is beautiful and I had to snap a pic of it before eating because it was so beautiful.

qG9oesRwlH1ZDeHjaKRvew.text: Ok I thought LA food was good until i started trying out Las Vegas food. This place blew me away for some of the most insane and visually pleasing brunch creations I've ever seen. I got the crab cakes Benedict and it was a crazy amount of food piled high on a huge plate. There were so many components to the dish I absolutely loved every bite. You have to try this place if you go to Fremont street or stay at the Plaza!

KIWBx3MfzbzN1MdCAiPzRA.text: Did you know there's a Hash House on Freemont?   Me neither! But luckily it sits inside the Plaza, and if you've never been and you're really hungry, then a-go-go there! Massive portions of high-end tasting food is the best way to describe this place. I'm always a sucker for the chicken and waffles - the chicken is wicked tender and moist, and I love the fried leeks all over the plate. This time we tried the sausage and biscuits too, and they were "almost Texas-good", said my American-born husband.  Highly recommend sharing an entree, unless you're like my hubby and I who don't agree on breakfast tastes (I like sweet/savory and he's a spicy chorizo kinda guy).

U8_D6tnhF3yW6n8xg7bOhg.text: Everything about this place was wonderful we actually went for breakfast and dinner. For breakfast I ordered the chicken and waffles they were absolutely fabulous the chicken was seasoned perfectly and juicy. The waffle was nice as well as the fried onions on the dish. For dinner I ordered the chicken pot pie I couldn't finish this dish it was overflowing with chicken and potatoes. It was simply the best pot pie I've ever eaten. I highly recommend this place and I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie &#34;Delicious &#34;!!!!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dgmw5zK-MikitWAyM45-Rg.text: I'm not sure where all these three star reviews are coming from, so I've got to give this place a 5 to balance things out. I sense that a lot of frustration may come from people who are coming in at rush hour (11-12:30) and frustrated with waiting. If you come in before 10:30 AM on the weekend, you should have no problem getting seated and served quickly. On to the food.  My wife and I ate here twice in one weekend. I had the machaca skillet one day and chorizo skillet the other. The machaca was very tasty with the beef being the star, but the chorizo scramble knocked it out of the park. The flavor in the chorizo is amazing. It's so good, you really have to be careful how much you eat because no one who's not an NFL lineman should be eating this whole plate. The portions are huge. Most people could eat half and be full. The biscuits and jellies are all fresh made and delicious as well.   The cocktails are like everything else, large. My mom got a prosecco cocktail which came in a larger pint style glass. We ordered a nitro cold brew and I'm not sure if something was off but it wasn't very dark and tasted weak. We sent that back with no issues taking it off the bill.  We had a different server each day, but both of them were consummate PROS! They were attentive, very personable and hard working servers worthy of praise.   They also have some decent happy hour promos from 4-7, but that's pretty standard for everywhere in Vegas.

hmfJ_ZFXhgntgZKxqQfi3g.text: First time here. We were told the portions were big, yes they are! If you can split it, definitely do. Most of the plates are left with half the food not eaten. I had the Original Farm House Benidict, it was huge. I barely ate half. There was a roasted red pepper sauce instead of the usual hollidasie sauce. Not sure I will get hat one again, it reminded me of marinara sauce, more of a dinner item.   Our server Sonia was great. Constant refills and very sweet. The only issue I had was woth the hostess when we first walked up. We had to way a few minutes (I know it's horrible to have to wait) but we hungry. When she finally walked up she had am attitude about having to be at work. No smile, mad at the world attitude. (Might want to rethink her being the first face the customer sees.)  I would definitely come back next time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EQoB-cnBoY64a5arJZJ9Ww.text: Oh my god, huge plates, huge portions. I could have shared this Chicken pot pie with 2 others and probably had some left over. Sauce was delicious also. Nice dinner like atmosphere and now upstairs for Plaza Bingo

wx_S6gqSoDei_-ZFzJ0ESA.text: If i could give this place 0 stars i definitely would. First off the wait was horrendous( I'm going to add that the place was half empty with many tables and booths open), service was half assed with no attentiveness to our party, the food looked like something out of a horror movie( a complete mess and was not appetizing!) , totally turned my appetite off. I came here on a recommendation from a friend who's a local. Least to say we aren't friends anymore. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED !!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9iF60GLkSVgX15XaBZ-2eg.text: I start by saying the food was great. Went in for lunch and it wasn't busy.  Service.... It was really bad. No one even came to get our drink order for almost 20 minutes I almost left (I timed everything after this) Finally she came we ordered our drinks and food.  10 minutes later our drinks came.  She then came back about 10 minutes later and said "Did you get your food?"  We said no and she said oh ok and then did refill our drinks We waited another 35 minutes for our food. She brought to the food to our table and then left. We were never asked if everything was ok or even if it tasted ok. She never came back except to drop our bill off and then left again only saying I'm your cashier I'll take it when your ready.  We left cash on the table to cover the bill and a small tip.

Ksds5xYn3atr2rvgaE-u5g.text: Definitely a lot more food than a person needs but they do let you know ahead of time how enormous there portions are. Wasn't impressed with the taste of my meal or my husbands. Friendly wait staff, just really long wait time. Prices are great for quantity.

wBjAd8ngabI2XNH-1aeF0w.text: I like this place. It's actually a hidden gem on Fremont St. The service was cool, quick and efficient. We had the "Man vs. Food" Fried Chicken Benedict. DELICIOUS!   Huge Portions....and the staff warned us. So we shared the meal and still ended up with leftovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage chicken eggs benedict... with a Twist. You should share this plate

ct30ZBPeOWyq83E1rUIswA.text: Holy yumminess! This place is so fun. The atmosphere and food are amazing and the prices are very reasonable for Vegas. The waffles and chicken are SO GOOD. Huge portions, so share with a friend. We will definitely be going back.

RAzzBLTO07uRdzYPSYWj6w.text: Several locations in Las Vegas. We stopped in the old Vegas location. Conveniently located at the entrance of Fremont street. I have visited the various Nevada locations. Staff was helpful and quick but relatively non impressing. Entertaining he was.  We were seated at a table not too long upon arrival. Waiter answered questions that we had on the menu as we contemplate various items. We had a request for an item staff was unable to provide but waiter was nice enough to joke with us when the food came.  Execution of food was on point. Large oversized and well portioned to the price of the meals. Hot and delicious were the chicken and waffles I ordered. The dish was seasoned right. Hot was the syrup. Ascetics of the dish were stunning.  Overall gold experience not the best but not the worst. Not sure what delay in getting food out. Overall good. I would come back. Nothing egregiously bad. Better than average was this location.

Jl1VewppUwtgnVut9UTOEQ.text: Went here for a late breakfast after a hard night of Vegas style debauchery. I had their famous chicken fried chicken Benedict. And man it was amazing. I could drink the chipotle hollandaise sauce that smothered it. My buddy had the hair of the dog which comes with 8 slices of bacon and a 22oz can of Budweiser. Cool spot. We'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q9oQyVIjQ9LHa0pCelyDkA.text: I love this place. Every time we come to Vegas, this place is a must!! The food is great, the portions are humongous, the price is decent, the service is great, what more can you ask for??? I have never had anything bad from here! Speaking of service, our server ( Rebecca) was awsome. She had a really wonderful attitude that I appreciated since my awful experience at the plaza hotel in the casino with a rude worker. She was a breath of fresh air! I will never go back to the plaza's casino but will definitely go back to the hash house in the plaza!!! Thank you Rebecca for your positive attitude and wonderful customer service!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cheesecake
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBBLT sandwich

uoQmBK-G3FBmkIZN2qlegw.text: Hash House a Go Go? How about Hash House a Yeah Yeah! As a foodie, I'm appalled for never knowing about this place, even if it is a chain. My cousins turned us onto this joint and it's one that will go on in the memory book.  The food is freakin' fantastic! The portions are huge! The price is quite affordable! The menu options are outstanding! And now I'm freakin' hungry!  Whatever you do...next time in Vegas, go visit the Hash House. Especially if you ever crave Chicken and Waffles! YUM

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage Fried Chicken &amp; Waffles w/ Hardwood Smoked Bacon, Hot Maple Reduction and Fried Leeks #foodgasm #foodporn
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Herb Vinaigrette Chicken w/ Griddled Mashed and Veggies #love #foodie #foodgasm #foodporn #vegas
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ground Beef Meatloaf trimmed w/ Roasted Tomato &amp; Griddled Smoked Mozzarella Cheese on Milk Bread #foodgasm #foodporn

ZD8st4gQg8MYnTlaPOrGKA.text: Try having the manager say uncooked chicken are people's preference!! Nooo... my chicken is suppose to be FULLY cooked and how are you a F&B manager or general manager, shame on this place for not teaching these guys how to run a restaurant! Service and cooked food, at the strip location is 100x better!!

Fz9V4UtSlyQg6iseLlkS6w.text: We parked at their parking location. Free for 1 hour. We were 1 hour and 2 minutes. Charged us $5. Such a scam. No validation . Won't be back.

Cajw49uELpcnFhNv6KqJWA.text: The food portions were huge, delicious, and the servers were very friendly. I ordered the basic breakfast and couldn't even finish it!! However, you can only be seated once your entire party is present which for a large party it is unfortunate when you have to go back to the end when you are only missing one person (we had 11 people). Another issue was that they will sit you down but they don't take your order right away even though your whole party knows what they want. The servers take your drink orders only, bring the drinks out right away, then leave and don't come back for 20 minutes. They then take the food orders, but it took about 40 minutes to get and then getting the check once we finished was also time consuming. We arrived at the restaurant at 9am and didn't leave till 11:30am so be sure to dedicate a chunk of time in your plans for this place.

SXFVUlgQhTgEyzS4Ci9OsA.text: HUGE portions! I split the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken with my wife and it was more than enough. Even the kids pancake is 14" in diameter.  We're at the Vegas location in the Palace Hotel. The atmosphere is cool and fun.  I'd come back!

MVl2YUB_iOaCEoY566sckQ.text: This is Red Neck Heaven. Portions are HUGE with lots and lots of fat, carbs, sugars....all the good stuff. You gain five pounds just walking in the door. When we ate there - middle of week, just after noon rush - half the tables were empty. Still, the orange haired waitress had us wait 10 minutes for a table. Waitress was distracted and when kitchen staff brought lunch to the table he almost threw it rather than sitting it on the table. No eye contact, much less actually speaking. But the Bloody Mary's are great as is the food but it's just too much food; that said, lots of people were cleaning their plates!!!!.

L2GR7uLS7dzQ-zj-uOUTdw.text: A solid meal and drinks.  Get's a little busy and service slows down, but portions are huge and quality is good.

4Twc-C3P-0eZ8gwMwmD-Xg.text: So grotesquely overwhelming, multitudinous, bombastic, and monolithic that it's like a volley of regret straight to the aortas of your now barely pulsating heart. That beating organ is now like a deflated tire after roaring across a police issued spike strip.   How does Hash House a Go Go exist? Even if you're drunker than a 19th century prospector, it's still easy to feel bad about stuffing your face with the food that's served in this restaurant. Forget reading Dante's Inferno; this place is like living the third circle of Hell. Everything is perpetually slathered in gelatinous gravy, propped up by creaking pillars of bacon, or slathered with butter and pancake syrup.  But...  It's so good.   If your girlfriend is laboriously attempting to make eye contact with you, even as you ram fried chicken the size of a Buick down your throat, your brain will still refuse to emit shame. You will make her sign a disclaimer, before you enter the restaurant, that says, "As your girlfriend, I will still love you even after your body absorbs seven biscuits in thirty nanoseconds."  And you know what? That obligatory story about how quantity overwhelms quality is an old wives tale when it comes to the hallowed ground of Hash House a Go Go - everything here deserves to be stuck to your incisors.   So go on and make it rain, Hash House a Go Go. In this case tears of defeat and of joy.

kOzZWcwhXLoX-6ApTdV39w.text: Got one of their recommended breakfast plates with fried chicken, eggs, bacon, mozzarella cheese, biscuits, potatoes and Chipotle cream house. Sounded great. It wasn't. They piled stuff on top of the chicken which made it soggy, the biscuits were dense and flavorless. The potatoes needed seasoning. I didn't like it at all. Asked for a side of biscuits and gravy because I didn't want to eat more than 10 bites.... And that sucked worse. The gravy had no flavor, it tasted like roux /flour and the biscuits were still hard and no good flavor. Disappointed. I had chicken and waffles years ago and liked it.

YjNB85BoJcvGmbNe7_IuyQ.text: Meh.  This place specializes in huge portions of mediocre food.   I will say, many many people rave about this place and seem to love it, so I'm definitely in the minority. But, I've eaten here multiple times now and walked away everytime thinking...meh.  Your love of this place probably depends on how you judge restaurants. If you like the the theme of huge portions at low prices, it's a fun place to try.  BUT, if you are a True foodie and you are looking for flavor, quality, or something that will make you lick your lips with satisfaction, this place just will not do the trick. Nothing here tastes bad, per se. But nothing tastes truly delicious or has you wanting to go back for more.  Overall, if you have a picky palate, try somewhere else. You'll just be disappointed in Hash House.

IqL7Boczae7gcBCbbQRGxg.text: Weird name, awesome food. Even watching other people get their food is interesting. The plates are piled high with food. It's almost scary. However, the prices aren't bad at all, given the portion size and quality. I got the chicken & waffles (never had it ever). It was great the waffles were fluffy with a kinda crispy outside. The chicken was moist, tender, and crispy with a nice sage flavor. Loved it.

FBPfux9L3fn95w27Sjue-g.text: Food and servers get 5 stars!! Hostess gets a big fat  ZERO!! I had never been here and was excited to try it when we got to the hostess she looked at us and then looked away and continued to shuffled through papers after standing there for a few minutes we just decided to let her now it was 6 of us she continued looking annoyed with us like we were bugging her then grabbed menus and just walked over to a table set the menus down and walked away. Never spoke to us once.

oJLOChKzW0XzCWG6Xuz2WQ.text: If you want an extra large portion of OK food, go here.  Luckily, our server warned us to only order one breakfast to share.  We ordered the Fried Chicken Benedict.  The first few bites were great, but it was so big and took so long to get through that it ended up getting cold.  And it was not good after that.  Our server also told us that it's not good reheated.  So, we spent $13 on a meal that 2 people could only get half way through.

-Szogt9hazfE4eaY7d7PuQ.text: Went to this Hash House A GoGo back in February and it was the BEST!  We ordered the Chicken and Waffles and a Scramble and a side of fries and split it between 3 people and it was PLENTY!  Service was quick - even though they were training a brand new waitress!  Coffee was hot and fresh, fries were delish and the best thing of all were the fried leeks that were on the chicken!  Oh Lawd!  Cannot think of one thing that was a negative here.  Loved it so much we went to the Hash House A Go Go in Chicago this past month!  Looking forward to the Dallas location opening soon!  GOOOOOOOO - you will not regret this!!!

-a8jV6xNs8Ze-VplGA1C1g.text: Awesome food. Very nice servers. The homemade strawberry jam was incredible. Killer pancakes!

3feCPmIfM-vrE1oJoan8Fg.text: This place gives you huge portions.  A great spot for breakfast and lunch.  I posted a few pictures of the burgers.  Check out the pics and then stop by and try one.  It was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eOYvyPDUsXgLRemSee_UrQ.text: I find this place to be MIND BLOWING. The food is insanely original and innovative, for example, my girlfriend had chicken and waffles. And while the menu item doesn't sound so enthusiastic in the description, what ended up on our table was 4 pieces of syrup drenched fried chicken piled high and speared into waffle cakes, stuffed with BACON!  Bacon! Stuffed into a WAFFLE! Can you imagine that?  Some crazy shit here!  The service is slow, but it's understandable. At the time we arrived to eat here, our waitress was serving 7 tables in the early morning. She can alternate between Spanish and English (she's Caucasian), and had some unruly tables full of grumpy, whiney old people to deal with. 7 tops is ALOT of people to feed. So we had to give her credit for keeping her cool under pressure.  The atmosphere inside, versus outside the Plaza casino was just as significant as The Griffin bar on 6th street and Fremont. You have your shady fuckers bumming around and looking for change outside the casino (Fremont happens to be a major place for bums to mill about, and also is the drop off point for newly released inmates from the Clark County and City jails at the Golden Nugget valet), and then you got the more sociable folks coming inside to eat.   Security and the staff do a good job to keep trouble out, if not appearing to be overworked.

h7F3RmyJYC3rRksBoP8V1g.text: Perfect stop for lunch after a day of walking in the heat. Mandy our bartender was amazing  I will warn you the baby Burger is actually 1 lb where the Burger is a 2 lb so order the baby version. And you'll be full for the day.

qjHUS9hnmZ0zJmQYvhS2IA.text: Yet another wonderful experience at HHAGG!!    There were four of us girls, two of us being seasoned HHAGG eaters.  So we knew not to order one meal each!    Between the four of us, we split the Snicker's pancake, the french toast, a side of potatoes, and bacon.  There was MORE than enough food, and we had some left over!  The food was AMAZING as usual.  Everything was so delicious and fresh!    Too bad the service wasn't really up to par with our food.  Different waitresses kept coming over to take our drink orders and then none of them actually BROUGHT them.  Plus, we saw our actual waitress once, and once only.  Someone else (eventually) brought us our drinks, she took our food order, someone else brought the food, someone else checked on us, and someone else brought us the check.  So tell me why HER name was on the bill??  Questionable...

bjRO6fzXV7ZF9nC0TNLSmA.text: Do not get the burgers. They're huge and flavorless. So gross.   This is a gluttons heaven on earth. Everything is made super - no - quadruple sized. You just can't make burgers taste good at that size. Not possible.   My husband's pancakes on the other hand were delicious but sickening after a few bites. When the pancake is the size of a SmartCar it's hard enough to finish- when it's covered in sugar it's even harder to finish.

H9xQY3riH_Yy-z_rHML2Rg.text: best fried chicken I've ever had. It must have been partly do to the sage. So good. Waffles were whatever. I'll definitely be coming back.

lRSKWxV4lEZmwmX5tbsW0g.text: Well hash house you've managed to seriously disappoint me again. Thought I'd try to give it a chance seeing as its been 3 years later. I thought maybe the service would improve but I guess I was wrong. This place has got to have the world's worst service. I'm starting to think this is one of those jag restaurants that purposely has really, really, REALLY bad service. Rude waitresses that absolutely forget about you once sit down. This time I was also disappointed in my food as well....I've decided the only thing worth eating here is the brown sugar banana pancake. Sure your portions are big but when your foods only so-so what's the point of super sizing it?!? Seriously though, WPRST. SERVICE. EVERRRRR!!! If anything, I'd recommend that you call and place and get it to go.

LoLWsbRTI8ia_ZdSyaOs7w.text: Me and my Fiance wanted to eat something late nite, came across this place in Down Town Vegas! Great lil joint, Wanted to get the  Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict like advertised by Man Vs. Food... But It was a lil to overwhelming for me. My girl got the normal breakfast - Egg whites, bacon, potato hash, and biscuit! Me on the other hand I got The Big Tractor Driver Breakfast - Sunny side eggs, Sausage, potato Hash, and one freakin Huge buttermilk Pancake! It was yer usually breakfast late nite eats, but I think next time we are gonna try the Fried Pork chop sandwich, and the Man Vs. Food Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tractor driver big breakfast - buttermilk pancakes, sausage, sunny side eggs!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Basic - egg white, bacon, potatos, buttermilk biscuit!

DGqwuX23tfVxBaGUPT1Svw.text: Larry was our server. Please change stations. I'd even wait an extra 20 minutes to do so. How can a place of "hash house" dare call country potatoes has browns. Are you kidding me? When a customer orders you probably shouldn't assume they want something other than what they actually ordered. Over priced half wits!

ZctbMhtlGFJRqehFj7yF0w.text: Service is absolutely terrible at this place! If you get a server named Mandi, request a different one immediately.  To begin with, I was sat in a booth that did not allow high chairs, apperantly it is a fire hasard to have a high chair slightly blocking a passage way... so then why was a sat here??? We were moved to a different booth, In which the crapiest server I've had in a long time was stationed, Mandi.   We sat for about 10 minutes before mandy greeted us, by the time she finally came by I was ready to order. I asked for an Avacado burger and my gf had the brown sugar banana pancakes. To drink, we both had water.   Mandi brought out our waters NO STRAW. Don't you just hate that lol. I would have loved to asked Mandi for straws but she was no where to be found. So I sipped straw-less.   25 long minutes later, she finally shows up and lets us know she will find out what is taking so long with our order. She comes back to the table food and all. Makes me wonder if the food was ready before hand and she just then got around to checking.   The food was amazing, it was worth the wait, my Avacado burger was yummy and HUGE. My gf's banana panckaes were so good too! The food is why this place even has 3 stars from me.   Halfway through my meal, my water runs out... but where is Mandi? My lovely gf offers to share her's.   We finish eating, time to pay the bill. We wait and wait but no Mandi? wtf... I have a 2 year old with me, they get impatient fast and I have to sit and wait for another half hour, till finally my gf goes and looks for her. She finds her visibly eating in the lounge area... oh we were pissed. We left the money, an angry note to the manager.

MkBSOEM5UtazMf3QEvGGug.text: Sadly I wasn't impressed. Server wasn't particularly friendly and the food wasn't hot. Definitely didn't live up to what I had heard about the place. Doubt I'll go again.

XigQQatnhK1BwYdjLQMoRA.text: I almost did not go here because of the reviews that I read but I am glad that I DID!  Some places get kinda screwed by uber sensitive Yelpers and this is one of them. This place is meant to be fun, fresh, and big. It delivered for me and we came back two more times (one time was for more Budweiser in a bag)  The food was huge and delicious. Our server was slammed but he could see that we were good energy people so he made sure to keep us entertained even though he was slammed. We were drinking Hamms beer and Budweiser in a bag at 8am which was super fun and then the food came out... Well as you can see in all of the pictures, the food was huge. Lets not forget that it was delicious too!  Biscuits were warm and fluffy, chicken was moist, and meatloaf was perfectly seasoned.  I really like what they are doing here and if you are staying downtown then this is a pretty cool place to eat if you have the time or if you are super hung over

XVTnPAfJiekCbH8d33OL6A.text: You ever look back at a meal and say to yourself, "thank god we shared that." I don't say it often but in the case of this place, it couldn't be more True. 10 AM Vegas breakfast is early but we had somewhere to be. Yelped and Man vs. Food verified that this place was worth checking out.   One dish was all I needed to vindicate this decision. A fried chicken eggs Benedict that literally could of fed a family of five. We couldn't even finish it, and I'm no dainty eater. I smiled in my best food coma face as patron after patron tried to tackle this behemoth single-handedly. If you're under two bills, don't even think about it.   Easily one of the best breakfast dishes we've ever had. Look at the pic!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken eggs Benedict $16

R3PyScZm0YC09fX4NfH7ug.text: If it were possible to have half a star, I would have done that.  This location is the first thing you see when you enter the hotel located just off Fremont.  However, don't be fooled -- there is nothing special going on here.  Quite honestly, we should've left after being seated as the lady working the front had the worst customer service. Yet we gave it a chance.   Then our server -- slow as ever -- came over.  Don't worry, he didn't have ANY manners.  When someone says thank you, a simple "you're welcome" will suffice.   While waiting way too long to order, we heard an employee (the lady with colorful hair) repeatedly cursing.  Mostly talking about how she didn't want to be at work, with quite a few more "fucks" in that statement.   We will spare you the details as to how bad the food was.   All in all -- DONT FUCKING DO IT!

yussW6L9GKYqWFAOJMUuIA.text: We arrived and waited about 10 mins to get our table. Our waitress approached and she was friendly and suggested some drinks. She brought our drinks and walked away too fast for us to even let her know we were ready to order. We waited and waited and she never came back. One person in our party had to go find her so we could order our food. Once we ordered, we didn't see her again for a while. Fast forward 45 mins and we asked a different server about our food. He was very nice and helpful and went to find our food (Thank goodness for him!) He brought our food and made sure we had what we needed. Our server returned with no apology or explanation. Got our food order wrong, but we were so hungry we decided to eat it and ask for our check. She brought us the wrong check, but by this point we just wanted to pay and get out. When we checked our bank account after leaving, she had charged a different amount (more than what we had ordered or what our receipt originally showed). With the combination of terrible service, cold food, wrong order, and wrong amount being charged, we definitely will not be returning.

lvvg7cyQleKOiAtUBQBwGw.text: My partner and I decided to eat here because of the happy hour from 3-6pm (also convenient since we were staying at the hotel). The main menu is average price for Vegas $20+/entree, but during Happy Hour you can get a whole bucket of deliciously spiced chicken for only $5..What a Deal! The $5 Bacon Mac n Cheese is currently on my top 3 mac n cheeses ever! So Good!   If you're looking for a delicious relaxing place to eat that's not too crowded, check it out! And their $3 well drinks are a plus!

vPEoFiZRMw4I_e-6KfvTEw.text: We went to Hash House for my sons birthday. He had had seen Man vs. Food and was super excited to go for his big day. We were immediately UNDERWHELMED with the uneven table our group was seated at, the salt and pepper shakers were dirty to where we had to ask the waitress for clean items. The Waitress was awesome except she kept forgetting our togo boxes, thus we ended up leaving our food for those who wanted to take their food. The food was not good, to put it nicely. Most of the group ordered a burger, and were satisfied, some were not as their burger was bland. I ordered the bucket of chicken, and let me say the fries are AMAZING, the chicken was beyond horrible, and had a rancid flour taste, with no real seasoning. I must say we were expecting better, and it was beyond mediocre, thus if I try Hash House again I'll go to another location, but as it stands, I'm done with Hash House as a WHOLE...first and last.

45qrTMgn_wKVXKcLDiyrIQ.text: The perfect breakfast off the strip. Everything was delicious and quick for a Saturday morning. I would highly recommend

mPQ68Vgqexg2A9G5VoOr0Q.text: Great find for breakfast!  Split a sage fried chicken Benedict breakfast platter and a blackberry granola pancake. Insane amount of food, and VERY good. No way we could finish it, but not because we didn't try. Our server was great too; laidback, friendly and helpful.

guahkrp2czCKgh60Ur_QIQ.text: Atmosphere was friendly the staff was kind. Lovely place with tv sports channel on.  The food was so good came out fast.  Clean and very loud but can't complain it's in a casino lol

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried country chicken steak featured in man vs. Food

YJPrG9pgV5EfuAvAwsoDBA.text: This has been my favorite place for breakfast in Vegas for years. This was my first time at this particular location and it did not disappoint. The staff were happy/friendly. Service was FAST. This location is tiny which makes it feel even more quaint and gives it that downtown feel. And they are on open table! Brilliant!  I love their menu; it's a great mix of offerings. And of course the servings are huge. Good think I like to share........  The drinks are great, too. Oh, and they have nitro cold brew coffee! Amazing! It doesn't even need cream, it's already creamy deliciousness.

mz6oEy_e-yEY5XljhbzbkQ.text: We always have to end our trip here before going home.  Best location of theirs to go to in Vegas.  No wait.  Friendly service.  Fast and always accommodating.    About 15 min north from the strip (we came from Bellagio)  Definitely worth the trip!!!  My favorite thing to get here is the saged chicken Benedict...  Yummy! But instead of scrambled eggs I get them over easy.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage chicken Benedict with eggs over easy.

F1gRBpYtGdmgYK65jHM-vg.text: Had breakfast here twice! Crab Benedict was the bomb!!!  Both meals were amazing!!! First waitress was awesome and very attentive, was hoping to have her again. We ended up with a younger girl who was ok... But over all great experience!

IyHwveXpj1kWriWtOJphXg.text: This was my second HH to visit, food is delicious but a lot of the portions are massive; unless you can eat a lot you really need to split most meals to get your money's worth.  Some options are more reasonably sized but their signature items are big.

LpuOAMBD61vm16w9bpCaBg.text: If you're starving or just a glutton, Hash's serving sizes are right for you! The plates are like photo frames. I shared the chicken and waffles ($18) with my friend and still had left overs. The chicken was perfectly juicy with crunchy skin, and the waffles had BACON baked inside  They also have drinking glasses that are "street legal" that you can take with you. Cute country atmosphere, great meal presentation.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken and waffles

vdl5HneKlD706oZh2mV0sQ.text: So disappointed!  My husband and I were seated right away by the friendly hostess but things went downhill from there.  It took 15 minutes for our waitress to acknowledge us and take our drink order.  Then it look 15 minutes just to get those drinks, it was only coffee and water.  Once we ordered our breakfast, it took 35 min to get our food.  I can't say it was our waitress cause someone different brought our food to the table.  From our table we. Hold here the kitchen staff laughing and talking.  Seemed like they were too busy socializing to get the food out in a timely manner.  The food was just ok.  We ordered the corned beef and hash.  I've had much better.  It came with a biscuit on the side which was hard.  It didn't break when I banged it on the table.  When I stuck a knife in it to see if the inside was soft it crumbled into little pieces.  Terrible experience at this location!

z1XV8y66f0FQiGB8r4GiMA.text: It is a great place for breakfast.  Waited about an hour, but it was worth it.  Large portions of food.  Very friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So goooood!!!

Today I ordered fresh squeezed tangerine juice and it was absolutely amazing !!! Taste just like a tangerine It is my new fav drink.  Today i has the Texas ranchero and I was soooooo satisfied the flavors are amazing . I definitely recommended this place to everyone.

_FgnQeWESE2Ml64SEmhIFA.text: The food was quite good. The atmosphere was casual and our server was amazing.  Not the cheapest place to grab breakfast but good quality and big portions.

D2-6sK8QMNYtUYN7XiO06Q.text: Wow! I loved this place! The chicken pot pie was outstanding, the salad was fresh and the service was amazing. We are coming back to eat here again it was so good. It was like having a home cooked meal. If you visit Vegas you must come down here to eat. You will not be disappointed. Now I need somebody to wheel me out. I am so full.

TyfGHlTMXKKi2SlF8sa1iA.text: Food is terrific. Portion sizes are huge so we share! Chicken and waffles are an experience all their own, delicious! Pancakes are the size of your head, and so good! A must visit!!

yg0aT-psY2NKompw56InIQ.text: We started at the MGM grand and were bound for this place located in Old Vegas.  It was as my friend said, "Harld & Kumar's White Castle."  We traveled such a long distance on public transportation to reach our final destination, Hash House A Go Go.  It was as if the place was glowing.  Great service, huge portions, tasty food.  We freaking had a photo shoot as soon as our food had arrived.  It was as if the food was Brad Pitt.  Then nothing but silence at our table, because our mouths were full of food.  Tips would be to share your meal, unless you want to have left overs.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One big mess of food

jl1srAqN3NzVrZzzW4GGhw.text: I love to wander around Downtown and look at all the stuff hiding in the corners of the casinos.  In the Plaza, the big hotel / convention center at the corner of Fremont & Main, you can find a pretty standard looking casino, but the eateries in there are far from standard.  The Hash House is a strange Southern/farm-themed restaurant that serves up biscuits and 'hash' skillet scrambles, as well as Southern-style breakfast (chicken & waffles) and comfort food. I went here for breakfast, service was good.  They wouldn't do a turkey substitution on my scramble (I got the jalapeno/chorizo version and thought it tasted pleasantly like a breakfast taco), but the serving was generous and the flavor was good.  I'd give it a thumbs up, especially for a morning-after breakfast.  If you're looking for a low-fat snack before yoga though, give it a miss.

lA-dVc_ZAIaFKrvAGA7mPA.text: They were not joking, the servings are huge.  My waffle was enough to feed myself and my fiance.   My husband is usually able to eat his full plate, but he only ate about half his meal.  Which was potatoes, eggs, bacon and a biscuit.  It was very good! And very decently priced, both our meals was a bit less than $25.

msArecFKc3n2N3cn7mFXUg.text: Delish! Enjoyed every bite. Service was great. Worth the cost - got 2 meals out of it.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sage fried chicken

EQfdXkiCVHIKh7hiu0lgiQ.text: I need help walking back to my hotel. I am not able to finish half of my plate. This is hands down the best meal that I have had in Vegas. The prices are very reasonable and the service is phenomenal. Tina is knowledgeable of the menu and attentive. Definitely a do again!
