R6BQuU56Xsd02De8eXWGCg.text: Perfect Bloody Mary. First time coming here and I only tried a few bites of food but I did try the corned beef hash. It was served hot and a great change of pace having shredded fresh corned beef with cheese. It's like a breakfast Ruben. The potatoes were OK, they aren't what I like. I like fresh potatoes not ones from a bag...  Bloody Mary is pretty good though!!!

pjpeJJoUc4iwxBC8EBo3kw.text: Before we left for vacation we were watching some show on the Travel Channel and saw this place(the San Diego location actually) and made a commitment to have breakfast here.   After a short walk from our hotel to the Plaza we were seated and looking over the bloody mary menu. What better way to deal with a mild hangover than with more booze. I got a BLT bloody mary. This drink comes with lettuce, bacon, toast and a mayo packet so you can make a sandwich with all the trapping you have at your disposal. The bloody mary itself wasn't great but it wasn't bad either.   The standout here is the food. We split a scramble with basil and goat cheese. Holy eff I need to be making this at home. Incredible. When I return to LV This will be my breakfast spot. Eat here if you're staying downtown. I promise you will not be disappointed.

BYqiUsQlcmK2Hqh7xKG9iQ.text: This place is okay. Not anything spectacular, by any means. I've eaten here twice, once I had the mushroom cheeseburger and the second time, today, I had breakfast there.   The Stuffed Cheeseburger: The first time I went there I had the stuffed mushroom and swiss burger and it was alright. From the name, I assumed the actual patty was stuffed with mushrooms and swiss but it was actually stuffed between two patties. The burger was huge and they cooked it well done, just like I asked for but it lacked seasoning. The patty desperately needed salt; it was very bland. The mushrooms were slightly salted, could've used more but were still actually really good. The condiments were perfect, the fries were good and the burger was HUGE.   Breakfast: they offer a breakfast dish called The Basic which include two eggs cooked to your liking, sausage or bacon (two pieces of either, we picked pork sausage), potatoes (crispy or mashed), toast or biscuit and assorted fruit. I didn't really care about the fruit or the toast or biscuit so I just ordered sausage, two eggs, and potatoes a la carte. It was a couple of dollars more, but at least I didn't have to settle for something I didn't want. The eggs were pretty good, but I would've liked the white to be set a little bit more. The two sausages tasted good but they were very pale and almost looked undercooked. I should've asked them to cook them until they were dark. As for the crispy potatoes, I guess I kind of expected more of a hash brown/latke kind of fried but it wasn't, they were more like fried chunks and they were still very tasty, salted well and the portion size was good. My boyfriend ordered the basic, with two over easy eggs, wheat toast, mashed potatoes and sausage (he asked for them to be cooked well, almost burnt so it would be crispy). He liked it; his eggs were cooked perfectly, the sausage was delicious (I know because I tasted a bite of his; they were WAY better than mine which seemed barely cooked and not seared at all), he seemed to enjoy his toast but they completely forgot the fruit. He thought the mashed potatoes were alright but a little tough.  Overall, the food here wasn't bad. Breakfast was definitely better than lunch. Breakfast wasn't great for a place that specializes in breakfast. Compared to Denny's, it was like double the price for the same quality. I would return for breakfast but not for lunch, not for a burger at least. I'm sure there are MUCH better burgers around.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed mushroom cheeseburger. Good but the beef patty desperately needed salt.

AIuwIG6-SD7WJkoBUwLQ3A.text: Great place and great service as well couldn't have asked for more.  Service was spot on kind polite curteous and funny... We loved it here. The food was amazing as well and the portions were beyond out expectations. Be hungry very hungry if you done here.

aQ1-F6WVe1YbB_iG7LZAqg.text: They say Go Big or Go Home, but Hash House offers everyone the chance to Go Big and Go Bland.  This place offers fun dishes, massive plates, and very little flavor.  They sell themselves as a Midwestern-American eatery.  And the menu is piled up with ginormous plates of meat and carbs in various forms (chicken and waffles, giant burger, chicken and brie sandwich, etc).  The tv show "Man v. Food" helped put this restaurant on the map based on the host's love of the "Chicken Benedict"--which consists of a layer of mashed potatoes with a biscuit, fried chicken, bacon, cheese, spinach, and eggs.  It's huge!  It's famous!  It's okay.    Every which way you turn on this menu is a dish that should be the greatest thing you've tasted--I mean there's nothing "light" on the menu.  But despite all the carbs and butter and fat on the menu, most dishes are simply decent.  The burger -- flavorless ground beef.  The Chicken Benedict -- surprisingly bland.  The egg scrambles -- fresh, but surprisingly plain.  I seriously want to introduce the kitchen to salt and spices.  I've eaten here several times because of friend's supposed love of the menu, but I just don't get it.  The restaurant lures customers in with the promise of indulging in "meat and potatoes" piled high.  They've got the quantity right, but the flavor is sadly lacking.  Bottom line: Hash House is worth a visit as a culinary curiosity.  But the lack of flavor will prevent most customers from repeat visits.

h45UtizP5QUfcb5pOmXKHQ.text: Great food! Not to happy about the waitress keeping some change of mine, not getting a receipt also. Not Good! For that reason you are getting only 2 stars.

PHPqvtbvWirKQGa-UmpDNQ.text: I ate here a few years ago at the Henderson location, and it was good.  Not great, but good enough to try again.  This time we ate at the downtown location in the Plaza hotel/casino off Fremont street.    I ordered the HH Original Eggs Benedict.  Presentation was dramatic, as usual, but the food was disappointing.  Bed of mashed potatoes were good but nothing remarkable.  Tasted like a homemade mash with little or no cream/butter and skins left on.  Then on top of that were two halves of a biscuit.  Bottom half was hard as a hockey puck.  I was about to call the waiter over to take it back but then I cut into the top half, and it was soft.  No intention of eating all those carbs, so let it go.  Tomato was under ripe and spinach leaves were cold and crispy.  Eggs were poached perfectly. Bacon was thin and just okay.   "Red pepper cream" poured over the top was uninspired.    My companion ordered the smoked salmon egg white scramble with fresh fruit.  Strawberries were pink and white.  Not red.  Not ripe at all.  Pineapple was good.  She enjoyed the hash, but I thought it smelled horrible.  I don't like strong fish scents, especially for breakfast.    Will definitely not be back.

_-L8TTNfELWCkGz7BwxjHA.text: The Plaza may be a bit run down (and smelly... whatever they use to "mask" the cigarette odor, just stop), but Hash House is worth coming here! It isn't as busy as the other locations, and they are super friendly. I had friends that came into town, and they allowed them to sit down first so they could surprise me when I got there! We even had a few extra people, and they brought us another table so we had the room.  Food is delicious, but be prepared for huge portions. I was only able to eat about half of my biscuits and gravy. Did I mention that they came with mashed potatoes?! Just about all of my favorite foods rolled into one. My friend got the chicken and waffles, which got a huge thumbs up. My 4-year old goddaughter got the cheeseburger off the children's menu and it was the size of her head! Deliciously seasoned fries.  The only con was that we had given the waitress cards and cash, and asked for cards to be run first. We should have had $10 left over in cash, which would have been part of her tip. Unfortunately, she decided not to bring our change back, and we had to ask for it. Shady trick. She got tips anyway from all the card holders, but she could have had more if she just did the right thing.

Bdqhfz9y7ouTawyS-VBLPQ.text: normal breakfast but big.  Service was friendly but very slow.

u7nKOxhcbry_jFs0KGZMag.text: What a cool find at the end of Freemont street in the Plaza hotel.  We were looking for breakfast food and trusted the yelp reviews and they were right as usual.   I had the chicken and waffles and it is more than any one normal human can eat.  Two big breast and 4 or 5 waffles.  I was hungry and I am a big man and I left a lot of food on my plate.  Portion 5, chicken 4.5 waffles 4 price 3.5 service 4.  We will go back next time we are on Freemont street.

Csoml2LKDoDPUFNOK6a6Aw.text: Called ahead, they said it was not busy and that their was no wait.  When we arrive they say that there is an hour wait even though there was no party/ line in sight, we waited 15 min and were seated, that had me like O.o why?? Food was good, pancake was massive.

IVxag9AMEh533wb_wgomqA.text: I'm not a fan of big chain restaurants, but due to all the people I know that were appalled that I had not tried this place, I thought I should at least get off my food snob horse and give this place a try.  I wasn't kicking and screaming going into this place, but I was a little annoyed that I was being forced to take a break from gambling, that is until the food came.  Three adults shared the legendary Man Vs Food favorite.  I was expecting a ton of mediocre food smothered in gravy.  When the plate arrived it sure looked like what I was expecting.  Literally, this thing is the size of a regulation size football, and not the controversial deflated Pat's size either, fully inflated.  I was however extremely surprised when I took my first bite.  Each layer/component of this behemoth is actually very well made and tasty in its own right.  I didn't understand the fried spaghetti sticking through, but that was about my only question about the dish.  Three adults + one serving = still had leftovers.

ZIUDOpO6AN2KvOWjyXffoQ.text: Me and my boyfriend came yesterday. So we got seated by a lady. We got our drinks but then the waitress didn't come back to take our order. Then we notice there was only one waitress in the entire restraunt. Everyone around us were getting service, except for us. She took so long that we ended up leaving. Not to mention she seemed kind of rude.

smmIgYUt2t4taz5i_XQP9Q.text: This is a cool little place. The portion sizes are enormous! No cheap but will not disappoint either!

CwFqjIBirRr6AqKLymd-NA.text: Stopped here for a cheap Las Vegas breakfast.   We didn't get the basic under $10 meal.   My advice, DON'T!!!!  The other meals for a few bucks more are worth the money and then some.  The Andy Sage Fried  Chicken Benedict was FANTASTIC.   The Country Friend Steak was OUTSTANDING.   I don't typically rave and capitalize words for effect, but this place was too great to not speak up!  It really is your loss not to stop by and enjoy this place.   I am not affiliated with this place and trying to drive business, don't miss this place!

BsWBB77_mdDi_-3T2JDpCw.text: First experience: waitress was not informed we were seated. Long wait. Then we dealt with shift change. Long wait. New shift prepared a small version of the #1. Second experience: I went to dinner and had the ribs with the horse radish in the mashed potatoes. Unfortunately my first bite was almost entirely horse radish. When I mentioned it to the waiter he replied," I'm sorry, that's how we prepare it". Ribs were a  disappointment too.
